Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX filed a lawsuit against me and on XX/XX/XXXX levied my entire bank account without notifying me of any of this. This is from a debt that is over 7 years old I believe, and that I had believed to have been settled years ago. I had no idea this debt was still active and no idea any lawsuit had been filed. The docket number I found out after I called because my bank account was levied is XXXX.

Bank of America has repeatedly contacted me regarding my mortgage that is due on the XXXX of each month with a grace period that is due on the XXXX. I spoke with a representative Wednesday, XXXX XXXX and she stated she submitted sometime of cease and xx. I have received 3 call from BOA and it sickens me to my stomach, and I 'm being harassed during a 15 day grace period.
BANK OF AMERICA seeks to collect a debt that is barred by the California Statute of Limitations. No judgment or debt has been filed or had by BOA against me.

I have been working with Bank of America ( BOA ) ( also known as ; FIA Card Services ) to resolve an issue that they reported a payment as 30 days late to the XXXX credit reporting agencies. While it is factual that they did not receive payment, and I do not dispute that - they failed to update my billing instructions per my communication. I made this communication to all of my other credit cards and it was updated without issue. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I moved from XXXX to the United States. When I came back, a charge on my FIA card came back as 'suspicious ' and required me to call the fraud department to verify my address, contact information and other information. When I called, I instructed them to update my address in the system so my bill would be sent to that address. They failed to turn off electronic billing as part of that request, update my phone number, or billing address. I know that they failed to update this information because when I called to dispute the credit information, the BOA employee told me that their system showed that my mail was being returned. 

On XXXX XXXX, I received an email from XXXX XXXX, a credit monitoring company, that negative information was posted to my report. That day, I located what account was being reported as late and immediately called BOA/FIA and made a payment to clear the entire balance to {$0.00}. At that point I explained the issue to the staff and they proceeded to argue that I was responsible ; they failed to notify me of my rights to file a dispute, so I escalated to a supervisor. After ~30 seconds the supervisor came on the phone and his tone was much nicer. He said that he would file a dispute and " word it in a way that worked best for me, that hes working for me and knows what to put in the report so it comes out on my side ''. He did not collect other data, ask about my dispute or why I am disputing, or any of the facts that would typically be required to make a dispute. Essentially the dispute process was a joke ; but he left me feeling like it would be resolved. 

1 week later, I received a note from FIA card services that they " investigated '' my dispute ( still unaware of what he put I was disputing ) and that they found the mark to be credible. This note looked auto-generated, without any care put into how the investigating addressed what I thought the issue was. 

I then filed a complaint with the XXXX. In response to this complaint, BOA reached out to me over the phone and initially told me that they had not, in fact, reported any negative information. After providing my social security number though, they were able to locate the account. The representative proceeded to say I was liable, and got me so upset by his lack of responding to my specific issues ( I updated my address when their fraud department called - why had BOA not done it in their system?, he claimed I was not receiving mail from BOA, despite the other associate saying their systems showed my mail was being returned ). I asked on the telephone to escalate to their supervisor and the associate did not transfer and said he needed to investigate more. The associate was a bully - I do n't know how else to explain it, and had cast his judgement early in the call. Mind you this was all being done before any investigation on my specific card was done by this associate. 

Facts : I asked for my address and contact information to be updated, and BOA failed to do so on a fraud prevention call. Had they done this I would have received notice about my bill. 

I will be buying a house in several months, and these negative remarks will have a negative consequence on my ability to secure a mortgage if BOA does not make this change. 

BOA did not take the investigation process seriously, intimidated me over the phone, and this is my last step before hiring an attorney. Given the address change and issues, BOA should not report this item.

I have been receiving calls from XXXX XXXX XXXX for some time now. They call not only the number I gave you but others as well. However since you 've asked me not to supply you with contact information in this statement I will not list them. 

They claim they are collecting from checks from XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. I have asked them on numerous occasions not to call me anymore. They still continue to call me. Furthermore, not only do they call me still, they call me upwards of 10 times a day. I have printed out my call logs as proof. 

Besides the fact that they are obviously harassing me, I have also been hung up on in the middle of the conversation only to be called right back within minutes. I 've even been called by a supposed supervisor named XXXX who told me she heard the harassing phone calls and would rectify the situation. Well they never stopped. Some of the representatives who called me are named XXXX and XXXX. I never get a last name. 

At this point I am filing this complaint as I am an informed consumer. it was n't but 90 days ago where I had completed services with a credit consulting firm and they informed me of several laws regarding collections. I 've read the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and I know that they are not allowed to harass me. Besides the fact that the debts they are attempting to collect are not legitimate as I have contacted the banks that the collection agency claim the checks originate from, I know that the XX/XX/XXXX date they gave me make the debts past the statute of limitations for suing and credit reporting. Since they have now been informed not to contact me anymore and they continue to do so they are in severe violation of the F.D.C.P.A. Please look into this as this company should not be allowed to collect anymore. Who knows how many people they have conned through their illegal tactics.

I received a letter today from XXXX XXXX, regarding CFPB complaint XXXX. I called XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, extension XXXX, and as always with all previous debt collection by BOA, no one actually answers these phone numbers. These letters are fake attempts to resolve complaints and are blatant attempts to collect a debt using " we are a debt collector '' on the voicemail. As such, and since no debt is owed, I am instead writing yet another CFPB complaint to address what is so very wrong with the letter I received. First of all, this sentence is at issue : : '' We are able to confirm that there has been no avtivity on the closed account following these transactions '' XX/XX/XXXX. That is not what the fraud department at XXXX and XXXX told me! After receiving the initial hardcopy of my free report around XX/XX/XXXX in COLOR it losts 13 monthly payments on time. So it was verified in print and by phone that BOA did in fact report it. Yet the letter dated XX/XX/XXXX enclosed inside this envelope today by XXXX, says, " Bank of America conducted an internal technology upgrade XX/XX/XXXX, which resulted in an update to the national credit reporting agencies ... determined no bank error ... '' That is a lie. That is not what was printed on my hardcopy from XXXX when I called BOA on XXXX XXXX XXXX to tell them fraud had been committed by a bank employee and it is not what XXXX XXXX at XXXX fraud department told me either. None of the evidence agrees with what BOA keeps saying, falsely. Either BOA or BOA 's servicer posed as the bank to firnish false payment history which ca n't be explained by XX/XX/XXXX, since it FOLLOWS a years ' worth of payments that happened prior to the cited computer entry. XXXX cited a XX/XX/XXXX date. Each credit reporting agency cites different reporting at different times and in different ways pronts it on each of the XXXX reports. BOA also persists on looking at edited reports to find answers to their internal furnished data. It is not there. Some of the credit reports have since removed it because it is time-barred after XX/XX/XXXX. This is XX/XX/XXXX!!!!!!!!!! Ridiculous! All of this energy and resources to uphold erroneous data furnishing to XXXX credit reporting agencies on a debt that had XXXX value since XX/XX/XXXX defies logic and reason!!!!! Clearly the SEC should unvestigate BOA to see how many such " assets '' are on the banks books to trick investors into thinking cash flow is generated when none was generated. There would be no other sensible reason to keep in place an account closed half a decade before BOA allegedly acquired it and which was a worthless asset " dead on arrival '' asset that has generated zero income and yet had wasted many resources by the bank to deny they falsely reported it as I say they have. The facts are in my side. BOA ca n't manufacture fake documents and fake computer upgrades which are wholly inconsistemt with the printed records and expect any court in America to think fraud has not been committed. Recently, XXXX at the headquarters where this envelope was mailed - OH wait! where it was pretending to be mailed XXXX different zip codes : XXXX in XXXX and the XXXX XXXX meter at zip code XXXX in XXXX just adds to the deception! The letterhead adds to the deception with " Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX '' where the whistleblower works. I filed my many complaints long before the whistleblower case hit the headlinrs but all I read about it this month reaffirms my own complaints. I contacted that attorney to add information. BOA has not been honest with me not the creditvreporting agencies. There was no reason whatsoever to update a closed account from XX/XX/XXXX nor should it have ever been added to BOA 's computer database at any point in time. All that BOA is making abundantky evident it lies. No amount of reason explains it

This complaint is against Bank of America , N.A . as successor by merger to Bank of America , Home Loan Servicing, LP, as successor in interest to Countrywide Home Loans Servicing, LP ( " Bank of America '' ) for numerous violations of 15 USC 1692. Bank of America has violated the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( " FDCPA '' ) by among other things, its unlawful collection of debt when it had no contractual authority to do so while falsely purporting itself as " Servicer '' of the Mortgage loan ending in XXXX. Additionally, at least as early as XX/XX/XXXX, the Note and Mortgage the subject of this complaint were rescinded by the Mortgagor pursuant to 12 CFR 1026.23 ( d ). Despite the void status of the Note and Mortgage, Bank of America continued its unlawful collection actions and fraudulently attempted to transfer " servicing rights '' to the Void Mortgage to another company on XX/XX/XXXX 

Although Bank of America will likely attempt to respond to this Complaint by misleadingly stating it is no longer the servicer of the Mortgage the subject of this complaint, this complaint is based on the fact that Bank of America was NEVER the legal servicer of the Mortgage and can provide no evidence to the contrary. 

A CFPB investigation will confirm that Bank of America had no legal contractual right to service the mortgage loan the subject of this Complaint and has concealed this fact for years, now falsely claiming to have transferred said " rights '' it never legally held to another company. In the process, Bank of America made numerous false statements with regard to my Note and Mortgage in the attempt to collect a debt, and attempted to collect an amount not expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt and permitted by law in violation of the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act, a federal consumer financial protection law. 

Many of the false statements and misrepresentations are outlined in the full Complaint with supporting documents attached.

Consumer complaint narrative:
BofA misrepresented and breached the terms of a debt relief agreement. 

According to BofA, I provided a personal guaranty on a credit card account ( the " Account '' ) for a company that went out of business. On or around XXXX XXXX, 2015, in an effort to resolve the balance on the Account, I contacted BofA to seek a payment plan with interest rate relief. BofA representative XXXX went through a series of financial questions with me and then indicated that I had been approved for a payment plan and interest rate relief. 

Per the new payment plan, my interest would be reduced to 4.5 % and require monthly payments of {$420.00} for five years ( the " Payment Plan '' ). In exchange for the Payment Plan, I was required to ( i ) get current on the card, which required payment of {$990.00}, and ( ii ) authorize BofA to auto-draft the XXXX monthly payments from my personal checking account. I agreed. 

On XXXX XXXX, BofA initiated the withdrawal of the monthly payment of {$420.00} from my account as agreed. However, BofA had not yet reduced the interest rate on the Account. This meant the monthly minimum payment for the Account ( roughly {$650.00} ) was higher than the $ XXXX monthly payment. So the debt continued to rise rather than decrease. 

On XXXX XXXX, I emailed my local BofA branch representative, XXXX XXXX, to see about getting the interest rate on the Account corrected. She advised that I call " Card Services. " On XXXX XXXX, I called Card Services and spoke to manager XXXX XXXX. After briefing her on the situation, XXXX XXXX indicated that BofA would not honor the terms of the Payment Plan and that no interest rate relief would be provided. She said that the Payment Plan had not been approved by the BofA credit department and, so, never went into effect. 

This was a curious assertion, given that BofA had already withdrawn the monthly payment from my account per the Payment Plan terms and had given no prior indication that it had rejected or cancelled the Payment Plan. 

On XXXX XXXX, 2015, XXXX XXXX and I called Card Services and spoke to manager XXXX XXXX. After recounting the events to her, XXXX XXXX confirmed that interest rate relief at 4.25 % APR was indeed noted on the Account. She agreed to call me with a resolution no later than XXXX XXXX, 2015. 

XXXX XXXX did not contact me on XXXX XXXX, 2015. In fact, she never contacted me again. 

Instead, while I waited to hear from XXXX XXXX, BofA withdrew, over my objection, another $ XXXX monthly payment from my checking account, and applied it to the Account. BofA still did not reduce the interest rate as agreed. 

On XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX contacted XXXX XXXX again on my behalf. She spoke to manager XXXX XXXX, who indicated that BofA had decided not to honor the Payment Plan terms -- this, despite BofA 's continuing to take money from my checking account per the very terms it simultaneously disclaimed. 

BofA represented, both in word and action, that the Payment Plan was in effect, when in truth it had no intention of honoring its terms. Insofar as the Payment Plan terms are to my benefit, BofA disclaims them. On the other hand, those terms that benefit it, BofA embraces. To this day, BofA continues taking the $ XXXX monthly payments from my account, just as if the Payment Plan were in effect, yet denies me the benefit of the agreement. 

BofA 's intentionally misleading, deceptive, false and unfair conduct violates the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act. Promising debt relief as a ruse for collecting payments is also a violation of the Fair Debt Collection, among other common law principles.

Consumer complaint narrative: Today I received a letter from Bank of America dated XXXX XXXX XXXX. When I called the phone number on the back of the letter and I entered the last XXXX digits of account closed in XX/XX/XXXX, it said my first name and then said it was being " consolidated '' at my request!!!!! What? I asked the persons in XXXX ; XXXX and XXXX as I was bounced from state to state and disconnected again and again : where are the XXXX credit card statements I was promised two weeks ago? I was told they would be mailed so I can forward them to the XXXX credit reports - some of whom have already removed it based on the date alone. But others are miscommunicating the term " correctly reporting on your credit file '' which not true! Now - today - Bank of America has stripped their own computers of the furnished payment information in each month in XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX ; such that the bank 's responders to disputes ca n't see what they furnished in XX/XX/XXXX that is still on my credit report. Bank of America fabricated phony credit card statements to show the XX/XX/XXXX closing by me. However, they ca n't create documents in XX/XX/XXXX, as promised two weeks ago? The bank is hiding the fraud on this account by deleting the furnished data. That is fraud. The envelope received today did not come from XXXX either, despite the return address. It has been an annoying habit that letters are mailed from Bank of America from states other than the one it is written from. I suspect this is the bank 's way of avoiding the Attorney General of the state listed from having jurisdiction on the matter. This is compounding an already disasterous situation for no reason. The letter in no way allows a customer to talk directly to the place listed on the letter. Clearly, it was a fake form letter.

They have persisted with their calls to my place of employment. The person calling is named XXXX XXXX. They say they are calling about Bank of America but are not Bank of America themselves.

I left bank of America because I was being charged overdraft fees that were a direct result of them not crediting my deposits for up to a week. I left them and now I understand that they posted an outstanding debt to my credit report and show that I opened an account in XX/XX/XXXX when I stopped doing any business with them in XX/XX/XXXX. I called spoke to their representative and they said they would fax a letter showing that the debt was taken care of, then later in the day when the fax did n't come through they changed the story and said they would not be sending anything and that they sold the account to someone else and ca n't do anything with it.

I received a document delivered by the Sheriff of the county I live in. I was not home and the document was attached to the front door of my residence. I immediately called the Sheriff once I got home and read the document. The document said I owed a debt and listed the dollar amount of the debt on the document. The sheriff and other unknown persons were able to see my personal financial information. The debt collection agency threatened to take my vehicle as payment if I did not call them immediately and set up a payment plan. The sheriff also called the debt collection agency and he was told too that they would take my vehicle as payment if I did not call and set up a payment plan. I began to have a XXXX XXXX and contacted my M.D. I was prescribed XXXX to control my XXXX and prevent me from XXXX. I began to suffer from XXXX the same night as the document was left on my front door ; I returned to my M.D. suffering from XXXX and prescribed XXXX. After I got myself healthy adn back on track I was able to stop taking the XXXX but I still suffer from XXXX as I look over my shoulder feeling as though someone is going to take my vehicle as I go into XXXX to pick up a few groceries. It 's an awful feeling and as I am unemployed but actively looking for employment ; a payment plan is impossible as I am living off of my savings after moving into my mother 's home unable to pay rent or live independently due to unemployment and lack of money. My vehicle is paid off but the debt collection agency said they put a hold on the VIN so I could not transer the title into another name ; the hold on the VIN makes it impossible to sell the vehicle and buy a cheaper vehicle in order to make a lttle profit.

I am writing regarding a matter that has caused me serious financial ramifications, which could have been prevented had Bank of America been forthcoming with me, and followed their own procedures. On  XXXX  around  XXXX    XXXX   ( give or take an hour ) I inadvertently chose the wrong account during a transfer from my Checking Account (   XXXX   XXXX   ) on Bank of America 's mobile app. I sent {$1100.00} to my Credit Card account rather than my other  Checking Ac count (  XXXX  ). I called Bank of America immediately and spoke with their checking/debit department. The woman, I regret forgetting her name, informed me she had cancelled the transfer and told me I neednt take any further action. She further notified me that my {$1100.00} would appear back in Checking  XXXX , with verification via the mobile app once I refreshed the page. Upon refresh, the {$1100.00} was back in Checking  XXXX . I then completed my transfer from Checking  XXXX  to Checking  XXXX .     The next day (  XXXX  ) I noticed that my Credit Card account had an excess of around {$900.00} and that my Checking XXXX  was now - {$1100.00}. I called the  Checking/Debit D epartment back, explained that the first transfer was cancelled and asked what happened. They sent me to the Credit Card Department where the woman told me that they would be taking the  XXXX  sent to my Credit Card account and send it back to my  Checking  XXXX , balancing everything out. I was told it would take up to 10 days but it usually was a  3-5  day process.     Two days later (  XXXX  ) I checked my accounts to find that my Credit Card account was completely missing from the app, had been closed without my permission, and my Checking XXXX  was then charged  XXXX  {$35.00} fees. On Monday (  XXXX  ) I called again, spoke with the  Checking  Department who after being transferred to a supervisor credited me back the {$70.00} in fees. The supervisor told me that NO  ONE h ad indicated that the first transfer was cancelled or that it was a mistake, no one put notations in whatsoever. I was then transferred to the  Wealth Management  Department. The woman there could n't help me, but she put in a request for an investigation to try and get my Credit Card back open reinstating any balances I owed and have the {$1100.00} sent back to my Checking XXXX . She told me it would take upwards of 2 days.  Sidenote : My Rent  was due  XXXX  and I was waiting for a payment from  XXXX  of my jobs that was sent to  Checking  XXXX  on  XXXX , but since Checking  XXXX   was negative I did n't get the payment from my job. I 'm now facing upwards of {$200.00} in late fees due to having to wait for this Bank to fix this mess.     I received a call on Tuesday  XXXX  from the Investigator, but I was in a meeting. He left me a voicemail with  XXXX  numbers, his direct line and the  Wealth Management d epartment. He would n't answer his direct line, so I left a voice mail and then called the  Wealth Managemen  XXXX  Department again around  XXXX     XXXX  . The woman who answered had no idea what I was talking about, or what I was calling about. She sent me to  XXXX , a Credit Card  specialist. Consumer complaint narrative: BankAmericard Travel Rewards Visa Signature  card - False advertising, bait and switch rewards program In early  XXXX  of  2017   , before my oversea trip I called Bank Of America about this card 's rewards redemption program. The program specifies that the reward points can be redeemed as statement credit to offset the travel expenses charged to this card, so i asked the BOA agent ( on the phone ) what type of travel expense would be qualified and I was told, " any type of travel expense qualifies. '' Therefore, I advised him that I would be traveling overseas from  XXXX   XXXX  -  XXXX   XXXX  of this year and would be using this credit card there. While I was traveling overseas I purchased airline tickets using this credit card on   XXXX   ( an travel agency ) for about {$450.00}. After I came back from my vacation, on  XXXX   XXXX , I called BOA to redeem my reward points to offset this travel expense, but the agent told me he had trouble redeeming my points against my travel expense because there was some sort of coding error in my  XXXX  charge. He advised me to go ahead and pay off my travel expense first and then he will correct the posting code and redeem my reward points as statement credit later for me. But one week later I still do n't see the statement credit so I called BOA again on  XXXX   XXXX , and at first the agent said that I should be able to redeem my points against any travel expense but when she realized that the charge had coding error, she said she could n't do anything about it, that I had to contact the merchant ( mind you, in foreign country ) to correct the coding. I asked to speak to her supervisor and she said " it does n't matter, supervisor would n't be able to help in this case anyway. '' I ca n't believe her response! I feel so betrayed by BOA, because before the trip I specifically asked them what type of travel expense is eligible and was told " any and all travel expense are eligible. '' And because of this response I decided to take this credit card on my trip and not any other brands of credit cards. I could have brought and used my  XXXX   XXXX  or  XXXX  or  XXXX  card for that purchase if BOA did n't lie to me!! For a financial service company of this size to be so irresponsible or so incompetent with their business practice, I 'm beyond disbelief and disappointed. I feel hurt and deeply betrayed for believing and trusting this company in the first place.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was in  XXXX  staying at the  XXXX  on  XXXX   XXXX  with my entire company for a trade show from  XXXX  when I lost my  Visa Debit Card  and woke up Tuesday morning of  XXXX   XXXX , followed my normal routine and checked my on line account to find o ver 25 tra nsactions in process mostly $  XXXX  {$570.00}. There were multiple transactions {$400.00} and above from purchases made from an unidentifiable merchant as well as other transaction from a  XXXX  's  XXXX  that not only am I a resident of  XXXX , but am not even a member at  XXXX  's  XXXX . There were al so 2 ATM   withdrawals of {$500.00} each of which I never made. I was n't even aware we could withdraw more than {$500.00} per day from an ATM. In the list of transaction on my checking account there were  2 forged chec ks using someone else 's check from a bank called  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   which wrote " Pay to the order of ************ and signed on the front and back for {$1300.00} and {$1700.00}. These are clearly forged checks that did n't come from me and not only are they holding me responsible for these checks, they assessed a {$12.00} return items fee on eac h one. They also withdrew money from my B of A credit cards, which I have 3 of, to pay for overdrafts resulting from this individual making these withdrawals and purchases. These 2 trans action for the checks were listed on my checking account and I clicked on the images to see them and printed them. When you go to my online account, they are mysteriously not listed anymore, I ca n't get an explanation for that or anything else.       Throughout the last almost 12 days, I would call to get status of the claims and was repeatedly reassured that I was 100 % protected by B of A and although it might take the full 10 days, they would return all of my   money back to my checking and savings accounts. I spoke to a rep yesterday because of the 2 letters I received regarding the 2 forged checks and she said not to worry about them and they were probably automatically generated and as of last night some time, which would have been the end of the 10 day period, even if they were unable to reach all of the merchants, B of A will have put back all of the money this person took from my account as well as any fees assessed and they would continue to reach out to the merchants.
This was obviously not the case and this morning when I called a woman casually let me know that my claims were denied and she was sorry. Although I never received one   phone call from any representative from B of A, she proceeded to tell me that it was denied because I not only confirmed that I had possession of the card, but that I authorized all of these transactions.       Needless to say I am speechless and have never felt more helpless. There is no possible way on earth that I would have approved ov er 25 transactions (  and they informed me there were many, many more transaction attempts, but they were not listed on my list of transactions ) of outrageous amounts and when I first spoke to B of A the morning whe  n I realized this happened the first thing I informed them about was the fact that I did not have my Visa Debit card anymore.
I ca n't imagine how anyone who either speaks to me and hears about this story or reads my condensed version about this here, would feel comfortable and feel that their family is safe with their money in checking and savings accounts with Bank of America.       Thank you and I look forward to your reply and what actions will be taken in this matter.

Beginning in XX/XX/XXXX, a mortgage servicer, acting as a debt collector, contacted me XXXX years after a foreclosure was conducted on a property I owned in Massachusetts. I had no prior knowledge of this mortgage servicer/debt collector, XXXX prior to this contact. I had a XXXX and XXXX mortgage on the property at the time of foreclosure. Both mortgages were serviced by the same company : initially Countrywide and later Bank of America. BofA conducted the foreclosure in XX/XX/XXXX. 

1 ) According to MA state law, a mortgagee or mortgage servicer needs a deficiency judgement to collect remaining loan debt after a property foreclosure. In order to seek deficiency judgement, the mortgagee must provide proof of having sent a notice of intention to pursue any deficiency after a foreclosure. This notice must be sent by registered mail at least XXXX days prior to the foreclosure. Also, the mortgagee must sign and swear to an affidavit of the mailing of the above notice within XXXX days after the foreclosure. 

XXXX has not presented me with a deficiency judgement on the debt they are attempting to collect. They have not provided evidence that a notice of intention was sent to me or that an affidavit was produced as described above even when these documents or proof were specifically requested by me in a dispute letter. 

2 ) In addition, MA law has a statute of limitation for attempting to collect a debt of deficiency from a foreclosure of XXXX years. This attempt to collect the debt is XXXX years past the expiration of the allowed timeframe. 

3 ) XXXX made reports to the major credit bureaus about this debt that now appear as negatiave reports on all my credit histories. These reports have negatively affected my credit score at a significant level. I consider this reporting to be fraud and defamation. They also ignored a direct request to retract their reports to credit bureaus until they can prove the validity of the debt. 

4 ) XXXX has " threatened '' foreclosure on the property attached to the XXXX mortgage. I do n't believe they can foreclose on a property that has already been sold in foreclosure. XXXX appears to have partial or incomplete information on this loan and its disposition. They never refer to the previous foreclosure or a deficiency after foreclosure. I no longer have any ownership or legal access to this property. I consider this to be fraud and making false statements in attempting to collect a debt. 

XXXX ) I have never received any notification that this loan had been sold and/or transferred to another bank/lender, OR that the loan had a new servicer. The documentation from Nationstar states that the loan is now held by " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, as Trustee for XXXX Home Equity Loan Asset Backed Certificates, Series XXXX. '' At the time of foreclosure, the mortgagee was XXXX with Bank of America as servicer. I never heard anything from BofA or XXXX after the foreclosure was complete. However, I did receive communication and settlement funds from federal and state government as part of class action settlements with BofA for illegal foreclosure practices. 

6 ) The amount XXXX claims I owe and are trying to collect appears to be based on partial or incomplete information. The foreclosure that occurred back XX/XX/XXXX netted over {$35000.00} MORE than the balance on the XXXX mortgage. There is no mention of the funds from the auction of the property or of any funds being applied to the XXXX mortgage. XXXX claims that I owe the balance of the loan prior to foreclosure, about {$52000.00} PLUS an additional $ XXXX for interest and fees. Again, I would consider these amounts to be false statements, threats, and fraudulant.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The company FIA card services which is a subsidiary of Bank of America filed a default judgment against me for credit card debt accrued by defunct company MBNA XXXX on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. 

I applied for and maintained a business credit card with MBNA on XXXX before the company went out of business. The debt was accrued during the year XXXX. Bank of America acquired MBNA in XXXX and this arm became FIA card services that same year. Since my debt was initiated and established during the existence of MBNA and NOT after the acquisition period, this default judgment is a direct violation of the FCRA, as FIA is attempting to collect a debt of the defunct company MBNA XXXX.
They call evey XXXX minutes between XXXX and XXXX, even after I talk to representive. They even admitted that it was robo calling.
I was sued and paid the judgment. A new lawfirm file took over the judgment and garnished my wages. I have comunicated with them to stop the collection efforts to no avail.

On XXXX I defaulted on a mortgage loan number XXXX. On XXXX a fourclosure complaint was filed. The property than went to final judgement and the house was actioned off. The original servcer of the loan was XXXX XXXX Mortgage, Than the servicer was switched to Countrywide home loans and than to Bank of American N.A. I defaulted on this loan well over 7 years ago. Bank of America is still reporting this negative information on all XXXX of my credit reports. This are reporting complete different time dates and defaults on each credit report. Basiclly they have no idea when the default accured because the loan was transfered so many times. Attached is proof that tha default accured over 7 years ago. You can clearly see this on older credit reports i have also inclosed,

Couple of weeks ago ( after 6 years later ), I got a phone call from XXXX phone number @ XXXX. 
Saying that I have unsatisfactory case from Bank of America credit card amount of {$10000.00} that I owed and asking for settle amount of 50 % otherwise they will get a judgement and sue me .... 
I thought this account might have missed during the bankruptcy. After checking my file from the attorney and credit report that I pulled after 3 month later after bankruptcy, it clearly said that this account was " Discharged through Bankruptcy Chapter XXXX '' So, I called back to them trying to avoid unnecessary future hassle and I informed them about the discharge. Now they are saying to me that " This particular account 's discharge was fraud, therefore The bank of America sold this account to us to recover their loss '' also said there was breech of contract that I violated with BOA for this account in order to get a bankruptcy and asking me XXXX % of settlement instead of XXXX %. They basically told me that there was fraud on my discharge. But I did everything legitimately through my attorney and had no problem at all for 6 years.Is this scam? 
I needs some advise on this please. They said today is last day for settle and it really bothers me

The alleged account had been updated to cease and desist by the time they claim to have a trial and steal my information and my house at XXXX in XXXX TN. I XXXX XXXX make a claim with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) that the following attached attempt to collect a debt is highly fraudulent. My personal information is being floated in what is known in the debt collection business as a " debt Pool '', whereas collection information is outdated and not even enforceable. The attached collection from XXXX XXXX, XXXX does not state that the debt is no longer enforceable, a stipulation by the Federal Trade Commission. The method of an illegal posting of a collection on my personal credit report, or an illegal collection against my rights of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act can not be tolerated. In Federal Trade Commission v. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( 2009 ) the federal district court decided in favor of the Federal Trade Commission that a collection agency must operate within strict guidelines in the collection of a debt. The criteria are as follows : 1 ) The debt must still be enforceable within the state of procurement or where the original obligator resides, or a combination of both. 
2 ) The debt collector must be licensed and bonded if applicable within the state in which it is trying to collect, if the debt is collectable. 
3 ) The validation of debt ownership must be proved, without exception. 
There is no statement on the attached collection that the debt is no longer enforceable. The collection agency stipulates that Bank of America obtained a judgment against me. By legal mandate, the docket number of the judgment must be listed as well as what county clerk 's office the judgment is filed with. In this case, there is no judgment. The statement saying " This judgment may be forwarded to an attorney for execution '' is a complete falsehood. There can not be a lawsuit as the legal time limit to enforce a summary judgment action has passed. 
Even though the collection letter states that illegal, abusive, deceptive and unfair debt collections are illegal, this collection in its entirety is just that, a deceptive illegal attempt to collect a debt that is no longer enforceable. 
I demand that all my information be purged immediately by XXXX XXXX, XXXX and Bank of America, and that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take the necessary steps to sanction both companies for using such abusive collection tactics.

I would like a detail response as to how the information is being verified, and I would like a detailed payment history, if not I would like for the company and all three credit bureaus to remove the incorrect information from my report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX, 2008, Countrywide Home Loans , Inc., a subsidiary of Countrywide Financial, sold Countywide Home Loans Servicing, another subsidiary, to NB Holdings, another subsidiary that was wholly owned by Bank of America Corporation. Bank of America Corporation paid Countrywide Home Loans , Inc., for this sale by issuing it a note for XXXX. Countrywide Home Loans Servicing was the actual subsidiary of Countrywide, that serviced almost all of Countrywide 's mortgage loans. 

Bank of America Corporation assigned a mortgage without the note twice to its own foreclosure department by hiring and using XXXX XXXX, XXXX to twice to fabricate XXXX Assignment of Mortgages within six months of one another, which is impossible to FOR VALUE RECIEVED to happen twice, when supposedly the FOR VALUE RECEIVED already transpired. 

Open both attachments!!!

I had to open  XXXX  disputes with  Bank of America  on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  after experiencing a medical event prior to that weekend that left me with no memory of approximately four days which would have been from  XXXX . During that time there were  XXXX  transactions made that I am unaware of making those being as follows :  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX    XXXX   XXXX   (  XXXX , SC  XXXX  {$20.00}  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX   XXXX  {$86.00}  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  ( ATM Withdraw ) {$100.00} Now when the claims were made at the local BOA Branch ( Near  XXXX   XXXX  ) in  XXXX , SC with the banker sitting at her desk and placing me on the speakerphone so she heard everything that was stated. I informed them that I was unaware of making these charges and would like to dispute them, we went through the general questions about where was the card kept, where was the PIN kept, Was it ever out of my reach, etc. I explained to them that first off I had no memory of those days because of the transient global amnesia ( which I sent the medical release records to them ) and even informed them they could contact the releasing doctor because with this condition you may never remember events, can be talked into doing things you normally wouldnt and have no memory of them, etc. I informed them that my card is kept in my phone case near my Drivers license which has my birth-date on it, which the year was the PIN and anyone could have had access to that information when I was knocked out, asleep or whatever because even my tox screen test showed high levels of toxins in my system that I did not ingest. They said that they would start the dispute process and make a general decision to offer temporary credit or not within 10 days while they research the claims. Again the claims were broken into  XXXX  claim s Claim  # :  XXXX  ( for the {$86.00} and {$20.00}  )  and Claim # :  XXXX  ( for the {$100.00}  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   ).  Well everything seemed to be going fine I was issued temporary credit for the {$100.00}  ( Claim  #  XXXX  ) and was checking on the status of the  Claim  #  XXXX , which was never issued temporary credit for and still has not been. But of note it should be noted that on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  @  XXXX  I received a call from a  XXXX  with the fraud department whose message stated verbatim as follows " Hello this is  XXXX  call from  Bank of America Fraud Claims  this message is for  XXXX   XXXX   if  you could please return my call at your earliest convenience at  XXXX  again that number is  XXXX  ). I saw the message and called her back it was  XXXX  and since their was no extension to call I had to go through the customer service side which took roughly  10 mi nutes only to be patched over to the claims department where that agent looked into the claim and said they were calling to ask me some questions about the claim, which were the same questions answered when the claim was filed at the bank location and then stated that the claim had been denied because they could not reach me when they contacted me for this information. I informed him that this was not even 20 minutes ago since I was contacted for this information and I was informed that he was sorry all he could do was ask that the claim be reopened but that no temp credit would be issued since the claim had been denied. I even informed him I wanted to speak to  XXXX  manager because how can you deny a claim with in 20 m inutes of calling someone and stating to call you back at their earliest convenience, if it was that important shouldnt something else have been said. He just apologized and stated that he would put in the request and someone would call me back within  24-48 hours. This infuriated me so I emailed the BOA  president on Saturday morning about this matter and ask him to get involved because this was not right to cancel a claim after  20  minutes of calling someone and not telling them you needed to speak to them by the end of the day. I wake up this morning  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  and receive emails stating that the claim for #  XXXX  was reversed and the temporary credit would be withdrawn from my account on  XXXX   XXXX  and to contact them if I needed copies of what they used to make their decision. I contacted them and spoke to a agent by the name of  XXXX  out of Georgia, who informed me the claims were linked ( meaning the same agent could have worked both claims ) and that the claim was denied because I had a history with   XXXX   of a purchase on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  ( which I asked him how does one purchase in like 5 months establish a history with the merchant, and he said that was  one  reason it was denied, then he stated that I had stated that the card was always in my possession and no one else never had access to my PIN, and since the PIN was entered correctly the first time the research team had decided I made the purchase ), which I never informed them I informed them of exactly what is written above in beginning of this complaint. I feel as if this research department is ignorning information  (  both medical and about the location of PIN and card that has been given to them since the beginning of these disputes ) and feel that this is in retaliation by the bank or the banks employee for me reaching out to the  President  on Saturday to state my issues with his claim representative closing the claim with in 20  minutes of calling a customer.

When I was younger a man approached me and forced me to cash checks for him. It was XXXX separate checks at XXXX separate Bank of America locations. I told the bank what happened and whoever I spoke to told me that the fact that I was physically forced to cash the checks did not matter. I found that hard to believe and decided that I would not pay it because it in fact was a result of the actions previously mentioned. I also tried to file a police report of the incident at the time but because I had no information as to who the man was, the police could do nothing.

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX - We got a $ XXXX loan with XXXX for our primary residence valued, then, at $ XXXX. Made our payments to XXXX for the next few years w/o issue. Then in XXXX, Real Estate bubble burst.

XXXX - We were " served '' an official letter from XXXX demanding payment in full of the {>= $1,000,000} loan. I called and spoke to, " XXXX XXXX '' who was absolutely horrible and said if we did n't pay the loan off, they could have us " out of our home by XXXX '' We had a new baby girl and XXXX XXXX XXXX boy/girl twins ( XXXX/XXXX/XXXX was their XXXX Birthday party. I will never forget how painful that was ) Attorney gave me the run down and timeframes so I could plan accordingly. Attached to this complaint is a copy of a debt validation notice we received on  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , and dated  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , from the debt collection law firm of  XXXX   XXXX  in  XXXX  WA.     We dispute the validity of the debt identified in the notice and we will be sending a formal debt validation request and dispute letter directly to  XXXX   XXXX  within t he 30-day period of receiv ing this notice.  XXXX   XXXX  should cease and desist all collection activity and threats of judicial foreclosure until they have validated a debt, provide proof of creditor status and provide a complete accounting of all individual amounts, which would include any  3rd  party payments made towards this loan from obligors and other parties. Evidence of any electronic transfers of the note should be provided as well to establish who is entitled to receive payments.     The notice is a threat to deprive of our property with the statement, Even though the judicial foreclosure process is being commenced and may proceed during the 30-day period In this notice,  XXXX   XXXX  provides a false statement that BANK OF  AMERICA, N.A. ( BANA ) , is the current creditor to whom the debt/loan is owed.   BANA has never extended credit to us and has no economic interest in promissory note. BANA is only a servicer debt collector.
In a previous notice ( attached with this complaint ) sent to us by BANA, th  ey stated that  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  was the creditor to whom the debt was owed.      XXXX   XXXX  and   BANA are violating the FDCPA that they must comply with.
BANA   is not a creditor per the FDCPA http : //www.ftc.gov/os/statutes/fdcpa/fdcpact.shtm   803. Definitions [ 15 USC 1692a ] As used in this title -- ( 4 ) The term " creditor '' means any person who offers or extends credit creating a debt or to whom a debt is owed, but such term does not include any person to the extent that he receives an assignment or transfer of a debt in default solely for the purpose of facilitating collection of such debt for another.
http : //www.ftc.gov/os/statutes/fdcpa/commentary.shtm Section 803 ( 4 ) defines " creditor '' as " any person who offers or extends credit creating a debt or to whom a debt is owed. '' However, the definition excludes a party who " receives an assignment or transfer of a debt in default solely for the purpose of facilitating collection of such debt for another. '' 1. General. The definition includes the party that actually extended credit or became the obligee on an account in the normal course of business, and excludes [ 53 Fed. Reg. 50102 ] a party that was assigned a delinquent debt only for collection purposes.

I had hoped to add the following information to show how they respond to customers.     This morning I received a phone call from BOA regarding the complaint listed above. According to the  Overdraft Protection Law as of   XXXX   XXXX    , 2010 the def ault setting for a checking account must be a rejection of transactions by the bank if the checking account lacks sufficient funds. Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to your agency in hopes you can help me with some charges on my Bank of america card previously disputed with you guys. I would like to know the status of the disputes. I am   XXXX   and I do not owe a computer, no electricity or internet and I am not com puter literate. Communication is kind of difficult sometimes. So I asked my friend to help me with this. I did a complaint with CFPB previously but I lost track on what happened with my disputes. I was naive and let some companies take advantage of me and charged me for online services, meanwhile I told them I didnt own a computer, they said it wouldnt be a problem they would do all the work for me, and they did disappeared after, I tried to contact them many times to see what was going on, and they were not capable of fulfill with their end of the deal. I would like to know if the charges that I disputed with  Bank of America were ever investigated and if they did what were the results. If they were disputed as claim and defenses. I would really appreciate if you help me with this so I can get some closure please.

XX/XX/XXXX , Unauthorized ACH of {$7300.00} on my organisation 's checking account. Reported unathorised ACH to Bank  of America  in   XXXX   XXXX   Faxed an unauthorised ACH form to Bank  of America i n   XXXX   XXXX  . A notarized letter ( signed by the signatories to the account ) was sent to Bank  of America o n  XX/XX/XXXX . Bank  of America  has not refunded the unathorised withdrawal.

I 've been with Bank of America for over 10 years, the last several with low balance and little activity. I last transferred money about a year ago. I had estatements and reliably received an email balance alert every month. In  XXXX , I received a statement in the mail explaining my funds had been escheated to the state. I had received zero communication until the money was gone. Nothing by email or mail. I understand escheatment policies vary but I had used the account somewhat recently. I called B of A and after discussing with a rep, they placed me on hold and forwarded me to the state.

On approximately  XXXX   XXXX  my son moved to Oregon, and when I checked flights so I could visit, I found that   XXXX   XXXX   had service from   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  . While I was looking at flights on my tablet I saw an ad for a   XXXX   XXXX   branded Visa card offering mileage benefits. I signed up, supplied name, address and requested info and submitted the request. After the submission a popup appeared with terms and conditions and I noted there was a {$75.00} fee. That day  I  tried to find a contact phone number on the popup, to complain that there was NO notification of the fee prior to the submission action, but I was unable to find an active number. I wrote myself a reminder to contact the company after I received the card, with the intention of simply explaining the problem and cancelling the card ( and the fee ).   Yesterday,  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , the card arrived, and I called the number on the back (  XXXX  ). After explaining the problem to the agent, I was informed that it was my problem, and that the fee was expected to be paid even if I did not use the card.   I feel that their web-based promotions are badly presented and purposely misleading. I would like Bank of America to cancel this credit card account and remove the {$75.00} fee. If this resolution is made after the date this {$75.00} fee comes due, and I am forced to pay any yet to be received invoice, I ask that that amount be refunded to me via check. I further ask that there be NO negative credit report issued because of this misunderstanding.

I run   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   to foreign countries. In  XX/XX/XXXX  this year I took  8  photographers on a legal people to people tour of  XXXX . One of the group sent a wire transfer to my account at Bank of America from  XXXX  and mentioned  XXXX  in the transfer. I never received the funds. When I followed up on XX/XX/XXXX    I was told that the funds were under review. I continued to follow up every few days but I was never allowed to speak with anyone who was involved with the process. I have still not received the funds. This was a legal visit to  XXXX  under a people to people license and absolutely no money was either sent or received from  XXXX . All payments were made through a licensed operator in  XXXX . This can so easily be verified looking at my account transactions.  <P/>  2 weeks ag o, without informing me, my bank account was frozen. On   XX/XX/XXXX  I s poke to someone in the small business department and he told me I could still use my business account. I had already sent out several checks on that account. I also made a transfer to my daughter who needed the money. On Tuesday I get a call from my daughter in tears saying that the payment to her account had been reversed. Again without informing me, my business account had been frozen. I 'm now left with no money, several bounced checks and I have yet to receive an explanation why this has happened. I 'm told I have to present proof of residency although I have lived in the USA for 38 years. On Saturday  XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   I received a check for {$2500.00} from  XXXX  of the largest  XXXX  financial services companies in the United States. I took it to my local branch of Bank of America and asked the teller if there was a way that I could access {$700.00} dollars from the check that day. The Bank  Manager ca me out and said that I could take the check to   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   and cash it and bring the cash back and I would have access to the full {$2500.00} that day. I went to a nearby   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   showed identification. They said that there was a hold on the check and needed to call the   XXXX    company. After about  40  minutes I spoke to an assistant in the Bank and asked what was happening. The  manager of   XXXX   XXXX   came out and said that they could not c ash the check and I needed to call the   XXXX   account to receive the funds sooner than  XXXX   XXXX  but that the check would be cleared on  XXXX   XXXX . I went back to Bank of America and the  manager s aid that they would need to call the Financial services company to clear the check on Monday  XXXX   XXXX . I noticed on  XXXX   XXXX  that the check had not yet cleared so I reviewed my account online. There was a note on the transaction. Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America continues to charge overdraft fees to my checking account for charges that have not posted to my account, most recently on  X/X/17   . Only when I spend  30  minutes on the phone to point out to a customer service rep and supervisor this unfair practice will they correct it.

On  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX   I deposited a {$250.00} typed bank check from  XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   into my Bank of America checking account. The funds were immediately electronically withdrawn from  XXXX   XXXX  & deposited into my account. On  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  ,  four  days after the transaction was completed, Bank of America seized the {$250.00} from my account. As reviewing my account transactions on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , I observed that  BOA  had seized my deposit. I immediately began calling BOA customer service centers to resolve the problem. I was told on  3  separate calls to  BOA  customer service centers that the money was seized because the original check could not be verified. BOA claims the bank check could not be read well enough to be verified, yet their online banking center provides me a crystal clear image of the check in question. BOA read the check well enough to withdraw the funds from the correct  XXXX   XXXX  account, yet could n't read it well enough to keep the funds where deposited? I contacted the   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   customer to discuss the issue & see if their funds were returned. The   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX    customer immediately began investigating the fund withdrawal through a  XXXX   XXXX  telephone representative. The investigation with  XXXX   XXXX  found that t BOA  did not try to return the seized funds to the   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   or the  XXXX   XXXX  customer. BOA did not make any effort to notify me that they were actively withdrawing money from my account for any reason. My calls to  BOA  resulted in rhetorical circle explanations stating there was nothing I could do whatsoever to resolve the problem. In the manner in wh ich BOA  dismissed this issue, offering no resolve or assistance ; I do not believe this is an isolated incident. I firmly believe that BOA is performing these types of scenarios to people ( especially since the amounts are low enough to not afford a lawyer to take to court ). I truly believe  BOA  is running a scam, in small amounts to avoid massive public push back. They target random people, hoping to prey upon the elderly or individuals who speak  XXXX  as a second language who do n't know how to push back against an enormous corporation. The fact that the seized funds of {$250.00} makes me all the more suspect. Who, in their right mind, would hire an expensive lawyer to fight for {$250.00}? No one. Which means,  BOA  can conveniently make these types of monetary  seizures to  millions of bank customers and probably get away with it. This is an enormous illegal money making scheme that someone needs to investigate. I bet this scheme is netting millions from innocent customers.

Hello Ive been a Bank of America client for many years and have had this particular card for over 17 years.   My complaint pertains to an issue with BOAs online bill pay system that malfunctioned and led me to be marked late for the month of  XXXX   XXXX  for a payment that was due on  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX .     Bank of America at the time me on an auto payment system called Net Access Payment which required that I indicate a specified minimum payment amount after manually checking what the minimum payment is and that amount would automatically be deducted from my bank account.   But this meant that if the minimum increased, l Bank of America would still take out pre-set payment amount, thereby the payment that would be taken out would not be sufficient to cover the minimum payment.   My company requires me to travel a lot due to which I have auto payments setup for all accounts. I called BOA multiple times to try to get an actual auto payment system setup where I did not have to manually change the payment amount constantly, but was told at the time that no solutions existed and that I login from time to time to adjust the montly payment.     Back in late  XXXX  and early  XXXX  I logged into the BOA system and checked the minimum payment had been adjusted to {$170.00}. Therefore, I changed the auto payment amount accordingly to be a bit over the {$170.00}, as I wanted to take advantage of the 0 % apr and not payoff the account too quickly.     After doing this I began to travel all over the country for a period of 3 months for work and assumed payments were being taken out and the account was current. All the while I made sure no additional purchases were made with the account, as otherwise the minimum payment would have adjusted and I would constantly need to re-adjust the auto payment amount.     Finally upon returning home in early  XXXX   XXXX , I found my credit report score had gone done, as a late payment for  XXXX   XXXX  was reported by Bank of America. There were no calls or emails from Bank of America prior to this alerting me of any problems.     I would find that firstly BOA did not take out a payment for  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , that I had setup as the auto payment amount, and only took out a  XXXX  payment for {$170.00}.   Additionally, I was told that the payment due for  XXXX  was not the {$170.00} that I saw in  XXXX  after I had made the last balance transfer transaction, but instead had moved up to {$290.00}. The reason I was given is that when I logged into the BOA system on  XXXX   XXXX  to check my minimum payment, although the balance transfer for {$8000.00} had registered and the balance I saw was the updated balance, bu t BOA id not  adjust the payment until the following month.     Now had I known about this I would have certainly increased the payment amount.   I had over {$5000.00} in my checking account at the time, which was more than enough to cover the minimum payment. I have attached a copy of my bank statement for this.     I have called Bank of America and despite me being put on hold for ove r 30 minutes , they were not able to figure out why their own auto payment failed to take out the  XXXX  payment.

Consumer complaint narrative: In mid  XXXX   XXXX , I responded to the Bank of America 's {$300.00} cash bonus offer to open a new checking account with them. The offer requirement was to open a new checking account and make direct deposits totaling {$4000.00} or more within the first 90 days of opening the account. I opened the checking account on    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   and satisfied the  requirement within 30 days ( direct deposit of pension payments from TIAA ). In lat e   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   I ca lled BOA customer service to inquire about not seeing the posting of the {$300.00} bonus, the agent confirmed that I had met all the requirement and that he bonus was " in the processing stage. '' She advised me to be patient and check back in another 30 days. But after another month I still did n't receive the {$300.00}, so in early   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     I called the BOA customer service again about it, and this time the agent told me the bonus is still " in processing. '' Once again she confirmed I have met all the requirements but she said the waiting period is 90 days after meeting the requirements. She assured me the bonus would be posted after  XXXX   XXXX  and told me to be patient for a little longer. But  XXXX   XXXX  passed and still i do n't see the bonus. I called the customer service on    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   again , only this time i was told that my bonus was denied! They claimed that I have not made the direct deposit. I just ca n't believe this! After more than 4 months of assuring me that i have met all the requirements and that my bonus was on the way, now suddenly change the response?? And per their promotional term , 3rd par ty agent payments such as gov't and pension payments are part of the qualifying direct deposits. If they do n't mean what they say, what were they trying to do? Intentionally lying or false advertising to lure and deceive the consu mer?!

Consumer complaint narrative: CONSUMER 'S ORIGINAL COMPLAINT Reference : Bank of America Case No.  XXXX  On  XX/XX/XXXX , I initiated a billing dispute with my credit card issue r ( Bank of America ) regarding illegally collected travel tax charged on my credit card by merchant (   XXXX   XXXX   ).  On  XX/XX/XXXX , I sent another supplemental statement to Bank of America outlining the specifics of my billing dispute with  XXXX   XXXX . On  XX/XX/XXXX ,  XXXX   XXXX  processed my refund application for the illegally collected travel tax amounting to {$120.00}. To date, refund has not been processed by said merchant. On  XX/XX/XXXX , I received a letter from Bank of America stating they were unable to intervene in situations involving sales tax. It is glaringly clear from such correspondence that Bank of America  Credit Billing Dispute  never bothered to read the specifics of the billing dispute and the issues pertaining to prompt refund of the billing disputes in question. I spoke to a certain (  XXXX   )  a supervisor/manager from Bank of America who was not at all very helpful. I told him why is Bank of America stating on its billing dispute letter dated XX/XX/XXXX  that it can not doing anything not about sales tax when it was about something else. He responded that it was a standard letter generated by Bank of America. I told him it was incorrect and nobody including his staff was reading the specific issues addressed in my billing dispute letters of  XX/XX/XXXX  &  XX/XX/XXXX . It was about additional billing ( illegally collected ) charged by the merchant for travel tax which customer is exempted from paying. I have already provided the merchant documents to prove that the transaction is exempted from travel tax and proof to Bank of America. Yet, Bank of America continues to disregard this matter and specifically address the issues addressed in the billing dispute. Merchant to date has not processed my refund for the billing dispute in question either. Bank of America is clearly in violation of  XXXX  Credit Card Core Rules on investigating and for failing to resolve customer 's billing dispute including violation of the Fair Credit Billing Act.     BANK OF AMERICA 'S RESPONSE Our research revealed that the credit card account ending in  XXXX  was opened on  XX/XX/XXXX . On  XX/XX/XXXX , you contact Bank of America by way of telephone to dispute portions of two transactions on your account. The disputed transactions are as follows : {$96.00} of the transaction in the amount of {$1900.00} ; and {$32.00} of the transaction in the amount of {$720.00}. These transactions were with the merchant  XXXX   XXXX , which posted to your account on  XX/XX/XXXX . Correspondence was mailed to you on  XX/XX/XXXX , explaining that Bank of America is unable to intervene in situations involving a sales tax. Please understand that either a state or country has the right to impose a sales tax on a purchase. By giving your account number to the merchant and/or signing the sales slip, you authorized them to bill your account for the amount in question. The documents you provided with your claim is inapplicable and does not void the Travel Tax. In order to support your claim, a sales receipt needs to be provided that shows a different amount should have been billed by the merchant  XXXX   XXXX . If you do have such a receipt in your possession, it can be faxed directly to Bank  of Americas  claims team at  XXXX  or mailed to  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , TX  XXXX . The  Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) , which was created to assist consumers with incorrect or unauthorized transactions, states to protect your billing rights you must write to us within 60 days after the error appeared on your statement. Additionally, if you have an automated payment scheduled, please notify us at least  three  business days before the scheduled payment if you want to stop the payment from posting to your account. You are required to specify your name and complete account number, the amount of the transaction, the reason why you think the transaction is in error, and your letter must be mailed to the address specified for billing inquiries. Bank of America must work within all rules established by Card Associations and bank guidelines regarding customer disputes. I regret, in your case, we are unable to assist further with your dispute at this time without the additional previously requested information. We also suggest you continue to pursue this matter directly with the merchant to come to a satisfactory resolution. Account Ending In :  XXXX   XX/XX/XXXX  Contact Us :  XXXX  Extension  XXXX  Pag ge  1 of 2 Ag ain, thank you for your feedback and for affording us the opportunity to respond. Although it is n ever pleasant to hear our customers have been dissatisfied, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience.     COMPLAINANT 'S RESPONSE : Bank of America continues to be in violation of the Fair Credit Billing Act for failing to resolve the billing dispute in question. The merchant has processed complainant 's refund demand on  XX/XX/XXXX  ( as evidenced by complaint 's correspondence dated  XX/XX/XXXX ,  XXXX  and  XX/XX/XXXX  previously provided to Bank of Americ a ).  However, to date Bank of America continues ignore the fact that the merchant has acknowledged complainant 's billing dispute and not done anything in good faith to refund the travel tax illegally collected in violation of their own refund rules . Complainant has c onsistently followed the merchant 's refund procedures in good faith but Bank of America and the merchant continues to ignore this matter. Conversely, Bank of America has not provided complainant about the merchant 's response to this matter either to date.     All the documents and the facts presented to Bank of America and the merchant constitute valid legal defenses for a billing dispute. Additionally, the specific details of the billing dispute were also outlined very clearly and Bank of America has not addressed those issues either.     Complainant has no legal obligation to pay merchant for fees illegally collected and it is Bank of America primary responsibility as a party to the transaction to ensure the merchant bill a consumer correctly.     Bank of America continues to ignore and not comply with all the rules established b y Card Associations and  bank guidelines regarding customer billing disputes.     On  XX/XX/XXXX , Bank of America issued a credit of {$32.00} for only  one  of the disputed transactions. The remaining {$96.00} billing dispute has still not been credited to complainant 's account.     CFPB should take the appropriate steps to sanction Bank of America for continued violation of the Fair Credit Billing Act and not working within all the established Card Associations ( specifically   XXXX   XXXX   Core Rules ) and its own bank guidelines regarding billing disputes.

On  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX   or  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , I deposited a check for {$190.00} into my Bank of America checking account via my phone. I knew I had a billpay check for {$130.00} going to a creditor that was scheduled to be  paid on   XXXX  
 BofA said the {$190.00} check would be good to cover items that posted on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  . I assumed this would pay for the {$130.00} payment.     I carefully monitor this account. All day on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , there was never any overdraft notice. All day on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , there was no overdraft charge. But, when I returned home from work after  XXXX , in the morning of  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , there was a backdated overdraft notice and charge for {$35.00} on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX   for the {$130.00}.     This seems grossly unfair.  1. I had money in the bank to cover the charge. 2.  The bill was not scheduled to be paid until  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , when my check would have posted.  3.  I was never notified that a payment had posted on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , even though I have every type of alert possible set up for this account, and I monitor my account closely. Had I known that the bill payment had posted on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  , I would have immediately withdrawn funds from another bank and covered the payment.     I have asked for a refund of the overdraft charge, bu t BofA  refuses to give it to me. They claim that I should have known that the bank might pay my bills early and not tell me about it!     I do n't think it should be legal for banks to backdate items when backdating causes the consumer to be charged fees. Seems like a sneaky tactic designed to enrich banks. In addition, it should be required that banks notify customers immediately whenever they are overdrawn so that they can put money into the account to cover the overdraft without incurring a fee.

I filed a police report, and an identity theft report with the federal trade commission.
