Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a permanent resident of the   US and a customer of Bank Of America for years. Recently I was sent a letter requesting to go to a branch and provide my residency documents. It was then that revealed that my residency status in BoA systems was captured as a US citizen. This change had been made to my account without my knowledge and consent. My status was updated to the original correct citizenship though when I provided my legal documents, and the store manager apologized. He was even surprised how a customer 's citizenship status could be modified in their system like this.
Since this could have unknown legal responsibilities and consequences to the extent I have no idea what, I filed a complaint in the store to receive an official response from BoA on why and when this change had been made to my account. Two weeks later somebody called me and explained they had researched my case, but had no idea when or how this had happened! While she apologized on the call for this hassle, and confirmed this change had nothing to do with me ( how could it ), she refused to supply a written response taking responsibilities for this modification. Again, changing my status from a non-citizen to US citizen, specially considering I am a citizen of a country that is undergoing US sanctions, could have consequences in future that this is my right to know when this happened and why. This could also be a fraud or misconduct of somebody in BoA who had access to customers confidential information like mine.

On or about  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , I contacted the bank and credit bureaus about the wrong account number and information being reported on my credit file. All parties decided not to remove the information. My dispute is that I do not or did not have mortgage account number with the bank under the account number being reported on my credit file.
Received email from Bank of America fake site to input my username, password, name, address, credit information, and personal email login information Here is the scamming link https :  XXXX

I received a letter from Bank of America notifying me that they canceled my credit card due to the reasons  of 1. an inactive account and 2. seri ous delinquency, and public record or collection filed.     The fact is that I have had this particular credit card as an emergency backup and had no problems for the past 20 years, also I am currently in the process of removing fraudulent accounts from my credit reports due to identity theft of which I became aware only in  XXXX  this year.     I 'm not happy that the bank did not contact me first before canceling my card, and I have no way of contacting them to present my side of story.

I am having an issue with Bank of america. They have disconnected my online banking and i have not been able to access my account online or make payments to my credit card due to this. I have tried contacting them on fixing this situation and they are not helping me resolve this matter.

Bank of America offers a preferred rewards program. They state that you need  a '3-month average  combined balances of {$20000.00} or more in qualifying Bank of America banking accounts  and/or   XXXX   XXXX  and   XXXX   XXXX    investment a ccounts '. and 'We 'll review your program balance at the beginning of each month to see if you 've reached a higher tier. ' both quotes from bankofamerica.com/balancerequiremenents. I deposited the minimum amount for the second tier platinum on  XXXX   XXXX , and to date have not received the benefits of the platinum rewards. I ma de two phon e calls asking to have my account reviewed as on the mobile appliction it states 'Every month we will review yo ur 3-month  average combined balance ... ' and 'It 's calculated based on your average daily balance for  a three  calendar month period. ' No where does it say that a statement must be generated or that it is dependent on the number of days in the month.  A three calen dar month period does not have a foot note stating that it must b e one full ca lendar month. If the deposit occurred on the sixth of a month,  three months later is still a sixth of the month. It will be four  months in  XXXX  and the account I am sure will not be back dated. Our statement closed on  XXXX   XXXX , not the  XXXX  as in  XXXX . To be able to claim  a three m onth time frame with no particular details is extremely deceptive.

I charged   XXXX   XXXX   (  XXXX  )  XXXX  on my BofA credit card on  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX   in  XXXX ,  XXXX . The merchant (  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   )  offered me an option to pay the  XXXX  amount in  XXXX  which I declined -- the amount the merchant wanted was {$180.00}. I preferred paying in  XXXX  as the credit card compnay ( or  XXXX   )  would convert at a better rate. I did that for all my other charges on that trip and had no problems.     Later on it seem the merchant fraudulently changed the " decline paying in  XXXX  '' and charged me in  XXXX  instead. I could easily prove that if  BofA would get a copy of the original signed receipt. BofA  refuses to provide me a copy of the signed sales slip that shows I did not authorize a charge in  XXXX . This happened with many merchants in  XXXX  and I always declined paying in  XXXX  and had no problems on my trip -- -only this merchant fraudulently changed the option after my signature.     Today I have to pay  XXXX   XXXX  or BofA says they will spoil my  credit score  ... but they will not provide me a copy showing I authorized  XXXX   XXXX  ( which I did not! ) ... instead they claim this is foreign exchange issue -- which it is not!     The matter could easily be solved if BofA showed me a copy of the signed credit card slip -- - they will not because they know I did not authorize it. I called everyday for a month and they refused to provide a copy of the credit card signed transaction slip.

Bank of America sent me balance transfer checks to use up to the credit limit on the account of {$22000.00}. I took advantage of their offer. After they added all of their transfer fees they then reported to the credit agencies that I had exceeded my credit limit. My " very good '' rating immediately plunged  XXXX  points to " good ''.     I feel this is a deceptive banking practice.      1.  They should not allow me to go over my limit if they know the fees will push me over and kill my personal rating.      2.  They should more transparently disclose this issue to annyone taking advantage of their offers.     I called and talked to a representative named  XXXX  and then her supervisor called me. They basically relayed that this issue had been reviewed and the bank followed all policies so there was no error on their part.     I strongly disagree. Reporting that can so quickly destroy a very good credit rating so quickly over such an insignificant amount needs to be reviewed and addressed. The account was over the limit by {$52.00} out of a {$22000.00} credit line and was only over until I received my bill and paid it down as required the following month.

Consumer complaint narrative: I find that the Bank of America online banking website for my   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   card lacks enough basic information in obvious locations to educate consumers on their processes. This practice seems predatory. The statement balance amount and due date are n't automatically populated when you go from Account Overview to the Bill Pay Center tab of the site, which creates an extra step prone to human error while transferring the information from one place to another. The Bill Pay Center tab also does n't provide sufficient information, anywhere, that explains the different between  e-Bill  and  Recurring  Payments. When you try to establish an automatic payment, the website warns you that it takes a complete billing cycle to go into effect. My  XXXX  balance was paid twice (  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX   &  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX   ) and the latter was my e-bill initiated payment, which I was led to believe would NOT go into effect until it was time to pay my  XXXX    XXXX   statement. The website should provide a warning that my e-bill initiation would cover a specific statement. Consider elderly people, people living paycheck to paycheck, or young credit card holders that can not afford the mistakes that the BOA website seems designed to lead people to make. The mobile application is not much better! Until recently, your monthly statement balance was not easily located and also required poking around on lots of screens until you discovered useful information like statement balance.

Consumer complaint narrative: My husband and I opened our personal checking and savings account with Bank of America on  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  and our business checking and savings account on  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX .     On  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX , around  XXXX , logged into our personal account. Noticed that in our personal account there was a debit of {$880000.00} coming out of our account. I also attempted to log in to our business account, but was unable to log in. In my attempt to log in was given an error message of No match found. Please create a n ew Online ID and Passcode. We  had previously set up online banking, so this was a surprise to us. I immediately called the banks customer service center, asked about the debit amount coming out of our account and was told that the debit was put there by Bank of America as a way of stopping any further activity. I was then directed to contact th e Risk Closure  Department. Contacted them, was asked to provide my social security number and my Drivers License Number in order to locate my account and for verification purposes. Was told by a Risk Customer Service Representative that my account was under review and was most likely going to be closed. When I asked for the reason behind the closure, was only given the reason that it was a business decision and that we didnt adhere to the provisions of t he Deposit Agreement and   Disclosures and that at any time the owner of the account or the bank had the option to close the account without giving any reason for closure. I asked for more clarification of the closer and was told again that it was a business decision and was not able to give me any more information. Later, went home and rea d the Deposit Agreement and Disclosure again and  was unable to locate or determine any reason behind what was not adhered to within this agreement/disclosure.     On  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  around  XXXX , contacted t he Risk Closure Depar tment to obtain more information on our accounts and if they were going to be closed. In talking to the representative I was under the impression that I was discussing our personal and business accounts. Was told the closure was still under review and that there wasnt much else that could be done at this time. Furthermore, explained that we are a small business starting out and that we are only able to keep money in our account for a short time since we are trying to build our business by buying more products for resale. We dont have the capacity to keep money in our account for a lengthy amount of time. The nature of our business is that we buy our items from auction. At times we find good deals at the last moment, bid on the item, win the auction and make the purchase. We have a short turnaround time to make a payment. We are not like other businesses that purchase product and have 30 days to make a payment. For example there was a cash deposit in to our account and within that same banking day we sent a wire to a company by the name of  XXXX   XXXX , which also has an account with Bank of America, to purchase products that we had won on the auction. We have copies of the receipts for the items we purchased through the auction. If this documentation is needed to assist in this matter, we would be more than happy to provide them to you.     On  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  around  XXXX , contacted t he Risk Closure D epartment and was told that there was no risk closure attached to my social security number. I was under the impression that our personal accounts were not going to be closed.     On  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  around  XXXX , visited the local branch to see if our personal account was still open as well as the business account. I was told that the accounts were still under review, but were not closed. I again, still thought the accounts were going to be okay. After leaving the branch, I went to the ATM machine to withdrawal money and my card had been inactivated. Went back in to the branch and spoke with another representative. This individual noticed the pending risk closure and went to another branch employee to discuss. I was told they were trying to contact the Risk Closure Department to see if I could make a withdrawal and I was told that this department had already closed for the day, this was around  XXXX . This department closes at  XXXX  local time.     On  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  around  XXXX , contacted the  Risk Closure Dep artment to obtain clarification on whether our accounts were actually going to be closed. Was told that they were in fact going to be closed. I again asked for the reason behind the account closure and was given the same response as I received on  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX . I was still unable to receive a legitimate detailed reason for the closure. I explained to the representative that if the bank is going to provide the reason for closure of being that the customer didnt adhere to th e Deposit Agreement and Disclosure, that  they should be able to give a specific reason and page number within the agreement/disclosure that was not followed.     We strongly believe that that my spouse 's national origin, owner of the business, might have played a part in their decision to close our accounts. We did not receive an unbiased risk evaluation from Bank of America, due to his national origin. Bank of America was fully aware that the owner of the business had traveled and conducted routine business in  XXXX , which is his national origin.     During this time of not being able to use our accounts, we have suffered operational losses and opportunity costs of not being able to engage in normal planned business activity. This has put an undue stress on the business of not being able to purchase products. This has also put an undue amount of stress on our family, with young children, by not having access to our funds. I have also had to take time off of work to deal with this situation.

I received a piece of mail from a law firm in  XXXX   XXXX , AR, offering their services for representation regarding a lawsuit filed against me by  XXXX  and  XXXX  law firm on behalf of BofA. I was unaware of this at the time. My name was also in the Sunday,  XXXX   XXXX , newspaper noting said lawsuit. I feel that Bank of America committed an act of retaliation in the most obscene and disgusting way possible. On   XX/XX/XXXX ,  I placed a claim of fraud agains t one o f their customers in which I sent a transfer to. By mid   XX/XX/XXXX , th ey were stating that they stopped trying to get the money back. Honestly, I feel like they never tried, so I was out of my money of {$1400.00}. I tried to escalate this to the CEO of the company and apparently this was a huge no-no in their little world. Let me add, that not once have I overdrafted my account. So, here is the deal, today,   XX/XX/XXXX  2017,  m y deposit of almost {$900.00} hit my account for the week. Fortunately, I got gas at the beginning of the day and a few sodas, but by mid-day, on a Friday mind you, they instantly decided to shut down the account. No telephone calls, no emails, no letters in writing, nothing formal and I am left in the dark without a clear idea of what happened. I, then, called the customer service unit and got transferred. When I asked for a clear reason why my account was closed, there was no clear reason of why it happened. I was left completely in the dark. I got served with " Bank of America has the right to close your account at anytime ''. Well, that is nice, but why must the representatives of the bank be so smug and arrogant about it. This is hardly professional. It is almost like I worked for a week and Bank of America took it upon themselves to say " Well, we got this scammed out of {$1400.00}, what is anothe r $  XXXX +?  '' " He can handle it and we do not care if his refrigerator is empty, we do not care if his car payment is coming up due, we do not care if his day to day expenses need to be covered. We just care about  XXXX  this guy over because {$1400.00} was not enough. '' This is deplorable, unethical, and yes, I understand, perfect legal, but how am I to live over the next several days? All my money is wrapped up with the bank and they state how they will let me take my money from branch office. Yeah, they are giving me permission to come to the bank in  1 to 3  business days to get my own money. Guess what, Bank of America, THAT IS MY MONEY AND YOU ARE COMMITTING ACTS OF FRAUD AND MONEY LAUNDERING. You are holding my money, loaning on it, gaining a nominal interest rate on it, and doing of ton of interesting things that only banks like you know to do with it and what do I have? Nothing, nada, zilch, and a complete and utter upheaval of life. You have no class and that is unacceptable. Just because it was legal to close my account, you could have given me a date of when the account closure was going to happen to insure that I stopped checks, ACHs, and other items from being withdrawn from the account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank of America is listing an account on my report but can not 'validate the debt '. 
This reporting appeared on my report sometime during XXXX od XXXX, shows that it was a charge off in XXXX of XXXX, nothing done for years, and now shows charge off status every month since XXXX of XXXX. This makes me look as though I am currently in default. 
The only BofA card I has was account number XXXX and was closed in good standing back in XXXX. The account number listed on the report in not only unfamiliar to me but BofA, in a phone conversation on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the representative stated that BofA changed the account number once the account went to charge off status. She also verified that my original account, XXXX, was closed at my request and was in good standing upon closure. After several attempts to find an answer for me, while placing me on hold, she finally stated that they could n't find any statements past XXXX but the account was supposedly opened in XXXX and they do not know where the account came from. Furthermore, they can not provide me any documents that would validate this debt. 
Also, they reported the charge off to the IRS in XXXX which caused me to have to re-file my tax return and was charged many dollars in late penalties.

I attempted to open an account at  XXXX   XXXX , and learned that my name was in the   XXXX    for suspected fraud. So I contacted Bank of America, and asked how could I have my name and social security removed from the   XXXX   report, they explained I needed to pay the balances owed to them. Which the amount was right under {$350.00}, and I would need to write a letter in explaining that I had not only paid the balances owed, but did n't try to defraud the bank. I understood that when I was previously employed by    Bank of America,  due to a bounced check that I had wrote my account would be closed, and they fired me. I at the time was living pay check to pay check, and had plead with them to not fire me, but to deduct the money from my check that I owed them. I still got fired, and since then it took time to get back up on my feet. I 've now have remitted payment to Bank of America, and was informed  XXXX   XXXX   2017 that I  would n't be removed from  XXXX  They stated I did n't provide proof of my request asking to be removed from  XXXX , and that they did receive my letter but that was not sufficient. I 'm trying to better my life, but due to this  XXXX  report, it has caused me to be denied, certain apartment for leasing, and from opening a traditional bank account where I can re-establish a good banking history to obtain a mortgage loan.

Bank of America reports a debt that was discharged in Bankruptcy as having a balance, as being charged-off, and as being past due. 

Various courts have held that reporting a discharged debt as a charge off is advantageous to the bank because it can keep the debt on its books and makes the overall portfolio more valuable.

Consumer complaint narrative: They are taking days too report my pay to my loan company

Payment of {$180.00} due to Bank of America was submitted through  a Biller Service  on Saturday  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX . Payment was not processed by Bank of America until  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX . A late fee of {$25.00} was placed even though full payment was received and made before the due date. No partial payments were made. Called company and spoke with  XXXX   XXXX  to waive {$25.00} since it was the first time this happened, given that she mentioned she was not authorized to make that decision, she transferred me to her  manager   XXXX   XXXX , who reviewed the information in he system and after he verified mentioned that he could not waive the fee.     That Thursday  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  I looked to verify the fee and I noticed that instead of the {$25.00} I had been charged {$27.00} with interest. I called Bank of America again and throw time spoke with  XXXX  from California who did not want to provide her last name. I explained to her the situation and mentioned that I was being charged interest over the late fee and paid {$27.00} to avoid getting paid and interest. She wanted to remove the {$2.00} and did so without my authorization and I told her I would pay at that moment the full amount to avoid being charged more interest. She said I would be charged additional interest at the end of the month. How is this possible? I made the full payment and paid late fee with interest? Not understanding what clause in the contract says this. It is not clear. It seems that because of them proces sing one day late the payment I will need to catch up with them, buy then if I do n't pay they have two days to cha rge me addditonal interest? It seems Bank of America has the upper hand in this situation and I will always be at a disadvantage.     I have been a loyal customer since  XXXX  and I have never missed a payment.     Will my interest rate change? The Bank does not make this clear.   Will this affect my  credit score? Will this be reported in the Credit Bureaus? The bank says  no, but I would like an impartial party to clarify and have clarity if these charges are fair towards a customer who made the full payment on the card.     Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative: The error resolution procedures outlined in Section  1024.35  does not make a distinction as to whether the borrower asserts an error regarding an active or closed loan. It simply states that a servicer shall comply with the requirements of section  1024.35  for any written notice from a borrower that asserts an error and that includes the name of the borrower, information that enables the servicer to identify the borrowers mortgage loan account and the error the borrower believes has occurred. My complaints to the  XXXX  credit reporting agencies regarding the re-aging of my account serves as written notice to the servicer that an error relating to the servicing of my loan has occurred. This complaint serves as my request for documents and information relied upon by the loan servicer in making its determination that no error has occurred.  <P/> The FCRA requires servicers to provide accurate information to the credit reporting agencies. As such, Bank of America, N.A., as the loan servicer on this account, is required to comply with all requirements applicable to a notice of error with respect to such written request. I have disputed the accuracy of the date of delinquency reported to the credit reporting agencies by Bank of America,  N.A . The servicer must comply within 30 days after receipt of the notice of error. Pursuant to section  1024.35 ( e ) ( 4 ),  the servicer shall provide documentation and information relied upon by the servicer in making its determination that no error occurred within 15 days of the borrowers request for such documents.  <P/> Bank of America, N.A. has failed to explain why it believes my mortgage account first became delinquent in  XXXX   XXXX . The CFPB issued a final rule on when a borrower becomes delinquent for purposes of servicing rules.  <P/> A borrower and a borrowers loan obligation are delinquent beginning on the date a payment sufficient to cover principal, interest and if applicable escrow becomes due and unpaid The CFPBs definition of when a borrowers loan becomes delinquent is consistent with the mortgage loan provisions  of P2, S ection O a nd P4 Item 3 ( attach ed ).  <P/> The  XXXX   TILA Servicing Proposal  promulgated by the CFPB allows servicers to apply payments to the oldest outstanding periodic payment. When this occurs the borrowers delinquency must advance. In the instant matter, this did not occur. The payments accepted by the loan servicer between  XXXX   XXXX  and  XXXX   XXXX  were applied to principal and interest and not applied to the periodic property taxes that became due  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  ( see attached ). The loan servicer has not provided a reason authorized by law as to why my mortgage loan account was re-aged. They are required by law to correct the error.  <P/> A copy of this complaint has been mailed to today to : Bank of Americ a, N.A.,  Customer Service,  CA6-919-01-41 ,   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX   XXXX , CA  XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America withdrew {$910.00} from my account on    XXXX / XXXX /17   claiming that   XXXX   XXXX   had contacted them and stating that the check had been presented twice - once to mobile deposit and once to  XXXX . I did not cash any check at  XXXX . BoA refused to provide me with any additional details such as the date of the transaction, etc. They told me they mailed me a letter and that I should take it up with   XXXX   XXXX  . I then contacted   XXXX   XXXX    (  as did the party who issued the check to me ).  XXXX  conducted and investigation and determined that the check was only negotiated ONCE. To Bank of America. They had absolutely no record or contact BoA nor of the check being used at  XXXX . They offered to speak to BoA to clear the matter up.     I then contacted BoA again who suddenly claimed that   XXXX   XXXX   had nothing to do with it. They claimed that i had deposited the check once by ATM and once via mobile deposit. Again, utterly untrue. Actually, i accidentally deposited the check twice via mobile deposit. The first time i tried, it did not appear to go through ; I deposited the check again and later got  XXXX  confirmations. However, the money was only deposited a single time into my account so there would be no reason to later withdraw it. They supposedly launched an investigation to reapply the funds to my account. They assured me that i would hear back by yesterday. I did not, of course.     I then called them to follow up on the return of my funds, and this time they were back to claiming that it was negotiated at  XXXX . The person I spoke to -  XXXX  - was a complete  moron and  was utterly unhelpful. His suggestion was to have the party write me another check. But the money was never returned to her. And   XXXX   XXXX   claims it was not returned to them. Basically, BoA withdrew funds and send them ... ... who knows? Again, they refused to provide me with any proof that the funds had been used at  XXXX , and they refused to discuss it with   XXXX   XXXX    ( th e bank the check was issued from ).     They no refuse to help me in any way and refuse to provide me with proof the funds were used somewhere else. At this point, i consider this straight up theft, and I intend to contact the police as well as the Attorney General if the funds are not returned immediately with interest.

Most recent incident date :  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  Financial Institution : Bank of America and the  XXXX   XXXX . branch in  XXXX , NC Employees involved :  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX   XXXX   (   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   ) Horrible Cu stomer Service, Inconsistencies and Discrimination I have been a customer of Bank of America since  XXXX . I have been treated unfairly and inconsistently by branch employees and managers. I feel that I am being discriminated against and humiliated by branch employees inside the branches when I attempt to cash, deposit and seek to access funds from a payroll check. I have been cashing and depositing these checks from the same employer, ever y two weeks, for over one and a half yea rs, to date. Never has one check from this employer been dishonored, in my account. My check is typically never more than {$1000.00}. Nonetheless, I am given the option to deposit it and I have been refused the right to access even a minimal dollar amount upon depositing or attempting to cash my check. I have written complaints through surveys, written correspondence, and email to the corporate offices and the discrimination and unfair treatment still continues.     I have been discriminated against and treated in a very unprofessional and at times threatening manner. Often, I receive d iffering and conflicting information from the customer care center and branch employees. Branch employees h ave been denying me the right to funds earned and consistently deposited and cashed at the banks for over one and half years has caused many humiliating negative experiences in front of other customers and bank employees. There have been multiple incidences of intimidation and harassment that I have endured as a result of opting to bank with Bank of America, inside their  XXXX  branches.     The most recent experience happened today,  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX . I called the customer care center on  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  at abou t    XXXX   XXXX   to request a stop payment from a company that was drafting my account. The B of A customer care representative explained that I would have to pay  two  {$30.00} fees ( that were drafted from my account shortly after the call ) to ensure the stop payment happened, and I agreed. However, the draft still took place on the  XXXX  of  XXXX ,  ( 5 ) da ys after the call, and it caused the account to overdraft as I had other purchases and drafts taking place. The representative also encouraged me to take out any needed funds prior to the  XXXX  to ensure that they would not be usurped through or by NSF fees and the draft that could still go through, in spite of, the Stop payment request and the fees associated and paid.     At that time, I explained to the rep that I would be getting paid on the  XXXX  and that I would need access to the paycheck funds and that I would need to cash the check at the time of the call my account had at least {$700.00}. My concern was, would the NSF and  Stop  payment transaction cause my account to be in the negative? Would that occurrence, in turn, cause more harassment and humiliation for me when I made an effort to cash the check on the  XXXX . He assured me multiple times that I would have no problem, as the branch would consider the stop payment request and fees paid and honor the paycheck that I cash with Bank of Americ a ( every two we eks for the past year and a half ). He also assured me that any NSF fees charged to my account, as a result of the draft going through, ( in spite of the Stop payment request and fees ) would be credited back to my account without a problem.     Because of previous humiliating experiences, I did not attempt to enter the branch or do anything with the check on pay day. I held the check and waited to enter the branch on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX , simply out of fear of any further embarrassment or incident, as a result of the, branch employees turning me away and refusing to cash or provide access to my paycheck funds. Upon entering the  XXXX   XXXX  branch on  XXXX   XXXX . in  XXXX , NC, there were  only 3 ba nk employees visible to customers. No one was present to greet customers and direct them to the right area or explain the process to meet with a bank  officer. One  male was in the office staring at his computer, even though someone was waiting to be seen and sitting in the red chairs. I initially attempted to get in the teller line, then changed my mind and went over toward the red chairs, with hopes to ask my questions in a more confidential setting.  XXXX   XXXX  was at the teller desk. He was extremely rude and unprofessional, he did not greet me or explain the process required to meet with a branch member in the offices. He just raised his voice and in an irritated tone, in front of all customers and employees, then verbally summoned me to his window, as I tried to make my way to the chairs and wait for someone in the office to help me with my questions. He yelled, " I can not hear you behind this glass. '' He was so visibly frustrated and annoyed that a customer, at the other teller window, talking to the other female teller, jumped in the conversation and began trying to explain to me that  XXXX  was saying that he wanted to have me sign in at the teller window, before sitting down, to meet a bank officer. Without explaining the process,  XXXX   XXXX  required that I give him my debit card and then asked what was the reason I needed to speak to an office employee. I told him I had questions about my account and I can only assume he put my information in the system as he began typing. He put my card back under the teller window and gave no other comment or directive. He did not say someone will be happy to help you in a moment or please have a seat or anything to expalin the process. He did say the gentleman in the red chairs is already waiting.     After a few minutes,  XXXX   XXXX  came out of the office and straight to me, not to the man who had been waiting. I told him that  XXXX   XXXX  had mentioned the other guy was before me. It was obvious that their system and communication was inconsistent, because he did not have the man 's information or even know that the man waiting was there before me. When I met with  XXXX   XXXX  who was very polite, but seemed to more concerned about whether or not I still worked for a certain company that he had obviously seen noted on my account info. He was also more curious about who I work now, than he was about really listening and providing resolve for my concerns. I explained the entire situation and the promises from the customer care center. I also expressed the need to be able to access funds from my paycheck, even though the account was now, in the negative status. I also wanted information on why, as of  XXXX   XXXX , and after the stop payment fees had been deducted, the draft still happened from the company I had requested stop payment for. He said that he would try and find out answers after explaining that he was more in the role of a Merrill Lynch adviser. He left to go talk to  XXXX   XXXX  and he literally came back to me and said, that he was told that I "  may or may  not '' be able to cash the check or have access to any of the funds. He said that he " was told we would not know, until you go in the teller line to submit the check. '' When I did,  XXXX   XXXX  immediately said that the system would not allow me to cash the check due to the negative balance, but that I could deposit it to clear the negative balance. So, I asked if the stop payment and fees were explained to him, he said, " No. '' I then asked if he could see them, as the customer care center rep had advised, but  XXXX   XXXX  said that from his teller screen he could not see any of those things. I also asked him that if I deposited the check, would I be able to at least have access to minimal funds today? He said typically minimal access would be {$200.00} but because my account was negative {$200.00} plus dollars, that I could not have access to anything. He said that I would have to deposit the check and wait for the bank to release the funds in a couple of days. He was very dismissive and the conversation was again humiliating, as it was in front of other customers and employees.     I left and went to my car to call  XXXX   XXXX , the Regional Manager, who had provided his number and asked me to call him if I was ever denied access to funds from the same payroll check again or if I ever felt I was treated unfairly in any of his branches. I had a previous conversation with him after being treated in a threatening and humiliating manner in the branch at  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  by a branch employees who happened to be in the branch  manager  's stead on that day. He was very aggressive, intimidating and rude to me in the parking lot and subsequently, in the actual branch. In that situation  XXXX   XXXX  apologized and tried to provide resolve even though he admitted that this particular employees had been the subject of similar complaints from other customers.      XXXX   XXXX  was clearly annoyed by the call today, however and obviously, too busy to hear my concerns and experience. He said that he would call the branch to find out what was going on. He called me back and stated that my only option was to deposit my check, as the account was in negative status. He talked over me as I tried to explain the details of the situation and told me to go back into the bank and he would have someone explain to me why I would not be able to have access to any funds, much less cash my check while it was in a negative status, even if there was a stop payment request and the fees had already been deducted from my account.     When I walked in the branch, I was again, greeted by no one, I walked to the chairs and saw  XXXX   XXXX  talking to a female employee. Eventually,  XXXX   XXXX  approached me by saying, " Come on into the back ''. She never introduced herself or asked for my name or even said hello. Her badge was not visible the entire time. She never said I am happy to help you or try and explain things to you, She was extremely rude and demeaning. While in the back office with her, she talked down to me, rolled her eyes often and treated me like I was incompetent. It was clear that she could care less about my situation and she made sure her lack of concern was evident in her tone and facial expressions. At times when she talked, I interjected to provide clarity and she basically said, Are you going to let me speak? She made it clear that this was not going to be a conversation and that if i was expecting a change in what had already been conveyed, it would not happen at that branch and especially not with her. I tried to explained that I was confused and had multiple questions about conflicting information provided and eventually,  XXXX   XXXX  literally stopped talking and responding to my questions. She refused to speak or respond after she told me I had made a transaction  aft    XXXX   XXXX   on Monday morning. I explained that I had not made any transaction at that time and I frantically started looking up the email confirmation on my phone. My phone made noise when I accidentally touched the volume button and she in a very demeaning tone said, " Am I to assume that I am now being recorded? You do not have my consent to record this conversation. '' She  was ( extremely ),  confrontational and I was very uncomfortable being back in that area alone with her. She felt comfortable not providing resolve for me, being dismissive and out right unprofessional and rude throughout the entire interaction. I explained that I would not record anyone without letting them know and that I was simply on the phone to look up the actual times for the transactions. She was not helpful and did not provide good customer service. I was more confused and humiliated after meeting with her. I had no way of knowing what she was referring to regarding transactions  at    XXXX   XXXX  . I knew I had not made them, so I was also afraid there  may have been fraud. She provided no resolve. She did say, " the last thing I will do, is print off the transactions and you can go review them. '' When I left her office, she did not say  anything, not even goodbye.     When I left the branch, I drove home and I called customer care. I spoke to a lady named,  XXXX , and thankfully, she stayed on the phone with me until I drove to another bank ATM. She then asked me to proceed to deposit the check, and released access to {$190.00}. She explained the draft that happened in spite of the stop payment request would be removed and that the remaining {$700.0 0} ( or so ) would  be available to me in the morning. She was very empathetic and she actually made an effort to provide some resolve after the discrimination and humiliation I experienced in the  XXXX   XXXX  branch. She apologized for the entire experience and thanked me for being a valued customer since  XXXX . While I was grateful for her, why should I have endured or encountered the discrimination and unfair treatment tha t I contin ue to receive from branch employees? Consumer complaint narrative: I wrote a check for someone back in  XXXX     2016 a nd the person lost it. I reported this to bank of america and submitted an official claim.   A month or so later I noticed a fraudulent debit from my account ( made in  XXXX  while I was in  XXXX  - the check was stolen in  XXXX  ) and I alerted the bank. They told me to open another account and transfer my money over but keep the original account open as the refund for the check would go into there.   It 's now been 6 months since that happened, I still have not been refunded the check and my active account is constantly being charged the monthly fee for not having any funds  in it ( how can I  when it 's compromised?! ) as well as extended overdraft fees resulting from that.   At this rate the check amount ( a mere {$2 20.00} ) will not c over the fees I have been and continue to be charged by the bank. I feel this is being done on purpose and I am incredibly unhappy about it.

In  XXXX    XXXX  , I received an e-mail notification from Bank of America that my account had been frozen. When I contacted them, they told me I had to speak to the law firm who put the restraint on my account. I contacted them and they told me they had a judgment against me, but I didnt know anything about it.     I went to a free clinic at the court and they looked up the case, but there was no judgment. They referred me to an attorney. The attorney told me that under state law, the bank has to send me forms asking if there is any income in the account that is exempt from collection when they are asked to restrain the account. The Bank never sent me this form, and some of the money in the account is exempt under state law. My attorney contacted the law firm and found out that there was a judgment against me in a different case, and when we checked the court file, we found out that the reason I didnt know about the case was because they had served me at the wrong address. My attorney is asking the court to vacate the default judgment, but because that can take a while, she also contacted the Bank and the creditors law firm to ask them to release my exempt funds from my account.     The bank refused to speak to her and said that they would only speak to her if I was on the line with her every time she called to give them authorization to speak to me, even though I had already given my attorney written authorization. I have  XXXX  and have been undergoing  XXXX  treatment for my neck. It leaves me very tired and affects my ability to speak. I had saved up the money in my account to live on while I was getting treatment, since I would not be able to work because it makes me weak.     Although they would not speak to my lawyer about my specific problem, they told her that they always send out exemption forms and if a customer calls them and says they did not receive it, they send it out again. The bank has my correct address, so if they mailed it to me, I should have gotten it. Because the bank refused to speak to her, the attorney sent them a letter with a copy of a retainer from me and explained to them that they had not complied with state law and that they needed to send me the exemption form and to release the funds that are automatically exempt under state law.     The bank still has not sent me an exemption form and they still have not released the money from my account.

And an investigation on my complaint.    I also want to thank you for the offer of a lawyer in the case of Bank of America.   Bests Regards,  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX

We represent an elderly, isolated senior of limited financial means. On her behalf, we sent a letter to this creditor requesting no further contact of any kind. Although the creditor acknowledges receipt of the letter requesting no further communication, the creditor asserts its right to continue to send " servicing correspondence '' such as monthly statements. By continuing to communicate with our client after receiving her request for no further communication, the creditor is violating Section 805 ( c ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

On or about XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the XXXX purchased the residential real property located at XXXX, Arizona XXXX ( the " Property '' ), a single-family residence of less than 2.5 acres, used as a dwelling, for {$120000.00}. ( See XXXX County Assessor 's Office Printout reflecting that the Property is a XXXX square foot residence. ) The XXXX financed the purchase of the Property with two mortgages from Countrywide Home Loans , Inc. ( " Countrywide '' ) totaling {$100000.00} ( the " First Mortgage '' ), and {$18000.00} ( the " Second Mortgage '' ) ( collectively the " Mortgages '' ). ( See Deed of Trust, recorded in the XXXX County Recorder 's Office on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, at document number XXXX, and Deed of Trust, recorded in the XXXX County Recorder 's Office on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, at document number XXXX, BOA acquired Countrywide in or about XXXX, thereby acquiring the Mortgages. 
On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the Property was sold in a trustee 's sale, with a bid from a third party purchaser. ( See Trustee 's Deed recorded in the XXXX County Recorder 's Office on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, as document number XXXX. BOA has wrongfully misrepresented to the XXXX that they remain obligated on the Mortgages and has pursued further collection of the Mortgages from the XXXX. In fact, the XXXX have learned that, despite the trustee 's sale of the Property on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, BOA has wrongfully continued to report to the XXXX credit bureaus that the Second Mortgage is active and delinquent. 
Simply put, under long-standing Arizona law, the XXXX have no personal liability on the Mortgages, and BOA has no legal right whatsoever to collect, or to pursue collection, of any further sums from the XXXX. Pursuant to Arizona law, the borrower under a purchase-money mortgage secured by a single-family home on 2.S acres or less that is limited to and utilized for a single onefamily dwelling can not be held liable for a deficiency ( a ) following a trustee 's sale ; ( b ) in an action on the note ( regardless whether a trustee 's sale has occurred ) ; or ( c ) in a judicial foreclosure action. 
Here, because the Mortgage was used to purchase the Property, the Property is 2.5 acres or less, the Property is limited to and utilized as a single one-family dwelling, and the Property was sold in a trustee 's sale, BO A 's sole source of recovery on the Mortgage -- the Property -- has been extinguished. BOA, thus, has no legal right whatsoever to seek collection of the balance owing on the Mortgage from the XXXX ' remaining " assets ''. 
More specifically, A.R.S. XXXX ( G ) provides, in pertinent part, as follows : If trust property of two and one-half acres or less which is limited to and utilized for either a single one-family or single two-family dwelling is sold pursuant to the trustee 's power of sale, no action may be maintained to recover any difference between the amount obtained by sale and the amount of the indebtedness and any interest, costs and expenses. Thus, a single-family home on 2.5 acres or less that is limited to and utilized for a single onefamily dwelling qualifies for anti-deficiency protection pursuant to A.R.S. XXXX ( XXXX ). 
Here, as discussed above, the Property is less than 2.5 acres and is utilized as a single onefamily dwelling. Thus, the home constitutes Qualified Property. Further, as discussed above, the Mortgages were used to pay a portion of the purchase price for the Property. Thus, the Mortgages constitute Purchase Money Mortgages secured by Qualifying Property. As a result, A.R.S. XXXX XXXX ( A ) and XXXX I XXXX ( G ) patently apply to the Mortgages to " obliterate '' any personal liability of the XXXX on the Mortgages. Since the date of the trustee 's sale BOA has consistently misrepresented to the credit reporting agencies that the Second Mortgage remains an obligation for which the XXXX are liable and delinquent.

This CFPB Complaint / Affidavit & Notice is being filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau for a transparent examination and investigation of the Mortgage origination and servicing, RESPA procedures, Amicus program etc. The supporting documents raises other issues ( resources ) made available to the consumer pursuant to Federal Law, and the powers of the CFPB, OCC and Federal courts. 

Banks have used predatory lending in a mortgage ( from its inception ), and denied the consumer remedy to a complete and accurate investigation in regards to a void mortgage and illegally forged [ robo-signed ] foreclosure instruments, which caused a void lien to property. 

On behalf the consumer I offer this affidavit and notice to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in regards to your client XXXX activities in association with BANA and XXXX. XXXX XXXX, the following issues demonstrate that your client in association with these financial entities have condemned and denied the consumer remedy and a review of ALL documents ( proof of claims ) subject to public access, despite requests for validation of the debt and to certify all parties ' foreclosure activities. 

The mortgage origination of AWL and the servicing of BANA, in association with CWHL and the claims made by XXXX assignment, and the foreclosure sale held by your client by and through the debt collection agencies ' and any other unknown third parties are moot and without good point. 

The consumer has provided through the CFPB portal : The Mortgage/Note is void because the alleged Lender AWL, stated in the mortgage/note to be a New York Corporation, and was not in fact incorporated XX/XX/XXXX or subsequently, at any time, by either CWHL, or BANA, or any of their related corporate entities or agents. '' As " debt collectors '', the financial entities and several other debt collection agencies refused, despite the consumer 's request, pursuant to the FDCPA to verify their debt collection activities. 

A history of his Petition for Writ of Certiorari [ Case No. XXXX ] - U.S. Supreme Court The 10 year statute of limitation for the collection of debt has expired XX/XX/XXXX and the debt is too old to be sued on. 

Information that, XXXX and associated debt collection agencies ', can not provide evidence of the Lender 's AWL written assignment to XXXX or certify they examined the assignment for an illegally [ ROBO-SIGNED ] forged signature. 

An enormous amount of information to refute XXXX activity in association with BANA ; AWL ; CWHL ; and XXXX. 

His administrative defaults should help to reduce any arguments by showing the records of the financial entities and the debt collection agencies ' reflect they failed in their lawful duty to respond and to provide all damages and injuries caused to any of the related corporate entities or their agents. '' The consumer wishes to inform you XXXX XXXX, he does not intend to dishonor your offer, and conditionally accepts that you and your client are not duty bound and do not encompass the authority to take any further action on this matter by law ; and upon conditionally accepting your offer he proposes that you provide your written and signed Proof of Claim under penalties of perjury, that you and your client et al are not subject to Federal Law and the powers of the CFPB and the OCC both which have jurisdiction over the following : Mortgage origination examination procedures Mortgage servicing examination procedures RESPA procedures Amicus program Warning letters Payments to harmed consumers Supervision and examinations The CFPB Supervision and Examination Manual Failure to provide your written and signed Proof of Claim under penalties of perjury to the consumer will deem your claims again, irrelevant and meritless.

Judgment against me I was not served

I am at the trial phase of a debt collection case filed by XXXX XXXX XXXX that is using a debit collection attorney to represent them. The account was issued XXXX different account numbers during the life of the account. The fourth account number is the charged off number. The account was opened in XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and was charged off in XXXX XXXX. They do not have the last XXXX numbers to the account for first 21 months of the account. When I brought this up at XXXX of the hearings, we are going on our third trial date, the plaintiffs attorney was completely surprised. I am representing myself at trial and I am not doing a very good job what so ever. But what I do know for a fact that if a party files a motion for any reason that motion is to be sent to the other party so they may object to the motion. The plaintiffs attorney had disclosed in its list of trial witnesses a person whom is the custodian of records c/o XXXX stating '' this witness will testify as to the assignment of the debt, the amount currently due and owing, and to as to all correspondence or communication between plaintiff and defendant regarding this debt. Plaintiff hereby gives notice that this witness 's testimony may reference documents that are records of regular conduct activity pursuant to rules 803 ( 6 ), 807, and 902 ( 11 ) of the Arizona rules of evidence. Please direct any communication for this witness to Plaintiff 's counsel. '' There was an affidavit from this person stating that " the seller of the account warranted the account to plaintiff at the time of the assignment and based on that warranty, plaintiff gave defendant written notice of the amount at or about the time of the assignment. '' This statement is completely false and I will bring it to the attention of the court. The Plaintiffs attorney never sent me the Motion it field with the court requesting a telephonic witness testimony of this witness. I brought this up at trial and was ignored. I happened to stumble over the recent Consent Order issued by cfpb against XXXX XXXX XXXX and after review I recognized several of the issues described, like paragraph XXXX that were in violation were taking place in and during my case and trial. I am going to bring the Consent Order to the attention of the judge at my trial date XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. I have a question, when doing so and clearly proving that XXXX is violating the Consent Order is that grounds for the case to be dismissed.I checked off attempted to collect wrong amount because I have been included in a couple of class action settlements against FIA Card Services and was given a pro rated amount which would make the amount uncertain to collect. I have admitted to the court that this was my debt how could I not.Before the debt was charged off the original creditor offered me in a letter stating if I would pay XXXX by XXXX/XXXX/XXXX it would not charge off the debt. I made the payment on XX/XX/XXXX but they posted the payment on XX/XX/XXXX and charged off the account anyways. I hope that my issues will not be considered frivolous. The problem with the justice system is consumers are in the predicament because of financial difficulty so they can not hire attorneys to represent them. If a court appointed attorney could be appointed just for observation to the trial proceedings it would be of great help in preventing a consumer from losing the case because they did not present there case correctly. Thank you for your time and wish me luck on Monday, I will need it.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX & XXXX ( XXXX ), on behalf of FIA Card Services ( FIA XXXX, filed a Complaint against me personally on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, on a business debt of {$20000.00} for a defunct LLC of which I was a member. During the litigation, I discovered that FIA did not retain XXXX. Rather, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) did. Since XXXX is domiciled and licensed to practice law in XXXX, it retained XXXX to do its dirty work. Because FIA was not XXXX client, XXXX stonewalled my discovery efforts and would not produce the records I requested which would conclusively demonstrate that this account was not a personal debt. In spite of that, FIA could not prevail when it filed its motion for summary judgment. The court found that the affidavit filed was deficient. Subsequently, FIA made a settlement offer where it would dismiss the Complaint with prejudice and XXXX assured me that FIA would remove the derogatory reporting with all three major credit reporting agencies. Also, I knew that a dismissal with prejudice would require FIA to discontinue the reporting in accordance with the FCRA. The court entered the Agreed Order on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 

About a month later, I figured that FIA would have stopped reporting on this account and I viewed my credit report with all three agencies. FIA was continuing with the derogatory reporting. I disputed the entries for three months. Each time, the credit reporting agencies confirmed the entries. I sent an e-mail to XXXX XXXX, XXXX attorney whom I had dealt with on this issue. He responded that he would contact his client. Thirty days later, I checked my credit reports and the reports were continuing. I got back with XXXX XXXX again. He said that he was waiting for his client to get back with him. This happened for another three months, at which time I decided that XXXX XXXX would do nothing about this violation of the FCRA. 

Because I already knew that FIA was really XXXX client, I called XXXX in XXXX XXXX. They committed to get back with me within three days. A day later, I received an e-mail from XXXX XXXX telling me that his client just got back with him and he would send me an agreement to sign, then FIA would stop reporting. I told him that I had n't developed XXXX and he should acknowledge that his client got back to him only because I contacted XXXX. I told him that I hoped there is no clause that would cause FIA to issue me a XXXX the following XXXX. XXXX XXXX, the attorney, conveniently became incompetent. He said that all he knows is that if I sign the agreement, the reporting would end even though I knew that the Agreed Order robs FIA of the benefit of reporting because of the FCRA. 

Sure enough, not only did the agreement allow FIA to issue a XXXX to me, FIA in fact issued that XXXX in XXXX XXXX. How can a debt that does not exist be cancelled? I went back to XXXX again. They told me to contact FIA regarding the XXXX and XXXX regarding everything else. I contacted FIA. They told me that XXXX is their lawyer and is the only party that can resolve this issue. I do n't know who is whose client or who the real lawyer is. Because XXXX XXXX was having problems navigating this issue, he elicited the assistance of a partner at XXXX, XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX and XXXX disclosed that XXXX was not licensed to practice law in Kentucky and would like to help resolve the issue if I was agreeable to it. I was. I demanded that the XXXX be withdrawn or FIA reimburse me for my tax liability associated with filing the XXXX. I computed the value of the tax due attributable to the XXXX to be {$5800.00} ( Federal ) and {$1100.00} ( state ). XXXX dragged out this issue for months and eventually offered me {$5000.00} to sign the agreement. I declined it in XXXX XXXX. I disputed the XXXX when I filed my tax return. XXXX, XXXX, and FIA have refused to resolve this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
As you know, I have reported my identity was compromised. 

Police report and Identity Theft victim 's Affidavit were filed and mailed to the banking institutions, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and OCC. 

I ask that the charges be taken out of my billing. 

Please respond within the next 30 days that the charges are removed as of XXXX XXXX, 2017.

Received letter from XXXX XXXX, XXXX on behalf of Bank of America. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX could not provide debt validation. The situation was a nuisance and we settled via a stipulation for {$2500.00} with XXXX. XXXX XXXX did not disclose to us he was working with XXXX XXXX XXXX - a debt collector law firm. XXXX XXXX XXXX never provided any information to us via the FDCPA. We were completely unaware of their involvement in this matter until an email was sent to us by mistake on XXXX indicating they were in fact acting as an agent for Bank of America.We then contacted Bank of America , XXXX XXXX , CEO and were directed to a XXXX XXXX after many communications XXXX XXXX indicated this evening we were out of luck. The stipulation was signed # XXXX, it did not matter that the collection agent XXXX XXXX XXXX was not disclosed to us. When I asked for debt validation he said the " statute of limitations had run out '' and " he was unable to provide the validation ''. It did not matter as we signed # XXXX on the stipulation. I indicated to XXXX XXXX had any of this been disclosed to us we never would have entered into a stipulation. Had we known XXXX XXXX was involved along with XXXX we would not have agreed to any of this with Bank of America. There was deception in the lack of disclosure to us by Bank of America, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX was clear it would be punitive measures on our credit report as well.

This is an attempt to injure my credit for years to come. This practice could go on for a lifetime.

I have needed to take out over {$150000.00} in student loans to complete my graduate education XXXX. I now work XXXX and am not making ends meet because of the high cost of my loans. I fear I will never be able to afford a family. All of my loans, including government loans, are between 6 % and 8.5 %. How can banks charge such high rates when a person could buy a {$50000.00} car for almost no interest? I imagine they are " following the rules '', but what kind of society allows institutions to make money off the backs of young people who contribute significantly to the health of its population? Is there anything to be done? XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA

I opened a business in XXXX with another person. At that time we opened up a number of business accounts with vendors and banks. In XXXX I left the business and sold my ownership to my business partner. We provided all of our vendors and banks with our documents showing the business ownership changes. I requested that all of the cards in my name be closed and closed the credit line that was in our joint names. 

My old partner continued to operate the business till XX/XX/XXXX/XX/XX/XXXX time frame. During that time he apparently racked up debt he could not afford and he started receiving collection notices. I received XXXX from Bank of America at that time in my name. I contacted Bank of America and provided them with my change of ownership documentation and the lady I spoke with claimed to update the account and never contacted me again. In XXXX I ran my credit report and saw a collection agency was listed trying to collect on the old Bank of America debt. I called the company, explained the situation, and they stated that when Bank of America sold them the debt they only listed my name on the account and not my old partners. I was able to get my old partner to contact the collection agency and agree to pay the debt. I provided the collection agency all of the ownership change forms at the time and they never contacted me again. 

My partner never paid the debt and when I attempted to get a mortgage recently I saw that the debt was still on my account. I contacted the collection company, XXXX XXXX and they said that they would not remove me off of the account because that is how they purchased it. I requested that they contact Bank of America to get updated records because my partner should have been the personal guarantor and they would not do it. They said I had to get Bank of America to provide me that documentation. I called Bank of America to request details on the account. Bank of America said they can see that my partner is a personal guarantor and they have notes in their system that there was an ownership request documented but they do n't have any additional details. They do n't have copies of the change of ownership forms I sent in nor copies of the contract stating I am no longer responsible for the business. They are going to provide me with a letter stating that my partner is a personal guarantor but will not provide me with anything stating that I am not. 

I have also requested documentation from XXXX XXXX and Bank of America, verification of what the debt is. I was not with the company during the years that the debt was incurred so I have no idea what they believe I am responsible for. Neither XXXX XXXX nor Bank of America has been able to provide me with any account statements stating who used the account, what was purchased, whose card was being used and in what amounts. I have received nothing from them. I originally made this request in XXXX and they did not provide it and I 'm making the request again in XXXX and they are telling me they do n't have any of those details. I do n't have chance to dispute these charges if they ca n't provide me with the details on the account.

I XXXX makes a claim with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) that the following attached attempt to collect a debt is highly fraudulent. My personal information is being floated in what is known in the debt collection business as a " Debt Pool '', whereas collection information is outdated and not even enforceable. The attached collection from XXXX does not state that the debt is no longer enforceable, a stipulation by the Federal Trade Commission. The method of an illegal posting of a collection on my personal credit report, or an illegal collection against my rights of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act can not be tolerated. In Federal Trade Commission v. XXXX ( 2009 ) the federal district court decided in favor of the Federal Trade Commission that a collection agency must operate within strict guidelines in the collection of a debt. The criteria are as follows : 1 ) The debt must still be enforceable within the state of procurement or where the original obligator resides, or a combination of both. 
2 ) The debt collector must be licensed and bonded if applicable within the state in which it is trying to collect, if the debt is collectable. 
3 ) The validation of debt ownership must be proved, without exception. 
There is no statement on the attached collection that the debt is no longer enforceable. The collection agency stipulates that Bank of America obtained a judgment against me. By legal mandate, the docket number of the judgment must be listed as well as what county clerk 's office the judgment is filed with. In this case, there is no judgment. The statement saying " This judgment may be forwarded to an attorney for execution '' is a complete falsehood. There can not be a lawsuit as the legal time limit to enforce a summary judgment action has passed. 
Even though the collection letter states that illegal, abusive, deceptive and unfair debt collections are illegal, this collection in its entirety is just that, a deceptive illegal attempt to collect a debt that is no longer enforceable. 
I demand that all my information be purged immediately by XXXX and Bank of America, and that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take the necessary steps to sanction both companies for using such abusive collection tactics.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX We refinanced our home with a loan from Countrywide, made payments until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX when the market crashed. See Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Countrywide sent a Notice of Default and Acceleration letter and said specifically, " If the default is not cured on or before XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the mortgage payments will be accelerated with the full amount remaining accelerated and becoming due and payable in full, and foreclosure proceedings will be initiated at that time. '' Clearly stated, this is not a foreclosure, but foreclosure may happen in the future. See Exhibit XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX came and went with no additional notices or legal actions as stated in the previous notice. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I file for BK See Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I waived my right to a discharge for all debt, letter mailed to creditors XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Statue of Limitations begins to run again 30 days after the mailed letter, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX See Exhibit 4. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Bank of America sends another NOD stating " Bank of America , N.A . intends to initiate foreclosure action on the mortgaged property. '' This another threat of a lawsuit that never came, but never the less another " Notice '' and reference a future action that that bank intends to take. See Exhibit 5 Bank of America transfers servicing to XXXX, and later to XXXX. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX sends Notice of Default and Acceleration letter, just like in XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and other notices over the previous 7+ years. This is another Notice ; a foreclosure has still not commenced and no other legal action has taken place. See Exhibit 6 According to WA State law, the 6-year statute of limitation for lender to collect on the debt was up on : XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. 

XXXX : Statute of Limitations requires a lender to take an actionto enforce within 6 years of the acceleration for written contracts. Law dictionary define an action as : n. a lawsuit in which one party ( or parties ) sues another. I still have not been a party to a lawsuit that would toll the statute. Exhibit 7 XXXX/XXXX/XXXX comes and goes and no lawsuit is filed. The lender has had over 7 years to take action, still no lawsuit filed, and over 6 years of the Statute of Limitations running. Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Trustee records Notice of Trustee Sale, with sale date XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Again, a NOTICE as in the title of the document. Lender specifically is choosing not to take legal action and file a lawsuit, rather to follow a non judicial process AFTER the debt is barred from collection. Exhibit 9 XXXX/XXXX/XXXX comes and goes, several continuances of sale are issued. Trustee is aware of SOL issues. Phone calls and letters explain to trustee the situation and they do n't have the sale. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ( 120 days past sale date ) comes and goes with no sale occurring. WA foreclosure law requires lender to start the foreclosure process again. Still, no tolling has occurred yet. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Trustee records Discontinuance acknowledging that they have to start over but the last day to have the sale was XXXX See Exhibit 10 Trustee also records new NOTS with new sale date of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. They are starting over with the foreclosure process on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. See Exhibit 11. 

Now, the lender is wrongfully trying to collect a debt that is barred from collection AGAIN! 

Either way, the 6-year SOL has passed on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, over 302 days past the 6 year tolling date, and over 8 years past the first late payment. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX agrees to continue the sale until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX to look into this further. See Exhibit 12. 

As of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I have still not been sued by the lender, Bank, " holder '' " servicer '' or any other party claiming to have standing to do so, nor has anyone commence a Judicial Foreclosure. 

PLEASE HELP!!!

On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX sent someone to the house I live in, and delivered a complaint summon for an old debt lawsuit. They said Bank of America assigned the debt collection to them. The summon looked fishy because it did not have a file case number on it. I called the Superior court in XXXX, XXXX, and the clerks told me I could not file my answer to XXXX , XXXX ' complaint because there was no file case number to file it under. I had only 20 days to sent my Answer to XXXX , XXXX in XXXX. I sent my Answer and request for debt verification, and validation with requests for proof of ownership of debt, chain of assignment, the contract between Bank of America and XXXX , XXXX on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. XXXX , XXXX received the certified mail on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. 

I wait for XXXX , XXXX while I checked nearly everyday Superior court record for a file case number for nearly four month. I was very sick and waiting for surgery, so I was focusing on my health. I forgot about XXXX , XXXX I thought they drop the lawsuit because they ignore my request for debt information, and they never sent me anything that I asked for. 

On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX my roommate handled me a letter from XXXX , XXXX. It was confusing letter because it listed dates for a court trial on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ... A year away. This letter had a file case number on it dated XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. There was no words about them winning a default judgment against me. I found out about the default judgment my calling the Superior court with the file case number, and the clerk told me, yes, XXXX , XXXX got a default judgment on me. I filed my Answer, Motion to Vacate, and evidence, and file a counterclaim under the file case number on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. XXXX , XXXX was not suppose to file default judgment without providing supported proof, and complete evidences of ownership of debt collection right, contract between Bank of America, and between me to pay them, ect. 

I want you to go after XXXX , XXXX for violations FDCPA, and XXXX consumer fraud laws. XXXX , XXXX used unfair, misleading statements, ignore my request to show proof of debt, ownership of debt, and right to collect payments, fees on debt, and right to bring sue and get a default judgment without a contract. Contract terms to fees, interest, ect. XXXX , XXXX quickly put the default judgment on public record because another lawyer contact me to offer help with bankruptcy filing. 

I only have a small veteran pension, so that is judgment proof, but the judgment has now hurt my credit ratings again. I told XXXX , XXXX this in my Answer. I want you to charge XXXX , XXXX old debt buyers heavy fines for violations, request them to remove any public and private default judgment on credit bureaus records, forbid XXXX , XXXX from selling my account information to other debt buyers, and have them remove any bad inquiries off all credit bureaus, and encourage them to pay me counterclaim fees for fraud, misrepresentations, wrongful lawsuit, and damaging character image with wrongful default judgment. 

I want you to sue them, collect my violation fees, and remove the default judgment from all public and private credit records since they got it through fraud. I filed for Motion To Vacate on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Our court date is on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX.

Third, Bank of America claims they filled a XXXX, not only is it against the law to file a XXXX for an account that was a result of identity theft but there is a court case that has said that it is not right to force someone to pay taxes on miscellaneous income and expect them to pay you back, and you are actively trying to collect this by holding my credit hostage with this fradulent account. Lastly, I have received information from Bank of America directly that shows that an account attached to this one has my wife 's maiden name on it over a year after we were legally married and her name was changed on every account she had, I must say that it was a nice try sending the records up until our marriage month but thanks to your associates, I was able to get the records for a year after that. I also want all the recordings from XX/XX/XXXX where I called Bank of America, if they are brave enough to send all of them, there is proof that they have said so many lies and then changed all the account information to fit their story, like how I was told that an account was closed in XX/XX/XXXX with a name that changed 2 years prior, that they also had a lawyer on this account that I have never met or talked too, an address I have never heard of, and with all these errors Bank of America still refuses to remove this account. I am done sending you documents, I am done being nice. I will present all this to a judge and will cheer when he rules in my favor.
