Consumer complaint narrative: I have had several on going issues with bank of America. My previous co plaint against them is still unresolved. They are consistent with having horrible customer service. When coming into the only branch in  XXXX    XXXX   there is always a hit or miss with a notary. The branch has only  XXXX  notary for the whole   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX  and if she 's not available you 're stuck going to another bank or notary service. I booked an appointment as I was instructed to do and it was cancelled because once again they had no notary. Furthermore I added an authorized user to my account and was told when I signed up for it they would be a user not a co owner now I am having to close the account just to get this person off my account. Bank of America  executive off ice someone by the name of  XXXX  has still not spoken to me directly about the previous complaint it 's a phone tag of him calling every few days and not setting a specific time to resolve the matter as I 've left voice messages requesting. Horrible bank that still wo n't honor disputed transactions.

Bank of Americ a ( " B of A ' ' ), closed my checking acct on   XX/XX/XXXX  ( that I had just opened  XX/XX/XXXX  )   and reported for " SUSPECTED FRAUD ACTIVITY '' on   XX/XX/XXXX , closure status  XX/XX/XXXX  =  " UNPAID. I have been unable to open a checking acct at ANY other institution based on a presumption published by B of A. I consider this Defamation of Character! FACTS  : 1 ) My  account was overdrawn beginning Tue sday  XX/XX/XXXX  ; this overdraft was settled w/ cash, in a branch on Monday  XX/XX/XXXX  ( {$310.00} ). B of A reported with  XX/XX/XXXX  dat e as unpaid at time of closure. This is untrue. My account was overdrawn fo r 3 bu siness days. I have already disputed this with the bank and  XXXX , with no success.    2  ) I was changing banks from  XXXX   XXXX  (  XXXX   )  to Bank of America ; both accts were open/active.    3  ) I was expecting funds in both of my B of A and  XXXX  accts over the weekend (  XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX  ) from a family member AND another source. I conducted transactions between the  XXXX  accts on what I considered deposits in transit. Due to a misunderstanding, the deposits were not made. I learned my acct was negative the morning of  XX/XX/XXXX , and due to financial hardship at the time, I was unable to resolve immediately ; my acct was  o/d 4  out of 5 days that week at B of A. My aunt was out of the country on an international cruise, returning by Sun  XX/XX/XXXX , so I thought we would talk, and fix Monday  XX/XX/XXXX . We went to the banks on Monday, and she explained to both branch managers/personal bankers, confirming that it was an oversight on her part. We deposited cash to over the overdrawn balance, again, on  XX/XX/XXXX .   I have had an active checking account with a major financial institution since  XX/XX/XXXX , It is appalling that a major financial institution can report their " opinion '' of " suspected fraud '', when it is defamatory in nature. I am a   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , I started and LLC and I ca n't open bank accounts at even " 2nd chance '' banks because of one word that they have inappropriately used ... '' FRAUD ''. This has caused people to be skeptical and has hurt me financially in a number of ways. I disputed this with various departments and went to my local branch and sat down with the branch manager and walked him through all of the facts and circumstances. I conducted what I would consider non-significant transactions over the weekends based on what I considered to be deposits in transit. I resolved the problem within 4 days paid the negative balance in full. When I continued to follow-up with the branch  manager  I was finally told that they would be doing nothing, and not changing the reporting because, and I quote " the  risk  department told me there was no business purpose for them to reverse anything ''. WOW! My 25 year career includes over 10 years of providing   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , including over 5 years with a "  XXXX   XXXX  ''   XXXX   XXXX   and over 10 years in   XXXX   XXXX  and  XXXX   the majority of which was at the   XXXX   XXXX  l.  XX/XX/XXXX  was a somewhat tragic year for me financially as I was unemployed. Given what I do for a living, background checks are performed. I have been forced to do my banking through  XXXX . With all due respect to  XXXX  given my profession, it literally hurts me daily because I work with smart people ... who assume that I have a banking problem to make that my choice for my personal and business accounts. I am currently  XX/XX/XXXX , and even my client who pays me via ACH deposit ( between {$3000.00} and {$5000.00} per week ) has questioned and shown suspicion about my banking. Finally, I work very long days and often cant make it to the bank. This  XXXX  bank does not even provide the opportunity to make deposits into an ATM. How can a bank unilaterally do this to someone? To not allow them to bank with them, and report to an agency used by banks such defamatory wording ... using words that essentially " bans '' me from opening an account at a reputable or even "  2nd  chance '' bank. Then, to have to gall to actually tell me, in so many words, that they are not going to change anything because there is nothing in it for them?!

This new complaint relates to the complaint already in progress submitted   XXXX   XXXX   , 201  7  #  XXXX , with  Bank of America , provider of the  XXXX  card for the  State o f California temporary  XXXX  insurance program.     Summary :   XXXX   XXXX  , I noticed a transaction made with the card at  XXXX  while I was at home asleep in my bed. It was a pinned transaction made at a local ATM that I frequently have used . 6 ho urs after the transaction was made, I had discovered it, reported it, and at the directive of BOA I had called the local police and reported the transaction.     This new complaint is in regards to the willful and wanton delays in reimbursing the funds, in violation of not only the regulation cited in the original complaint   ( CFR Regulation " e '' ) but now under the controlling attachments regarding Fiduciary Duties of Banks under the DTPA.
Timeline   :   XXXX   XXXX  , Filed Dispute With Bank   XXXX   XXXX  , Having no credit issued or reimbursement made, I called and spoke with a supervisor, "  XXXX  '' several times. She informed me that because the transaction was " pinned '' that there was no evidence of fraud. ( Although the notes on regul ation " e '' specifically state that whether a transaction is pinned may not be used to determine its validity and that rather the only requirement for reimbursement is that a customer report the transaction as unauthorized within 48 hours here I reported in 6. ). Furt her,  XXXX  informed me that my own statement was not sufficient evidence that the transaction was unauthorized ( criminalizing the victim ). Further,  XXXX  informed me that this was status quo policy regarding disputes in their department at BOA, and " she dealt with this every day and knew regulation  " e ''  thoroughly. She also refused to connect me with any lateral or higher supervisor and would not provide contact information for a regulation compliance or legal department. She did offer to have her  manager call me within 24hours, a call I am still waiting for.      XXXX   XXXX  , I also initiated contact with this bureau to seek resolution with or without the help of the BOA disputes department.       XXXX   XXXX  , I tried calling disputes and claims department and asking for a supervisor again. She "  XXXX  '' who conveniently seems to be the only supervisor voice at the disputes call center, promised m e a manager c all again which never came on the  XXXX  or  XXXX . I insisted that  XXXX  place the police report ( vague as it was ) that I had gathered from  XXXX  and add it to my file and reopen my claim as she had informed me that the department had already ruled my claim invalid.     On   XXXX   XXXX  , I finally made contact with the regulation compliance person from BOA   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , who informed me that she would act as a  liaison be tween the bank and I throughout the complaint process and that she would have the situation resolved by her own decided resolution date of   XXXX   XXXX  . I informed   XXXX   that this further violated regulation "  E  '' which requires reimbursement be complete within  seven days, with a maximum customer liability of {$50.00} if timely reported. I also informe d her that the BOA card agreement presented to me when I was given the card stated that timely reporting was supported by a "  Zero Li ability '' policy thus negating the federal allowance of {$50.00} of customer responsibility.   XXXX   did not seem to be concerned with my reimbursement ( although she did apologize ) nor the timeline.       XXXX   XXXX  , I receive to conflicting pieces of mail. First, a letter from this Bureau stating that the bank has requested more time to prepare a response and that could be 60 days. I also receive a letter from  BOA d ated   XXXX   XXXX  , which states the additional review I requested has been completed and there was no decision error found. These are highly conflicting statements ...     While my first complaint focused on the handling of my claim and the lack of reimbursement ( STILL!!!! ) in violation of CFR  " E '', I w ould like to now file a complaint that is separate yet related to the original about the timeliness of responses indicative of a willful and wanton disregard for my consumer rights protected by federal regulation with instructive ( clearly worded  ) n otes on how to treat regulation "  E  ''. I now wish to enforce my rights violated by  BOA  ( hereafter " the bank '' ) enumerated by the DTPA clauses regarding Banks obligations and duties as a fiduciary.     Regulation "  E '' i s very clear as to the requirements of its application :  1. An unauthorized transaction was made and the only stipulation that designates transactions as unauthorized is a " reporting by the cardholder within 48 hours. '' Here I reported the charge as unauthorized and in only six hours. The bank  does not disputed this fact.    2. The regulation application notes specifically state that whether a transaction is " pinned '' is irrelevant unless the person conducting the transaction had at one time been an authorized user and now was not. The suspect in this case was never authorized to use my card and never authorized to even possess the card, Bank of America has provided no evidence ( and can not unless they manufacture it )  that I have ever authorized anyone to use the card.    3. The maximum liability of a customer by Federal Regulation " E '' is {$50.00}. When timely reported. Banks may create more lenient but not stricter liability on the part of the consumer. BOA did choose to be more lenient than the fed, because in my card agreement presented when I got the card, I was informed that BOA imposes " ZERO LIABILITY '' for unauthor ized use so long as reported timely. Because the time of reporting is not in dispute,   BOA admits that I was in compliance with this policy and therefore also the more strict federal policy.
4. Regulation " E '' requires that in any case, when timely reported, any funds removed from the customer account must be reimbursed no longer than 7   business days after the unauthorized transaction is reported.   XXXX   XXXX   from  BOA,  when I spoke to here on   XXXX   XXXX  , did not dispute the  seven d ay requirement of regulation  " e ''. In fact she had no answer as to why this was not already reimbursed, but told me not to worry because they had determined they would provide resolution of this complaint by a promised deadline with the Bureau of   XXXX   XXXX  . Imagine my surprise when I received notice that the BOA had asked fo r additional time to prepare an answer when  XXXX  had appeased me by telling me I would have resolution by   XXXX   XXXX  .  Imagine my  further surprise to learn that BOA had already decided the second opening of this dispute against me on   XXXX   XXXX   when I received a letter to that effect today in the mail.     NEW OFFENSE : THE NEWEST VIOLATION OF BAN  K OF AMERICA IS NOT A VIOLATION OF REGULATION E, BUT RATHER A NEW PRIMA FACIE VIOLATION OF THE FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITIES ENUMERATED UNER THE DTPA.
THE VIOLATION OF THE SEVEN BUSINESS DAY REIMBURSEMENT REQUIREMENT ( STILL TOLLING ) AND IT HAS AMOST BEEN A MONTH NO  W ) WHILE BAD ENOUGH, IS NOT NEARLY AS BAD AS THE WILLFUL & WANTON ACTIONS UNDER THE DTPA, BUT I NOW SEE THAT NOT ONLY ARE THERE CONTINUES ACTIONS WILLFUL AND WANTON, BUT POSSIBLE WITH MALICE AFORETHOUGHT, ADDING A PUNITIVE ELEMENT TO THE DAMAGES IMOSED UPON THE OFFENDER ( HERE BOA ).     The facts here are not disputed. I made the report to the correct department on the correct date within the time pe riod allotted by " E ''. F urther, I was patient in allowing a grace period before I called back  XXXX  and  XXXX . What is bothering me now is that even after speaking with   XXXX   XXXX   and being further patient :  1.   I STILL HAVE NOT BEEN REIMBURSE  D 2. HER PROMISE TO ME THAT RESOLUTION WOULD OCCUR BY THE NINTH IS OBVIOUSLY BELOGNA AND THERE IS STILL NO REIMBURSEMENT OR CORRECTIVE ACTION IN PLACE FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE.
3. BOA HAS ASKED THE BUREAU FOR MORE TIME, BUT CLEARLY BY BOA 's OWN ADMISSION THEY HAVE ALREADY MADE ANOTHER REVIEW   AND RULED NOT TO PAY IT AS DENOTED IN THE LETTER I RECEIVED. THUS BECAUSE THE FACTS ARE UNDISPUTED AS APPLIED TO THE TIMELINE, BOA 'S DECISION TO REMAIN AWARE OF MISSED OBLIGATIONS AND CONTINUE TO OPERATE UNDER SOME BELIEF THAT THE CONTINUED DELAY IS ACCEPTABLE.     I FIND IT MORE DISTURBING THAT BOA 'S CONTINUED DENIAL WHEN BOA HAS UNDISPUTED  PRIMA FACIE EVIDENCE THE CLAIM IS LEGITIMATE IN COMPLIANCE WITH REG E. ( THE ONLY REQUIREMENT BEING TIMELY ) CONTAINS A CONFLICT OF INFORMATIO N BETWEEN SUE 'S REQUEST FOR ADDITIONAL TIME TODAY AND THE LETTER I RECEIVED TODAY    XXXX      DATED   XXXX   XXXX  , SAYING THE SECONDARY EVALUATION OF THE CLAIM HAD BEEN SATISFIED.     BECAUSE OF THE WILLFUL AND WANTON DISREGARD OF THE FACTS OF THIS TRANSACTION, AND THE CHOICE OF BOA TO CONTINUE TO DENY THE CLAIM, THEY ARE CLEARLY NOW IN VIOLATION OF THE DTPA WHICH IN THE LEAST PROVIDES THAT A {$400.00} REIMBURSEMENT IS NO LONGER ACCEPTIBLE, BUT RATHER  TREBLE  DAMAGES OR IN THIS CASE {$1200.00} BECAUSE THE BANK HAD NOTICE AND CHOSE WILLFULLY AND WANTONLY TO IGNORE THE FACTS AND FAIL TO REIMBURSE THE ACCOUNT.     I NOW BELIEVE THAT SUE 'S CONTINUED DELAY AS REQUESTED TODAY, FURTHER ESCALATES MY DTPA CLAIM TO A WILLFUL AND WANTON STANDARD BUT NOW ADDING WITH MALICE AFORETHOUGHT.     HERE   XXXX   XXXX    NEW  OF MY COMPLAINT, NEW THAT BOA WAS IN REGULATORY VIOLATION BY FAILING TO PROVIDE RELIEF WITHIN  XXXX  BUSINESS DAYS, AND HAS FURTHER DELAYED THE PROCESS BY " NEEDING MORE TIME TO RESPOND, WHEN CLEARLY THE LETTER MAILED WITH A   XXXX   XXXX   DATE IS  PRIMA FACIE EVIDENCE THAT B OA IS NOT INVESTIGATING FURTHER AS STATED. THUS  XXXX  KNOWINGLY FURTHER DEPRIVED ME OF MY ALREADY TARDY PAVEMENT AND THUS SUBJECTED HER ORGANIZATION TO PUNITIVE DAMAGES IN ADDITION TO MY NOW  TREBLE  DAMAGES.     PLEASE BE ADVISED IF I DO NOT RECEIVE  TREBLE D AMAGES IN MY ACCOUNT BY CLOSE OF BUSINESS TOMORROW, I DO INTEND WHOLEHEARTEDLY TO SEEK A COURT ORDER, UNDER THE DTPA AND BECAUSE I AM SO INCONVENIENCED BY THE ENTIRETY OF THE EVENT, I ASSURE YOU I WILL MAKE CERTAIN THAT PUNITIVE DAMAGES ARE ASSESSED WHERE NEEDED.

They told me to e-mail   XXXX  , which I did, they cancelled my card and will reissue me a new one.

I applied on  XXXX   XXXX  for the   XXXX   XXXX   credit card which the sponsor is Bank of America. At the time of the application, m y credit score r eturned as  XXXX , my debt to income ratio was under 30 % and my annual income is more than  XXXX . This credit card offers a range  of APR betwe en 12.99 % to 19.99 %. The result of my application was a line of credit of  XXXX  and a high-interest rate of 19 % . First of all   we are talking about a credit card with incentives for travel, therefore, if I would like to travel to  XXXX  and I would like to buy more than  XXXX  tickets it would be almost impossible because my credit limit, also if we consider that this offer does n't have an introductory 0 % off APR and m y credit score is clos er to the category of excellent, I am wondering if I am applying for a mortgage? I have been spoken 2 times with the department of credit card services from BOA and they only say that they are sorry, they can understand my frustration and they sent me a letter telling me how to build  a credit score and how I can keep a good one as  well. Please if someone needs to have a position of 1 % of the wealthy population in order to receive a fair deal from BOA and their credit cards they should let this know to the hard working people.

Consumer complaint narrative: I used my Bank of America Visa credit card in this transaction for which I disputed the charge. I pre-ordered an aquarium from the online retailer  XXXX  in   XX/XX/XXXX  wit h an expected ship date of    XX/XX/XXXX .  M ultiple delays led to an estimated ship date of   XX/XX/XXXX , an d then finally   XX/XX/XXXX . Howe ver, the seller stopped communicating earlier in the year and I have tried multiple times to contact them through various methods such as email, online form, and chat. In addition, I moved in  XXXX  and have been unable to successfully update my shipping address. I called Bank of America initially to start a dispute and the person I spoke to on the phone said that even though this was charged in   XX/XX/XXXX  , that because the latest updated shipping wa s  XX/XX/XXXX , t hat it would be no problem and still within timeframe and she was able to initiate a dispute. I received a fax number which to fax in my request and all supporting documents. After doing so, I received a letter saying the dispute fell outside the timeframe and they can not do anything. I called in again and this time a different representative said there is nothing they can do, contrary to what I was told the first time I called . Below is  my response from a prior complaint that went unanswered : " This requirement was not met because the transaction posting date was more than 540 days. The last date we could have entered this claim would have been   XX/XX/XXXX .  '' I called the week of   XX/XX/XXXX   and the representative on the phone said it would not be a problem initiating the dispute. This is due to the fact that the PROMISED delivery date of the purchased product was   XX/XX/XXXX . " Therefore, we can only suggest you continue to pursue this matter directly   with the merchant to come to a satisfactory resolution. '' I obviously had tried disputing with the merchan t (  both  XXXX  the company and  XXXX  the intermediary ) and it did not work nor did they respond to me. Thus, I came to the bank for help. This has been stated in all my evidence and it is offensive Bank of America suggests this solution. It seems they either have not read/comprehended my statements or does not care. " Bank of America respectfully denies your request for compensation, as there has been no error in the handling of your account. '' I never said there was an error in the handling of my account. This really is a purchase protection issue. I initiated the dispute because the company failed to deliver the product I bought and refuses to refund me. By denying compensation, Bank of America is saying they do not care and that I should never pre-order a product using their credit cards because if something goes wrong down  the road,  they will refuse to help. I believe Bank of America has more power to deal with the merchant  XXXX  and the intermediary   XXXX   than I. My hope was that they would recoup the loss from those companies as they probably have the resources to do so. Bank of America is the credit card I used to make the purchase and at this point the only way I can recover my money. Even under the circumstances in timing, I request to be reimbursed for my losses.     I appreciate Bank of America for refunding me the foreign transaction fee associated with this purchase, however the amount of loss to myself is still a much greater amount that I can not afford to lose. In the last response, they said " Bank of America has followed its established credit standards, and is fully committed to adhering to all fair lending laws, and regulations. '' It 's not about just being legal, it 's about making it right for the customers who use their credit cards thinking they have the protection in case the merchant is engaging in fraud. Note that it 's bee n 2 1/2 years a nd I still have not received the product I purchased.

To whom i t may con cern, On  XXXX   XXXX ,  2017  I opened a core checking account with Bank of America. My account was in good status and I made several qualified deposits to my account from m y   XXXX   XXXX    account as well as  XXXX   XXXX  account. I was also received my Bank of America debit card on  XXXX   XXXX . I did not realize that BOA closed my account until when I attempted to activate my card. I made several phone calls to figure out what happened the BOA staff simply told me that they do not have any obligation to disclose the reason. The bank just simply closed my checking account and I will not be qualified for applying for any BOA accounts in the future.   I have good relations with all other banks and am in excellent credit status. Also I am not involved in any negative financial activities in any forms. Therefore I need to know why exactly Bank of America treats an honest and responsible customer like this. Many thanks.

Met with   XXXX   XXXX  at Bank of America in  XXXX , NC on   XXXX   for information regarding an auto loan for a lease buyout. I asked whether I should apply for credit in my wife 's name only or jointly and he advised since I am the primary earner to apply jointly.     On  XXXX , I applied for a joint loan and called into Customer Service to be told that a joint application would n't be valid to do a lease buyout for my wife 's lease since if my name was not on the original lease, I could n't be on the credit application.     A few hours later on  XXXX , we did an auto application in her name only and then were told that application would not be valid since her father originally co-signed with her on the lease and that both names needed to match exactly.     So now my credit has been pinged once and my wife 's credit has been pinged twice and we have approved loans that are not valid and unable to close for the transaction advertised, given terrible advise by several loan offices and customer service agents all along the way.     I was given bad / incomplete information by the original banker and th en 2  subsequent phone representatives in order to encourage me to apply for credit without remotely trying to identify what was in my and my wife 's best interest.     Additionally, the law / policy that is forcing names on a credit application to match exactly both signers of a lease seems unnecessarily burdensome to younger couples who are trying to transition assets and financial responsibilities into their own names and our of their parents names.
The Bank has been  manipulating my deposits to generate additional fees. I thought this was illegal. I thought Dodd-Frank elim inated these practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I, the consumer, defined by 15 U.S. Code Section 1692a ( 3 ) as any natural person obligated or allegedly obligated to pay any debt. 

15 U.S. Code Section 1692a ( 4 ) The term " creditor '' means any person who offers or extends credit creating a debt or to whom a debt is owed, but such term does not include any person to the extent that he receives an assignment or transfer of a debt in default solely for the purpose of facilitating collection of such debt for another. 

15 U.S. Code Section 1692a ( 6 ) The term " debt collector '' means any person who uses any instrumentality of interstate commerce or the mails in any business the principal purpose of which is the collection of any debts, or who regularly collects or attempts to collect, directly or indirectly, debts owed or due or asserted to be owed or due another. Notwithstanding the exclusion provided by clause ( F ) of the last sentence of this paragraph, the term includes any creditor who, in the process of collecting his own debts, uses any name other than his own which would indicate that a third person is collecting or attempting to collect such debts. For the purpose of section 1692f ( 6 ) of this title, such term also includes any person who uses any instrumentality of interstate commerce or the mails in any business the principal purpose of which is the enforcement of security interests. 

15 U.S. Code Section 1692c ( a ) Communication with the consumer generally Without the prior consent of the consumer given directly to the debt collector or the express permission of a court of competent jurisdiction, a debt collector may not communicate with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt -- ( b ) Communication with third parties Except as provided in section 1692b of this title, without the prior consent of the consumer given directly to the debt collector, or the express permission of a court of competent jurisdiction, or as reasonably necessary to effectuate a post judgment judicial remedy, a debt collector may not communicate, in connection with the collection of any debt, with any person other than the consumer, his attorney, a consumer reporting agency if otherwise permitted by law, the creditor, the attorney of the creditor, or the attorney of the debt collector. 

( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt, except -- ( 1 ) to advise the consumer that the debt collector 's further efforts are being terminated ; ( 2 ) to notify the consumer that the debt collector or creditor may invoke specified remedies which are ordinarily invoked by such debt collector or creditor ; or ( 3 ) where applicable, to notify the consumer that the debt collector or creditor intends to invoke a specified remedy. 

Specific Violations : BANK OF AMERICA has violated 15 U.S. Code Section 1692c ( a ), I, the consumer did not authorize or give you prior consent to communicate with me, and there is no express permission of a court of competent jurisdiction. 

BANK OF AMERICA violated 15 U.S. Code Section 1692c ( b ), as they communicated with other parties and individuals, namely XXXX. 

BANK OF AMERICA violated 15 U.S. Code Section 1692c ( c ), I the consumer notified BANK OF AMERICA XX/XX/2013 to cease and desist all activity. 

BANK OF AMERICA did an assignment that was recorded in the county recorder 's office in XX/XX/2013, causing a transfer of debt to a third party to claim, in violation of 15 U.S. Code Section 1692c ( b ). I did not give you my prior consent, or you did not have the express permission of a court of competent jurisdiction.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This charge was not authorized at any time and the company that made the unauthorized charge,  XXXX   XXXX , has not responded to our attempts to contact them to reverse the charges. An initial charge first made on the card was authorized, but the company did not complete work we had hired them to do as agreed upon, and this second charge was made without our permission or consent and absent any proper notification. The reason being that the work the company was hired to do was not completed as agreed upon. We agree we owe a final payment, but we do not owe {$2800.00} and should not have been charged without a renegotiation.     As is clearly indicated in highlighted portions of printed emails,  XXXX   XXXX  agrees that all the work agreed upon in the contract with them was not done and that they would agree to an adjusted ( lowe r ) final price. Instead, they charged our card for the full   amount without our permission and have avoided our calls and emails asking for this charge to be reversed.     We phoned Bank of America at the very first notice that this was charged and we informed the representative that this was an unauthorized charge. It was posted to our account anyway. In my conversations with  AAA Financial Services/Bank of America representatives on several occasions since, I was informed that we  would not be charged any late fees or penalties and that I would not have to pay until this investigation was completed.  One representative I spoke with said there would be documentation sent for us to complete, but I have not received this. I have only received bills. Please adjust your    records to reflect that this is an unauthorized charge that should not result in any late fees or penalties.
We never received any notice of any required documentation involving an alternate contractor  , nor were we informed by letter of any rejection of our case or contradictory finding of our claim. We were told by phone that the case was not resolved in our favor without any proper explanation. My last conversation with a dispute supervisor  XXXX   XXXX  on Sunday,  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , he gave me this mailing address and that perhaps someone here can help.     We sent a payment for {$2400.00}. This is the proper amount owed, and we hoped this will resolve this matter.     Specifically,  XXXX   XXXX  did not dispose of the old appliances as they were supposed to, did not clean the work site in accordance with the agreement, and installed less labor-intensive floor tiles which was both incomplete and done improperly. The overcharge transaction was not authorized at all and if we wind up in court, we are confident that any fair judge will find in our favor.     The disreputable vendor in question,  XXXX   XXXX , has been notified numerous times and his still refused to rectify this situation.     We recently sent payment for {$610.00} with the stipulation that we are making this payment under duress and only in an attempt to clear our credit rating. We fully intend to pursue this case in the courts and retrieve this money from  XXXX   XXXX .     Bank  of America/AAA Financial Services was   notified immediately that this charge was unauthorized and took no action to protect consumers from a fraudulent charge. Additionally, it agreed by cashing the check we sent earlier this year to resolve the matter with that payment and then violated that stipulation.

Bank of America released the funds for me to use immediately. So I used them. Two days later on   XXXX / XXXX /20  17 t he bank decided to place a 10 day hold on that check. This caused my account to now be " overdrawn. '' At this point, they charged a {$12.00} fee for transferring funds from my checking account to cover that  ( after 20 minutes o n the phone with a supervisor, I got that {$12.00} fee reversed ). There was not enough in my savings account to cover all the amount overdrawn, so after 5 days of being overdrawn, there will be a {$35.00} " extended overdraft fee '' charged that they said ca n't be reversed. From my perspective, the bank released the funds for me to use and took them away 2 days later just so they could charge me more fees and tell me there is nothing I can do about it. I was not receiving regular communication about my account from my bank. I was not getting quarterly statements like I was supposed to. I also was never informed that they were starting to charge fees for their savings account. When I finally did get a statement I saw the fees and called customer service. I requested that the fees be reversed because I was never told about the fees and I requested a supervisor call me and explain why I was never told and to have the fees reversed. My final request was that the account be closed to prevent this from happening again. I was never called back, the account was never closed, and the fees were not reversed. I asked that the account be closed at least 5 times. And I made the request e to 2 diff erent reps. BofA is defrauding their customers by charging fees without informing them, not sending regular statements, and when requests are made on the accounts, those requests are not fulfilled. I want ALL of my money back, I want ALL fees reversed and I want the account closed. This " bank '' is a joke.

I applied for a bank of america business checking account and was initially approved provided sufficient documentation of the business and received a business debit card and online banking access as o f  XX/XX/XXXX .   No activity occurred other than an initial {$25.00} deposit. Today  X/XX/2017    I could not activate the card and was today the account was terminated for no reason. They did not disclose this information to me legally the representative was rude and provided no additional information. This should be against the law to terminate good standing accounts and waste peoples time with an already burdensome application process ( i would have applied elsewher e ). Plea se enact a federal regulation overseeing the closure of these accounts, many people are having their money with much large deposits being stolen by Bank of America. To call them names and ridicule them does not due them or myself justice instead take control of these banks and enact legislation that will regulate these unjust activities OR sue them and give us our money and time back. I am a  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  patient and they just took more time off the remaining life that i have. What pieces of garbage!

In addition, when looking at the different transaction they are processing the big $ amount items first so they can collect more in fees. Wi th one of the transacations I endup paying {$35.00} in overdraft fee for a cup of coffee I purchased. I reached out to  them today, but they were unwilling to offer any help even though I 've been a client for over 15 years. Thank you in advance for your consideration.

On  XXXX   XXXX , I went to Bank of America to close my deceased mother 's checking account. I gave them her death certificate and letters testamentary showing that I am the executor. They told me they would send it to their estate dept, I would hear from someone withi n 48  hours, and that the process would take 10 days -  2  weeks to complete. After about  2 w eeks I called them as I had not heard from anyone. The  manager  told me that I needed to fill out more paperwork, have it notarized and bring it in. I did all this and she told me that I should receive a check in 10 days  - 2 wee ks. After  2 1/2  weeks I called again to find out why I had n't received anything. After checking with the estate dept., she said that someone finally looked at the account and realized that it was left to the family trust, so we would need to start over again and a ll 5  trustees would need to fill out new forms, notarize them and send them back. SOMEONE FINALLY LOOKED AT THE ACCOUNT  FIVE  WEEKS INTO THE PROCESS!!! This was on  XXXX   XXXX , and the  manager  said she would mail the forms that day. My sister finally received her paperwork postmarked  XXXX   XXXX , over a week later. This has taken almost  two  months and still no resolution. We have been lied to and deliberately delayed.   Bank of America is making this process as difficult as possible, and dragging out the process as long as possible, either willfully or through complete incompetence. I believe they want to keep the money as long as they can.

My mom wrote me a check from an account she had been saving for me for college. It was a CD account so when the CD closed it transferred to her account. There was a mix up and the bank closed the account and sent my mom a check. My mom did not know this when she write me the check so it ended up returned. When I found out I tried to call the bank to catch it before anything happened, but by then they had frozen my account. I called a few times to get this resolved and kept getting referred to other departments. Now today  XXXX . XXXX .2017 I went to the branch to see what can be done. They told me the account can not be reopened, however I found out that they 've flagged me as fraud. Bear in mind no one from the bank called me to let me know this is what happened even after several attempts to find out what 's going on. This is not fraud and I can not believe Bank Of America would just close my account and flag it as fraud without finding out what 's going on. I just graduated high school and heading to college, what do I know about fraud? I strongly believe Bank Of America should confirm before destroying people 's history by labelling them as fraud. This will seriously affect me at such a young age and whereas i know they have the right to close the account, they should not be allowed to just use fraud as an excuse. I have paid the balance owed and would like Bank of America to remove that red flag from my history. Thank you.

In late-  XXXX   I contacted  XXXX ,  XXXX  and   XXXX   with the following request. " Please remove the following derogatory report from my credit report : Bank of America Date Reported -  XX/XX/XXXX Payment Status - 120 Days Late Account Status - Derogatory Account Number -   XXXX   Account Type - Conventional real estate mortgage Original Loan Amount - {$260000.00} Date Account Opened - XX/XX/XXXX Date Account Closed -  XX/XX/XXXX  This property was sold via the HAFA program on a short sale. <P/>
I was told by BOA as well as licensed realtors that if I did a short sale it would be on my credit report as derogatory for three years. I feel I have either been lied to by both, or that BOA 's current practice is incorrect. I would really like to know rules or laws, if any, apply.

Since the last 8 months I am being charged a monthly fee on my Bank of America savings account. They are doing a bait and switch. A condition get put on my account without any notification to me of the same. Instead of producing the paperwork and accepting there was a change in account requirement, the manager is questioning me why I did not come earlier. This is looting in broad daylight - ready to stiff even a long tenured customer!!!

My name is  XXXX   XXXX . I am having an on-going problem with Bank Of America. I feel like they have discriminated and criminalized me for things that happened within my account that simply can not control. After talking to numerous BOA representatives, I 've realized that they have come to conclusion that I was the one who had been making the fraudulent purchases. Several BOA representatives have told me that in order to get my money back I will need to get a police report. In the mean time I had no money but fortunately I had a check from one of my family members that I decided to cash on saturd ay (   X/XX/17    ). The check was for {$7000.00}. I believe that ever since the problem with the fraudulent activity BOA has been treating me unfairly. I am very upset and offended that a bank that I have invested many years into, has been treating me as if I am a criminal. Not to mention that the person who wrote me the check is a family member and is on record to have wrote me checks close to the {$7000.00} check and NONE has bounced or considered to be fraud. I would like to see all of my money back, insufficent charges off and I would like to be released from this bank. I literally have no money to get to and from work, all because BOA has decided tho treat me unfair.

Consumer complaint narrative:

I have called several times talking to many of the bank associates and ended with them telling me different reasons why my account was closed. Because I had overdraft, I had a   XXXX   balance when it was closed and also because I did not comply with their standards. I got no straight forward answer. I then asked them to mail me the reason and the only thing they mailed me was the notification that my accounts were being closed and not the reason why they closed them. They responded with a back dated,  XXXX   XXXX , 2015 response with my accounts closure and it stated that I did not comply with their deposit agreement and disclosure. On my   XXXX   XXXX   report it said something different, it said that I was attempting to transact in a prohibited manner. Consumer complaint narrative: In  XX/XX/XXXX , I received an offer in the mail from Bank Of America to open a checking account and to set up auto deposit to earn a bonus offer of {$300.00}. I opened a checking account on  XX/XX/XXXX on the computer. I set up  XXXX  auto deposits with my checking account number. In a few weeks, I received a letter from BOA about my account, a pin # and a debit card. Then, on  XX/XX/XXXX  I received a checking account statement saying that the {$25.00} that I had opened the account with had been withdrawn and my balance was  XXXX  dollars. I called the  XXXX  number on my statement and I was directed to the fraud department and then to the risk department. I was told by the risk department that my account had been closed and that I needed to open a new account. I was outraged. I expressed very clearly to the risk department that I had already set up  XXXX  auto deposits to this checking account and that I did not want to open a new account. I asked to speak to a manager and spoke to   XXXX   XXXX  . in the risk department. He told me that I could not re-open the account that was closed and that I must cancel my auto deposits and open a new checking account. I told him that I did not want to do that and asked why my account had been closed in the first place. He said that he could not tell me why. I asked to speak to a manager above him and he told me that there was no one above him. He suggested that I go into a bank branch and ask to speak to the branch manager. I went into the local branch in   XXXX   XXXX  , CA. that very day and asked to speak to the branch manager. I was told that her name is   XXXX   XXXX    and that I could come back and see her on XX/XX/XXXX . I scheduled an appointment to meet with her and did so on XX/XX/XXXX . In that meeting, I told her that I had spoken to 5 BOA employees and not a single one had offered to give me my {$25.00}!   XXXX   XXXX   told me that I should expect a check in the mail within 2 weeks. She also explained that the risk department at BOA is a separate department and that even she could not see why my account had been closed. She offered that I open a new account and I told her that I felt that I had been discriminated against and that my account had been closed and my money had been withdrawn without my consent and that I did not want to open a new account. I added that all of this had been done and no reason or explanation could be given. I told her that it was outrageous and that I was very offended. I explained that I had spent hours setting up my account, setting up the auto deposits, calling on the phone, coming into the branch and then coming back into the branch to meet with her and that I still was not being offered my {$25.00} deposit back, I was not being offered the {$300.00} offer that I was not allowed to do because they closed my account, or an explanation why I was being treated this way or an apology. She did apologize at that point and asked me if she could try and find out why my account was closed. I asked her why she had not done that before our meeting because I had let the bank receptionist know why I needed a meeting with her the day before. She could not say why other than it was hard to find out why accounts are closed. I asked to speak to a manager above her and she told me that she would have him call me and gave me his card. It is   XXXX   XXXX     XXXX   XXXX   did call me the next day, which was Saturday  XX/XX/XXXX and he told me the same thing that   XXXX   had told me. I told   XXXX   XXXX    that I can go bank anywhere but that BOA had solicited me to bank with them for a {$300.00} bonus and I did but the bank was not allowing me to earn the bonus because they had closed my account and without reason even though I have asked repeatedly and my money has not been returned to me. I contacted the state of Florida, sent in proof of my relationship to the owner of the account, my mother, and all other required documentation. They want some kind of business paper from the banks. The problem:

Bank of America closed my account and escheated my property to State of Wisconsin (that is the information that I was able to get from Bank of America with your previous help, see case ID  XXXX ). State of Wisconsin's online Unclaimed Property Database (see   XXXX   ) does not provide any property under my name. So, I contacted State of Wisconsin Unclaimed Property Division, provided them all the necessary information and requested a MANUAL SEARCH in their Unclaimed Property Database.  possible Bank of America misspelled your name or make a data

 to go back to Bank of America and talk to them. They have
 more information about the property then us.

Now I need Bank of America or the Federal Reserve System or anyone to locate where my money from my closed account is.

Thank you for your help.

Ban k of American  offered a  XXXX  signature credit card in connection with   XXXX    XXXX . As part of the inducement to apply they offered  XXXX  bonus miles and a companion ticket for the cost of the taxes and fees associated with the fare of the ticket. They offered apply now and book your travel immediately. This is not true. Although I was immediately approved for the card and immediately made the required purchases, when I received the actual card an " insert '' stated that the miles and the companion ticket would not be issued for up to  two  more billing cycles.   I would not have filled out the application nor would I have used this card had I known I would not be able to travel within the very near future. " We look forward to traveling with you soon '' is not exactly what they mean. Applying now and if you 're instantly approved- you can book your next flight immediately " is a lie. " Buy  XXXX  ticket, and get  XXXX  for just the taxes and fees from just {$22.00} after you make {$1000.00} or more in purchaes within the first 90 days '' is another lie.

I have  XXXX  Bank of America credit cards and had some problems in the past that warranted the increase in interest rate. But since then, about three years now, my status has changed and not only do I pay on time, I have not missed a payment and in most cases have exceeded the minimum payment. After a long period of time decided to call the Bank of America to inquire if the interest rate can be reduced, I was told that on my account there a note stating that the interest rate can not be reduced.   As I stated that my situation has changed from the past problems and my payment activities for the past three years proves it, why ca n't my interest rate can not be adjusted??   I have another credit card that on their own about a year ago did reduce my interest rate without my having to ask them. If they did that, why ca n't Bank of America do the same? Why do keep punishing me for thing that happened in the past? Do they not think that circumstances change over time?   Please look into this complaint and advice me how I can resolve it.   Thank you for your assistance.

Only way you can tell what fees you are being charged is to download the monthly statement which is only way to access statements when using paperless option. Consumer complaint narrative: I have a Bank of America credit card that was opened when I purchased    AAA. I opened the card to get a discount on AAA. I paid with a check for the first year of the AAA then the next year was billed to my credit card. I called and told them I no longer wanted AAA and I was under  the impression that it was canceled and the charge was being credited back to my credit card this was in  XXXX  of    2017.  I did n't get another bill until   XX/XX/XXXX  I  was still being billed f or AAA alo ng with late fees and interest I called Bank of America and they removed the fees but told me to conta ct AAA with my dispute. I called AAA and they told me that my membership was n't canceled a nd that it was to late to cancel it and that I had to pay for it. I called Bank of America back and tried to dispute it with them but they are telling me I have to pay it. I do n't understand how a credit card company can hold me responsible for something that I do n't w ant. AAA is telling me that there is no notes from where I called in  XX/XX/XXXX  however they also told me that if there is no change made to the AAA account that they do n't have to note it.

I have yet to be contacted regarding resolving fraudulent charges on my Bank of America credit card. Initially they refunded my card of charges around {$3000.00} for fuel purchases over a couple month period. I requested my visa be cancelled and reissued a new card number. B of  America took th e money back after their 'investigation ' stating that it could not be fraud because a chip card was used. Clearly my banking history for more than 20 years with this same bank shows I have never made purchases like this. It 's not even possible to buy as much gas as was being charged within the same day  ( s )  at multiple locations when worki ng 40 hours+ a  week. I have been to  2 Ba nk of America branches in-person to have this looked at and brought documentation. It was a bank mgr that informed me of card cloning. I have been in contact with the week-day fraud depart., the customer svc depart, the weekend/after hours fraud depart, everyone does/says the same thing - they apologize, say they will have someone contact me re my appeal of the denial and my requesting a further investigation. It 's been over a year. Yes, over a year. I 'm so irritated that I 've only been making the minimum payments since this happened, I initially never activated my new card number because I want to close my whole banking experience with B of A because of this. Not  one pe rson has followed through with my multiple requests. This is absolutely unbelievable.

I bought tickets to a  XXXX  show in  XX/XX/XXXX . I used my Bank of America  Card whi ch I have not used in 2 years or so, maybe more. I began getting monthly fees for a " subscription '' ) for $  XXXX /month from the  Theater or t heir provider ( I purchased the tickets  - a one time   event -online at the theater 's website ). I immediately contacted this service provider, known as   XXXX   XXXX  , and requested the fees stop as I did not subscribe to any such service, I merely purchased the tickets online as directed by the theater 's site.   I got an email ( dated  X/XX/2017 - addended ) from   XXXX   XXXX    stating since I was within a grace period I would be unsubscribed and my previous fees refunded.   The next month I received a late notice to my B of A CC account and an additional monthly subscription fee. I contacted B of A and explained the situation. I was transferred to the claims department where I explained it again. I spent neatl y 30 minut es explaining my situation to them and they transferred me to to fourth and fifth person. It seemed they were trying to dismiss my complaint through attrition.   I never use that card yet they allowed this suspicion charge occur and to repeat after complaint. I feel as though both companies are using the " small fee disguise '' to defraud me as these tiny charges keep coming and adding up.   It should also be known that while B of A applied a late fee to this card for these hidden charges - something I would have expected them to be on guard for - I have more than enough in their rewards program to cover these charges of total {$17.00} ( rewards total $  100+ ) Thi s is not a matter of not being able to pay but of certain intrusive charges.   This  may be  insignificant $ but it is adversely affecting my credit, something I have maintained in excellent status -- no late payments  in 20+  years until this.     Thank you,  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX .    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , NY  XXXX  (  XXXX  )  XXXX  B of A : Account #  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  Bank of America   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  TX  XXXX    XXXX    :   XXXX  (  NY ) -- -- --  -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - ( email from   XXXX   XXXX   ) : Thank you for your message.     We are very glad you found our service helpful and we are sorry you have chosen to ca  ncel your subscription.
Since you are within the 6-week grace period, we will issue a refund for the {$8.00} subscription fee to your credit   card. We will cancel and deactivate your subscription, so that you will not be charged again.     Thanks for giving us a chance to serve you. We hope to have the opportunity to be your guide again in the future. Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2009 I defaulted on a mortgage loan number XXXX. On XX/XX/2009 a fourclosure complaint was filed. The property than went to final judgement and the house was actioned off. The original servcer of the loan was XXXX Mortgage, Than the servicer was switched to Countrywide home loans and than to Bank of American N.A. I defaulted on this loan well over 7 years ago. Bank of America is still reporting this negative information on all XXXX of my credit reports. This are reporting complete different time dates and defaults on each credit report. Basiclly they have no idea when the default accured because the loan was transfered so many times. Attached is proof that tha default accured over 7 years ago. You can clearly see this on older credit reports i have also inclosed,

I was informed by my credit reporting agency that I have negative reporting on my credit report dated for the month of  XX/XX/XXXX   XX/XX/XXXX  and XX/XX/XXXX  from Bank Of America it showed that i had missed payments / late payment made on my account and it was reported to the credit reporting agencies showing an negative impact on my credit I have contacted Bank Of America on numerous occasions trying to get this problem resolved on my credit report I have finally sent them copies of thier own records showing my payment were made on time but they have not yet responded back or reported my payments were made on time i have been corresponding back and forth with BANK OF AMERICA but they just keep giving me the rum around over and over.

I received a letter from  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  .  that represent the client   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , charging me for a debt of  XXXX  that is not mine.   The date of the letter is    XXXX   XXXX   ,  2017 , but I just received yesterday and it says the original creditor is BANK OF AMERICA / FIA CARD SERVICES  N.  A.   I never had an account with Bank of America or  FIA Cards  so I don`t know why I am being charged.   I calle d FIA  and they don`t explain anything for me, they transferred my call to several people and no one can explain what this charge is about.   I also called   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   .  that represent the   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   and they also did not know to explain to me what is happening, they just told me that the name in the letter is someone else and they ask me to ignore it, but this charge is in my name and my address, I can`t ignore it!

XX/XX/XXXX  credit card declined. The last three times I have used card it was declined but when call company was told there was no problem. When I called today, XX/XX/XXXX , the said they had closed account. The card was in my deceased husband 's name. However, within a week after his death, I took death certificate to bank and they changed name of checking account, savings account, overdraft protection, and another credit card. The account that has been closed showed I presented death certificate but a bank employee failed to complete the necessary process. I have used this card with my name on it for almost 4 years ( his death was  XX/XX/XXXX ). This card had a {$21000.00} limit and {$530.00} in cash rewards. Payments are current and balance is {$1200.00}. They will not even give me the cash rewards as will only issue check in deceased husband 's name. It finally registered why they are doing this when was told they were scrubbing accounts ( after 4 years ). When he mentioned it was not discrimination, then I realized they do not want a   XXXX   year old retired person with that high of a credit limit. My charges made have always been low and payments made. This is obviously age discrimination. At the least, I want my {$530.00} cash rewards.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I noticed my Debit Card was missing and called the bank I believe the morning of  XX/XX/XXXX . I went on line and noticed that my account was over drawn at that point and told the Bank Rep to immediately cancel my card as it was stolen and used. My   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   was also stolen ... .I did get my truck back around the end of  XXXX  thanks to the help of the   XXXX   XXXX   Police Department . Everything my partner and I had inside was stolen but thank   XXXX   no damage to the vehicle.
Two days after I reported the card I called the bank asking how long it would be before I got my new card. The gentleman said about a week to 10 days and asked why I have n't cancelled my old card! I told him I did ... and he said whoever took the first report did not cancel the stolen card so that number could still be used ... but since the account was over drawn it was n't used any more. The did send my new card and told me they would update the account with all this information and get back to me.
I did n't know that I had to check my message box in my bank app to get these reports ... I noticed the reports late but was able to fill out the proper forms. Then on  XX/XX/XXXX  I received another message to file the fraud statement which I did.
On  XX/XX/XXXX  a message stated the temporary credit would be reversed on  XX/XX/XXXX . I immediately called the fraud department and they had my NEW CARD NUMBER as currently being used and that is the reason for denying the claim. I told her they have the CARDS MIXED UP ... so the Bank Rep took down that information and said they would add to report and get back with me. Then I receive another message on  XX/XX/XXXX  that they would be reversing the temporary credit as they determined that no error has occurred and claim is resolved! HOW? WHY I asked ... then the letter said the transaction activity in question was authorized as they used my pin ... I told the rep my PINS and Passwords are in my phone! I DID NOT AUTHORIZE ANYONE TO USE MY CARD! Just like I did not give my keys to someone to steal my truck and possessions for almost a month ... that is why I called the police.
I had a business check taken from the middle of our check book for our business a few years ago and we were INSURED when someone stole from our bank account. Why is this any different. I never overdraw my account. I have a   XXXX   XXXX  , I am a   XXXX   XXXX   for some High End Customers and I work part time at a   XXXX   XXXX   ... I never overdraw my accounts and always pay my bills on time!
One of the last messages dated  XX/XX/XXXX  stated by the bank " We 're here to help '' - " If you have any questions or would like to request copies of the documents we relied on to reach this decision, please call us at   XXXX   ''. I did and asked the gentleman that I would like copies of the documents and he said there are no documents! WOW ... NO DOCUMENTS ... then how did you arrive at this decision???
I asked for copies of the pictures from any ATM 's and they said they do n't get those only if the card was used at their Bank. I know ATM 's have pictures ... I have seen it on the news and TV. They simply did nothing! WHY do I have to take the beating? Am I not INSURED or protected somehow??? I asked to speak to his boss ... His name is   XXXX   and he said the name of his boss is   XXXX   XXXX   and she would get back with me in 48 hours or another one of his managers.
Thank you for helping in this matter. I work hard and {$660.00} is a lot of money to me. Please let me know what else you need from me to support your review.
I am attaching copies of the messages from the bank for review.
Thank you.

I  applied for a zero percent apr purchase card with BofA online. My application came back declined because I had a block on my credit. I tried calling numerous times to speak to someone and I could not get anyone to look at my application so I simply dismissed it. A couple of days later I received a call from BofA from an analyst that said if we can call the credit bureau we can get this credit card approved. We called and they approved my credit card. A couple of days later I received the card WITHOUT the promotion of zero percent purchase interest. I have called and spent hours on the phone with them and they said I do n't  qualify for the card with that promotion. If I did n't qualify for the card that I applied for then why was n't this communicated with me at the time of the application or when I spoke to the analyst to verify the product I applied for? If I was approved for another c ard ( one that I never applied for ) then why was n't this told to me in order for me to make a decision on  how to proceed? Instead, I get a card with a high interest rate that I never applied for nor that I wanted. This seems like a misleading practice to offer something to someone and then deliver another product that the customer does not want. I spoke to  XXXX   XXXX  in resolutions who was not able  to help and refused to allow me to speak to someone to file a complaint. I was told a manager would call me back and no one has to this point. I have wasted hours of my time in this and there is still no resolution in sight.

On the  XXXX   XXXX   2016,   XXXX  $ were debited on my account on a ATM with the code of my card in  XXXX   XXXX .   First of all, I had my card with me the before and the day it happened. I have never been to  XXXX   XXXX  and I do n't even have my driver licence and I ca n't rent a car.   I was at m y   XXXX    school this day, and I have a letter that certifies that I was in  XXXX   XXXX  this day.     After few reflexions, I think what happened was that I 've been to an AT M ( w here I 've been few times ) and this ATM copied my data ( the number of the card and the code ) and copied the card with the number and the code.     I had explain this many times to Bank of America, by phone call and letters and they always said that my case ca n't be refund because they have the number and the code of my debit card.

I have been receiving numerous calls from a blocked number the past few days. This evening the number finally left me a message. The caller stated she was calling from Bank of America on an important servicing matter. Her name is XXXX XXXX. In her message she said she wanted to discuss options that may benefit me however my input is needed on this matter and to call her back to discuss the options. I figured this was regarding my Bank of America checking account so I called the number she left me back. I spoke to a different representative and they told me there were no options to discuss and that this was an attempt to collect a debt. Not once was it mentioned in the message that this was an attempt to collect a debt or that it was related to my credit card. It was misleading. I already have an agreement with Bank of Americas collections department and have been paying the agreed to amount for the past 5 months.

I submitted a form for auto payments during the first months of my auto loan. I sent the first payment because it states to make payments until the auto pay begins I thought my auto payments because on their Bank of America it did n't show a payment was due.     I was never notified that I had missed a payment.     They state that they tried to contact me but I have no voicemails or email notifications that told me my payment had not been made.     I believe this is unfair because on their website they have payment alerts that tell me when a payment is due. Apparently it only shows when credit card payments are due not auto loans. No where does it state that. I was under the impression that if a payment was due it would show an alert. it did n't.     They told me that have time stamps of me logging in before the 30 day late payment.     I have and had enough money in my account to have covered that payment.

My case was closed today after the company provided a response. When I read the response I wanted to offer feedback but the option was not allowed to open as the link stated file not found and the case was closed. Case number was  XXXX  against Bank of America who is charging late fees. In their response they stated the payments were automatically refunded, but this is not true as I had to call and was told by their staff I had to call to have them refunded. Overall I am not satisfied with their response and the overall length in time it took to respond if the response was that simple. There is no language to suggest that they will change their language as I had requested in my complaint.

Originally  Bank of America stated they closed my accounts due to a business decision a few months ago, i do n't check my accounts that often and did n't know the reason until recently. I have a credit card account with Bank of America. They state in their Credit Card Agreement that they are subject to the laws of the State of North Carolina. I have read that they can close my account for any reason which they did. But they did not tell me what the reason was. I have never missed a payment and I am still making payments. On  XXXX   XXXX ,  2017 , a charge was submitted in the amount of {$75.00}, to Bank of America via my debit card from   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  VA  XXXX . Bank of America returned the charge as a check/item and charged my account a {$35.00} insufficient funds fee for each debit card transaction. This is a practice that has been repeated. However, if the debit card were used at the establishment in person, the charge would have been rejected immediately and no fee would be charged.     I contacted Bank of America on  XXXX   XXXX , then again on  XXXX   XXXX  when I spoke with a superviso r [   XXXX   ] r egarding the policy of charging a fee for the use of a debit card, when it 's used without being swiped or inserted directly into a credit card reader. According to  XXXX , the vendor received initial authorization for process the charge, however, they took too long to complete the process. Therefore, by the time the charge was completed the bank is within its right to charge a fee, even though the debit card was used.     If in fact the bank issued an authorization to the vendor, I should not be penalized with a fee once the process is completed. For this reason, Bank of America should refund all fees that were associated with debit card purchases or payments.

Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America has made it very difficult to access funds direct-deposited into my checking account. I recently had to travel across the country to deal with a family death, and wanted to move some funds to a credit union I 've been a member of for decades. That way I could avoid traveling with a large amount of cash, and would have access to the funds at a familiar location at my destination. My first plan was to write a check on my Bank of America account and deposit it to my credit union, in time for it to clear before my arrival. However, BANK OF AMERICA HAS NEVER SENT ME A SET OF CHECKS FOR THIS ACCOUNT. I am perplexed as to how a " checking account '' does not come with checks. Next I looked into transferring funds, but Bank of America charges {$3.00} to transfer funds to another institution. I have never encountered such a fee. As I prepared to leave town, I started to panic that I would not have money when I got there. Finally, going through all my new-account materials, I found one single temporary check that looked fake and unofficial, and used it for lack of other options. Meanwhile, I did n't realize that my wife tried to help me out of the stressful situation by withdrawing from a Bank of America ATM near her office, and deposited the cash into our credit union immediately before I left. Had I known that day, I would have stopped the temporary check, but I did n't know we had duplicated efforts for a day or two. The temporary check bounced and Bank of America assessed a {$35.00} fee for the returned check. When we discovered the problem we immediately made a big deposit into the Bank of America account to cover it and ensure the account is in good status. Then I contacted Bank of America to explain how it occurred, and asked them to waive the fee. The Bank refused, and still has not sent me pre-printed checks for this checking account. Bank of America seems to set its customers up for failure by making it difficult to transact without fees. So I am asking the CFPB 's help. Thank you.

Bank of America offers co-branded credit cards with   XXXX    XXXX . They offer  XXXX  versions of the credit card with very different rewards and sign-on bonuses.     Bank of America 's application is problematic because a consumer will apply for the credit card with the better rewards/bonuses, but the bank will make the final determination of which version of the credit card the consumer will   receive.
I applied for Bank of America/  XXXX   XXXX   Signature Card. My applicati  on was approved, but Bank of America sent me the Platinum Card which provides lesser rewards/bonuses. I cancelled my card.     Bank of America should simply have  XXXX  separate applications for their  XXXX   XXXX  credit cards. I would rather be denied for the card I applied for instead of receive a card I do not want. Going through this application process is a waste of time and effort, as well as a cost imposed on m y credit score, when I can not simply apply for the card I want.

I have sent documents, letters to support my dispute numerous times to credit bureau, and to the bank in regards of 30 days late in my credit report. I have called several times to the bank, and I was told to dispute with the bureaus. so I did. and I was told that the report was accurate.      XXXX   XXXX  , 2010 I   t  rade in a c ar to the dealership for another car that I can afford. I still owed the bank for the car I traded in. Consumer complaint narrative:
I had  XXXX  credit cards with Bank of America, both were Visa cards, one ending in  XXXX  and the other in  XXXX . Both were issued in  XXXX .
<P/>
Both credit cards were always in good standing, and were always paid on time. I also never went over the credit limit on either one of my credit cards, and they were used frequently for basic needs, and always paid on time.
<P/>
Between XX/XX/XXXX  and XX/XX/XXXX , Bank of America closed both of my credit card accounts without any notification whatsoever. Notifications were sent afterwards, which I received today. I still have a balance on my cards, but can not use any of them. Now, this information will adversely affect my credit which I have been working on rebuilding for years, and  XX/XX/XXXX  accounts will be listed as closed accounts. If I had been given the opportunity to pay off the balance in order to at least keep the accounts open to build " credit history '', as most credit scoring systems consider this an important factor on building credit, I would have paid them off. But the opportunity was not given, nor was any notice given prior to this occurring.
<P/>
According to the letter received today, but dated  XX/XX/XXXX , the date the accounts were closed, the decision of closing these accounts was based on " account history, your total relationship with us, current economic trends and a copy of your credit report ''. I have been a Bank of America customer for almost a decade, if this was based on my credit report, a recent negative account was added which was immediately disputed and this particular agency issued a corrective letter to expunge/delete my records from all  XXXX  credit bureaus. The letter is attached to this complaint. This decision was made blindly, without regard to the consumer, me, or every other consumer they have done this to. Now, I have to pay for this decision in the form of bad credit.
<P/>
Whether or not this is a violation of the CARD Act, which requires any " significant change '' to the account to be notified 45 days prior to the change, I do n't know nor am I an expert. What I do know, is a large population of us living in this country are struggling to upkeep our credit, and yet, we have yet another financial institution hurting people financially, and hurting their score despite payments being made on time, yet ironically labeling themselves with the name of the country they are supposed to represent : America.

Consumer complaint narrative: I had a checking and savings account with bank of America for about a year  (   XXXX   ) . My purse and cell phone was stolen which had most of my personal papers and information inside in  XXXX  of   XXXX  . I went to the bank on a Monday morning when they open to tell them about my situation. I did all the paper work and filed a claim and closed that account out. I then again went to the following day to reopen a new account to set my direct deposit for work back up but I was then told that I was not able t due to my account having fraudulent activity. Someone tried to upload fake checks into my account and then tried to take money from my account twice. I again explained to then bank people that my personal belongings were stole. MY Phone which was a  XXXX  did n't have a passcode and also had my bank app and my emails and things on it was stolen as well. I Then talked to the fraud department on the phone and she told me that the phone that uploaded the checks was a  XXXX  which I had a  XXXX . I ask them if they could look at the atm cameras but was told no. So I felt like that was wrong but I  ten  went to   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   and opened a account with them until one day my account was closed out the blue. I then had to go to   XXXX   XXXX   and ask them what happen and was told that bank of America sent to the consumer agency that my account had fraudulent activity which made me not able to open up a nother bank account with any bank. So the banker at   XXXX   XXXX   helped me fill out the paper and send it to the consumer agency to dispute everything but I still have n't got a reply or anything and its almost been a whole year. I feel that if somone actually comes to the bank to report something on there account due to lost personal info or identity stolen they should take into consideration and help that person instead of blaming them.

This whole process by BOA has been unfair to consumer.
