I have an   XXXX   XXXX   Visa card through Bank of America.
 XXXX 
It had a {$17000.00} limit that was reduced without explanation on  XX/XX/XXXX  down to {$3200.00}. My balance at the time was {$3100.00}.
 XXXX 
I had n't used my card since approximately  XX/XX/XXXX  and it had a {$0.00} balance. ( I have always paid the balance in full monthly and I only use the card once or twice a year for travel ).
 XXXX 
I received a bill in XX/XX/XXXX  that included my {$0.00} balance and what I think was a new {$85.00} annual fee. I did not pay the bill cause I knew I was going to use the card in the next couple of weeks so I would pay it when I returned from my international trip coming up.
 XXXX 
I called Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX  to let them know I was going to be out of the country and using the card as my main and only form of payment from  XX/XX/XXXX  through  XX/XX/XXXX . They confirmed this action and I assumed everything was set and ready to go.
 XXXX 
I successfully used the card multiple times internationally on my trip until receiving a fraud alert text after getting my card denied purchasing a {$15.00} waterproof phone case in    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  ,  XXXX  on   XX/XX/XXXX . I confirmed the purchase through the fraud text alert and my card worked again moments later.
 XXXX 
I again used the card without issue numerous times over the next week and a half.
 XXXX 
My card was then declined a t   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   on   XXXX   XXXX   on  Monday, XX/XX/XXXX . The restaurant tried running the card twice. I received no immediate follow up text for an explanation or asking a question, no e-mail, no phone call or anything explaining why it was declined.
 XXXX 
I ended up having to call using my cell phone ( international calling ) and spent 45 minutes trying to figure out why my card was deactivated. I was transferred three times and had to repeat my situation each time to the person I talked to. I ended up paying for lunch with cash.
 XXXX 
I was told by bank of america customer service that due to missing a payment ( I used the card for the first time just two weeks earlier ), the system had deactivated my card and would n't allow them to reactive it until the next business day. I explained how it was my only form of funds, stuck at a restaurant without money, and I was traveling internationally like I had told them on the phone two weeks earlier. I reminded them I still needed to pay for lunch and the hotel that night.
 XXXX 
After 45 minutes on the phone I was told my card was now reactivated and ready to use. I had already paid for lunch with cash at that point and finished the conversation on the ferry.
 XXXX 
When I reached my hotel, I went to use the card and it was, again, declined. I, again, received no text or contact explaining the dispute or denial of service.
 XXXX 
I did not want to deal with customer service again so I contacted my mom in the US and we were able to get the room paid for.
 XXXX 
My balance on the card at the time was around {$3100.00} and my credit limit was {$17000.00}.
 XXXX 
Luckily, I was able to return to the US without trying to use the card again, although it left me in serious stress knowing I had to travel home without access to viable funds that I am entitled to in my card agreement.
 XXXX 
I received an e-mail on  XX/XX/XXXX  that my credit limit had been lowered from {$17000.00} to {$3200.00}. I received no explanation and no further contact.
 XXXX 
I received a bill on  XX/XX/XXXX  that listed a {$27.00} fee and {$12.00} in interest charges. I had only been using the card for the last 3 weeks and had never received a statement with any purchases listed on it.
 XXXX 
I find it incredibly unethical, immoral and unnaceptable that a credit card company would treat a customer this way.
 XXXX 
I have never missed a payment on a credit card in 15+ years. I have never had my credit limit lowered before, let alone from {$17000.00} down to {$3200.00} when my balance is at {$3100.00} ( Was {$0.00} on  XX/XX/XXXX ) and they know I 'm traveling out of the country and using the card as my only funds.
 XXXX 
After getting no explanation from customer service for treating me this way after spending what was probably more than 30 minutes on the phone, I ended the call and thought this behavior needed to be reported.
 XXXX 
No customer should be treated the way I was treated and Bank of America should be required to change their policies so they do n't put their customers lives in danger by cancelling their only form of payment while in a foreign country. They knew I was there and had no right to cancel my card or lower my credit line.
 XXXX 
I contacted them to tell them I was traveling out of the country before starting to use my card. They contacted me about possible fraud when I was traveling and I immediately returned their text so they knew how to contact me. They then cancelled my card when I was traveling ( knowing it was my only form of payment and without explanation ) and forced me to call collect to resolve it. They said they resolved it but then my card was denied again that evening at my hotel. I had to contact my mom internationally to figure out another form of payment. I finally received a bill today and it showed a {$27.00} fee and over {$12.00} in interest. Those are fraudulent practices. I had n't even been using the card for three weeks and was already being charged fees, interest, having my card cancelled, and my credit lowered by over {$14000.00} without explanation.
 XXXX 
If I did n't have some cash and the ability to contact my mom, the outcome of me not having any way to buy things could have been drastic. This sort of treatment of a customer is unacceptable, especially to someone with a very good credit history.
 XXXX 
Banks ca n't play with customers lives like this. I demand a detailed explanation from Bank of America so I can start to understand why they would drop the ball so severely.
 XXXX 
Thank You,   XXXX   XXXX   (   XXXX   )  XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: On   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     I contacted Bank of America to try to reach a resolution with an account that I allegedly owe. I did not to admit to any debt owed and asked the representative what options are available for this unowned debt to be removed. The representative proceeded to tell me that this is her last call of the day so we needed to resolve the issue immediately. The more I explained, she let me know that she would have to connect me to a collection department. When I was transferred to a collection department, the rep informed that no pay to delete options could be made with bank of America because, " When your account is charged off, we get discounts with the FDIC and the account does n't effect us anymore. '' He proceeded to refer me to  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  and said that I would have to talk to them to resolve this issue and work to have my credit updated. After contacting this company, they did not even attempt to pull up any account or verify any amount owed and yet demanded a payment of {$2000.00} for removal of account. I would not proceed with any transaction and was informed that Bank of America and  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  can sue me for refusing to pay the debt!!!

I  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to intercede where Bank of America is still carrying my PAID IN FULL account as a CHARGE OFF. I find this practice to be offensive to American consumers. We American citizens were never given a bailout like our national banks. When I paid off even the back interest, Bank of America had to take the credit item from sub-standard to standard, and that in effect removes the Charge off status. This is a violation of  Rule 5000  FDIC and it does apply to the fair Credit Reporting Act. If national bank can have it both ways pertaining their abusive practices of FDIC regulations against FCRA guidelines, whats the point of individuals working their way back financially from a financial crisis they caused. This account should be upgraded to simply PAID IN FULL!!!

The debtor is currently in the process of short selling her home. During the preliminary Title review, XXXX abstracts of judgments were found by FIA card services. Title contacted Attorney that file the Judgment and was informed that they no longer represent the client and that is now been serviced by Bank of America. We contacted Bank of America requesting a demand to settle this judgment and obtain a release. As a response we received a demand letter for {$6400.00}, however, in that demand there is not sufficient information to verify the following : 1 ) that this debt, in fact, is the ones mentioned on the judgements attached to the property 2 ) that in fact this amount will settle the XXXX judgments attached to the property. 3 ) that upon receipt of payment this company will send to debtor Acknowledgement and Satisfaction of Judgments 4 ) that Bank of America is the representative for FIA Card services. 
Since XX/XX/XXXX2016 we have been attempting to obtain the above clarification. Again and again, we have been informed to fax our request to the Legal Department handling this account. We have done so on multiple occasions. On XXXX I received a voicemail from the legal operations department stating that the demand we received is the only demand they use and that once they obtain payment they will further follow up on my request. As my supporting documents will show I have done everything I can to give this servicer the opportunity to resolve this case. Unfortunately, after over 2 months I need more assistance to resolve this issue. I also requested if they can not provide the information requested to provide me a release of the XXXX judgments in question. Today when I called and spoke to the Collections department 's manager and informed him that I need more assistance and will be forced to seek alternative assistance his reply was " do that ''.

On   XXXX   XXXX  ,  2017   , I had given a friend of mine my debit card to temporarily use. He had informed me that there was going to be a lot of transactions and deposits going to my bank account, and also asked me for my online banking login information. He told me not to worry and assured me that everything would be fine. Taking his word, I did not worry at all, although I was observing his activity from the online banking system.     The next day, I received some text notifications from my bank that my checking account was placed on a restriction due to the amount of activity associated with it. Not worried too much by it, I contacted the bank and cleared the restriction. Before the day had concluded, my online banking access had been completely revoked.     On   XX/XX/XXXX , I had co ntacted my bank to ask if my paycheck from my job ( which was direct deposited on that day ) was in my checking account. They told me that it was, but I would not be able to receive it due to checks that my friend had deposited to my checking and savings being considered counterfeit. They told me to give them until the   XX/XX/XXXX  to th oroughly look at the checks to see if they were real or not.     When the     XX/XX/XXXX  came aroun d, I had contacted in the early evening to learn that the checks were returned and that the only available funds out of both my checking and savings was {$290.00}. They also provided me the process for how to receive the funds.     The next morning, I went to a banking center to withdraw the above mentioned funds from my checkings while distraught by the realization of all that happened within that short couple of days.     I did n't learn of my accounts being officially closed until I went to a banking center  on the  XX/XX/XXXX  attempting t o clear a small negative balance in my savings account.

My mortgage payment with Bank of America has never been late for 11 years. During the month of   XXXX   XXXX  , I made a change to the automatic payment of my mortgage. The change resulted in my mortgage payment being not credited to the loan account, but to a Bank of America 's credit card account. Due to that mistake, my mortgage payment was delinquent on   XXXX   XXXX   for more than 30 days.
<P/>
Until   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , I was not informed by Bank of America by phone or written notice regarding the delinquency. The only reason I found out of the delinquency was because a service that I use,  XXXX , informed of a drop on my credit history rate.
<P/>
I called Bank of America on the same date,   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , and explained the situation. Bank of America never informed me that I could have retroactively transfer the credits I have on my Bank of America credit card to my Mortgage account with Bank of America. I made the payment over the phone on that same call on   XXXX   XXXX  , and they also refunded all fees related to late fees. On that recorded phone call, on   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , I was informed by the Bank of America associate that there were no records of attempted calls from the collection department to inform me of the delinquency.
I also did not received any written notice from Bank of America before   XXXX   XXXX   informing on the delinquency of   XXXX   XXXX  .
<P/>
My credit payment history is impecable with all companies I have applied for credit.
My credit rating was above 800 in almost all Credit Report Agencies. That mortgage delinquency reported by Bank of America made my credit report to drop around 200 points. It took me more than 17 years to build an impecable credit history. Bank of America reported a delinquency without good faith efforts attempts to contact me, violated a RESPA regulation ( 12 CFR 1024.39 ( a ) ) and my rights as a consumer. My voice mail on my phone estates my name and request the called to leave a message. I never receive any voice mail from Bank of America.
<P/>
I have records of the credit card account holding the credit amount due on my mortgage ( I did not owe any amount on the credit card on XX/XX/XXXX  so the payment done was applied as a credit to my credit card account ). The date of this payment is the same date of the mortgage due,  XX/XX/XXXX .
It was clearly a mistake on my part, but I am not a number. I am a good consumer with an impecable payment history, not having any late payment or delinquency in 11 years of mortgage.
<P/>
Bank of America did not make any attempt to contact me by phone, mail or email within 36 days of my mortgage delinquency, which is a RESPA violation ( 12 CFR 1024.39 ( a ) ). Based on that, I requested Bank of America to contact the Credit Agencies to remove the delinquency from my credit reports. However, Bank of America refused to do so.
<P/><P/><P/><P/><P/>
Bank of America did not make any attempt to contact me

Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America, Your company has been falsely reportin g   XXXX    acco unts that are due to identity theft. A mortgage loan, home line of equity, and a personal credit card through your bank. I had started to dispute these items once i saw them on my credit report after obtaining credit after turning  XXXX  years old. As of   XX/XX/17 ,  Bank of America, has resolved my disputes against these claims of identity theft and has cleared them off my   XXXX   and   XXXX   report. These accounts are under a different name, with my  SSN,  opened years before I had turned  XXXX . BOA seems to have noticed the inaccuracies since they were deleted off  XXXX  CRA 's, but  XXXX  is still reporting. I disputed  the Line of Equity a nd Mortgage that remain on my  XXXX  credit file on   X/XX/17     only to be contacted by  BOA saying the accounts are accurate. When I call BOA the fraud line representative advises there are no accounts anymore with my SSN in the system. Which is why he advise I dispute, and the accounts should come off since they are not in the BOA system anymore. However, after I disputed again they 're verified somehow and being reported still as fradulent and whenever I dispute the claim comes back as " remains '' on report. I have sent in my police report, SSN, CA drivers license, and proof of identity. It seems BOA acknowledges that these accounts are not mine but will not remove them from reporting to  XXXX  only.  XXXX  advised me they have not received any updated reporting status to delete these accounts, and BOA is still reporting as OPEN.

XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  received a statement on a Bank of A merica Visa Card th at showed {$4500.00} new charges that are not mine. Called immediately spoke with fraud they said they would investigate.Canceled the card. Received a letter mailed  XXXX   XXXX ,  XXXX  saying they would investigate and issue temporary credit pending conclusion of investigation.   Never heard anything until I called them today to reveal that they had issued a replacement card, chip embedded, to someone who committed the fraud. It 's a card that I last used in  XXXX  and before that  XXXX  for charges less than {$40.00}. It 's a back up card that I simply continued to hold because it only had an annual fee of {$12.00}. The fraud was committed  over a two day period. On the third day the card was rejected fraudester called in and was told to bring i t into a branch.Which they did not and the problem stopped. There were fraud charges on the card to an electric utility to pay a personal bill, and truck rental which would also have yielded info on who is the culprit. All this and B of A never even called me nor even when they found out someone had my SS #, Address and Birthdate which they used to get the replacement card. I went int o a Branch today demanding action to find out what they knew so I could ascertain the identity theft damage. Found out they will not release any info to me until I fill a police report and they file a supoena, Time frame uncertain to complete. All this time has passed and someone out there has my identity info. B of A has done nothing to stop it or help me with info to protect myself. Asked for a Supervisor today and was told up to 48 hours for a response. I am just looking for the information to  protect my financial rear end- and they will not even help nor acknowledge their complicit behavior!

Consumer complaint narrative: I had a Bank of America card for a year and I made my payments on time without being late and I was supposed to get my  XXXX  deposit back after 12 months of good payments and I was denied twice in the past and I had a inquiry for that I got a letter from Bank of Americ a saying I w as denied because I had a past credit card that I did n't open up back in   XXXX   which I did n't open up I was  XXXX  at the time and did n't had no credit at all the bank found out there is no fraud so I was responsible for that card I feel like Bank of Americ a is lyi ng to me and m y credit score i s  XXXX  and they wo n't give me my  XXXX  back to me

I accepted a balance transfer offer from Bank of America i n  XX/XX/XXXX , an d opened with them a Credit Card ending in  XXXX . In mi d  XX/XX/XXXX  I received a  standard email from Bank of America about payment received to my Credit Card with them, just saying thank you for your payment, as usual. My Credit card is on autopay, and monthly payments are automated bank to bank.   Then later that month I received a separate email from  XXXX  ( which I use to monitor my credit ) stating that there has been a negative report of delinquent payment on my Bank of America credit card. I went to the bank of America web service to see what was going on in my account, there I saw my payment had gone through without a glitch, nothing else on my credit card account.     Since I do n't have much time to manage these things, my Credit card has been on autopay since I can remember. I was able to get back on the web and see my bank of America credit card account la ter in  XX/XX/XXXX , the re I found a strange (  ledger styl e ) set of boxes to tick and allegedly confir m one b y one all my credit card payments ever made to the Bank of America Credit Card. I found this odd, but anyway I dedicated to it as much time as possible to confirm the last few years of payments one by one to this credit card. I checked that my autopay was still operational and decided to make the time and make a phone call to the company asap.     Then I received a letter from Bank of America stating in general terms that due to recent changes in circumstances, I did n't know what changes or by whom, but anyway it was their letter and their decisions, that my credit limit was being decreased by {$1700.00}. Nothing else on such letter.     Within a day or two, I got another email from  XXXX , now I appeared as delinquent in payments fo r 30 a nd 60 days with Bank of America. I went back to the Bank of America Website to see my account, there I confirmed that my Credit limit had been reduced and that m y  XX/XX/XXXX  autopay payment had gone through without a hitch, but there was a request that I pay over {$500.00} in arrears for  XX/XX/XXXX  and  XX/XX/XXXX . I picked up the phone and called the  number on the back of the Credit Card.     After a bit of digging, th e CS repre sentative for Bank of America explained to me that apparently my minimum payment had gone up, since I was up to then on a " reduced payment amount '' for their balance transfer offer. That was something no one ever contacted me about, and was not on my account at the Bank of America website. I had set up a monthly payment that was minimum payment plus {$20.00}. The explanation was that since that minimum payment amount apparently changed, the amount on autopay did not cover what the bank wanted to receive sin ce  XX/XX/XXXX , but th ey failed to notify me in any way. So I paid the agent the full amount she asked for over the phone, and set up a new autopay amount f or  XX/XX/XXXX .    The Bank of America Customer Service agent assured me that since she understood that this was a technical glitch on the Bank 's end, and the credit card was on Autopay, I should have been contacted and it was a technical error, not a failed payment by me- the client, as was reported to the credit bureaus. She assured me that the error would be corrected, the negative report would be erased from my credit history, and all would be fixed with their apologies.     Instead, what happened was that the bank reported to the credit bureaus that I had finally made the late payments, and they went ahead and closed my credit card, leaving me with a an outstanding debt on a credit card that has been cancelled by them. I found out about the Credit Card being closed through the Credit Bureaus, not by a bank notification. The bank actively destroyed my Credit instead of correcting the error. That was not what was agreed, and definitely hurt my credit on a credit card that was on autopay. This needs to be rectified.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Who  m It May Concern, Yesterday my husband and I had property SOLD and left with a check to be deposited.
We deposited the check into our JOINT Checking Ac  count . ( Bank of America ) Within 12 hours there was thousands of dollars being processed/withdrawn out of our JOINT Checking Account. The company that withdraw the monies, was n't indicated at all in our JOINT Checking Account statements. There was no ALERT! that was indicated to us with our online Accounts at all.   <P/> Of course, we immediately went to the closest Bank of America to see what on earth was going on with this particular account mentioned above.  <P/> 
The Bank of America Manager found out that it was a Credit Card issued back in the early  XX/XX/XXXX  through my husbands company which has been CLOSED since XX/XX/XXXX . They indicated that    the last payment wa s XX/XX/XXXX . The  Credit Card was through the company which was also a LLC. My husbands name was the ONLY name on the Credit Card. Not mine.  <P/> The monies that were withdrawn is also mine. Th e Checking Account is also a JOINT Acc ount.  XXXX  Bank of America fraudulently withdrawn monies out of a   JOINT Checking Account  XXXX   XXXX   Please note, there was no notice by mail or phone calls to Alert us of any problem or issues to resolve any matters with Bank of America.
<P/>  There needs to b  e ACTION taken against Bank of America.
<P/>  My husband and I are retired and only get a small amount per month through social security. This Sale of t  he Property was to be a small cushion of security which was taken away from us like a thief in the night.
<P/>
Please let us know what ACTION must be taken so we can proceed to go further and have our monies returned to us.    <P/> Thank You.

On    XXXX  , I paid m y car payment bill through bank of America. They decided to process the payment twice. The payment was o n XX/XX/XXXX  a nd was for  XXXX  and then processed again on   X/X/2017     for  XXXX .  <P/><P/><P/> My wife and I are in the process of closing this account and are lowering the balance and monitoring it while she changes her direct deposit. O n   XXXX  ,  my wife and I verified this balance with each other before writing a check for cash at another institution. I have attached a screen shot used for this conversation we had by text verifyi ng one debit an d the remaining balance in the account. With this additional debit and another debit process the account will now be in a negative balance. In  XX/XX/XXXX  Bank of America made  a Bill paym ent for this car payment to the wrong account. Our credit card is through  XXXX  and car loan is through  XXXX  in  XX/XX/XXXX  they sent this to the wrong account though I put it in accurately on their   Bill Pay.
<P/>
At this point it is possible for my wife to be criminally charged with theft by check in Oklahoma.
<P/>
Bank of America may be retaliating for a series of complaints detailing their harassment of us for filing complaints.

Consumer complaint narrative: On Thursday   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     I contacted Bank of America ( " the bank '' ) to find out why my principal balance differed from what I was told it was going to be when I signed the documents at the dealership because all the guy could see was what was entered into the system. I was told to contact the dealer to find out. I called the dealer, but was unable to reach anyone. Then, I called the bank back to see if I could get a better response.  Low  and behold I was able to reach a nice lady who took time out of her busy day to help me get to the bottom of things. She was able to locate my loan documents and agreed that the loan document indicated that my balance should have been lower than what they had in the system. She told me she was going to submit a research request to get it all straightened out. She gave me a confirmation number and told me that someone may reach out to me if they had any questions or needed further information. After I got off the phone with the bank, the dealership called me back. Since the lady at the bank told me that she was working on a resolution, I told the dealership that and they went ahead and considered the issue being handled. The following day ( Friday   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     ), I received a phone call from a rep at the bank, but we ended up playing phone tag and never had a chance to connect. On Monday    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   I received a letter from the bank informing me that they had been trying to reach me, but they were unsuccessful and I needed to contact them to get the issue resolved. I called them back on Tuesday   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX       at which time I was told that I needed to contact the dealership to get the issue resolved. I contacted the dealership again to no avail. The issue is a lack of assistance in getting a disclosure discrepancy resolved. I signed a security agreement agreeing to pay the stated principal balance and that is what I want to pay. No additional fees, no less than the agreed upon amount. I believe that this discrepancy is a Regulation Z violation and should be handled as such.

Amount {$68000.00} / Account  XXXX  / Ba nk No.   XXXX  /  BofA  Check #  XXXX ,  XXXX  : Bank of America,  N.A.   XXXX   XXXX , Texas, Payee : The  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , Notation : Dealer Reserve  XXXX   XXXX . When we first learned that our reserve funds were no longer on deposit in the  XXXX  bank, it would not tell us where the money was -- and it took us years to find it. Our corporation is a North Carolina corporation, yet we discovered  that BofA wrongly escheated our funds to the Texas Comptroller. Compounding this error is that BofA failed to include both our last known address and our federal tax ID number, information that the Texas Property Code requires that the Texas Comptroller receive with escheated funds. The Texas Comptroller requested the omitted information, and it w as refused. The  XXXX  bank would like for our funds to be returned to it, but the Texas  Comptroller refuses to do so. Early this month Texas Asst. Attorn ey General  XXXX   XXXX  asked BofA to provide her with the omitted information, and it again refused. The fact that adults would engage in thi  s Catch 22 situation is silly because BofA might be too big to fail, but it is not above the law of either the United States or the State of Texas. The obligation to return our reserve funds lies squarely and singularly with BofA, and we have every right to insist that it pay us our funds. Then it can deal with the Texas Comptroller in an effort to recover the funds that it sent there. We no longer want to be in the middle of this circus. We submit that BofA and the Texas Comptroller have enjoyed the interest-free use of our funds for much too long already, and now we want to receive payment of our funds.
If you wish, you may consider this complaint to also be a claim against DIF for deposits unquestionably owed by BofA to T  he  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , a North Carolina corporation, and which Bank of Americ a, N.A., has declined to pay on demand. We have no obligation to chase our funds cross-country as a result of BofA having committed multiple errors, nor ought we to have to pay a host of legal expenses to recover our funds after such errors and subsequent default by BofA. BofA has the first obligation to pay us, and FDIC shares that responsibility for our insured funds.      Thanking you in advance for your interest and assistance in this matter.

Complaint relates to my Bank of Ameri ca Visa Card.    Details below.     Statement for period   X/X/17  to  X/X/17  en ded up in my  Spam folde r so I missed the payment du e  X/X/17  of { $390.00}.     The statement for per iod  X/X/17  to  X/X/17     included a {$25.00} fee + {$33.00} interest which when added to my   XX/XX/XXXX  acti vity totaled {$4400.00}. This was fully paid in   X/X/17 .      When I received the statement for pe riod  X/X/17  to  X/X/17 , my  total activity was {$16000.00} which is due   X/X/17     which I have scheduled to pay fully. However, this statement also included an interest charge of {$150.00} which they calculated on an amount of {$10000.00} at 17.74 % rate. Consumer complaint narrative:
I had an automated mortgage payment throughout the year of  XXXX , and inexplicably, the payment set for XX/XX/XXXX  did not process. I did not receive notice from the mortgage servicer until it was 30 days past due, severely impacting my previously   XXXX   XXXX  . I have statements from earlier in  XXXX  showing the automated payment was run monthly in the amount of   XXXX  . Upon learning of this, I instantly made a double payment of  XXXX  ( for  XX/XX/XXXX  and  XX/XX/XXXX  ) on  XX/XX/XXXX , and restarted the automated payment for  XX/XX/XXXX .
Interestingly,   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  , lying, useless member of the Bank of America crime family, pointed out in her reply only that I started the automated payment for  XX/XX/XXXX , refusing to acknowledge that the payment had been automated leading up to  XX/XX/XXXX , despite evidence in prior statements that it was. Interestingly,   XXXX   XXXX    conveniently did not provide the  XX/XX/XXXX  statement, which would have showed the automated payment to be in effect leading up to  XXXX , because it would have been incriminating.
When I pointed this out, she said the online banking history data was unavailable, refused to discuss it further, and said the bank would not change its position regardless, and would not provide evidence of who discontinued my payment ( I received no confirmation of discontinuation and I maintain that I did not make this change ). She kept asking if I had further questions, then refused to answer them when they were posed.
If I discontinued the payment, as they claimed in the past while refusing to provide the evidence, why not provide the evidence to me and shut me up? The required retention period of 7 years has not expired. She was unfazed and said the case was closed and she would provide no further assistance. She should be fired ( which the crime syndicate obviously wo n't do because she is aiding in covering up their misdeeds ), prohibited from working in the banking industry, and either be subject to banking industry sanctions or criminal prosecution, if applicable.
I implore the CFPB to require to Criminal Bank of America to provide the evidence I have requested, or for the CFPB to either investigate the records retention violations, or refer this matter to the OCC.

Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America has started charging our account Overdraft fees on small, one-time debit card transactions just this year, without our opting in. We have had the account since   XX/XX/XXXX , did not  opt-in for overdraft protection, and became alarmed when we were getting hit with stacked, cascading Overdraft charges since the begi nning of  XX/XX/XXXX .      Upon looking into this, we found that this is an illegal practice since   XX/XX/XXXX  - the b ank CAN NOT extend overdraft charges on debit or ATM withdrawals if they did not provide explicit, written explanation of their overdraft program, allow the customer to affirmatively consent to the program, agree to the fees, and then provide documentation of the customers written consent.     We called BOA and requested copies to show any evidence that we opted in, which they were unable to supply. The only documents we were given were a basic account opening document with not even a mention of any Overdraft protection program, let alone the legally required, separate notice outlining the program.     We called again, and were told they could not reverse our charges without our lodging a complaint.     This is very likely happening to many customers, and needs to stop, and all illegally obtained charges need to be reversed.     htt ps : //www.helpwithmybank.gov/get-answers/bank-accounts/overdraft-fees-and-protection/faq-banking-overdraft-13.html

On XXXX XXXX, 2017, I went to the local branch of Bank of America in XXXX, NJ, to make a payment on my credit card. I was told to use the Bank of America ATM located there. I inserted the money, {$730.00} in cash, and attempted to make a payment, when the machine came up with an error notice and informed me that my cash would be returned. A few seconds later, another error came up on the screen that said, '' unable to return your money ''. It then printed out a receipt with a contact number for me to call. I went up and spoke to a teller who told me the money would be found that night when the ATM was opened. I then proceeded to call the number listed and was told that there would be a credit within 48 hours to my account for this money. After 48 hours, there was still no credit. We called again and were told it would take seven days. After seven days, I still had not received the money or a credit to my account, so I again called and was informed that I would n't be getting the money back, it was n't their problem, and I was on my own. When I asked about interest fees and my credit report, I was told it was n't their problem. I called the local bank manager, and he gave me another story. He told me that the money would be credited since they found it, and they would take care of any fees associated with it, credit issues, etc. but to give him another few days for it to be done. On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call from the bank manager, XXXX, again. He told me that everything was taken care of, and the credit would appear on the account within 24 to 48 hours. I waited until Friday, XX/XX/XXXX, and the credit still had not shown up. When I called up today, XX/XX/XXXX, I  was told that I had no right to be upset or worried, and that the credit would show up, but for now, there is no timeframe for it to happen.

XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX    XXXX , Texas   XXXX     XXXX   XXXX  , 2017   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   I am an employee of   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   and a Bank of America customer, checking account numbe  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  . My employer also banks with Bank of America, according to our paper checks. I have had direct deposit for years with another bank. However, I contacted my employee earlier in the month of  XXXX  2017, to let them know that I wanted to change my direct deposit to Bank of America. They told me to expect a paper check for the current month.
I received my pay check by mail on   XXXX   XXXX   2017. I took the check to a Bank of America Branch on   XXXX   in  XXXX  to deposit in into my checking account. According to the receipt and the bank teller, I was told that they would hold the funds until  XX/XX/XXXX  the following Wednesday. I could not afford this offer. I was in a crucial financial deficit. I was about to lose my car. The lien holder of my automobile ordered me to pay a certain amount by May 30-no exceptions. I had to comply with them to keep my car. I spoke to the bank manager to no avail. To resolve this problem my option was to reverse the deposit, I had to go to my alternate bank which released the funds of the entire check ( drawn on Bank of America ) the next day.
I had a problem believing that Bank of America was holding my check which is drawn from this bank for so many days. I questioned, why are the funds on hold since it drawn from Bank of America. These funds should be verifiable and released, specifically, since I am a Bank of America customer. I also had an overdraft between {$530.00} {$580.00}. No problem, I was prepared to deposit the check to resolve the overdraft because I was going to have enough to pay my other bills.
In the meantime, n ot anticipating this problem, I made several purchases, scheduled to be processed at Bank of America. These following transactions to  XXXX  Stores - {$250.00} ; {$30.00} {$12.00} ; {$2.00} :   XXXX   - {$120.00} :  XXXX  {$48.00}. I believe all of these merchants are Bank of America customers themselves. The problem is that I figured that Bank of America would at least pay the  XXXX  transactions because they had done so before. I later made a deposit to cover it. Since Bank of America chose not to pay these items referenced above, the merchants continued to submit them, adding the {$35.00} fees per tr ansaction.
I contacted Bank of America and asked them to pay the items because they were Bank of America customers. I was informed that it was an automated decision by the processing center. Yet, the charges kept coming.
I was also concerned ; specifically, relating to the merchants who also acknowledged Bank of America as their bank for business. I contacted a manager on  XX/XX/XXXX to request that {$340.00} in overdraft fees be returned to me. Again, if the bank had paid the items, I would have paid them as the direct deposit was going to be applied. The manager did refund {$100.00}. I was grateful ; however,  the merchants continued to submit the items and Bank of America continued to charge me {$35.00} per transaction.  XX/XX/XXXX , I thought e verything was resolved.  XXXX  made an error and posted {$100.00} to my account. They sent the remaining amount of my paper check by mail. Again, because of financial deficits, I had to return to my alternate bank to cash the check.
The Bank of America system no longer reflects the  XX/XX/XXXX  transaction of the deposit applied and reversed because of an extended hold. It seems that it is my word against them. Because this was done electronically, there has to be a record of this transaction somewhere. When my deposit on  XX/XX/XXXX  was applied, the overdraft totaled, {$820.00}. Although I have small positive balance in my account, this did not have to happen if Bank of America had paid the items presented.
These items have now been returned to the merchants with additional fees. Therefore, I am requesting that Bank of America refund the amount of {$430.00}, which also includes the   XXXX   service fee is {$12.00} since my direct deposit is now in full effect.

Dear  Sir/Madam, Re : Accoun t  Number :   XXXX  This is to inform you that I 've recently pulled my credit report and noticed that there 's a collection listing from your agency on my credit report. I have never been notified of this collection action or that I owed the debt. This letter is to inform you that I would like a verification of the debt and your ability to collect this money from me.   Under the FDCPA, I have the right to request a validation of this debt. I request t  hat you prove that I am indeed the party who is contractually obligated to pay off this debt.
I hope you are aware that reporting any invalidated information to major credit bureaus may constitute defamation of character. In addition, you must also be aware that until you validate this debt, you can not continue collection activities or report this information to the credit bureaus. Non-compliance with this request may land your company in serious legal trouble with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and other state/federal agencies.
Please attach copies of the following documents : 1. Agreement with your client that authorizes you to collect on this alleged debt.
2. Agreement that bears signature of the alleged debtor where he promises to pay the original creditor.
3. Complete payment history on this account, to prove that the amount you wish to collect is accurate.
Sincerely, A Fraud item   result in identity theft  Bank of America   ( a ccounts #  XXXX  ) successfully disputed as Verification shown on my credit report file sent on    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   in writi ng form. The credit report of (   X/XX/2017  ) and  the report file number  XXXX  shows these items were deleted from my credit file. Now these items have been reinserted on my credit report.  <P/> The last credit update on    XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   which is 14 days passed from   XXXX   Verification Letter on   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   was received, I discovered the item Bank Of America #  XXXX  had been  REAPPEARING into my credit file when i check my credit report online. By LAW you are required to notify me with  in Five ( 5 ) days limits of Re-inserting a previously Deleted item under ( FCRA ) Fair Credit Reporting Act in Written Form. I did Not receive any such notification. You have VIOLATED the Fair Credit Reporting Act FCRA 611, Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] Clause ( ii ), ( Considered 9 days late from the time expired without a written form ).
<P/>
In accordance with the requirements of the FCRA as stated below, I am hereby requesting your complete compliance with any and all of the provisions : *FCRA 611, Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] *Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material.
*Certification of accuracy of information. If any information is deleted from a consumer 's file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ), the information may not reinserted in the file by the consumer reporting agency unless the person who furnishes the information certifies the information is complete and accurate.
*If any information that has been deleted from a consumer 's file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) is reinserted in the file, the consumer reporting agency shall notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing not later than 5 business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. Additional information. As part of, or in addition to, the notice under clause ( ii ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing no later than 5 business days after the reinsertion date. In responsibilities Credit Bureau is liable if fail to observe the time limits.
( I ) a statement that the disputed information has been reinserted ; ( II ) the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available, or of any furnisher of information that contacted the consumer reporting agency, in connection with the reinsertion of such information ; and ( III ) a notice that the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumer 's file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the disputed information.
<P/>
I received no such notification. This is a serious violation of the FCRA, and I reserve the right to pursue further action. Your agency may avoid such action by immediately deleting this listing from my credit report.
<P/>
If an Item Reappears : All violations of the FCRA are treated seriously and can result in a {$1000.00} fine, payable to you, should you successfully sue the offender and win in court. Sometimes merely notifying a creditor or credit bureau of a violation is enough to get the item removed.
Should an offender refuse to cooperate with you after notification of FCRA violations, and you are not willing or able to go to court, you could report the violation to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) or the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and let them pursue the matter. Make sure the offender is aware you are reporting them to one or both of these two agencies. When governmental agencies confront such problems, however, the consumer isnt eligible for the {$1000.00} statutory reward that might otherwise be payable should the matter be resolved in the consumers favor in court.

Consumer complaint narrative: On  XXXX    XXXX   My  XXXX  yr old son which is on my act. made a deposit into the Bank of America ATM of a  XXXX  check and  XXXX  cash. Immediately after the deposit he received a print out that said they have placed a block on his act due to irregular activity. He then called the # on the reciept and the teller said they have lift the freeze and told him to withdraw money to see if it would work. He then withdrew  XXXX  and thought all was well. The following day he attempt to use his card to buy a drink and it was declined b/c there is still a block on the act. Thursday night I called BOA and they transferred me to several people. I explained what happened and said I have a reciept showing the  XXXX  check +  XXXX  cash. After being on the phone for  3 h rs straight and no one could tell me why the act was closing besides there was a " cash jam ''. I wanted to know how he received a reciept for a  XXXX  deposit if it jammed, also with BOA. It takes up to 40 bills and only excepts bills it reads and and says what it reads along with having cameras. Still nothing resolved! Friday morning I went to my branch and brought the  two  receipts. After being there for over  2  hours. All they could do is give me the  # s I  have already contacted. They also said they have had several complaints with that particular ATM. and it was weird I have a reciept with the money in question, but they still closed the act. They suggest filling another complaint, so I did. They said come back to the bank on the following We 'd  XXXX  and they will have more info. When I showed up on Wed all the bank manager could do is give me another # to make another complaint, she also said they have sent a cashiers check of  XXXX  on  XXXX . This will be the 3 complaints with the risk dept, ATM service, claims dept. Since then I have been on hold, hung up on collectively of  5+  hrs trying to understand why they wo n't allow him to get the  XXXX  that he deposited and how can he have a reciept with the money that was deposited if it spit it out. Thanks for any help!

A Fraud item result in identity theft Bank of America  (  accounts #  XXXX  ) successfully disputed as Verification shown on my credit report file sent on   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     in writing form. The credit report of (   XXXX     ) and the report file number  XXXX  shows these items were deleted from my credit file. Now these items have been reinserted on my credit report.  <P/> The last credit update on   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     which is 14 days passed from  XXXX   Verification Letter o n   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX     was received, I discovered the item Bank Of America #  XXXX  had been REAPPEARING into my credit file when i check my credit report online. By LAW you are required to notify me within  Five ( 5 )  days limits of Re-inserting a previously Deleted item under ( FCRA ) Fair Credit Reporting Act in Written Form. I did Not receive any such notification. You have VIOLATED the Fair Credit Reporting Act FCRA  611, Pro cedure in case of disputed accurac y [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] Cl ause  ( ii ), ( C onsidered 9 days late from the time expired without a written form ).  <P/> In accordance with the requirements of the FCRA as stated below, I am hereby requesting your complete compliance with any and all of the provisions : *FCR A 611,  Procedure in case of disputed accuracy  [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] *R equirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material.   *Certification of accuracy of information. If any information is deleted from a consumer 's file pursuant to subparagraph  ( A ), the information may  not reinserted in the file by the consumer reporting agency unless the person who furnishes the information certifies the information is complete and accurate.   *If any information that has been deleted from a consumer 's file pursuant to subparagraph ( A ) is reinserted in the file, the consumer reporting agency shall notify the consumer of the reinsertion in writing not later than  5  business days after the reinsertion or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by any other means available to the agency. Additional information. As part of, or in addition to, the notice under clause  ( ii ),  a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing no later tha n 5  business days after the reinsertion date. In responsibilities Credit Bureau is liable if fail to observe the time limits.   ( I ) a statement that the disputed information has been reinserted ;  ( II  ) the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available, or of any furnisher of information that contacted the consumer reporting agency, in connection with the reinsertion of such information ; an d ( III ) a no tice that the consumer has the right to add a statement to the consumer 's file disputing the accuracy or completeness of the disputed information.  <P/> I received no such notification. This is a serious violation of the FCRA, and I reserve the right to pursue further action. Your agenc y may avoi d such action by immediately deleting this listing from my credit report.  <P/> If a n Item  Reappears : All violations of the FCRA are treated seriously and can result in a {$1000.00} fine, payable to you, should you successfully sue the offender and win in court. Sometimes merely notifying a creditor or credit bureau of a violation is enough to get the item removed.   Should an offender refuse to cooperate with you after notification of FCRA violations, and you are not willing or able to go to court, you could report the violation to the Federal Trade Commissi on ( FTC )  or the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and let them pursue the matter. Make sure the offender is aware you are reporting them to  one or both of these two  agencies. When governmental agencies confront such problems, however, the consumer isnt eligible for the {$1000.00} statutory reward that might otherwise be payable should the matter be resolved in the consumers favor in court.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have experience nothing but terrible customer service from bank of america. I was charged a  XXXX  overdraft fee for  XXXX . I withdrew funds from the ATM and did n't know :  1. They cha rge a fee for a  XXXX  negative balance.    2.  I have a savings account with over  XXXX  in it. I thought they would be able to pull the funds from my savings like they done transfers in the past.    3.  They so many confusing caveats to their website that a customer should get a  one day training just to fully utilize the online resources I called in to speak with two incom petent representatives about the fee. They tried to bait me into an argument by focusing on all the things I could have done. I did not do these things because the options were not made available. I explained to the  Manager   XXXX   th at I have a savings account that should transfer funds when theirs not enough in my checking.  XXXX  said that only applies to ACH transactions, however per the  Core Banking understanding document it states- " With Overdraft Protection, if you 're about to overdraw your account, we 'll automatically transfer available funds from   your linked savings, credit card or second eligible checking account. On ly 1 tran sfer fee charged per day. I have never had an overdraft fee before and I thought I could trust them, but if I have to deal with employees that are snide and trying to prove a point I can take my business back to  XXXX .  XXXX  makes it know that if it is a transaction about  XXXX  they will charge a fee. Bank of America does not make that fee schedule readily available. It is wrong to loan  XXXX  and get a  XXXX  return on that loan. That 's extortion. Please look at my bank history as well to see how they try to confuse customers and steal their money.

In  XXXX  I opened a bank account with Bank of America. I was looking for a loan with an internet company that said they could approve me with a loan but they needed to verify my bank and account info. They tried to make a deposit in my account but it was something fraudulent with my name on it. Bank of America closed my account and wo n't let me open another and I ca n't open one with anyone else either. I did n't do anything wrong other than try to get a loan. I contacted the company and they said that it was n't them who I was talking to and dealing with. They said that sometimes internet companies will use other companies names to give out money but there most of the time fraudulent and not the company they say they are. At this point I did n't know what else to do I did call the actual company to complain but because it was n't that company technically they could n't do anything. I also tried to explain to Bank of America that I was unaware of what happened and that I did n't do anything fraudulent but they still close the account and refused to let me open up a new  one  and now because of this I 'm flagged in some sort of banking system and I can open a bank at any Bank and this is so frustrating I need some help please.

I was shocked when I reviewed my credit report and found late payment on the dates below : 30 days past due  XXXX  I am not sure how this happened, I believe that I had made my payments to you when I received my statements. My only thought is that my monthly statement did not get to me.

I went into Bank Of America on   XXXX   XXXX  , 2017 to open a savings account. I spent over 2 hours with a banker who tried to convince me to move over retirement and business banking over to the bank once he found out I was a business owner. I placed {$100.00} in the account and then remembered I had a personal check that had been given to me. I explained to the banker that I make it a habit to never deposit personal checks in my account from non family members and that I had been meaning to stop by Bank of America to cash the check and since I was there opening an account could he have the check cashed and the funds also deposited into my account because the line had 15 people in it. I had already spent so much time with him opening the account. He had me fill out a deposit slip and stated that he 'd take care of it.
He then brought me back the receipt and set up an appointment to follow up with me on  XXXX / XXXX /2017 for other banking products.
I did'nt notice at the time that the check had been deposited into my account and not cashed as I had requested.
The next day I received a call from Bank of America stating that they were closing the Savings account. No reason given and I did inquire as to why and was given the statement that " there 's nothing wrong we just choose not to do business with you ''. I thought this was strange because I have several accounts at different banks and credit unions all in good standing.
I received a check in the mail from Bank of America a week later for {$88.00}. {$12.00} less than my initial cash deposit because the check had not cleared. So in essence I was penalized for a check that I asked the banker to cash. Then to add insult to injury I find out a month later that I have been put in   XXXX   XXXX   for closure of account due to unpaid charges from Bank of America.
I go back to the local branch of Bank of America on   XXXX   XXXX  , 2017 due to   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   notifying me that I 'm in   XXXX   XXXX   and unable to open an account so I can apply for a Private Student Loan for my daughter. I speak to the bank manager who stated it was his first day in the branch and that I would need to call the RIsk Department because he would have no authority to assist me with the issue.
I then call the Risk Department of BOA and they tell me that I 'm not in   XXXX   XXXX   and they 're not sure where that information could be coming from.
So I call   XXXX   XXXX   and they tell me that I am indeed in   XXXX   XXXX    and that I need to dispute the information. I place a dispute and call BOA back. When I call the bank back I am again told that they did n't send anything to   XXXX   XXXX  . I explain that I just got off the phone with   XXXX   XXXX   and they are showing information in their system for unpaid charges. I also explain I have never had a banking relationship with BOA other than the savings account that was open on   XXXX   XXXX   and consequently closed on   XXXX   XXXX  . I have no unpaid charges and there was no valid reason for them to place my name in   XXXX   XXXX  . The representative gets a supervisor they look over the account and she comes back and states that it appears its an error and it will be cleared up within 10 days. She apologizes for the inconvenience assures me it will be taken care of. I also inquired as to whether the check that did n't clear had any bearing on the reason for the account closure and was told there would n't have been any issues if this check had cleared. So I assumed this was a way of telling me without stating the check was the real reason for the account closure.
Then on   XXXX   XXXX  , 2017, I receive a letter dated   XXXX   XXXX  , 2017 stating the closure of the account was valid and that they would not be removing me from   XXXX   XXXX  . I have done nothing to warrant my name being placed in   XXXX   XXXX   and need this information removed immediately. If the banker would have followed my instructions the check would have never been placed in the account.
This is causing me harm as I am in the process of getting a private student loan for my daughter and ca n't proceed until this is cleared. I am also trying to secure a new Merchant Account for my business and may not be able to do so due to this information.
I have also reached out to the person who wrote me the check and BOA has done no adverse action against them except for a {$35.00} charge for a returned check.

Ladies and Gentlemen : I write because Bank of America 's automated systems reported my automobile loan as being 30 days overdue, when in fact I had submitted a timely payment but inadvertently underpaid as a result of information provided to me by the company 's online payment tool. I phoned the bank 's customer service office but was summarily rebuffed. While I would not object to paying a modest late fee over the miscommunication, the bank 's action has damaged my creditworthiness despite my spotless payment record and good-faith attempt to fulfill my obligations under the loan. The details of the incident : 1. I have maintained an impeccable record of monthly payments on this note since the loan was opened. See Exhibit A ( attached ). It underscores my record of regular payments and highlights an unusual quirk of the Bank of America online payment tool : Our country 's second largest bank maintains an online system that does not allow payments to be scheduled or posted on weekend days.
<P/>
2. Since the loan was issued, I frequently have paid more than the minimum required amount ; that is, made additional principal payments. As you will see from the printouts in Exhibit B, the bank does not merely credit the additional payment against the remaining principal amount, it changes the minimum monthly payment from month to month accordingly.
<P/>
3. Late in   XXXX   of this year, I went online to schedule my payment for  XXXX . On my account page, both the payment due date and payment amount fields indicated " N/A. '' I assumed that, because I had been paying rather more than the required minimums, and the minimums varied from month to month, that no payment was required for  XXXX . Nevertheless, I scheduled a payment of {$400.00} anyway.
<P/>
4. A month later, when I went online to make my next payment, my account summary indicated a " late charge '' of {$7.00}, and a total payment due of {$1200.00} ( Exhibit B1 ). I ascribed the late charge to the previous payment 's not having posted until XX/XX/XXXX  and, while a minor annoyance, thought nothing more of it under the circumstances : The previous month, my summary page had indicated " N/A '' for the amount due, and I had nevertheless submitted a {$400.00} payment. When I drilled down on the website, I saw that my previous month 's payment had posted ( even though it was n't reflected on the account summary page ), and proceeded to schedule the next payment to more than cover the difference between the indicated payment due and the {$400.00} payment that I had made the previous month. Subsequent monthly summaries ( again, see Exhibit B ) showed no late fees of any kind and once again reflected varying minimum payment amounts that were in line with the norm. I never received any unusual notification or indication of a problem of any kind from Bank of America.
<P/>
5. I was appalled when, a few weeks later, my credit monitoring service notified me of " potentially derogatory information '' having been posted in my files with the  XXXX  major credit reporting agencies. Upon investigation, I discovered that Bank of America had reported my account as being 30 days past due. I called the customer service phone number provided on the bank 's website, and was connected to a spectacularly unhelpful customer service agent.
<P/>
The young woman with whom I spoke informed me that the late charge was not, in fact, a function of of any payment that did n't post prior to the first of the month, but rather that my account was " delinquent '' because I had not submitted the " full amount due '' prior to the end of the month of  XXXX . She further advised that the bank 's payment processing systems " automatically '' report delinquent accounts to the  XXXX  bureaus, informed me that I should have known from my online statements that I had not made the required payment, and that the bank does not offer " courtesy '' removal of delinquency flags. I pointed out that the statements showed only that a payment had been made, and that the bank 's own website had shown " N/A '' in the payment due field, yet I had acted in good faith and submitted a payment anyway. I also noted that an inadvertent underpayment, made in good faith and based on information that the bank had given me, is a very, very different thing than being 30 days overdue. I stated that I was not seeking " courtesy '' redress, but rather correction of automated reporting that would have a material and deleterious impact on my FICO score, as a result of what the bank 's website had led me to conclude. She, in turn, responded that " there 's no way for our IT department to reconstruct what the site showed on the day you scheduled your payment, '' and therefore I was responsible for the underpayment, and the fact of the total amount actually due was not submitted by the end of the month ( a little over {$100.00}, on a {$25000.00} car loan account with a spotless payment record ) was the same as being 30 days past due. After it became clear that we were talking in circles, I terminated the call.
<P/>
6. I have reported the matter to  XXXX ,  XXXX  and  XXXX , but there are two issue involved here that warrant CFPB 's investigation : a. I am not optimistic that the credit bureaus will look beyond the letter of the law, and it is the essence of a bank 's ability to get away with this sort of behavior that cries out for redress. If it is legal for the bank to behave this way, then I likely will get no relief from the credit monitoring firms.
<P/>
b. This incident speaks to the deliberate ways in which very large financial institutions victimize consumers in order to boost fees and miscellaneous charges ( from which, it is my understanding, these banks reap literally billions of dollars in additional revenue each year ). Specifically, Bank of America 's action did far more than result in my being charged a few extra dollars in fees -- It has had a material and deleterious effect on my credit profile, despite my good faith efforts to fulfill all of may obligations.
<P/>
While the imposition of a late fee is an annoyance, it is n't materially harmful. But in its zeal to harvest such fees, Bank of America acted in bad faith in this case : The bank 's own website provided information that led me to believe that I had no minimum payment due, yet I submitted a timely payment anyway. Had I been informed that there was an underpayment ( beyond merely a statement that showed the amount I already had submitted with no other indication of a problem ), I easily could have made an additional online payment right away ( Here again, we have at issue a pittance -- $ 100-odd, that I easily and happily would have sent as a supplemental payment had I known ).
<P/>
Such an inadvertent underpayment, made in good faith and directly in response to account information shown on the bank 's own website, is a very far cry from being 30 days overdue on a scheduled payment. I am hard pressed to see the reasonableness of the bank 's being able to experience IT failures in its online payment system, then to fail to provide a customer with an appropriate notification ( Every other financial institution with which I work sends an email or text if a payment is not posted by a specific date, yet somehow our country 's second-largest bank does not ), and then to refuse to remove a delinquency flag once the relevant facts have been brought to its attention by a customer with an unblemished payment record.
<P/>
On a macro level, the banks ( including Bank of America ) may be seeking mainly to find ways to generate billions in collective fees and charges. On a micro level, however, the fee is a trivial thing for me compared to the bank 's making it appear to the wider world that I was delinquent or otherwise cavalier regarding the maintenance of my account.
<P/>
By way of redress, I seek no financial adjustment of any kind. I ask only that Bank of America show the same degree of good faith that I have shown throughout the life of this automobile loan, and correct my record with the three leading credit reporting firms. My actions were based on information provided by the bank ; the matter could have been resolved easily within the month of  XXXX  had the bank but notified me ; and the bank representative 's arbitrary and capricious refusal to elevate my complaint to more senior level managers who could have reviewed the facts in evidence smacks of bad faith and a predatory culture on the part of Bank of America. I ask for your assistance in rectifying the situation in accordance with a " common-man '' standard of reasonableness and good faith.
<P/>
Thank you for your attention to my case. Please advise if you require any additional information or documentation.

Consumer complaint narrative: on Monday  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX   I made a  XXXX   XXXX  wire transfer payment in the amount of {$210.00} to FIA card services. That payment was never credited to my account. ( I made a pay by phone payment Wednesday  XXXX   XXXX  after my payment was due. ) When I called to ask about the payment I made through  XXXX   XXXX  on Monday, I was told by customer service that even though it was considered the " money in minutes '' transfer it could still take up to 3 days to post to my account. In turn I incurred a late fee. I talked to FIA card services  XXXX ,  XXXX ,  XXXX ,  XXXX . I was then informed that an investigation would be opened and that I would receive a letter in the mail.   In the letter that I received there is a fax number to send correspondence. I faxed all of my documentation on Weds  XXXX  with a fax confirmation. Including the sequence/ confirmation number that I was given from  XXXX   XXXX   confirming  that the payment had been received by FIA card services.   - My name is correct on the payment, my acct # is correct, and FIA card Services information is all correct on the wire transfer. There are No errors.   When I called FIA card services again on  XXXX  I was informed that the process could take up to  10  business days and to follow up after  6/9.      I called FIA card services again on  XXXX  and the representative did n't even understand what I was talking about because he could see my pay by phone payment that was made on the  XXXX . I am still trying to receive the credit for the {$210.00} that was paid through  XXXX   XXXX . I have re-faxed all of my proof of documentation several times and customer service has been basically useless.   The last advice I was given was to call the number on the letter I received. I was calling that number then! Meanwhile my credit card still is not showing this payment and I am still incurring a late fee.   I have never in my life had such an issue with any company such as this. I have also never attempted to pay  XXXX   XXXX . I am at a loss.   I ca n't get the funds back from  XXXX   XXXX  because they are confirming the funds were received by FIA card services.   I ca n't get through to FIA card services because no one knows what the heck is going on.   Let me be clear that this issue is NOT regarding a pay by phone payment. It is regarding a wire transfer payment that has NOT been credited to my account since  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX  .   Please help.

AKA " MONEY MULE '' FRAUD. The money order was explained and proved to be in court a fraudulent money order, that I was the victim of a   XXXX   XXXX    Job and was given false instructions as a scam job victim. Being the victim of a scam job, and unaware I cashed the money order and was found to be responsible in court for the money order.
The judge ruled in favor of Bank of America, and gave them the judgement of my savings account in the amount of {$400.00} and a closure of my account. Until further notice. Stated I no longer owed them any money and that I would be able to establish an account at a later date.
I have not been able to reopen a account with Bank of America since  XX/XX/XXXX . As this is not correct as the representative in court stated that I would be able to reestablish a Bank of America account at a later date.

I have my checking account with Bank of America.     I have a payday app on my phone called  XXXX . I use this app when I need more money.      XXXX  on my phone has to basically dial in to my checking account and pull banking information such as direct deposit, ACH of funds and Current Balances. In  XXXX , I had filed a claim in the amount of {$200.00} and was issued a temporary credit of {$200.00}. The claim was recently denied and the {$200.00} was taken back out of my account on XX/XX/XXXX  which caused my account to go negative. I deposited cash into my account to make it a positive balance. Yesterday,  XX/XX/XXXX , the bank withdrew fees of {$100.00} which again made the account go negative and cause another NSF fee of {$35.00} to be withdrawn in addition to the {$100.00}. I had filed a CFPB complaint on  XX/XX/XXXX  in regards to the bank not properly disclosing a change in process regarding fees. The complaint number was  XXXX . These {$100.00} fees from  XXXX  were in relation to that same scenario which previously got corrected by the bank in  XXXX . I contacted the bank this morning and spoke with someone in claims who said they were n't the right department so they transferred me to collections, who of course was n't correct. I called on my lunch and spoke with the general customer service who said they would have to transfer me back to claims. Again, they said they could n't help me. I am asking that these fees be refunded back to me in order to put my account back into the positive status that it was prior to them being taken out. I have been a customer of this bank for 20 years and the level of customer service is horrible now compared to what it used to be. I even recently had fraud on my debit card which I know is increasing from every bank, but the customer service I received at the branch when trying to obtain a temporary bank card ( which I never got ), was ridiculous. They told me they were too busy and that I 'd need to make an appointment, but that if I could just wait a few days my card would come. I 've seriously considered small town banking again.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In   XXXX   of this year (2017) I was the subject of a fraudulent scheme - perpetuated through  XXXX .  I needed a short term apartment rental in   XXXX   XXXX  , CA (for work) and I found one through   XXXX  .  I communicated with the supposed agent and signed a lease.  I transferred $ XXXX  from my Bank of America account to another BoA account provided by the fraudulent agent.

An hour after the transfer, when I had not heard back from the Real Estate Agent, I contacted Bank of America and asked them to stop the wire transfer.  Two things happened while on that call:

1. They confirmed that the wire transfer had NOT yet concluded but refused to stop it fro going through.

2. The BoA agent - His name was  XXXX  I think (in their fraud team) told me "Sir I am sorry - but it looks like you have been the subject of a fraud.  When I asked him how he could be sure, he said "We've had other bank customers complain in the past that they transferred money into this same account and did not receive the service for which they were paying".  

In other words; Bank of America knew or at least had knowledge of previous fraudulent activity on the account but still did not warn me (a 20 year customer with BoA) in advance of the transfer.  The bank simply allowed me to throw my good money into what they knew was a suspect account.

I contacted the bank on several occasions about this.  I even asked to file an Enterprise Complaint , but they basically told me that the error was mine and they closed my inquiry / compliant with "Customer Error".

I acknowledge that I initiated the wire transfer.  But my bank of 20 years did nothing to warn me that I was transferring money into a suspect account.  And then, when I opened an inquiry - they placated me on the phone with a bunch of "I am so Sorry" statements and promptly closed the complaint and assigned the fault to me.

These circumstances required me to depend on my credit card use to make ends meet therefore producing a substantial debt that was difficult and almost impossible to maintain.   I contacted Bank of America on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  and explained my circumstances to a representative named  XXXX  and asked if I could enroll in a hardship payment program.   She connected me to  XXXX   XXXX  who told me that my payments were current and I could not be placed on a program and instructed me to call back in  one  month to see if I would qualify for another program.   I contacted Bank of America on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  and spoke to  XXXX   XXXX  and explained my situation and she told me that my payments were current and that I did not qualify for a program. I asked how could I qualify and she told me that I would have to default on three consecutive payments to be considered for a program.   So as  XXXX   XXXX  instructed me I made no payments on  three  consecutive payments months and then was contacted on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  by letter from the  XXXX   XXXX    XXXX   by  XXXX   XXXX  stating this is an important matter that I need to discuss with he and to contact her as soon as possible. I immediately tried to contact by the phone number she provided and her email address numerous times through  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  with no response from her. On  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  I contacted  XXXX   XXXX  and asked her if I would qualify for the hardship pay-down program. She took all my income and expenses in hopes that since T had missed numerous payments as instructed by Bank of america representatives that I would get some help. But  2  weeks later " I '' called back to see what the statis was and was told I did not qualify because the program would only lower my monthly minimum {$20.00} but lower my a.p.r. considerably but still I did not qualify because my income was too low.   I have had numerous correspondence trying to get some help but it seems to me that I have been getting the runaround and had also contacted a debt consolidation company recommended by Bank of America who told me that I did not qualify for their program because I have a monthly surplus of income?   They also withdrew " set back '' {$1700.00} from my checking account to cover past due missed payments with out my authorization.   I am at my wits end and would greatly appreciate your help for I do not want to declare bankruptcy and sine this occurred my credit rating has been devastated from a rating of  XXXX  to  XXXX .
