Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the living party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is PROOF of contractual obligation proving my obligations to perform or comply, that is binding on me to pay this debt. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request ( demand ) for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent tangible evidence that I have any legal/lawful obligation to pay you > or company. At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the  XXXX  major credit bureaus (  XXXX ,  XXXX ,   XXXX   XXXX   ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character, & information breach, using fictitious names, reporting false information, punative, and what ever codes and laws that are applicable!. I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, ( which it already has ). I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond with clarity to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. This also includes not contracting with other credit reporting companies or debt collectors using means of extortion in attempt to collect something that was never due. There is also the matter of information breach which   XXXX   puts me at risk currently, It would be advisable that you and your client assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION Please provide the following : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the creditor. Any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account. Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. Name and address of alleged creditor. Name on file of alleged debtor. Alleged account number.
Address on file for alleged debtor. Amount of alleged debt. Date this alleged debt became payable. Date of original charge off or delinquency. Verification that this deb was assigned or sold to collector. Complete accounting of alleged debt. purchase price for information from alleged creditor*, Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful. Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTION AGENCY in case legal action becomes necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Memorandum in support A misrepresentation is an assertion that is not in accord with the truth. When a person enters a contract because of his justifiable reliance on a misrepresentation about some important fact, the contract is voidable.
Misrepresentations can be either : 1. innocent ( not intentionally deceptive ) or 2.
fraudulent ( made with the knowledge of falsity and intent to deceive ). Contracts induced by misrepresentation or fraud are generally considered voidable. This means that the person whose consent was not real has the power to rescind ( cancel ) the contract. The elements of misrepresentation and fraud are as follows - notice the similarities. ( authors addition ) Innocent misrepresentation Fraud 1. Untrue assertion of fact ( or equivalent ) 2.
Assertion relates to material fact 3. Actual reliance 4. Justifiable reliance 1. Untrue assertion of fact ( or equivalent ) 2. Assertion made with knowledge of falsity and intent to deceive 3.
Actual reliance 4. Justifiable reliance 5. Economic loss ( in a tort action for damages PARTS OF A LAWFUL CONTRACT 1. Parties competent to contract The parties to a contract should be competent, being of the age of consent, of sound mind, not disqualified from contracting by any law to which s/he is subject. A flaw in capacity may be due to minority, lunacy, idiocy, drunkenness or kind. The parties should be of like kind, being either artificial Legal Entity and artificial Legal Entity, or living Man/Woman and living Man/Woman, allowing more than two parties but never a mixture of these kinds. 2. Free and genuine consent The consent of the parties to the agreement must be free and genuine. The consent of the parties should not be obtained by misrepresentation, fraud, undue influence, coercion or mistake. If the consent is obtained by any of these means, then the contract is not valid or lawfully enforceable. 3. Full disclosure When negotiating a contract, full disclosure is the act of providing all material information, or telling the whole truth, about any matter which may influence the decision-making of the other party or parties before they decide to enter into a contract. 4. Sufficient consideration The consideration is something of value possessed by the parties that is brought to the contract table. This something of value is bargained for and given in exchange for a promise or a performance.
The parties must each receive a benefit and each suffer a detriment. To be enforceable, a contract must have sufficient consideration. A contract is unenforceable if it has insufficient or unequal consideration without agreement. 5. Certainty of terms The Terms and Conditions of the contract must be fully disclosed and agreed upon, and must be certain and fixed, i.e. not variable as with interest rates. 6. Meeting of the minds A meeting of the minds consensus ad idem, occurs between the parties when they recognise each other, understand their mutual obligations, and agree. This meeting of minds can only occur between like kinds, being Legal Entity with Legal Entity, or Man/Woman with Man/Woman.
A corporation and another corporation may enter into contract by way of accommodation parties, and a sentient being and another sentient being may enter into a contract directly, but a corporation and a sentient being together can not enter into a contract as they are notof the same and equal kind. 7. Signatures or autographs Written contracts between Legal Entity actors must carry the wet ink signatures of the parties, each wet ink signature being anaccommodation from a Man/Woman. Written contracts between living Men/Women must carry the wet ink autographs of the parties, and/or living identification such as a thumbprint.
Living standing is recognised by a thumbprint, or more often by an unambiguous declaration with the autograph, such as authorised agent written below. 8. Privity of contract A contract exists only between the parties. No third-party can obtain rights contained within a contract, or buy or sell a contract, without the express permission of the original parties.

They responded in the affirmative. After applying, they informed me that they had to send the request to their office for further review, which would have involved an additional credit inquiry. Since they already put a hard hit on my credit report, without a response, I asked to speak to a manager. When a manager finally called back 4 days later, she refused to remove the credit inquiry hit. The manager was condescending, arrogant, and completely unhelpful. If you want to deal with these people, know what you are in for. Dishonest, deceitful, arrogant, condescending. Not what I call good customer service.

I signed up with a service called XXXX XXXX and linked my Bank of America account to it so that I can cash out on my paycheck early instead of waiting for payday. This requires that my account maintain a positive balance in order for them to send money to the Bank of America account. Bank of America has not maintained an active communication with XXXX XXXX to show the realtime balance in my account. As a result I am not able to cash out with XXXX XXXX and am limited in my ability to pay for things I need to survive. I need Bank of America to actively participate with XXXX XXXX so that I am not handicapped when my personal account is low in balance.

Bank of America allowed someone to access my credit reports with XXXX and XXXX earlier this year. I never authorized it and have no idea who they gave my personal information to. Now I 've had identity thieves steal credit cards and insert addresses into my report so they can use my accounts history for their own gain. It is likely that BOA is the source that has allowed these criminals to act using my credentials. BOA called me about the fraud and said they would remove the inquiries from both credit reports. They never did. I asked XXXX and they confirmed, so they removed them quickly. XXXX failed to properly investigate my dispute and it remains, hurting my credit score. <P/>I 'm angered that BOA is so cavalier about endangering my critical financial information and that it ca n't even be bothered to remove the inquiry from my reports.

Consumer complaint narrative: My credit card just renewed, XXXX XXXX. The old card was on file with the XXXX XXXX XXXX. The new card was charged by the XXXX for a subscription I did not want. I checked my XXXX account and found they had an updated credit card info, i.e. new expiration date. I never gave them that info. The only other source is the card issuer, Bank of America. At the very least I should have been notified of this. I would like all future charges from XXXX stopped. The original charge back inXX/XX/XXXXwas an error. I called XXXX and was told it could not be canceled because of an automatic system. I decided to not pursue the matter it was only {$28.00}. Now the charge was made again with the new card.

On the evening of XXXX XXXX, 2017 my account went into a negative {$880000.00} because of a hold of {$880000.00}. I was not able to access my account and both of my cards have been deemed invalid. When calling customer service they could not help me. I called risk management and they could not give me any information other than Bank of America has decided to close the accounts. Both my personal and business account. This hold was from the bank itself not someone stealing my identity.

I lease a XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I asked Bank of America for a car loan on XX/XX/XXXX which was approved by them. Last month on XX/XX/XXXX I went to the DMV to put the XXXX under my name when they gave me the news that in order to put the XXXX under my name I have to pay the use tax fee of {$3600.00}. I went to the bank and asked why the use tax fee were not pay or why they were not part of the loan. XXXX ( person who helped me approved the loan ) told me to call XXXX XXXX and asked them about the title. I called them & they told me in XXXX that Bank of America was now responsible about the title and the fees. I went again & told XXXX what XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX told me. As I was handed the forms by XXXX to sign about the loan, I signed a form NOTICE TO PROVIDE FIRST SECURITY INTEREST without being notify by XXXX that I was going to be " responsible to pay all taxes assessed on the vehicle. '' In order to put the XXXX under my name & for me to pay the use taxes, he told me & offer me to Increase my credit on a credit card that I have from Bank of America in order to pay the taxes without paying interest until next year.

Checking account with Bank of America. Continued to allow withdrawals on my checking account that were not authorized, which caused numerous additional charges to my account. I went to the bank and was unable to resolve the situation after waiting 2 hours, with an appointment. I withdrew all my money and they would not allow me to close account. Now they sent a letter saying my account is closed and I owe {$600.00}. Then they mailed me a new debit card? I had to go to another bank. This is going to end up going on my credit report as a not paid account.

She said to go into a branch and she would tell me what to do. Went to XXXX XXXX. branch Kept me waiting for 15 minutes with no one at customer service ask for manager XXXX XXXX to call XXXX. XXXX called XXXX again did not call back would correct the problem. XXXX XXXX no longer at that position referred to XXXX she would take care of the problem and credit money needs POA would let me no were to fax. Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America will not stop harassing me with phone calls, even though I have told them to stop and they can see we 've made the payment on our travel trailer. These are robocalls. You say hello and no one is be replies for a few seconds. We scheduled our payment ON THEIR WEBSITE for a future date. They STILL call. This month, they called XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. Several of these days, they called 4 and 5 times a day. If I answer, and I 've grown weary and tired of explaining the same thing over and over, they still can not get it through their heads that we scheduled the payment. There was one female who was very nice and even offered to credit a late fee they had charged this month, which tells me the calls should have stopped then, but they did not. They restarted the next day! I suspect this is a hired outside company, because they say they have no access to BOA systems? This makes it all the more egregious. It is upsetting and stressful. They need to STOP.

They also stated and a quote : On XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America exercised its Right of Setoff by using the {$25.00} balance recovered from your savings account ending in XXXX and the {$100.00} balance recovered from your checking account ending in XXXX, to offset part of the {$290.00} outstanding balance on your MyAccess Checking account ending in XXXX. The outstanding balance remaining on this account is {$160.00}.
Another lie from Bank of America, as stated in their own written words : We have confirmed that as of the date of this letter, your checking account ending in XXXX was accurately reported to XXXX XXXX The date of the letter was XX/XX/XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX, the balance Bank of America reported to XXXX XXXX was paid in full in the amount of {$290.00}, as reported by XXXX XXXX. Yet in Bank of Americas on written words the balance was {$160.00}. Bank of America owes me {$120.00} for an over payment of the account as Bank of America reported to CFPB and to XXXX XXXX.
Proof of Payment to XXXX XXXX with deliver confirmation attached.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Long story short I made a purchase and did not get what I paid for. I submitted a complaint for reimbursement of funds through Bank of America. I asked to speak to someone in charge of the disputes department, and got ignored.I was asked to submit a claim for my dispute. I submit everything they asked for on X/XX/17, and I was denied my refund because Bank of America told me, " We understand that you were n't satisfied with the outcome of the service the merchant provided, but they have the right to receive payment for any services that were rendered. '' It was not a matter of not being satisified. It was a matter of not getting what I paid for. What if you were charged for something for a service that you did not get in full? Would n't you want some kind of refund?
<P/>You would n't let yourself be scammed by a company so why should I be scammed? I put in another claim and was called by the manager, and once again I followed directions. I submitted my proofs. The manager even told me yes I want to help you, call me, etc. I submitted the claim again, called like I was instructed to, was ignored, and given a claim denial letter on XX/XX/17. <P/>XXXX XXXX BANK OF AMERICA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I called Bank of America regarding a return item fee on my account. I explained that the cutoff on the ATM machines state the business day is over at XXXX XXXX local time and I thought that was across the board but the app has different information and list it as XXXX XXXX ET. I spoke to XXXX # XXXX, a supervisor who basically informed me that is was my error and it was just MY account that was not eligible for courtesy waiver even though my account has never had the issue before. I asked per policy and procedure shouldnt all accounts be treated the same? She said yes per fed regulations they had to but MY account was not getting a courtesy waiver. She basically said depending on the account, Bank of America can or can not make the decision to waive the fee. I have had a similar issue with Bank of America in the past. What criteria do they use to determine when fee waivers occur if the customer is at fault? What makes my call to BOA for courtesy waiver different than another customer who calls in and misses the deposit cutoff time and request a waiver? I would like that information from BOA as well as the {$35.00} fee waived if it can not be provided, because all customers are not being treated equal. What is the basis of the unequal treatment is it gender, race, religion, geographic location? I would understand if there was a policy in place and no one received it, but to just say no when I have never asked or had this issue before is ridiculous without a reasonable explanation when it is something that is offered to some customers. They need to provide data showing the race/gender of customers that are offered fee waivers. Would that data be skewed? Does it favor particular groups?

On XXXX XXXX 2017, I opened a business account with Bank of America. Initially, everything was going fine. They sent me a welcome email on XXXX XXXX 2017 and they let me know that my business debit card was coming in the mail. On XXXX XXXX 2017, I tried to activate my new business debit card and it said the card could not be found. I spoke with a customer service representative and they told me that my account was closed. I asked why it was closed and all she would say is that " it was a business decision. '' I asked to speak to her superior and she told me that I could but they would tell me the same thing. When I spoke to her superior, I was told again that my account was closed and she did n't have to give me a reason why the account was closed but it was on page 2 of my contract stating that they could close the account at any time. I told her I 've never received any contract and I could not find any information stating this information. I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau on the same day. On XXXX XXXX 2017, I received a call from XXXX XXXX and he stated he was with the Complaints Department with Bank of America and he received my complaint from the Better Business Bureau and he wanted to know what happened. I told him what happened but something about this guy did n't sound right with me. He told me that he would look into the matter and get back to me as to why the account was closed. What I could n't understand was he was able to pull up my information in his computer yet he could n't see why the account was closed? I grew more suspicious of XXXX XXXX and thought this guy is going to come up with some sort of lie as to why the account was closed which to this day, there 's no reason for at all. The next day, I received a packet in the mail from Bank of America welcoming me to their bank and issued my bank account number. I called XXXX XXXX and told him that the customer service representative on the phone expressed to me that I would not be receiving this packet in the mail because the account was closed, yet I received it. All this guy could tell me was it was already sent off and they can not control when the packet would arrive at my house but he would get back to me no later than XXXX XXXX 2017 which he said was on a Monday. When I looked at the calendar, it falls on a Saturday. These people are going around the world and back to come up with a lie as to why they closed the account and no one ever gave me an honest answer. I 've since learned through reading complaints about Bank of America that this has happened before where they 've closed people 's accounts for no reason.

I have tried to get the 3 companies to look at the charge off documents and told of the IT and gave them all of the particulars, as stated here. Consumer complaint narrative: Despite an account being closed for over a decade, Bank of America is reporting a CURRENT foreclosure for the month of XX/XX/XXXX on my credit reports at the XXXX, XXXX and XXXX consumer reporting agencies. Said entry - under account number XXXX - had a negative date of last activity of XX/XX/XXXX. When disputed to the credit reporting agencies, the account was not deleted, but updated to a CURRENT foreclosure status, severely impacting my credit worthiness. The negative account is over ten years old and must be removed from my credit report.

Problem : Bank of America ( BOA ) accessed my account without my authorization via a system override to create a pay to account to pay themselves. I noticed this when I received an Email stating : " a pay to account has been set up for account xxxx ... If you did not create this pay to account please contact us. '' I do not use the bill pay system at BOA to pay my credit card. I pay my credit card balance in full ever month ( sometimes twice ). I use the balance transfer process to pay my balance for this credit card. I felt violated that BOA misused my financial information for their benefit - without my authorization. When I contacted BOA to get it addressed I was told that " I created the pay to account. '' To which I advised that I did not, and requested that the representative check the records to validate payment process used to pay the card every month. I further noted that I did receive an Email from BOA to contact them in the event that I did not create this pay to account - and was following the guidance of the Email by contacting them and making them aware of the problem. I requested a supervisor and was given the XXXX XXXX in the XXXX PA office, who agreed - this was a misuse of my financial information for their benefit, and should not have occurred without my authorization. She then warm transferred me to a Online Banking representative ( XXXX, Lastname unknown ) who advised that a " system override '' was used by BOA to authorize them to access my account to create this pay to account on my behalf - confirming this was not done by me - the customer but by BOA. I feel like BOA has taken advantage of my trust in creating a direct route to access my financial resources to pay themselves. The account has never been past due and I have always paid my balance on time and in full. Customers should be aware that this is happening. If they can access your account to set a payment account for themselves, whats to stop them from creating a system override to filter money from your account. This is wrong, it is an unauthorized misuse of my information. They should not have the right to go into my account to make this change. This leads me to believe that my account information is not protected from BOA employees. For the purposes of this complaint the manager in XXXX PA and the online banking representative was very helpful. Please redact their names for publishing purposes so they are not retaliated against by BOA. Their names were provided to benefit the investigation. I did ask for a policy, procedure or other documentation where BOA has notified customers that they can make this type of change, and was advised there was no such documentation. I also asked for a customer inquiry, reference, or other tracking number to document the call today, and was advised that there was no such reference number. ( Which is why the manager in PA provided her name. )

I CALL THERE RECOVERY NUMBER SPOKE WITH XXXX  AND SHE SAID I DO N'T OWE ANY MONEY THE BALANCE WAS ADDED TO MY BANKRUPTCY. I ASK IT I CAN GET A LETTER SHOWING I DO N'T OWE NO FEE 'S IN IT WAS ADDED TO MY BANKRUPTCY SO I CAN CLEAR MY NAME WITH XXXX XXXX AND OPEN A BANK ACCOUNT I WAS TOLD NO. XXXX/XXXX/17 -- Called Bank of America ( after receiving MANY calls -- -at least 3x per day and a letter in the mail ) to negotiate the debt I owed. Told the customer service agent that I only wanted to be contacted via written communication and no more calls. They wanted to negotiate MY debt based on my fiance 's income which I said no. They pushed for me to provide information on his social security number as well as income. I still said no. They sent my call to an agency that works to negotiate debts down and I had to speak to them even though I did n't want to. I declined their offer also. Since that call I have received COUNTLESS calls per day from Bank of America including voicemails. The two most recent have been XXXX XXXX at XXXX ( voicemail left ) as well as XXXX XXXX at XXXX ( voicemail left ). They also call at inconvenient hours which are disruptive to my life.

I received a letter from Bank of America in regards to my credit card on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. They indicated that I had failed to pay my bill and that they closed another card I had with them ( had that card since XXXX ) and that the card in question had been delinquent over 60 days and that they had contacted the credit bureaus. I immediately called BOA and explained to them that I never received a bill or statement. They told me what email they had sent the bill to and that email address was outdated and no longer in commission. This means they would have received an error message when emailing that address. I realize this is likely an automated process and that maybe they do n't have a process for checking for outdated email kickbacks. But when an account goes delinquent that has been in good standing for over 10 years with no late payments - One would think that they would reach out to the customer in another way. BOA had an alternate email address on file - never used it. They had my phone number on file - never called me. They had my address on file - never sent a statement or a letter ( until the one informing me they contacted the credit bureau ). I never received a statement and therefore did not know I owed anything. I rarely use this particular credit card. My history will show my balance was XXXX with activity in XXXX and XXXX - soley because I had my XXXX stolen and was waiting for a new one. I thought I had paid off the balance in XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX ) but one more charge came through. This charge was {$110.00} and that is the charge that went past due. I paid off the balance of this mess ( {$170.00} after late fees ) the day I received the letter from BOA ( XX/XX/XXXX ). My credit score dropped XXXX points because of this incident. In XXXX XXXX my credit score was XXXX and this one late payment resulted in my credit score dropping to XXXX. I have filed a dispute with Bank of America who continually promise the matter will be resolved but it never is. It has been almost 3 months now. I filed a dispute with XXXX who sent me a letter indicating that nothing could be done. I have now filed a dispute with XXXX. Two issues exist here. # 1 I never received a bill and they knew that - because the email address would have failed. They never used any other available means of contact and therefore BOA was fully aware that I never received a bill and still proceeded to file a derogatory claim against me with the credit bureau. That is just wrong. # 2 The punishment does not match the crime. I 'm XXXX years old and have had credit since my father co-signed my first car loan when I was XXXX years old. I 've had a credit card since I was XXXX ( and still have that card today ). Never once in XXXX years have I ever had a late payment or any other kind of derogatory claim against me. And yet because of one late payment my credit score drops XXXX points? From Excellent to Good?? This does not add up to me. And that is an issue with the Credit Reporting Agencies. The whole point of a credit score is to indicate your credit worthiness to creditors. Now it looks as though I have a shotty payment history when in fact that is not true. Quite the opposite. This is negatively affecting my life as we are looking to buy a new home and will be forced to pay a higher interest rate should this matter not be resolved. Over 30 years that will equal tens of thousands of dollars. All because Bank of America never thought to utilize the alternative forms of contact available to them to send me a bill for {$110.00}. And because apparently to the credit bureau - that 's a crime worth a lifetime of credit built. This is just not adding up to me. It feels wrong. This is my last resort. I truly appreciate your time.

No response ). I have been told three times that I should expect to receive the refund Saturday or today. Nope, nothing as yet. It is interesting that a bank will take your money in a matter of seconds but can not explain why it takes two weeks to return an error. XXXX told me the refund was approved today!!!!!!!!!! You can not make it up and I am just appalled that banks can sit on a {$9000.00} refund with no repercussion to them for acting so unethically and unprofessionally ... ... ... ... ... ...

Consumer complaint narrative: I was layed off from my job, applied for NJ unemployment and was given a debit card. One week it was loaded with XXXX $ and the next day it was XXXX. There were 5 charges from 500 miles away apparently done online that accumulated my entire check. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX All Done on the same date. I disputed charges and recieved provisional credit, then the money was deducted out of my account after the investigation. They found that the charges were correct. I dealt with some of the rudest people I have ever talked to in my life, there were no similar transactions or any background to lead them to believe I was not in fact telling the truth. They gave me transaction numbers, company numbers to contact, told me if I found any information that it would help my case. I spoke with supervisors, documented at XXXX XXXX, their sister company XXXX XXXX and not only did they agree with me that these charges are bogus, they could not find any of the transaction numbers to be valid, they could not find in archive me ever having, creating or supplying my card to an account or anybody affiliated with any of the above. They shared similar stories, were helpful in my concern and ideas and recommendations how to proceed. I have not been able to get in contact or recieve a return phone call recently from XXXX XXXX XXXX but i spoke with someone originally when this happened and they also could not verify a single thing. XXXX XXXX  is no longer in business or the phone number BOA gave me is no longer valid. How in any way possible BOA verified any of these charges blows my mind, they are in no way, no how possible or valid, I have since run out of unemployment, still aggressively surching the job market, married with mortgage and XXXX children at home and that 700 plus dollars means the world to me. I have been questioned ten times over was the card in my possession, could someone else in your household of used it, etc .... to the point of borderline disrespect. This now has been my second dismissal where they verified the charges. I called on X/XX/2017 at XXXX and spoke with charge companies and BOA for about an hour. They suggested re opening my claim and I did the research, called to verify my information that was gathered today at approx XXXX and amazingly they reopened, investigated and verified the claims and closed my claim again by the time I even called. I tell you what, they have a window of 90 days they said to expect a result yet they contacted the same companies that I talked to Friday that can not locate validation anywhere, they emailed, faxed or exchanged documents over the weekend about my so called charges and gathered and decided all to be valid by Monday. They must of opened the claims dept over the weekend, all 6 parties included etc ... I would not take it out of context to say BOA is playing the laws of average that if they deny X amount of claims, only a certain percentage wiill invest the time and money to fight there bogus findings. Its not my fault they are rated one of the worst for situations like this and I want my money and a apology.

Of note, my name is XXXX XXXX with Bank of America. I have not actively banked with them in over 10 years and have been married since, my name is now XXXX XXXX. <P/>We were initially contacted by the IRS regarding a XXXX form filed by Bank of America in XXXX regarding a {$3100.00} payment supposedly paid to us in XXXX. We had never received this payment and I had not actively banked with Bank of America in over 10 years. The IRS sent us a letter saying we owed taxes and late fees based upon this " unreported income ''. <P/>I was not able to get any assistance calling into the corporate Bank of America numbers, so I visited the local Bank of America Branch at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX PH ( XXXX ) XXXX. <P/>XXXX ( sp? ) a banker assisted me in obtaining the XXXX that Bank of America had filed and in helping me figure out what the payment was for. A corporate representative said it was related to a class action law suit regarding illegal interest charged to XXXX veterans. I was XXXX in XXXX and XXXX while holding a Bank of America Credit Card. <P/>I had been completely unaware of any class action law suit or that Bank of America owed me any money XXXX was able to find out that onXX/XX/XXXXa check was mailed to an incorrect address of mine and was returned to Bank of America onXX/XX/XXXX. Bank of America never attempted to call me or contact me, even though my cell phone has remained unchanged for 15 years. They simply documented internally that they were unable to locate an address. <P/>Bank of America then proceeded to file a XXXX form saying they had paid me {$3100.00} and filed it with the IRS, even though they had received the check back. <P/>After my inquiry, Bank of America promptly reissued a check for the amount of {$4100.00}. This was sen out on XX/XX/XXXX and I cashed it on XX/XX/XXXX <P/>No one in the branch or from the Corporate office was ever able to explain the discrepancy between the check issued for {$4100.00} and the XXXX form stating the amount of {$3100.00}. <P/>This information is affirmed by a letter Bank of America sent me, dated XX/XX/XXXX <P/>The problem is that the IRS states that to avoid paying late fees on this amount, Bank of America needs to reissue a XXXX form. Bank of America refuses to do this, states it is againts their policy. I had been trying to resolve this with XXXX XXXX in the tax department with no results. Actually he will call me and then I am unable to reach him for a return phone call. He has sent me letters stating he ca n't call me and references a case number XXXX. <P/>I have been in to the local branch numerous times. On my last visit on around XX/XX/XXXX I spoke with the branch manager. She called some corporate numbers and was assured a new XXXX would be issued. As of today XX/XX/XXXX I have not received it and have completely lost confidence in Bank of America to assist me in complying with what the IRS demands. If Bank of America refuses to reissue a new XXXX form I will be forced to pay late fees to the IRS on money I never received. <P/>This seems to be related to illegal activity undertaken by Bank of America while I was a XXXX veteran and if this is not resolved soon I will be contacting local media to see if anyone would like to pick up the story. If I can not personally resolve this I will keep looking for any entity that can help me. <P/>This is completely unacceptable and Bank of America needs to promptly reissue a XXXX or some other form that will satisfy the IRS.

I was confirmed a few times by the customer service that I had set up autopay successfully. However, I have been charged late fee and interests multiple times after that. Though they agreed to waive those fees, the inconsistency confused me with the calculation of my spending amount in the given period specified by the welcome offer. I calculated using the payment amount with the assumption that the payment amount should equal to the spending amount ( as the customer representative told me that autopay 's been set up correctly. After finding out this issue, I immediately filled up the difference by spending another {$40.00} in XX/XX/XXXX and tried to contacted BofA. I received a voicemail from BofA during the winter break when I went to another country. I tried to call back and left a voice message but never heard back. <P/>( 3 ) XXXX I should have received a companion pass after paying the annual fee. I did not get anything.

One week later no one did. <P/>See the service description from BofA below : https : //www.bankofamerica.com/privacy/accounts-cards/credit-debit-card-security.goPhoto Security ( r ) Your picture on your debit card helps protect you from fraudulent use if your card is lost or stolen. Plus, you may be able to use your Photo Security ( r ) card as an additional form of ID. The Photo Security feature is available on most Bank of America debit cards. The Photo Security feature is not available on ATM cards, small business employee debit cards or small business deposit only cards. Adding a photo to a new or existing Bank of America card is easy : Stop by a banking center. We can take your photo in just a few minutes and you 'll receive your new card in 5-7 business days ( a debit card replacement fee may apply ). Instead of canceling or delaying this transfer, the bank processed an overdraft protection transfer, from my saving to my checking account. Then it processed the automatic monthly transfer, sending the money back to my savings account, and then charged {$12.00} for the overdraft protection transfer. <P/>
I understand the transfers " worked as they were supposed to '' but this is an unfair practice and only hurts the consumer, to gain revenue. The bank needs to relook at this practice so that it helps the consumer, not the Bank.
<P/>
I am requesting the {$12.00} overdraft protection fee be reimbursed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This XXXX had a carryover balance since approximately XX/XX/XXXX. I was making more than minimum payments. On XX/XX/XXXX I paid the full amount due on this card in the amount of {$1600.00}. When the payment cleared my bank I checked the balance on this account and it reflected {$0.00} due.
On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX I called the customer service line and said I paid off this account and I do n't understand why I now have an amount due of {$12.00}. The rep said it was for " residual interest ''. I stated I never heard of such a thing and asked for this charge to be reversed. She said she could n't do it. I called again to the customer service line today, XX/XX/XXXX and again asked why I was being charged this fee. He said it was " easily missed '' if you did n't know about it. I explained that I have had this card since XX/XX/XXXX and carried balances before and then once paid in full I did not get hit with " residual interest ''. Again he said it 's easily missed. I asked for it to be reversed, he said he could n't. I then asked for a supervisor. This supervisor was rude saying I was going to ruin my credit if I did n't pay it. I said it 's a " scam '' and I refuse. If this fee is " easily missed '' then the bank is counting on consumers just letting it go without a complaint. I 'm not willing to do that. This is a hidden fee and I do not like being taken advantage of. I told the rep I am a very good customer and it would be a shame for the bank to lose me as a customer over {$12.00}. He said it was up to me if I wanted to see my " credit go down the tubes ''. I stated that I have other charge cards that carry a balance and once paid in full I do not get hit with hidden fees. Any assistance you can give to get this reversed is greatly appreciated.

Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America has blocked all my access to banks. I cant open an account and I paid them what they charged me on XXXX XXXX XXXX and they didnt report that I had paid them. I still cant open an account with any bank and the one that was at XXXX XXXX XXXX was cancelled. I went and they did want to help me.

Wednesday, XXXX XXXX, 2017 at XXXX XXXX, I received a text message from Bank of America to verify a business checking debit card transaction from XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX ) in the amount of {$8900.00} which was already approved by their bank/Visa department. I immediately responded via a text message that I did not authorize that transaction, and then telephoned Bank of America. I verbally informed them that I did not make a purchase, as I was at work at the time. Therefore, the Bank of America business debit card was canceled at that time and I submitted a fraud claim over the phone with the fraud department. I was informed that it would take up to 2 weeks before the charge would be reversed. I told them that was no acceptable to me, because that transaction created a negative balance in my checking account. In addition, I have been a customer with Bank of America for over 30 years personally and for 20 years with my business accounts. Based on my history, special consideration should be implemented. But again, I was told that it would take up to 2 weeks and that they were sorry for the inconvenience. Thursday, XXXX XXXX, 2017, I telephoned Bank of America requesting {$8900.00} be returned to my account. I was informed that since the transaction was still processing, that they could deposit the funds into my business account, and they did that immediately. Friday, XXXX XXXX, 2017, the transaction from XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$8900.00} posted to my business checking account which created a negative balance, and thus overdraft charges. Once again, I notified the Bank of America frauddepartment requesting the charge be reversed because I have a business to run. However, they said that they were sorry and told me that there was nothing that could be done until the investigation was completed. I voiced much frustration and deep dissatisfaction in the handling of this situation. Monday, XXXX XXXX, 2017, I telephoned the Bank of America frauddepartment because of returned payments along with an increasing negative balance in my business checking account. I requested that they pay the pending recurring transactions because I could not cancel them due to the timing of this event. My business partner, XXXX XXXX, and I were on the phone with the customer representative, XXXX, from the fraud department. She said she could escalate the claim to be reviewed in 48 to 72 hours as a hardship case to reverse the charges sooner than the 2-week timeframe. We both voiced that was still not acceptable and stated that we wanted to file a complaint, which she stated that she filed on our behalf. Tuesday, XXXX XXXX, 2017, I telephoned XXXX XXXX and spoke with XXXX XXXX, the assistant manager and informed her of this fraudulent activity. She indicated that she would file a fraud report and notify the corporate office accordingly. Wednesday, XXXX XXXX, 2017, I spoke with the manager, XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX inquiring as to whether their corporate fraud department was contacted by Bank of America. I was told that no contact was made. Once again, I contacted the Bank of America fraud department to check on the status of the escalation and was told that it was still processing. Again, I voiced my dissatisfaction with the handling of my claim as to why no one has contacted XXXX XXXX yet! At that point, I was livid and informed Bank of America I will obtain legal representation to deal with this matter. Thursday, XXXX XXXX, 2017, I spoke with XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX. She informed me that a man presented my Visa business credit card with his name on it and purchased a love seat, sofa and dining room set. XXXX also stated that the transaction occurred at XXXX XXXX on X/XX/17, and all cashier transactions are videotaped. Also, XXXX mentioned that the corporate fraud department was waiting on Bank of America to contact them. XXXX also advised me to file a police report, which I did the same day. I telephoned the Bank of America fraud department and gave them the information given to me from XXXX. I inquired why they still havent contacted XXXX XXXX. I was again told that my claim was still processing despite the escalation, which was to be within 48 to 72 hours. Therefore, I went into a Bank of America branch with the hope of getting some help with this situation, but to no avail. However, the customer service representative, XXXX XXXX XXXX refunded the overdraft charges to my business checking account. XXXX XXXX was puzzled as to why Visa authorized such a large debit authorization, especially when I have never made a debit transaction of this magnitude in the 20 years that Ive been a business customer with Bank of America. While at the bank, I explained to XXXX XXXX that I have my lease payment of {$2900.00} due on XX/XX/XXXX. As a last resort, I attempted to withdraw the said amount from my personal Bank of America Visa card. However, I was declined authorization by Visa and another Bank of America customer service representative, XXXX XXXX XXXX called Visa to ask why I was denied. She, too, was shocked as to why Visa approved such a large transaction but then denied me for an increase for a cash withdrawal level on my personal credit card. I explained to the Visa customer representative why I needed the cash. I also stated that Visa created this fiasco by failing to notify me before authorizing a large transaction. But that did not seem to matter to them and was transferred to the Bank of America fraud department, which again was not helpful at all. I was told that the claim was still processing. Therefore, I voiced my frustration and contempt for the disgraceful way in which this claim has been handled by a loyal customer for over 30 years. According to the Total Security Protection Package, the fraudulent charge should have been returned to the account within 24 hours. The Bank of America and Visa Security System totally failed to protect my account, illegally encumbered my money, and has caused unnecessary stress and harm to the financial well-being of my business.

Consumer complaint narrative: I open the checking account with Bank of America in 2015 and they close my account without letting me know what 's going, all they said because I deposited one of my cousin check into the account. So I ca n't open the account any where else because they said I owe them. My direct deposit from my employer always come every 2 weeks.

I wrote a letter on XXXX XXXX 2017 to all three credit report agencies. Then I did n't receive anything back from them. So I decide to check the status of my credit report still the same account is still say it delinquent when I paid thru XXXX cancelation of debt form I receive from Bank of America. I call Bank of America and they said that they are working on it since XX/XX/XXXXI have not received update from them it seem they are not listening to me. I am trying to purchase a home and the underwriter will not process the loan until this get resolve.

Someone used my atm card to withdraw funds without my permission. I went to the bank and requested a copy of the recording so I an see who was withdrawing the funds they said it would take 10 business days. I waited the 10 business days. and went to the bank and they clearly showed me a picture of some young women withdrawing funds from my account. It clearly was not me. They filed a claim which took 15 days. The claims department denied the claim because she had my atm pin number. I have no idea how she got it but according to them it had to be someone who spent the night at my home and must 've gotten the information when I went to sleep. My husband and I both senior citizens and that never happened and we do n't have security cameras in our little apartment so for them to make that assumption was ridiculous they are refusing to answer the claim, I asked for a copy of the picture so I can take it to the police, apparently is not company policy for them to give me a picture of the thief. Please help me retrieve my funds as bank of America is being unreasonable.

ON XXX-17 a charge for XXXX was billed to my debit card for XXXX, I do not have XXXX, I have been on hold with BOA for 33 minutes to dispute this. I can not dispute it online, have to call. I need your help.

Additionally, the IRS ( https : //www.irs.gov/uac/newsroom/irs-virtual-currency-guidance ) seems to indicate that purchases on this platform should not incur such a fee. I tried to dispute the charge but the website does not allow customers to dispute fees.

Bank of America inexplicably closed my checking account after two days and after I had already scheduled deposits into the account. They claimed it was for " business reasons '' and refused to offer any explanation beyond this.

Bank of America Credit Card Account number ending in : XXXX  Bank of America Case number : XXXX Dispute charges {$97.00} and {$98.00} I ordered a sample of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$3.00} & {$4.00}, respectively, on XX/XX/XXXX online. <P/>
After the cancellation, one month later I found that there were two charges, in the amount of {$97.00} & {$98.00} on my Bank of America credit card bill. They also didnt provide any terms and conditions when ordering the items nor in the shipment and no information on how to return the merchandise and receive a return authorization and did not provide a return address.
<P/>
Bank of America promised to investigate this issue, but Bank of America failed and refused to resolve this issue and charged {$97.00} & {$98.00} without investigation.

Sincerely yours, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( DOB : XX/XX/XXXX debt collector for credit card that I contend was erroneously sent to collections, as I had established auto payment ( {$50.00} ) above initial minimum payment ( approx. {$35.00} ) for a Bank of America credit card opened onXX/XX/XXXXwith {$2500.00} credit limit. The ( a ) initial billing and ( b ) date auto payment was established are conveniently not included in discovery, and I am unable to obtain this information online through my current BOA checking account. I have not contacted BOA since the filing of this lawsuit due to distrust and not knowing source of presumed fraudulent practices. BOA contacted me about delinquency of account, but on at least two occasions before account was transferred to collections, I spoke to BOA rep, which could not explain why the auto payments, in excess of billing expenses, were not adequate. In XX/XX/XXXX when balance was approximately {$1800.00}, below the {$2500.00} limit, I had transaction declined at local XXXX and then learned that BOA suspended the card. On XX/XX/XXXX BOA sold account to XXXX XXXX XXXX for undocumented amount. I am being sued for {$3800.00}. Though I have had no direct dealings with XXXX XXXX XXXX court record notes, " The last payment was posted to the account on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$50.00}. '' In reality, BOA continued to take auto payments for 47 months after it was sent to collections through XX/XX/XXXX, and without any expressed agreement and/or without addressing my contentions that the auto payments were timely and adequate, BOA sent this money to collections agent. The court documentation has discrepancies and falsifications, as it reflects " there is now due and payable from the Defendant the sum of {$2400.00} ; plus accrued interest of {$1300.00} through XX/XX/XXXX ... '' Additionally and just as contended with BOA, regular payments are taken simultaneously while default interest is being accrued. There appears to be 2-3 grounds where bank loses its creditor exemption, and I would like to explore counter claim ( s )  against bank and collections agents. The matter is set for trial in XX/XX/XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau : Hello. On XXXX XXXX, 2017 in the MORNING, I transferred {$25.00} from my Savings Account to my Checking Account at Bank of America.
On the EXACT SAME DAY ( XXXX XXXX, 2017 ) in the AFTERNOON, Bank of America initiated an AUTOMATIC transfer of my {$25.00} back into my Savings Account WITHOUT my CONSENT.
On the following day, I closed my Savings account, but the money was NOT accounted for. Because of this Bank THEFT of my money, I incurred 2 OVERDRAFTS on my account and had NO MONEY to buy me something to eat and ride the bus. I had to walk 11 miles in the hot sun.
I would like to file a formal complaint against Bank of America for th THEFT of my money. I have EVIDENCE and DOCUMENTATION of the Bank THEFT.
Call me ANYTIME : XXXX ; Cordially, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX I paid XXXX XXXX for a copy of XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was given a download link and registration number for the software, which I downloaded from XXXX  and registered. I then used the software for the next 10 months until XXXX notified me that the software purchased was not authentic. During this period the software vendor appears to have closed their business, so my attempts to contact the software vendor were futile. ( email attached ) XXXX assigned a case number ( # XXXX ) and sent me a letter stating that the software was not authentic. I then went to my bank ( Bank of America ) and because the debit card used was a Visa debit card, they investigated the case notifying me that I was within the deadline and issued a temporary credit on XX/XX/XXXX for {$910.00}. ( docs attached ) As of XX/XX/XXXX, the temporary credit has been withdrawn because the bank of XXXX XXXX stated that they were not notified within 60 days of the initial transaction per a notification letter from Bank of America. ( doc attached ) I would point out that : 1. ) I was not notified by XXXX that the software I downloaded from their site and registered through their site was not authentic until 10 months after the initial download and registration. This untimely notification unduly inhibits me as the purchaser from taking timely action against the software vendor.
<P/>
2. ) Because the vendor is no longer in business ( I presume ) I cant get their side of the story regarding the sale. It was suggested by yet another vendor that XXXX may have purchased a large site license from XXXX and then decided to sell off individual licenses. This may be what happened, but I ca n't confirm not can I comment on the legality of this practice.
<P/>
I would like to know what recourse, if any, I as a small business owner have in this regard. I have lost critical funding and although primary responsibility would naturally sit with the vendor who illegally sold the software they ca n't represent themselves. I would note they had a very good online reputation at the time I purchased from them. I also feel XXXX shares some responsibility to notify a purchaser at the time they register the software as to its legitimacy so that the end user can take appropriate and timely action.

CASE # XXXX MERCHANT # XXXX REFERENCE # XXXX TICKET/CARDHOLDER # XXXX TO : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MD XXXX PH : XXXX AND CFPB Ref No : XXXX Ref : XXXX TO : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, UT Dear XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX have a small business named XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. In XXXX XXXX, a woman named XXXX XXXX signed up for our XXXX training program which spans the course of one year. Our XXXX training program is {$6000.00} and we have all of our trainees sign a contract which states that there are no refunds given under any circumstances. XXXX XXXX purchased a home in XXXX in XXXX XXXX. She requested a refund in XXXX because she was concerned about her new commute and realized it would require additional travel time. XXXX XXXX filed a chargeback dispute. I, on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, responded to the dispute by sending XXXX XXXX 's contract and receipt as proof of her participation in our program. XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX denied my dispute because evidently there was not enough documentation to support the dispute. I then filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Board with XXXX XXXX on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX responded in favor to my dispute on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and the {$6000.00} was returned to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. PLEASE NOTE : I am submitting the response letter from XXXX XXXX. Today, I received a letter from XXXX XXXX which explained that XXXX XXXX filed a second chargeback dispute. I was not aware of this. The letter explained that I did not respond to the initial retrieval request and that my chargeback representment rights do not exist. I called XXXX XXXX  immediately to explain that I DID NOT receive the second dispute notification in the mail and XXXX XXXX explained to me that there was nothing more that could be done on my behalf. This is why I am filing a complaint with the CFPB once again. Please note : The information listed below is from my first complaint that I filed with XXXX XXXX which was then granted in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 's favor. I implore you to please reconsider your decision based on the information and documentation I have provided below. In addition : I also explained to XXXX XXXX that I do not receive mail to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  because our facility was vandalized. We were not receiving mail and then decided to obtain a XXXX. XXXX  All mail on behalf of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, should be mailed to the following address immediately. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX This may be why I did not receive the request to send further documentation for the second reversal chargeback. The only reason I received this new documentation from XXXX XXXX was because it was forwarded to our XXXX XXXX XXXX I just received it today on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. It was dated on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX was given our XXXX training manual which was installed on her XXXX by a technician. Please note : I am submitting documentation that she received this manual from our technician. In addition, she attended two XXXX training weekends. The dates are as follows : XXXX XXXX for 16 hours as well as XXXX XXXX for 16 hours. She received a total of 32 training hours as well as our manual. Lastly, XXXX XXXX came to our XXXX daily. We have an online scheduling system. She had obtained a username and password and signed herself in daily. The dates that she attended our facility to receive training, XXXX and XXXX XXXX are attached as documentation in support of this claim. The total hours are : 127 hours. For a grand total of 159 hours. XXXX XXXX sent me an email directly to tell me that she was leaving the program and receiving a full refund from XXXX XXXX. She sent me an email explaining that the outline for the XXXX training program was false and that she did not receive services that were promised. This is not accurate. Her complaints / accusations were as follows : 1 ) " Program details stated that apprentices would be able to access the XXXX Monday - Friday from XXXX XXXX, and Saturdays from XXXX - XXXX. There have been multiple occurrences where I have been denied access to the studio to observe, practice or XXXX during times when the training program details state the studio would be open. '' RESPONSE : XXXX XXXX was required to schedule herself on our online scheduling system in ADVANCE. She did not do this, rather she did this the day of prior to coming in to the XXXX. In addition, XXXX XXXX did not come to our XXXX at XXXX XXXX in the morning since she began the training. The times that she came to our XXXX were noted above. Lastly, I explained to XXXX XXXX that our studio had been vandalized on Saturday the XXXX and that there was broken glass which was dangerous and our door needed to be replaced on Monday morning from XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX. She seized this opportunity to demand a refund because we were unable to make the XXXX available to her during this time period. Pease note : I have a picture of this occurrence and I am submitting it as documentation. 2 ) " Additionally, although the training fee states that I would have unlimited access to the studio to observe, practice and XXXX, it was made aware to me after paying for the program fee, that if I XXXX someone not currently an apprentice or employee of XXXX XXXX XXXX, I would have to pay a {$25.00} studio rental fee, even if during the hours outlined as being able to have unlimited open studio access to observe, practice and XXXX. '' RESPONSE : It was explained in great detail to XXXX XXXX, at the BEGINNING of the program, that she was able to XXXX  employees and fellow apprentices for no charge ( included in the cost of our program ). In addition, if she wanted to XXXX clients that would like to pay for discounted apprentice sessions, she could do so and would be paid for doing so. XXXX XXXX agreed to this. Please note : I am submitting her XXXX and deposited pay check. Lastly, XXXX XXXX wanted to teach her husband XXXX XXXX. This was not a requirement. She did not want him to pay the XXXX for discounted sessions nor to be paid for XXXX  him. I agreed to her request but explained that a XXXX fee of {$25.00} was to be paid if she wanted to XXXX him specifically. This was NOT a requirement. 3 ) " The program details provided before submitting payment for the training fee, also states that there will be a monthly apprentice meeting/XXXX. The training program began on XXXX XXXX, and I was not provided with the first monthly/apprentice meetingXXXX. '' RESPONSE : There are a total of 8 apprentice meetings, held once a month. Apprentice meetings begin in XX/XX/XXXXand end in XXXX of XXXX. This was explained to XXXX XXXX at the BEGINNING of the program. 4 ) " As required, prior to signing up for the program and paying the program training fee, I submitted an application outlining my experience with XXXX. Since the program has begun, I have been told on multiple occasions that I not capable of completing training program unless I take multiple classes/privates all which come at an additional charge, not outlined in the program details. '' RESPONSE : XXXX XXXX was NEVER told that she was not capable of completing the training program unless she took classes and/or private sessions. Also, please note on XXXX XXXX 's application, she did not disclose that she had a physical/medical condition called XXXX She was concerned because her XXXX was bothering her. It was then that I realized she had XXXX. I asked her about this and why she did not communicate this to me PRIOR to beginning the program. She explained that she was concerned that I would NOT accept her into the program if she had been honest about her condition. She asked me directly what she could do additionally to enhance her training experience. I recommended taking classes and sessions but this was NEVER deemed a requirement. Please note : I am submitting her application as proof that she did not disclose her medical condition to XXXX XXXX XXXX CONCLUSION : I feel that the reversal of the {$6000.00} charge once again is unwarranted and unfounded. Based upon the foregoing information, it is respectfully requested that XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX reverse the refund given to XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$6000.00} and return the amount to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX respectfully.

XXXX my daughters bank of america ATM card was stolen via an XXXX she shared with other teenagers She did not discover her ATM was missing until a few days later when she checked her balance noticed a check for {$5900.00} was deposited and {$300.00} withdrawn. She contacted bank of america spoke with customer service told them she did not authorize transaction. A new atm card was issued with new pin. 2 weeks later she received a letter from BOA stating they are reversing the credit applied and they determined their decision was correct. I then got involved requested ATM footage etc. I reviewed ATM footage with a branch manager and my daughter. The person on ATM was a XXXX male. At that time my daughter recognized the guy as being on of the kids in the XXXX she was sharing prior to the incident. I asked how he got access to her pin. She advised another young girl riding in the XXXX was asking questions like what school you go to, whens your birthday etc. WHICH NOTE : her pin at the time was her Date of Birth. We also seen copies of the check it was a XXXX XXXX personal check. The person spelled my daughters name incorrectly on the check. Also the person who signed the check also endorsed it on the back. Bank of America has a male suspect on video footage, and check that incorrectly spelled my daughters name and was endorsed incorrectly. Since XXXX XXXX I have been calling trying to dispute. I was told I need to file police report. Which I have done and I have faxed and still Bank of America is refusing to investigate this fairly. Bank of America Fraud continues to say their findings are correct. Their reason is no one would be able to access her ATM and deposit with her personal information. As That is information she would only know. This happens to consumers everyday and is not uncommon. Unfortunately my daughter was a victim of crime. An innocent conversation in an XXXX resulted in her card getting stolen and her pin getting breached. The evidence on the ATM footage shows she did not deposit the check. Also the check image itself shows the person did not even spell my daughters name correctly. The person that signed the front also endorsed the back. Yet None of these factors are being taken into consideration. Instead Bank of America fraud just denies my claim says their findings are correct. Per the reasons I noted above. While in most cases that would be true. But when your Pin is your DOB. Fact remains consumers are more susceptible to fraud. Unfortunately my daughter being a minor when she opened her account set her pin as her DOB. The banks run across this every day and for Bank of America not to even take the time to look into this issue. I am starting to feel like because I am a minority. I am being treated like the criminal instead of looking at the facts before them. Between the footage & the check discrepancies I pointed out. Bank of America can not make a clear determination their findings are correct. Meanwhile The representatives in the fraud department have treated me rudely spoken to me in a condescending manor. Despite being a customer with the bank for well over 15 years. Not to mention I have mortgage through Bank of America. I called again today XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and again was treated like a criminal. I was told I can not speak to anyone there is no one that I can escalate this to and if I do not have any more documentation than the letter and the police report I sent. Bank of America Fraud investigator handling my claim will continue to deny my request. I am a consumer caught in the middle of a fraud situation and there is actual evidence that shows there was someone else involved. That person has gotten away with a crime. I am left to hold the bag. 
Today I have contacted my local news company XXXX XXXX. I am contacting CFPB and I am writing Bank of America head quarters. I had 3 open accounts. The account in question bank of america charged off and is now reflecting this on mine and my daughters credit and is possibly even in the XXXX XXXX. We are being penalized for being a customer. Anything that can be done to ensure this is investigated and a fair determination is made would be appreciated.

This action by Bank of America to add the 4 amounts is shown in the attached XXXX print of my online account. It was not a credit for the disputed charge of {$14.00}. The other 3 credits of {$8.00}, {$0.00} and {$11.00} that Bank of America alleged were made by XXXX never appear on any of my statements and were NEVER made by XXXX. Hence, the action of Bank of America of adding the {$35.00} of the credit it originally made for the fraudulent transactions is itself fraudulent and is only an attempt to cheat me out of {$35.00}.

This complaint stems from a decade-old foreclosure case, and specifically involves the attempted collection of a 'dormant ' mortgage debt. Ohio law is crystal clear that when a debt is not 'executed upon ' or 'renewed ' within a five-year period, the debt is considered dormant, and the lien is extinguished. Ohio law further defines the 'execution ' of debt to as " a process of court, issued by its clerk, and directed to the sheriff of the county. '' ( XXXX XXXX ). In my case, there was no 'execution ' as defined above, nor a 'certificate of judgment ' renewed during the period of time from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. As such, the Summary Judgment issues by the Court of Common Please became dormant on XX/XX/XXXX. Nonetheless, on three occasions since that time - specifically XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX - the alleged Plaintiff in my case file a Praecipe Order of Sale with the Court in what amounts to an attempt to collect a debt that I currently do not owe as a result of the statutorily-imposed dormancy. The specific statute is Ohio Revised Code 2329.07, which codifies when a Judgment may become dormant : ( A ) (( 1 ) If neither execution on a judgment rendered in a court of record or certified to the clerk of the court of common pleas in the county in which the judgment was rendered is issued, nor a certificate of judgment for obtaining a lien upon lands and tenements is issued and filed, as provided in sections 2329.02 and 2329.04 of the Revised Code, within five years from the date of the judgment or within five years from the date of the issuance of the last execution thereon or the issuance and filing of the last such certificate, whichever is later, then, unless the judgment is in favor of the state, the judgment shall be dormant and shall not operate as a lien upon the estate of the judgment debtor. One bankruptcy judge has explained the operation of these statutes as follows from In XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. Ohio XX/XX/XXXX ) : Execution and dormancy statutes are to be strictly construed. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ohio St. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Ohio XX/XX/XXXX ) ; XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 13 Kan. App. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ; XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Okla. XXXX ).
Section XXXX  sets forth the only means in Ohio for preventing a judgment from becoming dormant. The clear language of the statute requires the issuance of execution or a certificate of judgment before expiration of the original five-year period to prevent dormancy.
Section XXXX  provides that in order to extend the effectiveness of a judgment beyond the initial five  year period there must be either execution or the issuance of a new certificate of judgment before expiration of the original execution or certificate of judgment. As a result of the above, the law is clear that the judgment is dormant, and any action to collect on the debt is a violation of state and federal law.
