Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this complaint to accompany the complaint I 've filed with the fdic. Bank of America has denied a claim I disputed in regards to a restaurant purchase in which I was displeased with service, treated rudely with my family and did not receive all the product I paid for. Bank of America has made an impossible demand for me to provide documentation that I did not receive all the products i ordered even though I posted a negative review of the restaurant immediately after the visit. Furthermore bank of America has reversed a provisional credit to my account and is now charging me overdraft and insufficient funds fees. On XXXX XXXX 2017, I called in to file yet another dispute in which a credit was issued and was lie to by a bank representative in the dispute department that the XXXX was added back to my account and that after both provisional credits were applied that I actually would have a XXXX balance. This is also in direct contradiction to a letter mailed to me that the funds were to be reversed on the XXXX of the month not the XXXX. This is just added to the constant ongoing issues I have had with bank of America. I have also had to file the second dispute because a charge was made to my account on a day I did not authorize. I have since then closed my debit card with bank of America for my checking account and did not order another since they have failed to honor disputed transactions.

dear sirs. Here 's the problem I 'm on fixed income and retired and have serious health problems  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  not too long ago. I had a checking account and savings account they were charging me {$10.00} for taking money from savings to checking per transacti on at one m onth  XXXX  in fees and another month  XXXX  in fees for  XXXX  accounts in the same bank. I have modest income and about und er 2.000 in saving s in the bank. Because my serious health conditions I can not always monitor how much I have in checking savings too avoid overdraft fees. Because of my health problems I have a lot of  XXXX  and always worry about paying my bills. I ca n't pay all my medical expenses. I called customer service at Bank of America to see if they would refund my overdraft fees from savings to checking because my poor health situation. They said NO they do not care about your situation or that you do n't have a lot of money. They are the most heartless people that I have dealt with. All they care about is making as much money off the poor as they can. They are just the worst in humanity its always the bottom line  XXXX  forgives they do n't. I can give you copies of my paperwork from this bank. I do n't like complaining but its always the little guy vs the big banks. I had to close my account and go too another bank too save myself from financial disaster. Please help me. Sincerely  XXXX   XXXX

I received a letter dated XXXX XXXX, 2017 yesterday ( XXXX XXXX ) stating that BOA was shutting down my business banking account in 30 days ( with restrictions to the account starting in 21 days ). The letter states that there is no recourse, and that no reason for this closure will be given. The folks at the local branch I 've dealt with were unable to shed any light on the reasons for this. I 've never, ever had any financial problems with my account, which is tied to my 22 year old business with a stellar financial history. The letter states that I can call in to an automated phone line and leave a message, but that BOA wo n't reconsider closing my account.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I booked a bus ticket for XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX from XXXX, PA to XXXX, PA via their website XXXX using my Bank of America debit card. I am a frequent traveler on XXXX and I always received an immediate confirmation via email. However, I used to always pay via credit card but this time I paid via debit card and I did n't receive an email confirmation. XXXX website has no option to chat online or send emails regarding this particular issue. They do have online contact options for other issues but none for payment related. So I called the number listed on their website XXXX and spoke to a customer service rep about XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX. He said he could n't do anything about it and connected me to another department saying they could resolve the issue. It was an IVR ( Interactive Voice Recording ) and it basically said no one is available at that time. Since my bus was for the next day, I bought the ticket again using my credit card and this time got a confirmation email immediately. In the next couple of days I called the XXXX number about 3 times only to get the IVR and I realized that this issue was going no where. So I raised a dispute with Bank of America onXX/XX/XXXX. Its Claim ID is XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX,  Bank of America resolved the claim in the merchant 's favor and closed my claim. I am attaching 3 documents : ( 1 ) Bank of America transaction stating that the amount for XXXX was debited onXX/XX/XXXX even though booking was done on XX/XX/XXXX. This proves that the transaction never went through for 2 days and was successful after the travel date of XX/XX/XXXX. ( 2 ) XXXX credit card statement showing the amount for XXXX was credited onXX/XX/XXXX ( this is the 2nd time I had to buy the ticket since I did n't receive confirmation from the debit card purchase ). ( 3 ) Email confirmation from XXXX who process the payments for XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX for the payment done via credit card. Never got an email from XXXX or XXXX for the debit card purchase.

Bank of America promised to re-open my closed account if I provide evidence from XXXX XXXX that they did not honor my check because of signature issues and not because the funds were unavailable. The evidence from XXXX is attached and it was given to Bank of America management as an email attachment since XXXX 2016. <P/>The issue I am now having is why I keep getting a bank statement for my checking account ( account # : XXXX ), but in my online account it shows that I only have a mortgage account. My checking account was supposed to be open so that I can deposit money and pay my mortgage online without coming to the bank. Can someone please reopen my account as promised? <P/>Thanks.

I am highly disappointed with Bank Of America refusal to be customer centric regarding the overdraft, non-sufficient funds and extended overdraft fees that I have been assessed over the past year. One of the reason I chose to bank with BOA was because I heard of their desire to consistently deliver the exemplary service they know that their customers deserve. On several occasions, I have contacted customer service requesting assistance or direction with banking concerns and have only ended the call inquiring as to why instead of creating solutions for their customers, I 'm still in the predicament of where I started. I contacted the bank of XX/XX/XXXX regarding an unauthorized transaction to XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$36.00} that I had been paying for a product that I returned and because I had other transactions coming from that merchant, that it never dawned on me that I had returned those 2 items in which that charge was payment for.that I had been paying. I had been charged 11xs in this amount. Instead of providing a solution, the agent did everything in her power to keep me from filing any type of claim for the transaction and when I asked for a stop payment, she simply said that she could place a stop payment on the merchant for a fee. My question to myself is that, I have never received a stop payment before or any type of reimbursement for a fee for that matter and if this is causing financial hardship since she refuses to allow me to file a claim, why not provide the stop payment as a courtesy. In regards to the fees that I previously mentioned, a review of my account has indicated that I have paid {$1000.00} in overdraft, non-sufficient funds and extended overdraft fees since XX/XX/XXXX. By all means I know that as a customer, it is my responsibility to manage my account effectively ; however, there may be times in which are outside of my control and I have tried to discuss the matter with phone bankers but I 'm always told that they are unable to assist with fees and to only bring the account to a positive balance or I will get hit with additional extended fees. I am submitting this as a request for some type of reimbursement for some of the fees that I have incurred over the past year. Although I understand by using the account, I accept the terms and condition of the account and the fees that I am subjective to ... but as a consumer, sometimes its nice to know that a company values you as a customer and realizes that you may have made a miscalculation or misjudgment and be willing to say, as a courtesy,  we understand and want to keep you as a customer. I ask that you review my account relationship and provide a reimbursement for the fees that I have been assessed. The only fee reversals that I have received where the result of unauthorized transactions. Thank you for your time.

Bank of America 's credit card practice is rip-off. my XXXX monthly statement balance was XXXX USD. I had auto-payments feature ON. On XXXX XXXX I paid my balance in Full manually, just by clicking button " Pay '' when I was looking at my statement. On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX issued XXXX refund on my card, which made my balance on credit card even negative, but regardless of all mentioned Bank Of America on the last date of grace period charged my checking account again and deposited XXXX the second time, ignoring two things : 1. I have already paid in full. 2. I even had a negative balance. <P/>I found out about that looking at my checking account and immediately called them. The conversation with call center employee entails this complain. she told me that it was MY fault that I paid in full having auto payments on. I tried to explain that Auto payment feature must take into account all payments made by customer and refunds if any, and that it this the way banks like XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX work, but I heard " Based on our policy we will charge full last statement even if you have already paid ''. <P/>I am not a lawyer, but I am positive it is against common sense because it turns credit card to a nonsense product, and it should be against the Law. I experienced overdraft fee on my checking, which must be paid my BofA, but they ignore my complains.

I paid my auto loan in the months of XXXX and XXXX. Company claimed they never received a payment but made no good efforts to inform me of non-payment Called BOA on XXXX in an attempt to make my auto loan payment. Spoke with a rep who said he would transfer me to another dept. While speaking with the new rep she said that she had to transfer me to another dept. due to my auto loan payment being delinquent 64 days. I asked her how was that possible when I 've paid for the past two months, she said that it was n't her dept. but she saw where payments had been made but something " funny '' was going on with the account. I was placed on hold and then spoke to another rep whom stated the same thing, that my payment was 64 days late. She then said that it could 've been due to wrong account number/being a number off etc. I then asked why was n't I informed about my loan being 64 days past due, especially due to the fact that I had just spoke with a CSR last month and I was n't informed about it being late. I further asked why did n't I receive a phone call, letter in the mail, or even a basic email. I also told her that I had emails from BOA stating that my payments had been made, which she basically told me that those emails meant nothing ( why send emails with confirmation numbers saying payments have been made if no payments are received, or why not send emails saying that no payment has been received, seems a little backwards ) You can send emails saying that the payments had been made but none saying that it might 've came back and not been made. The CSR rep then went on to tell me that multiple calls had been made but my phone line was continuously busy ( Learned from a BOA manager on XXXX that they had all the wrong contact information concerning my account ) She then asked would I like to speak to a bank manager to which I agreed. I was put on hold and told that they were in a meeting and that they would call me back, She then proceeded to be nasty and ask for my phone number and ask, " are you gon na be home to answer the phone this time? '' Lets just say that I NEVER received a phone call from the bank manager and had to call back ( XXXX ) myself to figure out the issue. Spoke with a gentleman name XXXX who basically told me the same garb as I was previously fed. When I asked him when was I ever gon na be notified that my account was delinquent or were they gon na just come and repo the car he snickered and He basically said that I would have to go through the hassle of getting banking statements that the payments were made and that the research team would try and locate the missing funds, which I feel like I should n't have to go through the trouble since NO ONE went through the trouble of informing me about my account being delinquent. He then tried to verify my contact info, which was all wrong ( do n't quite know where they got this information from. ) he then stated that 's why I have n't been receiving notifications, which I still find inexcusable due to the fact that BOA can send me a notification via email on multiple occasions asking me to complete a survey about my call but no notification to inform me that the loan that they are financing is delinquent ( again backwards ) and as of today ( XXXX ) I still ca n't pay my auto loan due to notes that were placed in the system and all it does is connect me to a CSR.

On XXXX a transaction of {$7600.00} was made at Hawaii XXXX in XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX county. I received a call from Bank of America alerting me to the transaction. They asked me if I was the one that performed the transaction and I said I did not. Immediately a fraud dispute was initiated. This was a visa purchase made at the grocery store based on the information on my statement. Bank of America issued a temporary credit in that amount following the dispute. On XXXX the bank reversed the transaction and recharged me the entire amount to my account. On XXXX I received the attached notification that the bank would not follow through with the fraud dispute. They claim that this was a cash advance/ATM transaction. This is not consistent with the information listed on my statement and the information provided to me by the bank. I do not believe the bank performed it 's due diligence in researching the fraud. A large transaction such as this should have signature verification in place and I do not believe the bank even went as far as to obtain those records. On XXXX I filed a police report which is also attached below. Case number : XXXX Officer : XXXX XXXX XXXX

I applied to several XXXX postings at XXXX and one of them was from XXXX XXXX XXXX. The first email I received was XXXX XXXX 2017 from an email XXXX saying that it was tough to decide on the select group chosen for an interview because they received so many good resumes and that I was one of those selected for an interview. <P/>I was asked to add XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) on the XXXX XXXX platform to undergo the interview process. According to them, she was an HR recruiter for XXXX. This XXXX person gave me all the duties and responsibilities of the position and asked me if I could handle the job duties if I were being trained towards it, I responded by saying yes, then she proceeded with interview questions. Once we finished, she said to check back by XXXX the following day via the XXXX XXXX platform for the decision. The next day they said I was chosen. <P/>I received another email from XXXX congratulating me for becoming part of their company and they attached an offer letter. <P/>Then they emailed me a check {$3000.00}. on XX/XX/2017 with instructions on how to deposit it via mobile through my bank Bank of America, and that I was expected to cash {$2800.00} of it and deposit to a XXXX XXXX account the following day to a person named XXXX XXXX XXXX who is the vendor in charge of sending me the training materials for pre-training. I believed it and so I did, I also thought that since Bank of America made the funds available the next day, then it was a legitimate check. On XX/XX/2017 they emailed me another check for {$4000.00}. and from there I had withdraw and deposit {$3900.00}. for more materials. <P/>OnXX/XX/XXXX. I went to what I thought was my first day of my internship at XXXX and the security guard could not find my name in their system. I was told that I was actually scammed and that they were very sorry this happened to me, and that someone also got scammed that same morning. <P/>I went straight to the police station and made a police report, I also contacted Bank of America but they are not cooperating with me regarding my situation. Instead they withdrew my checking and savings accounts to pay themselves back from the fraudulent checks. Now I have negative status on my account of - {$6200.00}. Additionally, Bank of America flagged my account to be closed XX/XX/XXXX which is not the standard time to close an account.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of XXXX, Bank of America reported an open mortgage account on my credit report and listed the account as going into foreclosure. This account has already went into foreclosure and the final judgement and property sale were complete in XXXX, XXXX respectively. I have contacted Bank of America Customer Service XXXX on several occasions and told them that this account has already been resolved and that they actually own the property. At first they lied to me and told me the final judgement had been thrown out and that the case was going back into foreclosure, I asked for proof and never received anything. Twice during conversations I was escalated to a supervisor and was given a fax number to send in my documentation, both fax numbers did not pick up or allow me to send my documents XXXX XXXX / XXXX XXXX so I mailed them a copy of the final judgement and the notice of sale. I want this corrected and off my credit report, and after 5 calls to Bank of America to resolve this I have no confidence that further communications with them will resolve anything

On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I opened an account with Bank of America in there XXXX Georgia branch. The Banker and I sat and I explained to him what type of account I wanted to open ( originally the XXXX  account ). The Banker had to enter in my information twice as there were two profiles in Bank of America system. After merging both old and new profile, the Banker then ran the risk assessment and Bank of America system approved me for a regular checking account. At this time, I made a cash deposit and was given all my documents. On Monday XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I made two mobile deposit of checks I received. As of then and as of the morning of XXXX XXXX, XXXX my account was open and fine. On Tuesday XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I went to use my temporary card at a gas station and was declined use. I had to wait till XXXX to talk to a Banker, who transferred me to the Risk Department ; she informed me that Bank of America was closing my account because another institution had made a report to them. I explained to the Risk Dept Rep that I went through the Banks Risk management and was cleared so I do not understand why my account was being closed. She then transferred me to an automated system ( after I asked to speak to someone who could tell me who the other Banking institution was ). This automated system would n't allow me to speak to anyone. Do to Bank of America 's Risk assessment system and the lack of proper business professionalism I suffered humiliation but having my card declined and not being able to pay for my purchase. Bank of America should have never opened the account, accepted my deposit or allowed a full day to go by without any notification that my account was in jeopardy of being closed.

Bank of Americas check hold policy/risk department literally put me and my fiance in harms way being out at sea without the insurance we tried to purchase before the trip. We sold our home in XXXX California and drove across country to pursue our dream of living on a boat and travelling. We had a credit union in California but needed to open an account that would hopefully allow us easier access to our funds. On XX/XX/XXXX I went into the XXXX, Florida branch to deposit the funds from my credit union in California. I spent over an hour with a branch manager to make sure that I understood their Hold Notice ( see attached ). They give you {$200.00} upfront and then Hold code A was supposed to be released allowing me access to {$4800.00} and then hold D was to be released on XX/XX/XXXX for the remaining balance of {$15000.00}. Neither of those dates were honored even though I have the Notice of Hold outlining the dates and amounts. ( see attachments ) I was not notified by phone, e-mail, or text that they were not honoring the hold notice. I was informed at the grocery store by the cashier that my card did not go through. Upon my effort to find out why, I was informed that they did not release the {$4800.00} and that the {$15000.00} was going to be held until XX/XX/XXXX. The risk department wanted to place the burden of proof on me that the check had actually cleared. Now, that I dont have internet access what they want me to produce is not possible. They blamed my credit union saying that would not verify the check had cleared. The credit union offered to do a three way call with them to validate that the check cleared. That was not possible because the risk department much like the XXXX XXXX XXXX never speaks to the customer. I was able to supply them with the front and back of the check but that did not suffice. Apparently it takes 24 hours to escalate within the risk department so now we have lost yet another day. I spent three full days trying to resolve this to no avail. All I received was lobotomy type responses from all of their terrified employees to go off script and try and help. We did run into trouble and did need to get towed to the tune of {$1300.00} ( see attached receipt ). BofAs draconian, arbitrary, greedy hold policies turned what was supposed to be a beautiful trip into a XXXX nightmare. This has to be a violation since I have the hold notice that was not honored and through no fault of my own. The cash was not actually in my account until XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX XXXX in the morning.

Consumer complaint narrative: I just had a recent call from XXXX XXXX reps supervisor to call and tell me the samething her rep XXXX told me that when I reported my atm card lost and reported nothing was done in getting the finger pointed back at me telling me bank of America does not care both these women are unprofessional and rude I tried to explain to XXXX that I had tried to report this and nothing was done this is very frustrating that no one from this company takes anything serious I never owned an XXXX and im tired of being called a liar I want a manager to give me a call I 'm going to file more complaints with bbb, and the state of ga bank of America is not doing there job all they want to is call you and blame you and not resolve anything and I will not by no one from this company call me a liar when I reported my XXXX card lost and charges I did not make and I will not tolerate anyone telling me I 'm wrong is when none of this was handled right I do have evidence of me not owning a XXXX and I have other evidence to show what bank of America has n't done to resolve this but instead call me with excuses I want someone in hiring authority to contact me not XXXX nor XXXX, I called about a concern to report a problem and I 'm also going to the branch manager if I have to to get her to contact corp about this, I 'm tired of this and very angry that bank of America only cares about laying the blame on me instead of listening and pointing the finger please have a manager contact me asap thank you, I have never been treated with the disrespect and how someone calls you a liar unacceptable to me

I had scheduled an ON TIME payment in full on their online banking before my XX/XX/XXXX due  date. However, before that date, I closed a checking account, which had nothing to do with my credit card, nevertheless, that apparently changed my relationship with the bank, which changed my " profile '' which then triggered them deleting my " pay from '' account associated with my credit card, which in turn deleted my ON TIME scheduled payment. On XX/XX/XXXX they assessed a {$25.00} late fee as a result and after two discussions with a CSR, they will not reverse the charge. I find this practice of a profile change that caused a deletion of a " pay from '' account malicious and intentionally coded into their system.

On Thursday XX/XX/XXXX I was messaged by a user via an online dating app, whom I believed was flirting with me. Her profile name was XXXX, I asked her what she was looking for and said she said needed help completing a business transaction. XXXX proceeded to explain that she works for FDIC and completes transfers between accounts of business clients he/she worked for and in order for her to get paid or get her " cut '' she needed help depositing the checks into an account, which then I would withdraw the funds and send to XXXX a relative, or an assistant via XXXX XXXX. I asked her how she intended to complete the deposits. She asked me if I had mobile/online banking and with whom. I stated that i did have that service with Bank of America. I gave her my phone number in order to call me because she specified not being comfortable with talking through the dating app. Later that evening I received a text stating " Ok I am ready to deposit my checks and appreciate the help ''. She asked me for my BOA username and password and she reassured me that this was only because she was in possession of the checks that required depositing and so she would need to access the account, and so I gave her my online user ID and Password, along with the answer to whatever security question came up. Luckily the security questions were n't as viable information but I still made the biggest mistake of my life the moment I gave them my username and password. That evening at XXXX I received several emails and texts notifications showing that this person deposited four checks of " hers '' into my account ( {$990.00}, {$920.00}, XXXX, & {$790.00} ). She made sure to check in with me frequently to ensure I did not log into my online banking account which I did not think anything of it because I sometimes manage my mothers account and she and I can not be logged in at the same time. She then said to me, " Ok, I completed my deposits please do not sign into your account until the deposits are complete and processed ''. I said, well that will be a couple of days and they said, " no, the funds should clear in the morning, would you mind going to the bank when it opens to withdraw cash and send me my portion via XXXX XXXX. '' At that moment I was confused, but I went ahead and went to the bank Friday XX/XX/XXXX. Before I left, she texted me a screen shot of my mobile banking showing an available balance of {$3600.00} in my checking account as of XXXX from the timestamp on the phone the screen shot was taken. I received the screen shot text around XXXX and did n't notice the time stamp. I was called an ber around XXXX and was asked to withdraw {$2200.00}. The ber took me to a BOA with a financial center, the first one I went to had ATM tellers and neither of them were working. I told XXXX that I had to go XXXX and would be willing to try again later. At XXXX I made it to a local branch and went to a teller window which I then withdrew {$2200.00} and sent {$2000.00} to a " XXXX XXXX XXXX in Indiana via XXXX XXXX for a total of {$2100.00}. The XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX placed the transaction on a hold I did not know why, I let XXXX know that this was happening and she told me, to state " this person was my sister ... and the amount was for rent. '' and I assumed that XXXX was XXXX XXXXs sister and I knew XXXX would n't send it if I they knew I was sending it for another person. After I spoke to XXXX they released the money and I sent a picture of the receipt to " XXXX '' She said, " Thank you so much, I will complete my last deposits this evening and you will be able to go back to your account no problem. '' I then proceeded to ask her, " are you sure everything is ok because I can not see my account please do n't do anything. '' XXXX said to me, " I would not do anything to jeopardize your account but most importantly my career. '' I said, " ok, I will trust you and help you in hopes this is the last time because I only expected this to be a quick one-time thing. '' She said, " After tomorrow you can be done. '' At this time I was still sure I was helping someone in need. Early Friday evening at XXXX I get an email an text notifications of mobile checks being deposited in the amount of ( {$970.00}, XXXX XXXX & XXXX ). Saturday XXXX XXXX at XXXX I received a phone call from XXXX of BOA , I was not aware of what  department she called from. XXXX stated, " This is not a solicitation call I need to verify some activity on your account. '' I could n't answer the call at the time because I was at the XXXX XXXX I work for. I also thought I was aware of the activity on my account. I received a text message from XXXX around XXXXXXXX asking if I was ready to go to a teller? At that point I was ready to be done running around for someone else, I told XXXX I would just withdraw from the ATM around the corner. I was asked to withdraw {$1000.00} in order to send {$900.00} via XXXX. The XXXX XXXX at XXXX is self-service, I enter in my information and entered in the same receiver information as Friday XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX in XXXX. The total cash given to the associate was {$970.00}, I sent XXXX the receipt and she then asked me to send the same amount, {$900.00}, to her " assistant '' XXXX XXXX located in Indiana. I chose to send the final amount as a debit transaction via the XXXX  app for a total of {$980.00} once completed I sent her a screen shot of the complete transaction as well as screen shot of the receipt emailed to me. I then said ok is everything all set on your end? She said, you will be able to go back into your account around XXXXXXXX this afternoon for sure. I said ok, thank you very much and she said thanks for your help. I thought everything was fine and I knew what I should 've had in my account as far as funds so I proceeded to withdraw normal amounts of cash for myself and continue my normal spending. I received an email on Sunday XXXX XXXX at XXXXXXXX stating there was a hold and a freeze notice on two deposits. I texted XXXX immediately stating there was a hold and a freeze on two or more of the mobile deposits I allowed her to complete. She said I that she was aware but I should not be worried. So at that moment I chose not to worry until Tuesday XXXX XXXX when I received a second call from XXXX and she asked me to verify all of the ATM withdrawals which I said, " I did complete every single ATM withdrawal. '' XXXX proceeded to say, " ok ma'am thank you for verifying these transactions '' and the call ended. I then attempted to log into my mobile/online account, I then saw a message telling me to call a number that connected me to a representative from the online banking department where the rep said " my account has been put in holding and a freeze has been placed on my card because my account is a risk. '' The women then said, " The checks that were deposited into my account were counterfeit and with all the withdrawals makes my account negative - {$5500.00} as of right now any funds going into your account will be going towards that negative. '' I told the the rep those checks were not mine and I did not deposit them and I did not withdraw the money because at that I was so afraid and did not know what to do or if I could tell the truth, because I know BOA to be very unforgiving. She said, " ok well your going to have to file a claim with the fraud department. '' I was transferred to the fraud department where I was first connected to ATM fraud claim. I ended up being honest with the woman telling her as I told XXXX, Yes I did complete those transactions and stated I did n't at first because I was scared. So she said ok well I 'm going to transfer you over to check fraud claim after I told the check fraud claim rep that I NEVER saw the checks ever. After I filed the claim I proceeded to ask the rep from the fraud department, " what does this mean for me, my account, and my relationship with Bank of America? '' She then said, " Ma'am at this time it is up to the risks department and what they want to do there 's nothing I can do from my end. '' She also stated, " First they will investigate the check fraud claim, and if you file a police report feel free to tell us and we will cooperate.. '' As of Wednesday XXXX XXXX I have filed a police report but have not yet notified the bank. Prior to them depositing any of " their checks '' into my checking account I had a remaining balance of {$54.00}, a transfer from my boyfriend of {$170.00}, and a processing deposit from MA unemployment office of {$200.00}. I also had a savings account of {$10.00} which I keep trying to build but ca n't I am a main financial provider for my family. My biggest complaint is that the bank disclosed no information at the time on the first phone call letting me know that the checks were fraud, I did not find out until I had to call because my account had already been somewhat garnished. In sent a total {$4100.00} while I had a balance of {$430.00} and according to the bank statement I received Wednesday XXXX XXXX my account is - {$5500.00}.

Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for the Bank of america XXXX credit card on or about XXXX XXXX 2017. But the application is denied even when i am having the credit score of XXXX. At the same time Bank of America did n't provided any reason why the application is rejected? Moreover no instructions in terms of how they made the credit decision and how to acquire the free credit report. This is the clear violation of standards and standard operating principals. Worse than that - they send me a form to apply for the secure credit card to build the credit history, what??? It was just to rub the salt in my wounds. I never opted for getting any marketing or any other sort of material so why they are sending at the first place??

On XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a checking account with Bank of America in XXXX XXXX XXXX AZ. with {$1000.00}. I did not use the account and actually forgot about it. I do use a BOA credit card and online banking to track and pay each month. Recently I discovered that the BOA has been taking $ XXXX/month out for " service fees '' since approximatelyXX/XX/XXXX and this amounts to {$770.00} lost!
I spoke with a representative of BOA about ten days ago and was told that nothing can be done to recover the fees even though I was never informed that they would be applied after I had made the original deal to open the account which had no monthly charge with {$1000.00} balance.
I guess that they have some sort of " hidden wording '' in the original paperwork that I signed when I opened the account but I do not have any records to refer to as I totally forgot the account and trashed the old records a couple of years ago.
In a phone call today BOA told me that the original agreement provides that they can change the charges anytime and do not need my consent, which they did.
My complaint is that while this practice may be legal it is not at all fair to the consumer and should be stopped through regulation by Government agencies responsible for the consumer banking industry. Why should this industry be able to effectively change a contract element without assurance that the parties have been informed and consent to the change.
What a " shady '' way to do business in my opinion, but at XXXX Yrs. old I suppose my morals are obsolete.
Thank you for any assistance you may render, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I went to Bank of America branch in TX to take advantage of advertised promotional offer which was displayed on my credit card home page. It said get a 0 % APR for 1 year on transfers into my bank acct from my credit card. The total credit line was {$20000.00}. I had a balance of about {$12000.00} and available credit of {$8000.00}. I took the promotional offer and transferred the {$7700.00} at 0 % APR into my checking acct which I needed to complete a backyard project. I signed a little piece of document at the bank which I plan to attach and the guy at the bank said, XXXX XXXX, this is a great deal because you do n't have to worry about interest on the {$7700.00} as you would just focus on paying off the {$12000.00} because you have reprieve for one year on this one - " this one '' meaning the amount I just transferred to my bank checking account. I was very excited and  I left. I got Monthly Minimum Payments from XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX for {$410.00} which I paid on time for {$410.00} and my assumption was that interest charged on purchases within that period was part of that {$410.00} so I was happy to pay it. By the way interest charged on purchases within that period was {$210.00}. Next Payment XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX for {$400.00}. I was happy to pay it as well thinking interest charged on purchases was included in the Monthly Minimum Payment. By the way interest charged on purchases for that period was {$210.00} which is basically interest charged on outstanding balance. Next Payment XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX for {$420.00}. Which I will be paying in a week. I Interest charged on purchases for that period is {$220.00}. I later called them to ask how my Monthly Minimum Payment was being calculated and they said my Monthly Minimum Payment only applies towards the {$7700.00} that I transferred into my checking account and interest charges on purchases are basically capitalized so I am paying interest on interest every month. I told them that is illegal because a monthly minimum payment on a credit card must include interest payment for the period and they said no it was the responsibility that I took upon myself since I signed on to the promotion. My question is, how is it my responsibility to calculate how much interest I incur on purchases every month and add it to interest on previous balance then plan to pay it above whatever the bank dictates my Minimum Statement is based on the {$7700.00} I transferred. This does not make any logical sense and {$410.00} every month is a lot to pay on a 0 % APR card, just towards the principal. I called Bank of America and told them this smells like Fraud and the representative did not deny it only that he said I signed up for it. I decided to call XXXX XXXX and asked them what their opinion was on the issue and they said monthly Interest payment must be added into a Monthly Minimum Payment. Bank of America is capitalizing the monthly interest and making it difficult for me to make payments on the higher outstanding balance of {$12000.00} ( with Higher APR ) by keeping my Monthly Minimum Payment on the 0 % APR close to {$500.00} a month. They know that it would be difficult for me to make such a high monthly payment ( {$500.00} ) and still be able to pay towards the outstanding balance with high APR. This is fraud of the highest order and the 0 % APR was the trap.

Consumer complaint narrative: This is a complaint that Bank of America had error about posting deposit and false posting information and posting date then lost my money in my account. Bank of America or a person of the bank had changed informations from depodits to an account to a bank credits then robbed customer money in the account by debit it. Customer name is XXXX XXXX, account number XXXX with social security XXXX. On or about X/XX/17 there were small deposits on same days value about 600, 900 and 1500 with small amounts add up to total same days for those amounts. The bank had posted those as bank credits then later used 3 fake claims to steal all money in my account. This is robbing customer money with trustworthy to put money in the bank. I lost my money of the fake claims. The transactions came from a person loan me money then changed to bank credit from other merchants not associate with the transactions. This is fraud, robbing and stealing customer money in the account. The matter had been explainef to the bank but no return yet. It had been reported to FDIC, FBI and also now the consumer finance protection bureau. I nned my money return to me and credit for all fee associated to the lost.

I have a credit card from Bank of America. It is a XXXX credit line that requires pay off each month. For approx. ten years I have had card and used it for the rewards. <P/>I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, that Bank of America had closed my account because I had too many open trade lines, and had high balances on other cards. <P/>Never missed a payment or been late on this account. ( or others in the last 2 years ) Letter indicated any rewards I had would be forfeited. I had XXXX points in rewards. I did not close the account, nor did I do anything to invoke having my account closed- I know you have accounts at the " leisure '' of the financial institution, but without being guilty of any type of misconduct, I feel it is inappropriate for them to keep my points, I earned them via XXXX XXXX, which I PAID for since I paid the balance off each month. This was not a revolver, so if its paid, the rewards are earned. <P/>This is a terrible way to take advantage of customers. This is Bank of America.
I need Bank of America too send the right amount from checkings too XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had a checking account at Bank of America. On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX the bank issued a check with {$560.00}, that was my balance on my account. When I tried to collect the money, the bank returned the check back on XX/XX/XXXX with the stamp unpaid. The reason : refer to maker. I called check department from Bank of America and they told me that no check on my bank account was issued ever and my account is closed. This means that somebody in the Bank of America has falsified this check!
Please, help me to collect my money from the bank.

With reference to Bank of America 's letter no. XXXX I made 2 deposits of {$250.00} each from my retirement account within 90 days of opening the account. The letter clearly states that deposits made from a retirement account qualify for the promotion. Bank of America is contending that the deposit was not made from a retirement account. The bank is even refusing to accept some sort of proof from me showing the deposits are from a retirement account. The letter entitles me for {$100.00} bonus.

I XXXX searched, " Best Credit Cards for XX/XX/XXXX '' the week of XX/XX/XXXX. My desire was to find a new credit card with 0 % purchase period for extended period of time and offer possible cash reward. This financial plan was going to afford me flexibility in paying off my other credit cards in a timely manor without accruing interest on new purchases. After extensive searching, I applied for two credit cards on XX/XX/XXXX through the webpage XXXX. The first card opened was  a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The second card, the problematic and conditional card, was a BankAmericard XXXX provided by Bank of America ( BofA ). I copied verbatim the terms and conditions of the BankAmericard offered through XXXX  and placed it in my notes section of my XXXX. Here is the summary of the offer as stated by XXXX as of my application date of XX/XX/XXXX : '' 0 % Intro Purchases APR until XX/XX/XXXX, 0 % Intro APR for Balance Transfers made within the first 60 days and then 3 % fee for Balance Transfers after May 25, 2017 '' ... meaning, the interest rate would increase to 18.49 % in XX/XX/XXXX after 19 months. Bank of America said I could immediately begin making purchases, so I did. XX/XX/XXXX I received the actual card in the mail I activated it at XXXX hours. By late XX/XX/XXXX I received my first credit card statement and no interest was charged. Payment was made greater than the minimum payment due on XX/XX/XXXX, due dateXX/XX/XXXX. I continued to make essential and non-essential purchases up to this point. The later part of XX/XX/XXXX I received another bill, which is when I noted interest accruing to my account at a high percentage rate of 18.74 %! This was not in my 0 % Intro Purchase APR agreement with Bank of America or XXXX, so I paid greater than my minimum balance and phoned Bank of America. I spoke with XXXX from Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX at  XXXX hours and asked why the terms and conditions had changed since my initial sign up and she said to send a copy of the offer or offers closest to the offer I applied for and fax to her supervisor, XXXX XXXX ( Manager of BofA )XXXXXXXX for further investigation. It took a couple weeks for me to learn how to screen shot from my XXXX, but I came up with several different pages worth of offers from various websites that detailed the exact offer I signed up for, the only exception was my initial offer stated 19 months 0 % Intro Purchase APR and the other offers I found stated 15 months 0 % Intro Purchase APR. I did the leg work and was ready to submit via fax to Bank of America the information they requested. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX hours I printed off the offers and faxed to XXXX XXXX at BofA to XXXX for him to investigate further. I sent several screen shots of my offer, a letter detailing my excellent history with Bank of America and summary of the terms and conditions of the BankAmericard I applied for as advertised by XXXX and plea to rectify the situation. To add insult to an already stressful financial situation, I had to utilize an outside business to transmit the fax because Bank of America does n't have a client-based email system and it cost me another {$9.00} and change for such transaction! After providing all proof and pertinent information to Bank of America per their request, I thought my credit card terms and situation would lead to a full rectification, reimbursement of accruing interest and reinstatement of initial offer. However, the evening of XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, I received a phone call from XXXX XXXX, XXXX at BofA, telling me he received the information and his plan was to look through everything I 'd provided, for him to make his final determination on the status of my account. He 'd return my phone call with the verdict either later that night or next day. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX, XXXX XXXX phoned to say, " The screen shots '' I 'd offered and faxed to him " were only valid after XX/XX/XXXX '' and they " were n't sufficient '' to reinstate the initial terms and conditions of the card offer because they " were n't date stamped ''. I explained to XXXX XXXX again that I 'd copied verbatim the terms and conditions, but my proof did n't have a date stamp either. So, his suggestion was to, " Contact XXXX to get the offer they released on their website '' to show proof of the offer I originally applied for, " then resubmit '' to Bank of America and his private fax number. Per XXXX XXXX 's suggestion, I immediately looked up the business number to XXXX  and phoned them. XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX hours I left a detailed message at phone number XXXX to a voice mail box of XXXX XXXX Since I had n't received a response from anyone at XXXX over the weekend, I tried again to reach their customer service department, per their website, on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX hours, I left another detailed message with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX at XXXX hours I phoned XXXX and left more detailed messages for them to return my imperative phone call. Additionally, on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX hours I sent a message via email from the XXXX XXXX to customer service and still have yet to receive any kind of response from any of the XXXX company or employees. At this point, I feel like I 've been taken advantage of financially, emotionally and physically, so let me explain why I 'm filing this complaint. It is unjust enrichment for large internet companies like XXXX and financial institutions like Bank of America to continue operating when offering false advertising of XXXX percent interest rates on purchases for extended months, XXXX percent balance transfers within a short time period, changes to terms and conditions without adhering to initial advertised rates, all while benefiting financially from the well-intended consumer. I 'm outraged at the hoops I 've had to jump through in an attempt to rectify this situation. As it stands, there has been no compensation to right this financial wrong by either company. I 'm accruing interest at an alarming rate, despite my great credit score, all while I 've had to seek out the solution independently because these big companies ca n't be honest, stick to their word, or remain transparent! I would have never signed up for a card knowing I 'd be charged high interest on purchases from day one. I did n't  really need another card because I already have multiple cards with low interest rates. The whole appeal of this BankAmericard was the offered 0 % Intro Purchase APR for 19 months! I 'm appalled to be told I have to work harder to find the solution to Bank of America 's mistake. I 've done everything that 's been asked of me and then more. I pay my bills on time, have great credit, live a deceit-free life and give generously to the world. Emotionally this experience has left me wanting to close all my credit cards, withdraw my money from every financial institution/investment and sue the pants off Bank of America and XXXX! I 'm not a XXXX consumer!!! I thoroughly investigated each credit offer and took all the appropriate steps before signing up for a new credit card. To be embroiled in falsified advertising makes me very angry and hate big business! Sadly, I was n't even respected enough as a consumer to be provided a return curtesy call, after multiple attempts, to rectify this unjust situation by XXXX. Then there 's the physical side to this nonsensical dishonesty ... I 'm XXXX from an XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The fact that Bank of America required me to send documents and correspondence via fax ONLY, instead of allowing the ease and use of email is beyond me. All of these documents could have been sent promptly to BofA if they would have accepted an emailed version. It is n't an easy task for me to gather my personal/financial information, feel secure sending said information via random fax number, to said manager at BofA, then be turned down and told they could n't remedy their error with the information I worked so hard to gather. I 've had to physically travel to gather/send information causing great hardship to my already XXXX XXXX and the stress of the situation has also caused me to have an uptick in stress headaches. My hope is for the government, through whatever methods can be utilized and successful, stop companies like XXXX and Bank of America from falsely advertising rates, terms and conditions, penalize this atrocious behavior, right the wrong to the customer/consumer by reinstating initial offers, waive high interest credit card accruement to allow the consumer to regain financial independence and set an example for ethical business practices to ensure our economy will thrive. Please contact me if there are any further questions or details needed to ameliorate this complaint/process.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This account was disputed because the first date of delinquency was reported incorrectly by Bank of America, N.A. Neither XXXX nor XXXX were able to verify the first date of delinquency reported by Bank of America, N.A. and deleted the account from my record.
FCRA 623 ( a ) prohibits furnishers of information from reporting information to a credit reporting agency if the furnisher knows or has reason to believe that the information is inaccurate. The statute defines reason to believe that the information is inaccurate to mean specific knowledge, other than solely allegations by the consumer, that would cause a reasonable person to have substantial doubts as to the accuracy of the information ( 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and ( D ) ). The deletion of the account by XXXX and XXXX because of their inability to verify the information casts substantial doubt as to the accuracy of the first date of delinquency being reported by Bank of America, N.A.
According to XXXX, dispute results are not shared by credit reporting agencies because only the business knows which of the consumer reporting agencies have received disputed information ( see attached ). Bank of America has failed to notify XXXX that the information they are reporting regarding this account was deleted by XXXX and XXXX because they were unable to verify the first date of delinquency reported by Bank of America, N.A.

I demand this blatant abuse be stopped or I 'll be contacting legal counsel.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I applied online for the Bank of America XXXX XXXX Signature Visa and all of the benefits that come with that specific card. I was instead automatically approved for an XXXX XXXX Visa  Platinum plus card with a different annual fee and none of the benefits. Thinking this was a mistake, I applied again for the XXXX Visa Signature Card and the application went pending. I called BofA to see what was going on and they said they could approve me for the Visa Plat if i chose to. I chose not to but asked to have someone else look at my application for the Visa Signature card. He they asked if I consented to have my application reconsidered and i said yes. He then approved me for the other card, a Visa Platinum and claimed that I had never applied for the Visa Signature. I was escalated to a supervisor and she claimed my XXXX credit score and XXXX  income did not qualify me for the Visa  Signature and they decided to automatically approve me for a card that was not marketed at all on their application page. BAIT AND SWITCH. This is very deceptive. Definitely a UDAAP issue. I did some research online and there are HUNDREDS of other people who have complained about this same deceptive marketing practice. If you look at the link below, you will see advertising for ONLY the Visa Signature card and not the inferior yet still expensive Visa Platinum. There is no mention of the Platinum benefits or fees because they are inferior and nobody would apply knowing that they could be approved for the inferior card.
<P/> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I never wanted the XXXX XXXX XXXX Platinum with a {$50.00} annual fee and sub-par benefits . Nor did I apply for it. Yet somehow I was approved for TWO of  them. I closed them but do not want them reported on my Credit Report.

I have written XXXX County Superior Court to no avail. Although I do still owe the money, these companies are breaking the law by double dipping. Why the courts protect the big banks over XXXX XXXX persons is a serious injustice and I would like to see accountability in this matter. Part of being XXXX is to say that I am no longer able to work, notwithstanding money is in short supply. As such, hiring an attorney to get these liens off of my title is not an option. Thank you!

This is a reply to Bank of America, NA 's ( BANA )  response to Complaint No. XXXX submitted by XXXX XXXX XXXX. When fraud on the court exists, the orders issued by those courts are void. The courts were lead to believe that BANA had standing to pursue this foreclosure based in part on an affidavit attested to by someone who obviously had no personal knowledge of the facts or actually reviewed the account record. Specifically, the affiant did not review the mortgage document that clearly defines when the loan becomes delinquent. Banks have been afforded far more deference by the courts than they deserve considering the industry was riddled with fraud at the height of the mortgage crisis. In fact, BANA signed a Consent Order drafted by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency ( OCC ) after an examination revealed flagrant abuses where affidavits were obviously signed by someone other than someone with personal knowledge or reviewed the facts. Similarly XXXX XXXX XXXX, who responded to this complaint, had no personal knowledge or provided no evidence that she reviewed the facts. She was the attorney of record but was not the litigating attorney. My records from the numerous proceedings indicate that she never opened any of the motions I filed with the XXXX County XXXX Circuit Court when the cases were opened. Someone with personal knowledge of the facts should have responded to this complaint. Anyone can get a copy of a docket sheet and summarize. BANA filed or caused to be filed in federal and state courts, an affidavit in which the affiant represents that the assertions in the affidavit was based on personal knowledge or review. Under Michigan law, affidavits recorded with the register of deeds may be received as evidence in any civil matter and serves as prima facie evidence of the facts ( MCL 565.453 ). Prima facie evidence is sufficient to raise a presumption unless disproved or disputed. Despite being rebutted, the court presumed it was an accurate accounting of the facts. The response to my complaint is inadequate and fails to explain issues that are at the heart of this dispute such as : 1 ) Why BANA believes the loan first became delinquent in XXXX 2012. 2 ) Why BANA believes they do not have to respond to my Qualified Written Request sent prior to the foreclosure.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My account was closed on XXXX/XXXX/2012 due to suspected fraud activity in the amount of {$97.00}.
I was never notified of this and only discovered this information by accessing my XXXX XXXX report. When I have contacted the bank, they have no information on how I can resolve this issue.
Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MO XXXX

OnXX/XX/XXXX, I received a phone call from an unknown number calling to collect a debt I supposedly owed Bank of America. I vaguely remember paying Bank of America off years ago for an non payment on a previous account. They told me some information they had, and it sounded legitimate. They told me I had to settle debt soon before having legal action taken against me. I agreed to make multiple payments. I made 3 payments, on XXXX, X/XX/17, and X/XX/17 and received a paid in full letter via email. The case manager gave a name and number to call, but I misplaced them. In an attempt to call them just to follow up, I looked up the creditor and called which only brought me to an automated system and directing me to voicemail each time. I looked up my bank information and tried calling the number associated with XXXX XXXX XXXX who collected from my account, the same issue. I printed my latest credit report and saw nothing about this debt I owed at all.

I used two balance transfer promotional offers from Bank of America, one that expired onXX/XX/XXXXand the other active until XX/XX/XXXX. On the first offer, I was charged an interest of {$60.00} on a remaining balance of {$3500.00} on my XX/XX/XXXX -XX/XX/XXXX statement ( APR = 20.74 % therefore, interest = 20.74/XXXX*30/365* {$3500.00} = {$60.00} ). I then made a payment of {$3600.00} onXX/XX/XXXX. Any payment in excess of the minimum monthly payment is supposed to go to the account with higher APR first. My total balance at this time was {$6900.00} and the minimum payment required was {$120.00}. I also made a purchase of {$240.00} in this billing cycle ( purchase APR = 17.74 % ). I was expecting the balance on my first balance transfer to be lowered by around $ 3600.00- {$120.00} = {$3400.00} which will make it $ XXXX- {$3400.00} = {$63.00} or somewhere around that going forward. However, my XX/XX/XXXX -XX/XX/XXXXstatement shows this balance to be {$2300.00} and I was charged interest of {$41.00} on that ( 20.74/XXXX*31/365* {$2300.00} ). I believed this was an error and hoping that it will be rectified, I called the bank onXX/XX/XXXX. After longer than an hour on the phone and transferring between three customer service agents, all I got was that they basically admit that it is a mistake but were unable to correct it. One agent even mentioned the {$2300.00} is not a real balance, but it is a projection. However, the interest it accrued is added to my total balance of {$3600.00} ( {$6900.00} - {$3600.00} + {$240.00} + {$41.00} + {$1.00} ). You can also see that it is a bogus number because my total balance currently is {$3600.00} but the balances on the two balance transfer offers are written on my latest statement as {$2300.00} and {$3300.00}, which wo n't add up. The final agent mentioned the previous agent has tried to initiate a refund and she was not successful. Then he told me that I would get a detailed explanation of how I got charged the interest through mail with options to go forward. Today I received a letter datedXX/XX/XXXXfrom Bank of America and to my surprise, the letter stops mid sentence trying to explain the reason I was charged interest. This is appalling and it looked borderline fraudulent in all honesty. To make sure that the letter is indeed as it was, I called the bank again today and the first agent confirmed that it is sent from them. She in fact tried to tell me the reason I was charged interest and stopped midway. She said she was attempting to read me from the letter! Then she transferred me to another agent ( named XXXX ) and it was the same thing all over again. I asked the amount I needed to pay on the next payment date ( which is XX/XX/XXXX ) to avoid paying interest and the amounts I was told range from {$55.00} to {$3300.00} plus. All did n't make sense though because of the bogus calculation on my current statement that I explained above. I asked for an email address to address my concern further up but was told that I had to do that from my account but the online support is no longer available from there. And there is no way of contacting the bank by email in this day and age! Then I requested the agent to file a complaint/claim on my behalf or escalate my case to her superiors. After trying for a while, I was told that that was impossible too. I then indicated my intention to file a complaint but other than asking for apology, there is nothing that the agent was able to do to solve the issue. I am afraid that the bank will continue to charge me interest on non-existent balance whatever amount I pay next. Therefore, I am forced to file this complaint with the hope that I get a fair resolution. Please refer to my bank statements that I referred above and the letter I received today. Comparing the two statements clearly shows the glaring mistake that I tried my best to explain above.

Consumer complaint narrative: Sir : On XXXX XXXX,2017 I was out of town, on a vacation, five hundred miles from my residence in XXXX XXXX. A letter arrived from Bank of America, regarding insufficient funds in one checking account. I reacted to The message immediately upon the date of this notice. I was not able to cancel my vacation therefore I applied for help at the nearest branch of Bank of America in XXXX, Nevada. The branch manager whom I spoke with informed me that the processing of this transaction was delayed only temporarily and my account funded later when I returned in two days. The information was incorrect and I should not be penalized for their error.
I used XXXX to get money before my pay day and it made my account negative {$26.00}.

Bank of America, Your company has been falsely reporting three accounts that are due to identity theft. A mortgage loan, home line of equity, and a personal credit card through your bank. I had started to dispute these items once i saw them on my credit report after obtaining credit after turning XXXX years old. As of XX/XX/17, Bank of America, has resolved my disputes against these claims of identity theft and has cleared them off my XXXX and XXXX report. These accounts are under a different name, with my SSN, opened years before I had turned XXXX. BOA seems to have noticed the inaccuracies since they were deleted off XXXX CRA 's, but XXXX is still reporting. I disputed the Line of Equity and Mortgage that remain on my XXXX credit file on X/XX/17 only to be contacted by BOA saying the accounts are accurate. When I call BOA the fraud line representative advises there are no accounts anymore with my SSN in the system. Which is why he advise I dispute, and the accounts should come off since they are not in the BOA system anymore. However, after I disputed again they 're verified somehow and being reported still as fradulent and whenever I dispute the claim comes back as " remains '' on report. I have sent in my police report, SSN, CA drivers license, and proof of identity. It seems BOA acknowledges that these accounts are not mine but will not remove them from reporting to XXXX only. XXXX advised me they have not received any updated reporting status to delete these accounts, and BOA is still reporting as OPEN.

I sold tickets on XXXX. Two days AFTER the event, the buyers reported to XXXX that my tickets did not work. I tried settling it out with XXXX and did what they asked me to do. I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX ( the venue ) to ask for a scan report for the event and my tickets, and they told me they are unable to send me the scan report because they do not keep scan reports. I then contacted XXXX ( original ticket selling website for the event ) and asked them for a scan report and they told me they do not have scan reports for the event. I emailed XXXX all of my conversation transcripts with both XXXX XXXX and XXXX. I also emailed my original order receipt for the event. XXXX emailed me back saying they understand that it is beyond my reach to obtain the scan reports. Then I saw on my bank account that they immediately took out the money from my bank account. I asked XXXX for proof that the buyers really were not able to get in with my tickets, and any other proof that they did not just reported me just to get their money back even though they got in to the event. XXXX NEVER replied to my email after they have already taken out the money from my bank account. XXXX did not show me proof that the buyers were not lying, and I did everything I could to cooperate and get all the information that I could. I disputed this charge to Bank of America, but they decided to close the case in favor of XXXX. I would like Bank of America to research this further and help me obtain the proof that I am asking from XXXX.

I had a XXXX credit card limit on my Bank of America card. A XXXX balance I owe. I have been with them since 2008 and never been 30 days late, also re-paid all XXXX balances on time. Just now they made my credit limit exactly what I owe. Damaging my credit report as if I maxed my card to the limit. I have always paid back and never been late, they had no reason to reduce my limit after just raising it.
