Why should my credit score go down on an inquiry for a limit I already had? I have an XXXX XXXX with a limit way higher than that.

Bank of America has committed gross violations of Title X of of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of XX/XX/XXXX ( the Act ) which established the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and any and all referenced regulations and laws endorsed by this Act. The violations include as a minimum the following which are explicitly prohibited by the Act : unfair, deceptive, and/or abusive acts and practices in connection with consumer products and services and various other consumer laws and implementing regulations as endorsed by the Act. The CFPB is requested to initiate legal proceedings against Bank of America for intentionally, knowingly, and willful violations of the Act. <P/>The following are a few of the acts committed by Bank of America, and there are others which should be addressed in the prosecution of Bank of America and this investigation. The consumer will provide these upon request. <P/>1. Bank of America deceptively, unfairly, and abusively attempted to collect and even reported to the CFPB that merchant service cancellation fees were due when in fact they were previously waived by the merchant, XXXX XXXX. <P/>2. Bank of America deceptively, unfairly, and abusively attempted to collect charges for XXXX XXXX Equipment which in fact had been previously returned to the Merchant, XXXX XXXX. <P/>3. Bank of America unfairly and abusively attempted to charge the credit account when in fact the credit account was previously closed and the merchant account was also previously closed. There was no remaining contractual relationship between the consumer, Bank of America, and XXXX XXXX. These are clearly invalid charges. <P/>4. Bank of America submitted a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX to CFPB with numerous items, many are meaningless facts with virtually no relevance to the matter at hand and they appear to be an attempt to misrepresent ( deception ) the situation, BUT Bank of America deceptively ( by omission ) omits numerous phone calls by the credit card holder to them describing the situation, the required action, the prohibited tasks, and numerous other facts related to the dispute. <P/>XXXX. Bank of America failed to exercise due diligence in investigating the dispute, and as a result they abused the consumer by filing false ( deceptive ) claims against the consumer 's credit records with the Credit Bureaus. Bank of America committed gross negligence in performing their responsibilities as required by the Act. <P/>6. Bank of America failed to review ( deception by omission ) the contracts and recognize that the actual contracts were not discernible as to the consumer responsibilities as a result of the way they were presented to consumer, signed by consumer, and executed. This is again a failure to do due diligence by Bank of America, and fails to meet requirements of the Act. <P/>7. Bank of America failed to recognize that there was NO CONTRACT or credit agreement open between consumer and Bank of America at the time the paid XXXX XXXX. Bank of America had NO contract with XXXX XXXX, and therefore they were not authorized in any way to pay funds on behalf of consumer. This is unfair and abusive per the Act. <P/>8. Bank of America 's letter dated XX/XX/XXXX was totally inadequate to justify their position and actions regarding payment to XXXX XXXX, reimbursement by consumer, and filing reports to the Credit Reporting Agencies. <P/>SUMMARY : Bank of America 's actions clearly show they have willfully, knowingly, and intentionally violated Title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of XX/XX/XXXX( the Act ) in this matter. The violations include unfair, deceptive, and/or abusive actions which are explicitly prohibited by the Act. A formal enforcement investigation the CFPB is fully warranted and justified by Bank of America 's actions. T Consumers should be protected by such illegal behavior, and the full extent of the law and regulations should be used to demonstrate that not only is Bank of America not allowed to violate the law in this manner with no consequences, but no other credit or banking agencies should be allowed to perform these actions without being held accountable.. <P/>Regards, XXXX XXXX XXXX

My ex-husband and I purchased a home in 2001. Shortly after, we divorced. In the divorce, he was granted the home, and assumed all debt related to said property. I have submitted court documentation to the mortgage company multiple times, yet they continue to report this debt as mine. I am now in the process of trying to purchase a home for myself, and am practically unable to do so because this account is being reported on my credit report as a delinquent debt, and as a large debt that is artificially inflating my debt/income ratio.

Currently use my bank account with a third party company called XXXX XXXX. I make withdrawals from them, and then they take the payment from my bank account. Well my bank account does not report my balance to them accurately, which causes a delay in using their services. Every time there is a delay, they lower the amount I can borrow. My bank also takes longer than any other bank I have ever used in order to post transactions. Which causes me to overdraft almost weekly.

On XX/XX/XXXX I received yet another marketing email from Bank of America ( BofA ) for the BofA app. On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, complaint # XXXX. To summarize, in this complaint, I documented numerous attempts prior to XXXX/XXXX/XXXX to have BofA stop sending me marketing email, specifically marketing email pertaining to the BofA app. On XX/XX/XXXX, BofA responded and said, In consideration of your request, we have manually refused the option for the mobile application on your behalf on our system of record and this took place on XX/XX/XXXX, Please allow up to 48 business hours for the changes to be fully effective. In addition, please be advised we have recorded your request again to no longer receive solicitations from Bank of America. After their response to me on XX/XX/XXXX, I received another marketing email from BofA about the BofA app. On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed another complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, complaint # XXXX. To summarize, in this complaint, I pointed out that BofA did not honor their commitment to me as stated in their response to me on XX/XX/XXXX - the commitment to discontinue sending me email pertaining to the BofA app. On XX/XX/XXXX, BofA responded and said, While our enclosed previous response confirmed that the Do Not Email privacy choice was previously captured twice, a third Do Not Email privacy choice request was captured on XX/XX/XXXX. All privacy choices are honored within 30 days, with the exception of Do Not Mail requests which could take up to 12 weeks. In their previous responses to me, BofA considers the endless marketing of the BofA app as being part of my account ( and part of my account agreement with them ), and thus not marketing. However, as BofA well knows, the BofA app merely functions as an add on product and/or service. A product/service that BofA is well aware I dont need and dont want. Yet the BofA app continues to be aggressively marketed to my XXXX inbox. BofA has shown, time and again, they will continue to not honor my preferences, and not honor their commitment to me. This is exclusive to BofA. No other bank I do business with has ever done this or currently does this.

XX/XX/XXXX Bank of America Dispute Resolution Services Claim number # XXXX To CFPB I have some major concerns regarding the review and/or investigation conducted by Bank of America because a decision was made to close the claim based on evidence that you received from XXXX XXXX XXXX and not the consumer. The claim was filed XX/XX/XXXX and I received a temporary credit of {$4600.00} and again on XX/XX/XXXX. Im requesting additional investigating and in regard to resolving error of an unauthorized credit charge against my XXXX card. I have made several attempts to resolve this claim, however Bank of America indicated that they are siding with the merchant. I informed the representation at Bank of America that I didnt give permission for the merchant to credit my XXXX card for {$4600.00}. I also questioned if the merchant provided documentation with my authorization, however the representative stated that they dont care about the signature and I needed to get an Attorney. I have provided documentation to show that the parties in question charging my card without my authorization. XXXX XXXX provide documents that were altered and it was acceptable to Bank of America. Also, I provided a written contract with my signature, but I was informed by the representative that Bank of America doesnt review signatures because they are not liable for making sure signatures are valid on documents. The merchant submitted altered evidence that you are accepting as proof of wrongful doing. These facts should have been taken into consideration for the reasons listed below : A. The letter dated XX/XX/XXXX states that I provided information to your department to be reviewed by someone in dispute department, however the letter stated that have tried to work with the merchant to get the funds back, but all options have failed. I called Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX to inform them that they accepted alter documents and I provided some documentation including the official contract showing that I did not give them authorization to withdraw funds from my account. I indicated that I thought my funds were insured by FDIC and I was a victim of fraudulent activity. The representative stated that I would have to hire an Attorney to get my money back from the merchant. B. The letter dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX states that the temporary credit for {$4600.00} would be reversed based on evidence that you received from XXXX XXXX that were altered and changed. Two transactions were withheld from my checking account of {$950.00} and {$4600.00}. I gave authorization for {$950.00}, but I did not give authorization for XXXX to withdraw {$4600.00} from my checking account. C. I did not give XXXX XXXX permission to process charges on my debit card under the Electronic Funds Transfer Act. Therefore, this was an unauthorized purchase initiated by XXXX XXXX " without actual authority to initiate such transfer. '' During a review of our Reg E dispute process handling failed and is in violation within the 45 day period. D. XXXX informed us that they would pack our furniture on XX/XX/XXXX and delivery the furniture to our new home on XX/XX/XXXX ; however, after the first day of the move, the company threatens to keep our furniture unless we paid additional money to get our furniture delivery at the date that was agreed in the contract. I refused to pay any additional funds, so they made a decision to move our furniture. Later, I found out that XXXX XXXX charged my card. I immediately filed a police report and a complaint with the Department of Transportation because I didnt agree to pay additional funds or sign another contract. E. The claim was filed on XX/XX/XXXX and investigated until XX/XX/XXXX, but my acknowledgement letter states that the investigation would take 45 days to complete which this dispute is violation of Regulation E. The letter was sent to the Merchant on XX/XX/XXXX which delayed the completion of the investigation. The bank should have investigated the unauthorized debit card charges within 10 days of receiving notification from me. Bank of America has determined to reclaim the money without a full investigation. F. The letter dated XX/XX/XXXX states that the charges were approved by the customer ; however, I never agreed or signed any documents giving XXXX XXXX authorization to withdraw {$4500.00} from my XXXX. Two transactions were posted to my account. I did agree to pay the down payment of {$950.00} and XXXX XXXX with my XXXX, however I did not authorize the second transaction. Im providing several emails from XXXX XXXX still requesting my authorization to use my debit/credit card that is still requesting currently. G. The letter dated XX/XX/XXXX is not the contract that I agreed upon and Im including a copy of the original contract that I agree upon with XXXX XXXX. The contract that you received from XXXX XXXX has been altered such as the total charges based on the prior estimate, the first line of the amount, the total estimated charges, and the shipper/agent/representative date has been altered, this is not my signature and I did not sign this document. The document that was received by XXXX is an estimate document and the numbers have been altered. I sent the original contract to Bank of America showing the agreed upon cost. H. The 2nd page of the bill of lading contract is a falsified document because I did not sign this document, nor did I agree to the amounts listed on the estimate document. I. The email document has also been altered because I didnt send an email or forward an email to XXXX agreeing to any of the terms listed within the contract that you received from XXXX XXXX. Also, has anyone noticed that some of the information has be redacted and written all over by someone at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX invoice is falsified document and the information was forged by the company because I did not agree in writing or verbally to pay {$15000.00} to this company, however I did agree to pay {$9500.00} to XXXX XXXX which is writing. The written contract shows the correct amount. K. Im not sure why Bank of America accepted the explanation from XXXX XXXX stating that services were handled at 100 % because I tried to resolve my dispute before filing a dispute, but the company would not apply a credit to my bank account. I have filed two police reports and filed a claim to the Motor of Transportation showing that we were taken advantage by XXXX XXXX XXXX and they should be held accountable and reported for the falsified information that they have submitted to your dispute department. There were unauthorized charges made with my debit card against my bank account and I shouldnt be held liable. Once the documents were reviewed that you received from XXXX as evidence ( Did you question why the amounts and dates were altered? Did you validate the signatures on the documents? Did you request documents from the consumer? Did you review the date the complaint was filed and verify if you were in compliance of Regulation E, and UDAPP? Did you verify consents in writing for credit card charges used with for the debit transactions against my bank account? I plan to file complaints against Bank of America to the following : Federal Trade Commission Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Another police report A complaint with Bank of America Remove all my funds from accounts at Bank of America File and disclose reputational risk You are in violation of Regulation E and Unfair Deceptive Acts and Practice ( UDAAP ) and keep the credit of {$4600.00} permanently. If you have any additional questions, please contact me at ( XXXX ) XXXX. XXXX XXXXComplaints from consumers help us detect patterns of fraud and abuse. Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America and I have talked about how their representatives told me what I owed back in XXXX 2016 and after paying what they said I owed, they reported me 30/60/90 days late, knowing full well this was false. I was misled and now they are purposely reporting false information as some type of retaliation for what reason I have no idea. Bank of America 's customer service is horrible and they are misleading credit agencies by using all the reporting agencies to punish me for something I did based on what THEY told me to do. It makes no sense!

Consumer complaint narrative: My Bank of America account was charged a {$35.00} fee on XXXX XXXX 2017 for an overdraft of {$170.00} on the same date which brought my account to a negative balance of - {$210.00}. On XXXX XXXX 2017 the account was still overdrawn for that amount when I came in as I always do to cash my paycheck of {$710.00}, expecting to pay off the negative balance and take the rest out in cash, but the representative told me she would be unable to cash my check. I explained that this is unusual and asked why and she replied that it was the system not allowing me to cash the check. The best she could do was give me {$200.00} of my check. I said no thank you I will go cash it else where out of frustration for no being able to have access to my money as I needed the funds so I choose to the other local branch just down the street.Unfortunately it was just closing but I had the opportunity to speak with a representative who said the end of the business day was XXXX XXXX for those ATM at the branch, so if I did not want to incur an other {$35.00} extended overdraft fee I could still deposit my paycheck which was important to me as well. So I chose to deposit the check and had then expected to be allowed to use {$200.00} of my check deposit and instead falsely stated I had {$300.00} available now of which $ {$60.00} was the only amount I managed to withdraw. When went online to get a better idea of what was going on since the receipt would not show my available balance and why the bank held funds that are usually treated as cash I found nothing to justify it. The only transactions at the time was the same as it I was required to pay as I did on the XXXX of XXXX 2017, and could have been deducted immediately after deposit my check via ATM or even by phone as long as it was before XXXX that day. My online Bank of America account stated on XXXX XXXX 2017 a deposit for {$710.00} was made of which {$300.00} was availble now and {$410.00} was being held as credit pending to cover items posted on the XXXX XXXX 2017. The account reflected a {$300.00} credit to my account which should have been avail now and was not. I believe I should have been able to cash my paycheck as always. After bringing the account out of negative status should I have received the remaining portion of my check ( {$490.00} ) if there was nothing else that could have been pending at that time as there was no existing transactions or any type of authorizations from the time of the overdraft date and had no reason to prompt such a hold.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have had a credit account with Bank of America for two years. During that time I have made payments with my XXXX Checking account which I had set up to use. Several months ago, my daughter added me as a secondary to her Bank of America Checking account. Since then my payment of XXXX was deactivated on their end, I was advised that I had to electronically resubmit my checking account number. When I did their system burst multiple verification numbers, so that when I attempted to verify, the Bank of America server locked out my account number. I am told that even though it was their mistake, they ca n't do anything about it. As a person with a XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX, I know this is not the case. They are telling me I have to be even more inconvenienced and I have to print a form to mail to them. Since I currently am without a printer I asked them if I could receive the form at a Bank of America branch. They told me I could n't because they were a separate entity. If that truly is the case then my payment method should not have been deactivated by above actions. I am not comfotable going to a public computer to do this, which is what they are telling me I have to do. So, I have to wait until I have the ability to print this form electronically from my home before this problem can be resolved.

Around XXXX XXXX, 2013, I checked my accounts with Bank of America like I have done every morning. I had a joint checking acct with my son who was in college in XXXX at the time. The normal acct balance has always been low, since I was only able to afford to send him low amounts of money at a time. This morning when I checked the account, the balance was - {$880000.00}. I was shocked. I checked the transactions and they claimed that {$1500.00} was deposited early that morning, but they were a bunch of deductions taken. There was also a purchase of items over {$600.00} at a Rite Aid. All this happened in New York between the hours of XXXX - XXXX. I live in XXXX  and my son attends school in XXXX. I called BOA immediately to report there was some fraud going on. They took my information and I asked them to check the ATM to see who the person was that made the deposit and withdrawals. They deposited fake Money order and took out real money. I do n't know how they were able to do this. I had n't even has so much as a bounced check with them. I found that it was fraud through my son. They first cleaned out my checking and savings accounts and left me {$20.00}. I called and asked why did they take my money when I was the one who called and reported it. They told me " well as least we left you {$20.00} for gas. '' I was shocked they did that so fast without even investigating. Well, shortly after I completed all the necessary paperwork, they quickly send me a letter saying they did not believe that we did n't have anything to do with this. I thought the fraud department was suppose to investigate this. They place this on my record with XXXX XXXX even though I had absolutely nothing to do with this. I am unable to open an account now, and I am being treated like I committed a crime. I am currently looking for my documents. To show my complaint.

Consumer complaint narrative: Last Friday ( X/XX/2017 ) I went to a Bank of America located in XXXX XXXX XXXX Florida. I asked to withdraw XXXX to make a purchase from a private party and the teller told me that I could only withdraw XXXX. I had over XXXX in my checking account. I let the teller know I 'm actually a Vice President for Bank of America and I 've never heard of such a policy. <P/>I would not keep so much cash on deposit at Bank of America if I knew that I could n't get it out when I need it. Someone brought me into a Merrill Lynch marked office after the teller said he 'd get someone to help me. I 'm a ML client so I was hopeful that the Financial Advisor would be able to help me but it turned out that I was talking to the Branch Manager who was illegally working out of a Merrill Lynch office which is clearly against Bank policy. <P/>The Branch Manager " XXXX XXXX '' told me he could only let me withdraw XXXX. I ask him to give me an explanation of why I can not withdraw my own money and he told me since I work for Bank of America I should know what the policy is. I vehemently protested to the idea of limiting my teller withdrawals and if this was the case it would need to be disclosed properly to the consumer. <P/>I asked to see this supposed policy in writing and the Branch Manager refused to show me anything in writing. I let him know that this was a major offense and a breach of contract that I do not take lightly. I asked him how to submit a formal complaint against him and once again he tells me that since I work for the Bank that I should know how to complian against him. <P/>I ended up withdrawing XXXX since I had no choice and I immediately called the Bank HR department to complain. Bank HR forwarded my call to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX who they claim is an independent 3rd party. I have good reason to believe that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is actually a associate for hire that is paid to hide and even to suppress complaints. It has been 3 business days and I have still not heard back from either Bank of America or XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. <P/>I have been on a medical leave of absence for a few months and prior to going on leave I tried to report several compliance violations that I 've witnessed while working for Bank of America. I was treated very rudely by a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Supervisor and I luckily have a recording of the whole 3 1/2 hour phone call since the first Rep. I talked to gave me her permission to record. <P/>At this point I have no choice but to seek legal action on behalf of all the other employees and consumers that are being wronged by Bank of America. I would like to hear from someone in your organization to discuss these matters in greater detail. I am hoping that the CFPB will be able to help bring light to these matters.

I called when I discovered that the house was foreclosed. On XXXX XXXX, 2017, Bank of America ( BOA ) automatically charged our credit card account for a credit card payment of {$1600.00} AFTER we paid manually online -- billing us twice. We had made a request for automatic payment a year earlier, and it failed due to an issue with our other bank, and thus we did not have automatic payment set up. <P/>We complained, and the second charge was refunded on XXXX XXXX, 2017. BOA told us that for some reason, the automatic payment process had suddenly activated, thus generating the double billing. BOA claimed that the error with automatic billing was solved. <P/>When we later reviewed our statement, we saw that the amount appeared once again as a charge on XXXX XXXX, 2017. In a call on XXXX XXXX, 2017, XXXX from the Virginia office said that BOA had decided to apply the refunded amount to our current balance when it was originally refunded. They also refunded our other bank account separately. Thus they claim they paid us twice, and had to debit our account once again for {$1600.00} to account for the fact that they had used that amount to pay the past balance. <P/>The amount also improperly generated interest on the account. <P/>The misapplication of the refund to our current balance is a Books and Records violation, as is the failure to have a control in place for double-charging. BOA claimed that they have such a control, and that they " automatically '' refunded the discrepancy, but that did n't occur until we made a complaint and compelled them to acknowledge and correct the error. These lack of controls also allowed interest to be generated on the account during that period. <P/>It is not clear how they improperly activated automatic payment in the first place, and XXXX from the Virginia office refused to address that issue in the XX/XX/XXXX call, saying, " well, however it was done, whether we did it, or you did it, that 's what happened. '' This is after the previous call when another service representative acknowledged BOA had made an error and claimed that they had fixed it.

Consumer complaint narrative: Lot of nothing. The problem with the response is that I had an open claim, which doctors forms shown he was terminally. And I was told since I already have open claim that would transfer from XXXX to XXXX XXXX. I had an open claim that should have paid the card off because XXXX XXXX known that it was be death and was listed if over 12 month, it would pay off card.
Bank of America reports bogus information to XXXX even though I do n't owe them money

I 've been banking with Bank of America for 7 years and never had any problem until XX/XX/XXXX. {$1400.00} was stolen from my checking account ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). These were unauthorized withdraws. ... Incident took place in 3 different occasions ; XX/XX/XXXX as well as XX/XX/XXXX and or XX/XX/XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX, {$400.00} was withdrew at XXXX XXXX, XXXX NY. XXXX and or XX/XX/XXXX, {$200.00} and {$800.00} was also withdrew ( from XXXX XXXX XXXX Ny ). I knew about the incident through Bank of America, via a text message. On XX/XX/XXXX or XXXX, I got a text message from Bank of America saying that I should confirm a possible {$800.00} withdraw. I immediately replied to the text and alert the Bank about the fraudulent. The {$800.00} is suppose to be a 4th withdraw ... But, was declined because this unknown has reached my daily withdraw limit. 
I was asked to filed a claim which I did. 2 weeks after I filed the claim, Bank of America Fraud Department connected me. They asked what happened, I told them the truth. I told them that the debit card was in possession when the fraudulent activity occurred. I told them that I did not know who did it ( which is true ). I told them to pull the surveillance camera/footage ( all evidences are there ). Days after the phone interview, I got a letter saying that my case has been close ; that all transactions were posted correctly ... I was hurt. I was disappointed but I could't challenge their decision because my father was extremely sick at a time and all I care about was to keep my father alive. I took my father from one hospital to another but he later XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX, I lost my grandmother. XXXX XXXX I lost my job because I could't focus on the job.. I have been through a lot. I have lost a lot. I am not writing this letter to gain sympathy..I am writing this letter because I need my claim and case re-opened and properly investigated. It hurt that NO ONE from Bank of America Fraud Dept took some time to investigate my case.. Because if someone did, I would n't be writing this letter. I 'm kindly requesting that Bank of America pull the footage, survillance camera and pictures ( from the locations where all ATM withdraws occurred ) and properly review/ investigate my case. The debit card that was used to make these withdraws was n't mine. I was never in the area. No one else has access to my debit card or pin number ( I had my card on me when the fraudulent was going on. I am a victim of card skimmers. As previously stated, I have been banking with Bank of America for 7 years. I never withdrew money at XXXX XXXX and XXXX ; or XXXX XXXX. It will be greatly appreciated if the individual ( s ) involved are arrested for putting me through XXXX. No one deserve this. Lastly, I would like to see the footage of all withdraws that took place XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ( for the amounts stated above ).

Consumer complaint narrative: I have a loan through a financial institution that is set up on auto payment and comes out before the due date every month but on my credit report they show that I have been 30 days late on this account 4 times. I have tried disputing this with the bank in question as well as the three reporting credit bureaus but nothing has changed.

On X/XX/17 I reached a settlement agreement with Bank of America for the account ending in XXXX with an original balance of {$14000.00}. The account is now paid in full. Bank of America updated my credit report with all three bureaus to reflect the payment I made, showing a remaining balance due. The accounts do not show paid in full and remain as charge offs. I have exhausted the dispute resolution process with XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX and am seeking assistance from the CFPB to resolve the matter. I have attached the settlement letter and a recent copy of my 3 bureau credit report. <P/>Bank of America has been paid since XX/XX/XXXX and the company has failed to timely send confirmation of settlement to me, and failed to accurately report the account on my 3 credit reports, to include inaccurate investigation results.

The problem involves the Bank of America checking account holders contact line. I realize that consumers bring more serious problems to you, but I think this problem should be documented as well.
I manage the finances of my former husband, who has a XXXX XXXX My name has been added to his checking account. A new fee has shown up on his statement this month, and today on the morning of XXXX XXXX, 2017 I 'm trying to find out what it 's for. I spent 25 minutes on hold and finally had to hang up. I 'm in a location where my cell does n't work, and I had to make calls for work. I 'm back on this landline now, waiting for them to pick up, and it 's been another 20 minutes of waiting so far.
<P/>
Their answering message notes that this is the day after a holiday and there may be long waits on this line. Why, with a company with as much money as BOA, did they not then add staff to handle expected excess calls? People need work. They could fill extra positions with OT, per diem, or regular part time help, if that is the flexibility the bank feels it needs.
<P/>
Today is not particularly unusual. I routinely wait at least 15 minutes for anyone at BOA to pick up.
<P/>
It 's frankly abusive that a huge multinational corporation refuses to staff adequately in order to be minimally responsive to depositors. I have work responsibilities. I am also a XXXX XXXX. I started my work day two hours early today ( and what a blessing, that my current job allows me this flexibility ), in order to be available to take my former husband to two medical appointments later this afternoon. And yet BOA thinks it 's just fine to keep their staff numbers low and leave it to me, the consumer, to pay with MY time in order to ask them a question that is specific to our account and is not answered in their online FAQs.
<P/>
30 minutes and counting.
<P/>
Thank you for all that you do.

The email states in order to join I need to be a customer. It also states my family members can not be employed in the financial services industry. As a former employee BofA knows my spouse works in the financial services industry. Why are they sending this to me? Is it because they are so big that the left hand does n't know what the right hand is doing?

I was behind in my mortgage payments, so I borrowed {$6700.00} from my daughter and she deposited it in my Bank of America account. I made my mortgage payments, but unbeknownst to me, Bank of America had taken out {$1700.00} from my account, causing my mortgage payments to be returned. The seizure of {$1700.00} by Bank of America was for a credit card account, which had been inactive for a period of 9 years. The last payment I had made was in XXXX. It was a company debt, and our company had filed Bankruptcy in XXXX. I was unable to pay anything, because I was diagnosed with a XXXX XXXX XXXX and have been unable to work. My only income is {$570.00} from Social Security. I called Bank of America, and told them they could n't do this, and the customer service person very nastily told me that it could be collected because they had just written this off. I believe the statute of limitations is 4 years, which is a long time ago. No communications have been received at all for at least 8 years. I do not believe they can legally do this and I would like my {$1700.00} back. The credit card was in the business name, and the funds were taken out of my personal account. Now I am again behind in my mortgage payments, and have no way of paying it.

Consumer complaint narrative: Hello, I have a XXXX checking account with Bank of America. OnXX/XX/XXXX. I used my ATM card for 4 transactions, there was more than enough money in the account to cover the charges. XX/XX/XXXX was a Saturday. On Monday XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased gas, at the time there was {$5.00} in my account. The gas purchased over drafted my account and I understand this charge is my fault. I am not disputing this charge. However, all of the charges made over the weekend were charged overdraft fees as well. The gas purchase had n't even hit my account yet. On Tuesday XX/XX/XXXX, I received a deposit of {$140.00}. Bank of America charged 4 NSF fees to that credit leaving a balance of {$9.00} in my account. I have spoken to the bank several times regarding the processing of transactions, I 've been told they do n't process in the order they occur. I am a XXXX XXXX XXXX struggling to break even. The fees in question are unlawful. Please look into this matter.

I applied for a Bank of America Merrill+ Visa Signature credit card on XX/XX/XXXX and was approved the same day. I was approved for a {$20000.00} limit. I received the card on XX/XX/XXXX. 20 minutes after receiving the card, I made a purchase at XXXX. About 20 minutes after the purchase, I received a call from Bank of America informing me that they had closed my account because they approved it in error. According to the representative, the application should have been declined because they had extended me sufficient credit. I asked if there was anything I could do to reopen the account because I had been a loyal customer since XX/XX/XXXX and never missed a payment ; however, the representative informed me they could not reopen the account. Next, I asked if they could remove the account from my credit report. The representative said they could not remove the account from my credit report due to the purchase I had made just 20 minutes prior. I spoke to another representative a week later and they gave me the same information. The account recently appeared on my credit reports.

I applied for the XXXX XXXX Visa Signature Credit Card which had many desireable features which I was interested in. <P/>As I did not meet the credit standards for the Card as advertised above, I was assigned a card of lower features, a card I was not interested in having or accepting. <P/>The company did n't offer the inferior card, they simply assigned it to me. <P/>Within 10 minutes of being approved online for the inferior card I contacted Bank of America and asked that they rescind my application as opposed to closing the account that I neither wanted nor that I ever used.

It is unacceptable that BoA sent this XXXX XXXX person a letter containing my personal business when I do not know this person, the first time I have even seen this letter was in BoA 's last response, and I have never given BoA any permission to send anything to anyone but myself. You contacted a third party without my permission and this is the final straw. I also want to add that BoA has said nothing of the XXXX XXXX case regarding filing a XXXX and expecting someone to pay them back after forcing them to file this as income overruling what the IRS says, and I would also like to point out that BoA will not release the recordings because they prove my point. Also, if there was no other account with my name on it then tell me why I have a statement from this account, and I also like how you only added statements up until I was married, again skating around the issue that I am right. My lawyer for the XXXX case was XXXX XXXX of the XXXX XXXX and not the XXXX guy.

I called customer service they referred me to an XXXX number I ca n't find it but the man who answered would not give me his name. told me there had been a breach on my accounts and I was no longer a Bank of America customer and find another bank to do business with. I said I have been banking with your bank for over 25 years, his answer was we appreciate your business but now you need to take your business to another bank. I said I need to access my accounts. The inconvenience to my life has been overwhelming and I deserve answers and cooperation

Instead of stopping those transactions, Bank of America allowed them to post to the account and proceeded to charge three {$35.00} overdraft fees. <P/>I contacted Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX to dispute the overdraft fees, but they refused to be of any assistance, meaning that I have lost {$100.00} due to them not managing transactions properly. <P/>Additionally, despite me having set up account alerts to notify me whenever there is an overdraft, I did not receive that alert until the day after the transactions were posted. I have tried to call your customer service, but after waited for 45 mins listening to music, I was told this is how BOA does things. My credit card had over 20 fraudulent charges at several gas stations in Florida. I immediately called Bank of America to have the card cancelled and the charges reversed, which they did. A month later, the charges were back on my card. Bank of America said they will reopen the case, but they said the investigators are arguing they are valid charges.

Bank neligent in customer service and handling of disputed charge which has now caused me a severe lost Bank of america promised that they closed my card and no further charges were able to come in. After a XXXX charge did come thru rep told me that prior rep didnt actually closed the card and she messed up. I told him charge should have never been because card was supposed to be closed. Instead he issued a dispute on the charge and removed it. I never heard from the bank and charged reapeared and wreked havoc on my account. I called XXXX XXXX and a woman apologized that i was not notified about answering the dispute and she would try to remove on that day and at worst 2 biz days and i would not have to worry about overdrafts. It wasnt reversed and now i have overdrafts hitting the account and lost my salary in a transfer to it. I called and was told that the woman was wrong to tell me these things! We purchased a car from XXXX of XXXX and financed it through Bank of America. After 45 days we had not received any info on the loan. We called Bank of America and discovered they were sending all our info to our old address that we have not been in for over 2 years and is in a different state. When we told them, they said it was our fault for giving the wrong address, which we did not. Then they blamed XXXX of XXXX. After calling XXXX of XXXX we confirmed that our loan application never listed our previous address. This is Bank of America not taking responsibility for their mistake. Their resolution was to send all the info to the right address but they would not extend our due date. They would not overnight it or email it so I could take care of it quicker. Then at the end of the call when she was going to give me the confirmation #, we were disconnected and she did not call back.

XX/XX/XXXX I call Bank of America- Merrill Lynch for information on my balance owed on my VISA Signature ( Merrill+ ) credit card. The automated service quotes me a current balance on my account : {$1800.00}. So I intended to make a phone payment of {$1800.00}. When I chose the option to make a payment, the automated service quotes me the amount of {$1900.00}. This amount was not current but based off the statement datedXX/XX/XXXXXXXXXX/XX/XXXX. I received a credit from a merchant : XXXX for {$42.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, and another credit from them for {$7.00} on XX/XX/XXXX that was yet to be reflected in my statement for the following month. I was informed by Bank of America, I would receive a finance charge if I only paid the {$1800.00}, which would have brought my account to a {$0.00} balance. I had a {$0.00} balance on the previous statement. So, essentially, I would have to pay more than my current balance and have a credit of {$50.00} on my account to avoid a finance charge, even though that amount has already been credited on my account. If credits affect my current balance, then I should not be paying finance charges for bringing my balance to a {$0.00} balance. I was told by XXXX, a supervisor that Bank of America does not acknowledge credits to the account even if they are reflected in the current balance. Bank of America is misleading their customers by having their automated system state a customer 's current balance without a disclaimer stating that the full amount of the statement must be paid even if there has been a credit on the account. This racks up huge interest charges for Bank of America because the automated message regarding account balance potentially presents two different balances without explanation or instruction. What if I had bought a large item like a boat for {$5000.00} with my Visa, returned the boat due to faulty mechanism, the {$5000.00} credited to my Visa account within two days after the statement. Would I then need to pay {$5000.00} toward my now current balance of {$0.00} to avoid a 10.00 APR interest fee on my account? This is fraudulent and misleading. What right minded person would pay more than they owe when the balance is {$0.00}? Bank of America-Merrill Lynch is scooping up the millions in interest fees because they have mislead their customers to think they should make a payment based upon their current balance. Bank of America- Merrill Lynch is capitalizing on their automated services to keep customers from knowing what would keep them from paying unnecessary interest fees.

Consumer complaint narrative: I sent two postal money orders to bank of America, but the money orders did not show up on my deposit statement. ( 2 ) I sent them a XXXX money order and they sent it back because they told me they are any good to their business. My car was repossessed but the week before they pick up my car I called bank of America to make sure my payments were up to date and I was told everything was fine. I had receipts for the deposits I had sent and showed them to the reposessor and to bank of America but they did not accept them and my car was towed away. I have been having trouble with this particular bank for the last 2 months. Its as if they are targeting my account with employees or the money order got lost in the mail. Three money orders at different dates and times should not have been lost but it is possible. If it was up to me and they are guilty of negligence, I would have bank of America pay the total cost of the car I was paying for and money for damages. I hope I have written in time to keep others from having the same problem.

On XXXX XXXX XXXX I opened a business checking account, CD and business credit card at the BofA branch located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, WA XXXX. I selected Bank of America because they were advertising a bank credit for new checking accounts and credit cards. It was {$150.00} for new checking and {$100.00} for a credit card after 6 months. <P/>I followed up with Bank of America in XXXX of XXXX because I never received a credit for either promotion. I was required to submit request with both the credit card team, and checking account team. The credit card team honored the promotion, but the checking account team sent denial letter for case number XXXX dated XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. <P/>The denial letter stated the promotional code was not entered when the account was opened. I opened the account at the branch the same time the credit card was opened. If their banker did not enter the promotional code correctly when opening the account I do not see how that releases them from honoring their promotion.

I have multiple issues with Bank of America to start off with. I have had to cancel my card multiple times due to fraudulent activity with the same company ( XXXX ) twice already, taking money out of my account and once with another company. Is n't that what the chip is for? For better security? This has n't only been frustrating but a pain because I ca n't use any of my money because my card is cancelled, also frustrating because I 've had a new card 4 times already and it has n't even been 2 years! Another thing is, I use an app called XXXX, which allows me to access my paycheck early so I can pay bills, etc. It relys on Bank of America to send information in a timely manner such as account balance and recent transactions in a timely manner in order to do this. Bank of America highly slacks in speed towards their customers, even on business days, it took them almost 3 days to relay information during the week which is unacceptable when I 'm trying to manage my money. One last thing is, I honestly think it is outrageous how many fees Bank of America charges to use YOUR OWN MONEY. If you withdrawal too many times you 're telling me you 're gon na charge me a fee? That 's ridiculous. And if I transfer MY money between MY accounts too many times you 're gon na charge me a {$10.00} fee? I think this is ridiculous and all of these issues should be looked at. Not all banks operate this way.

i took out mbna bank of america credit card they froze my account for 6 months refused replacement card for a year and demand minimum payments monthly i tried to pay them in full for 6 months now i cant consolidate the company has put me in loads of debt mbna bank of america

I maintain a Regular Checking account with Bank of America, N.A. Bank of America recently announced that as of X/XX/17, all non-Bank of America customers cashing my personal check at a Bank of America location will incur an {$8.00} fee for each check over {$50.00}. Arguably unlawful, this practice is blatantly discriminatory towards those without the means, ability, or standing to maintain a bank account of their own ( e.g. the poor, illiterate, or undocumented ). It makes a mockery of the simple, time honored concept of a personal check. To wit, my personal check is my exact written order for the bank to pay the specified amount to the payee on demand upon verification of their identity and availability of funds. It is a service the bank agreed to provide to me in exchange for my maintaining a balance. The payee is not a part of that service agreement. Rather, the payee is being forced to pay a fee to obtain that which is rightfully theirs. In short, the bank is committing larceny while calling it a transaction. <P/>I have communicated my views on this proposed action to Bank of America but I am but one voice. I ask the CFPB to take action. Please do not allow this practice to stand. It is an avaricious, cynical corporate reach for dollars off the backs of those who can ill afford to part with it.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I applied for a Bank of America XXXX XXXX Signature edition credit card. I did so because I wanted to receive the benefits that were outlined in the offer ( e.g., miles, companion ticket, etc. ). I was immediately approved and was informed I could begin using the card, which I did ( spent over {$1000.00} ) to meet the requirements for the miles. <P/>Upon receiving the credit card in the mail, I called Bank of America to ensure that I would be receiving the airline benefits, because they ( miles, ticket info ) were NOT outlined in the paperwork I received with the card. They told me I needed to contact the airline to find out that information. I called the airline, and they told me they did not have access to that information and that the awards would be issued after my first statement ( since I already spent the required amount ). <P/>Approximately one month from when I applied for the card, the first statement was issued, I checked my account online. In reviewing my account, I noted that I did not receive the miles I was expecting, but rather only a small portion of that amount and no companion ticket. XX/XX/XXXX I called both the airlines and Bank of America, and was informed that I was not approved for the " signature card '', even though I have a excellent credit score ( about XXXX ) and my $ XXXX mortgage has been with Bank of American for the past 7 years ( always paid on time, no issues ). I was approved for a different credit card, 'platinum ', that was not eligible for the same benefits. <P/>I requested that they change my account to the 'signature ' edition, but they told me that even though I would be eligible for the signature card, I was no longer eligible for the airline benefits that came with that card because I was already issued the 'platinum '. <P/>Bank of America needs to be more up front about their different card options, which one someone is receiving and benefit differences, and people should be able to apply only for the Visa Signature edition. If this is not resolved, I am going to cancel my credit card with Bank of America and change my  mortgage to another institution.

This not only results in the bank pocketing " effectively stealing '' my {$75.00} annual fee it will show them as churning accounts and greatly scar my credit as it will show an account that was just recently opened by me as being closed against my will, which will also greatly impact my credit score going forward. This is inexcusable as this account is and always has been in good standing as I make all my payments on time and have never gone over the credit limits stated on this account. Not only that all information used to open this account was 100 % true and factual so Bank of America has no right whatsoever to have done this to me. I expected this card to be a long-term useful rewards card as it carries with significant advertised mileage benefits for XXXX XXXX

On Monday XX/XX/XXXX i deposited a check in the amount of {$2700.00} to my Bank of America checking account. On Tuesday i looked at my account and the deposit went through without a hitch. I started withdrawing funds from this check. On Wednesday Bank of America received notice from tbe check 's bank that the check was probably not going to clear. Wednesday i had made two online payments not knowing my bank decided to put a hold on this check. When i came home that evening and looked ay my checking account i was horrified to see that my account was overdrawn. The bank decided on Wednesday to put a hold on the account. I do not have a history of accepting bad checks or writing bad checks. If we went through my account we would probably find that the only time i was charged an NSF fee was when someone took money out of my account that i did not authorize. As of this date i have received absolutely nothing that there was a problem with this check. It is through my own vigilance thst i even know about it. My dilligence had the money replaced with a wire transfer on Friday, XX/XX/XXXX. The bank has charged me two NSF fees for the two checks i wrote on Wednesday. I do not think this is fair. The bank should have put a hold  on the check on Tuesday at the very latest. On Tuesday it did not appear that the bank was going to place a hold on it. How was i supposed to know not to write checks when they put the hold on the check on Wednesday? As i have already stated, i have received absolutely nothing from the bank letting me know there was a probkem woth the check. If i was not vigilant with my account, i could easily still be writing checks. Once i saw the hold, i did not write any more checks. I believe the bank should refund the two NSF fees. I spoke with a XXXX XXXX on Wednesday XX/XX/XXXX He is a supervisor in the California office. I have thought long and hard on whether this next statement is true. I truly believe it is. I thought he was noting the account not to charge me NSF fees, but there is nothing in the notes stating this. Yesterday i left a message for him to call ne. He has not done so yet.

I went out in XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ), California on the night of Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX beginning around XXXX PDT and stayed out until approximately XXXX PDT when the area closed ( please note this means my night technically ended on Sunday, XX/XX/XXXX ). The last charge I made that night was at XX/XX/XXXX at XX/XX/XXXX for {$44.00} - but after leaving the bar I noticed my phone and wallet were missing from my pockets. My best guess is as the venue was crowded with many people close to each other that I was pick-pocketed. I walked home ( I live nearby ) and immediately messaged my friends. First thing the following morning ( still Sunday, XX/XX/XXXX ) I went to XXXX XXXX XXXX when they opened. I called my dad from the store phone to ask him to block my stolen cards, then I spoke with a customer representative to buy a new phone because I had received an alert that XXXX XXXX XXXX had been disabled ( screenshot attached ) - so I knew it was taken as they blocked me from finding it. Once I had my new phone I immediately called Bank of America to report everything and let them know of the fraudulent activity. We went through each transaction and I noted when the fraudulent transactions began - first with a {$500.00} cash withdrawal in XXXX XXXX and then another {$300.00} cash withdrawal in the same area. There were also internal transfers made - specifically the majority of my savings account was moved to my checking account. There was then a fraudulent charge made at XXXX 's for {$1000.00}. The customer rep at BOA noted this and opened two claims. Within a few days I was granted a temporary credit for one of the claims and {$1000.00} was stored into my account. ***Please note I also made a report with the XXXX XXXX Sheriff 's department and provided this information to BOA*** Today, Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX I  received an email from BOA that they will NOT be reimbursing me for my losses and they concluded the fraudulent charges " were not made in error '' as stated in the attached letters. Also stated is the temporary credit of {$1000.00} will be reversed from my account on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. I immediately called to challenge this decision but I was informed the department is not open until Monday. 
Please let me know if there is any more information I can provide and I will gladly do so. Thank you for your help.

I have been a Bank of America customer for over 12 years and I have 2 credit card accounts established with them as well as 3 other personal banking accounts. I have never been late with a payment, I consistently make payments in excess of the minimum monthly payment due, and neither card is at its credit limit. The only thing that has changed about my risk profile is that another unrelated credit card account that had no balance- was compromised due to fraud. On XXXX XXXX, 2017, I brought a XXXX check drawn on XXXX XXXX ( in XXXX ) to Bank of America 's branch on XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX. The value of the check was XXXX XXXX dollars ( which is approximately 15,000 US dollars ). The bank teller told me that the check would be sent to their collection department, and that the collection process would take 4 to 6 weeks or more. He had me sign a form for agreeing on the collection process. No balance was added to my checking account. <P/><P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 92 days from XX/XX/XXXX ), I heard nothing from Bank of America, despite that it had been already more than 12 weeks since I brought in the check. So, I visited the above-mentioned branch to ask why my account had not been credited for the check. A bank employee, XXXX XXXX XXXX, told me that she did not know what was going on. She mentioned that she could reach the collection department only via email, so that it would take a few days for her to get the necessary information. She promised to call me within 5 business days. In this visit, I showed a copy of the check, which I received from the bank on XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX XXXX made a copy of the copy for their record. <P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 103 days ), I visited the branch again, because XXXX XXXX had not contacted me despite her promise. She had me wait quite a bit and spent much time claiming that she did nothing wrong. Also, she insisted that a collection process could take this much time, and that it could even take six months in some cases. Somehow, however, she escalated my case and promised to call me by the end of the next day ( XX/XX/XXXX ). <P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 104 days ), XXXX XXXX failed to call me again. Feeling that the bank was not working hard to resolve the problem, I called XXXX XXXX ( on whom the check is drawn ) to see the status of the check. They told me that they had seen neither a sign of the check clearing nor contact from Bank of America. <P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 107 days ), XXXX XXXX XXXX, a manager of the branch called me saying that he mentioned that the bank was willing to make an offer, given the delayed collection process. He told me that I could choose one of the two options. The first option was that I could continue to wait for another 4 to 8 weeks until the check clears. ( I did not understand why it was an offer, though. ) The second option was that I could have XXXX XXXX cancel the check and wire-transfer the money to myself, where all necessary fees would paid by Bank of America. I naturally accepted the second option. <P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 109 days ), I called XXXX XXXX. ( I could not do it earlier, due to the long XXXX weekend. ) XXXX XXXX told me two things. First, they could not cancel the check, because their system rejected the cancellation request. Second and more importantly, XXXX XXXX 's company rules do not allow them to wire-transfer funds to any bank outside XXXX. I told XXXX XXXX of Bank of America that his proposed resolution did not work. <P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 113 days ), XXXX XXXX called me, saying that a team of over twenty people was now working on my case at Bank of America and had found that the check had been lost. He mentioned that the bank could clear the lost check using the copy of the check XXXX XXXX made from mine on XX/XX/XXXX, if I give XXXX XXXX a permission to clear the check using the copy. He told me to contact a person at TD Securities by email. I emailed her accordingly. <P/>On XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 114 days ), the person at XXXX XXXX replied to me saying that my involvement in the clearing process would be unnecessary. She also mentioned that she had already told a staff at Bank of America how to clear the check by using the copy of the check. I passed this information to XXXX XXXX by email. I also urged him to release the funds to my checking account, given that the error was on their side, and the funds had been already held for 114 days. <P/><P/>As of XXXX XXXX, 2017 ( 118 days ), I have not heard back from Bank of America. I have no idea when my money will be put in my checking account.

Consumer complaint narrative: For the past 5 years, I believe that I have experienced ( and have evidence of ) organized deceit regarding my account with Bank of America. I believe that this is a direct result of technology fraud or incompetence. Bank of America has automatically opened an unauthorized account, created unauthorized charges/fees, closes the account, does this again and again, and then repeatedly and continually misdirects me ( a customer ) to hide that this is going on. As one of the successor trustees of a trust set up with Bank of America and supplying them all required documents, I am unable to get the required financial information from them that will allow me to manage my money. Can anyone help me get the financial information on our own money without having to take them to court?

On X/XX/16 went to XXXX XXXX for missing engine and motor trouble. They .Installed broken spark plug and misgapped the other plugs according to another garage, Failing service with XXXX I advised XXXX NOT to pay the charge of {$440.00}. XXXX has neglected to respond to my request for refund and chargeback, Received several phone calls from XXXX customer service employees XXXX and XXXX XXXX. They were to investigate. Somehow XXXX discovered that I had additional expense of $ XXXX.and sent me a check for same. I told XXXX about this as it proves guilt and liability.

I 'm filling a complaint against bank of America I had some temporary credits issued to my bank account because of a problem with my cell phone provider and they were not able to resolve my dispute and had to reverse the temporary credits on XXXX XXXX 2017 and I called them a week before asking them to give me an extension till the XX/XX/XXXX which is when I get paid I get paid every 2 weeks from my employer and I usually need this money to survive on again I asked them to extend things to the XX/XX/XXXX and then on Friday XX/XX/XXXX I went to go have some lunch and went to pay with my card since I had just got paid only to have it be declined I looked at my account online and saw that money was taken out by bank of America for the temporary credit reversal I called them and they told me that my extension had been denied so I asked them to return the money cause again I need that to survive on for 2 weeks until my next payday I was never notified of the denial they lead me to believe that it went through I want bank of America to return what they basically stole from me I make very little from my employer I want this agency to help me out and since I 'm from Massachusetts and yes which is represented by senator XXXX XXXX the founder of this agency I figured they can help me out

This is a serious problem~ regarding Bank of America 's Faulty & Misleading Accounting System across the board for all my 3 checking accounts with this bank, when using my Debit Card linked to any of my given BOA checking bank accounts. Here is the problem : When I use any of my debit cards to pay for a transaction, and the charge is, of course, immediately placed against my respective bank checking account to which it is linked, there is NO transaction number that Bank of America assigns to that transaction! SO I ca n't keep track of it! ~ or ANY of my transactions, so that I never know what my day-to-day ACCURATE balance really is in my accounts. What often happens is that even though the merchant has not actually claimed for that amount of money~ yet~ Bank of America deducts the amount of that charge from my respective bank account, and IF the merchant does n't really ask or claim for that amount of money IN 5 DAYS, Bank of America deletes it from its Telephone Banking System. And this same item that had shown up in my online banking account page, showing as still " processing '', has no Transaction Number assigned to it, but this amount is ADDED BACK INTO my bank account, AS IF THIS transaction had never taken place~ leading me to believe that I have more money in my balance than I really do! ~ because BOA knows that this merchant will rightfully come back at some future time and really claim for their money ( unless the bank puts it into a Claims Dispute, which has not happened to these charges, & BOA knows this ). THEN in either 3 or 6 or 10 or 12 days, when this same merchant decides to really claim for its money ( the charge I had made ), this merchant goes back to Bank of America & THIS TIME actually withdraws the money from my account, which then is reflected in my balance, of course. Again! SO BOA 's system of deducting, then adding back into my bank account in 5 days if the merchant has n't truly claimed for its money, then deducting same again in 6 or 10 days, is VERY misleading! Another PROBLEM associated with BOA 's accounting system is that, as I pointed out to a phone BOA teller this past Friday ( XXXX XXXX 2017 ), there is a duplication of this same transaction that then shows up on my online bank account balance page, where he could see that this charge is showing as " processing '' which has NO transaction #, and yet at same time, it is showing on same page that it has been paid in actuality at some later time~ all of which is reflected in the current " Available Balance ''. The problem here is that NO one could keep track of his or her account balance at BOA with this kind of misleading system & information! Hence, I have had multiple, multiple {$35.00} overdraft fees on all my 3 bank accounts with BOA, and while BOA has refunded some of them, many have NOT been refunded, and I have lost a tremendous amount of money because of this problem. I have repeatedly asked Bank of America to give us an ACCURATE balance on both its online and telephone banking system, and the various tellers & supervisors have said they think I have a good idea, and will " pass it along '' to whom (? ) at BOA, but nothing is ever done about it! Bank of America has tried to tell me also that it is up to the merchant ( to whom I paid a charge for a service, or made a payment ) to provide a transaction number to the bank, but regardless of whether a merchant does this, BOA SHOULD provide US, their customers, a tracking number, because it is on ITS OWN WEBSITE, WHICH THEY DO HAVE CONTROL OVER! But BOA denies any responsibility for this! I have told BOA that regardless of what a merchant does, it is incumbent upon BOA, as OUR bank, to give us a transaction number, so that we can keep track of it, until it is finally paid! Otherwise, I am always on shifting ground, like quick-sand, with BOA 's flimsy & misleading accounting, whereby they deduct such a charge, which has not really been withdrawn YET, then when a merchant has n't claimed for its money in just 5 Days, BOA puts back into our account that money, & then when merchant decides in about a week later to claim for that money, the money is suddenly withdrawn again, and this time, legitimately, without any prior warning to me ( because by that time, BOA has wiped it off my telephone account balance system, and as to BOA 's online system, as mentioned above, the same transaction has been assigned NO transaction number whereby I can see IF it has been paid, and when ), the bottom in my bank account drops out, and I am charged {$35.00} overdraft fees! THIS is LUDICROUS! WHAT a slick system BOA is operating! ~ VERY clever on their part, as a way to scam its customers out of money with these MULTITUDINOUS {$35.00} overdraft fees assessed on millions of customers at BOA! ~ because of its fraudulent, misleading accounting system which gives us defective, inaccurate, & incomplete information! BOA is and can get rich collecting ALL these {$35.00} overdraft fees, when you consider how many transactions I do every week, PLUS if you multiply that TIMES the number of OTHER BOA customers who also have to put up with such a fraudulent accounting system! I am asking that BOA would refund all my {$35.00} overdraft fees, and until BOA will change its online & telephone bank account systems to provide customers with complete & accurate information on each & every transaction, I will not do any more business there. I have repeatedly asked BOA to have a feature on its telephone system, in which we would be able to dial a number on our phone for our actual true balance, where all my transactions have CLEARED my bank account, and then we can dial another number on our phone to get a list of all the PROCESSING or " waiting in the wings to be paid '' charges, which would have a Transaction Number for each of them, which we could add up and KNOW to deduct from our actual true balance given on the other phone button. THIS is what I used to be able to do at XXXX XXXX ( I no longer bank there ). BOA just says that 's a good idea & then never does anything about it!!! Consequently, I have been caught in this misleading type of bank accounting system of BOA 's, to where I 've had to pay all these crazy {$35.00} overdraft fees!, which have caused me to go broke! On top of that, when I spoke with that telephone bank teller at BOA on Friday, XXXX XXXX, he was going to have a supervisor to call me back, to place a hold on my {$35.00} overdraft fees accrued on that & previous day, but NO one at BOA called me back, and even on Monday, after I 'd put more money into my accounts over the weekend, when their business dept is closed, so that I could cover for these {$35.00} charges coming in, I never got a call back, so I called BOA AGAIN on Monday to request for a Supervisor to call me back, but no one ever did. SO THEN I called at XXXX XXXX later that day, holding on phone for ONE HOUR to speak with one finally, and she said she was n't going to refund any of my {$35.00} overdraft fees. THAT is when I decided to contact CFPB, to see if you could intervene on my behalf, and ask them to refund all my {$35.00} overdraft fees, given their faulty & misleading bank accounting in which it is impossible for anyone to keep an accurate balance in our bank accounts, without having any transaction number assigned by BOA to each transaction, using our debit card~ plus the other problems with their balance system as described above. IF you need further information about this, please contact me at Cell XXXX. Thank you for helping me on this. I ca n't help but think many other BOA customers suffer under similar fraudulent & misleading accounting at BOA. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I use an app called XXXX. It pays me in advance of my payday in case I need some money but my bank has to report the transactions, which the 1st couple weeks was great, NO ISSUES. Now I guess they realized this helps me not to Overdraft, meaning the bank wo n't get to charge me {$38.00} in fees so they are not reporting transactions to XXXX ; therefore ; I am not able to get my money from them. Thank you, XXXX XXXX

I had a dormant account with Bank of America. Bank of America continued to charge monthly maintenance fees until the account was empty. After the account reached {$0.00} balance, Bank of America charged maintenance fees rather than close the account - leaving me with fees to be paid. Bank of America has threatened to send to collections for payment of fees rather than simply close the account when the account ended at {$0.00}. I contacted Bank of America at XXXX ET on X/XX/2017. Bank of America Representatives transferred me to a department and I was disconnected.

In XX/XX/XXXX, I opened a checking account with Bank of America. Less than three months later, they closed the account and froze my funds for weeks with no warning or explanation. Fast forward to the present day, and I can not open a new checking account anywhere because Bank of America has reported derogatory, inaccurate information about my brief banking history with them to a company called XXXX XXXX XXXX, which is accessed by 99.9 % of financial institutions before they will open a new checking or savings account for a consumer. Specifically, Bank of America 's statement on my consumer report is : " Transacting ( or attempting to transact ) with an account in an unauthorized or prohibited manner. '' I followed XXXX XXXX 's dispute procedures to have this information removed from my account in XX/XX/XXXX. One month later, they sent me a generic form letter stating that they 'd confirmed with Bank of America that the information reported was accurate and would remain on my consumer report. XXXX XXXX provided no copies of any of the information that B of A shared with them to support this decision, and in following up with them, I was told that it will be another three years before this information will be removed from my consumer report. I 've called Bank of America numerous times to contest this, and just today, spent 2+ hours on hold with no representative ever taking my call. 

XXXX XXXX is also reporting that I have a balance owed on a previous XXXX account that has been closed for over five years, but which allegedly was just reported to them in XX/XX/XXXX. Same deal -- - I disputed this, and received a form letter that the debt had been verified as accurate, but was given nothing substantiating this from XXXX itself.

I am writing to protest unfair banking fees for cashing checks written by their own bank customers. I received a letter today from Bank Of America stating that they will begin charging {$8.00} for non-customers who bring my Bank of America checks to my bank to cash. This practice discriminates against those who need the funds the most, such as any independent contractor, care giver, housekeeper, or landscaper. <P/>Is it illegal for banks to charge people for cashing checks written by that bank 's customers? <P/>The bank representative gave no good reason for charging the fee for cashing Bank of America checks to those whom I pay with a check. I understand that XXXX XXXX has also begun charging such fees. <P/>I already pay fees to the bank to maintain my checking account, and they have the privilege of holding of my money. The bank is providing no recourse. <P/>How can we protect consumers from these unfair fees? <P/>Thank you

During XXXX of 2016, my phone, and wallet were stolen at a downtown nightclub. Shortly after I was charged with outstanding overdraft fees, due to fraud activity. I notified the bank ( bank of America ) about the issue and filed a complaint. After a slight investigation, the bank came to the conclusion that it was indeed fraud and I was possibly at fault. The only fault I had was checking my account on another friends mobile app. The bank was uncooperative with any further assistance and then proceeded to close my account. The outstanding charges were up to {$560.00} dollars. Please get this problem eradicated, I 'm in desperate need of a checking and savings account. Please and thank you.

XXXX XXXX was shut down from the FBI, and filed Bankruptcy at that time. I DEMAND TO SEE THE TRANSFER OF SERVICING RIGHTS FROM XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TO BANK OF AMERICA, AND THE APPROVAL FROM XXXX XXXX THE PLAN TRUSTEE THAT HE GAVE PERMISSION TO MERS AND BANK OF AMERICA WHEN THEY SUBMITTED THE ASSIGNMENT OF MORTGAGE UNDER 11 USC 362 and 363.
