Consumer complaint narrative: I opened an account with bank of america around XXXX 2014 for XXXX and i didnt have ny card yet so i had to go to the bank to take out cash so the 3rd time i went i was told that i couldnt take out any money and that i had to call and figure out why it took me 2 hrs to find out that they closed my account and they really couldnt tell me why ive recently learned that they are being suied and needed to file my claim as quickly as possible

I call to resolved this issue with the merchant and after a failed attempt I initiated a case with the Bank. I spoke with approximately 7 people on XX/XX/XXXX about this situation. Representatives talking to me as if I did something wrong- Unbelievable! <P/>I am absolutely appealing the denial of my claim. The merchant did not receive my authorization to charge the amount and this is Fraud.

On XXXX XXXX XXXX I made a check deposit of {$500.00} via Check # XXXX. Shortly after on the XXXX of XXXX I made another deposit of {$600.00} via check # XXXX. Both checks were placed on a hold. When I called about the holds the rep explained because of the account having a negative balance before the checks would be held. However, my accounts went negative because of the bank. I was given a temporary credit for a claim that I filed with them regarding an unauthorized transaction. However, they stated that they had not paid that particular transaction and that they would be reversing the credit. They did not tell me when they waited days later interfering with my normal banking and for this reason I got charged a fee. That was not my fault at all either way you look at it. The fact that they issued the credit and/or took it back. I got charged two XXXX $ fees, one for overdraft and the other for being 5days overdrawn. I thought of this to be unfair but moved on. Now I am having problems with these holds and I have NEVER had a check returned and the checks I am depositing are from another LOCAL account that belongs to me as well and the money has already been taken from my other account. It is an Estate account and I pay myself from that account. However, I can no longer trust that my money will be available to me so I now have to pay fees to cash my checks some place else. This is not only a inconvenience but a disappointment because I am a new member to Bank of America and thought they were great at helping but I was wrong. I am being punished for their mistakes and it just is n't right. Not to mention I now get charged a maintenance fee for the account that I did not agree to and I can prove this via statements dated back to when the account was first opened online in XXXX. Please help me to get whatever hold they have on me corrected. I am a single mother and student and I need my money to care for my child.

When researching online for a promotional 0 % APR on purchases for the first 15 months, MasterCard through Bank of America was one of the options that came up. I choose this card because it was specifically for purchases and was going to use it for an upcoming trip and school. I applied online for this card and was approved. For my first billing cycle, I was not charged any interest. However, for the second billing cycle I was charged interested. I called the number on my credit card, and after explaining what happened was told by the representative that it was a mistake and she apologized for this error on the side of the company and transferred me to another department so that they could take care of it. This first conversation happened on XXXX XXXX 2017 at XXXX XXXX. When speaking with the second person, I was told that the card I applied for was only transfers. I explain my situation again and told him the first representative acknowledge the mistake. He continued to tell me there was nothing he could do.

On XXXX XXXX, 2017 i contacted bank of America to inform them that my card was not in my posession and for it to be closed. I also made them aware that i was in the State of Georgia. They then issued me another card and transferred me over to the fraud dept. But the transactions are still on my new account ending in XXXX.

The Bank of America froze ALL of my bank accounts after receiving a temporary order in a divorce case, that is now final. They are still holding my money as frozen, and their legal department will never talk to me or even send me info on when the money will be returned. it appears they 'charged ' me for the legal hold as well and are trying to steal my money. the divorce is final and i need my money back, there is no reason that they should be holding it.
Also, the order that they were provided by my x-wife 's attorney stated clearly that they were only to put a hold onto XXXX account. They went and took money from ALL my accounts including my son 's college account that was his money he was using the account. This was not ordered by the court, Bank of America just did this on their own.

On XXXX XXXX, 2017, I made a purchase on the XXXX XXXX XXXX US website for approximately {$100.00}. I paid with my Bank of America Cash Rewards Card. The transaction was denominated in US dollars. When the charge appeared on my card on XXXX XXXX, I was charged a foreign transaction fee of {$3.00}. This fee should not have been assessed, as I was paying on the US website of a company 's American division and paying in US dollars.

Months ago, I cut up my Bank of America credit card and sent it back to the company to close my account. Yesterday I received in the mail a 'change in terms ' to my credit card ending in XXXX. I tried to call the phone number to tell them the account was closed, but it asked for a credit card account number ( which I do n't have ) or a social security number ( which I input, but it did not recognize ). Since it did not accept my social security number, I got a recording that threatened " extended wait times '' because I allegedly did not input my number. I got tired of being on hold and hung up. THIS ACCOUNT HAS BEEN CLOSED. I HAVE NO OPEN ACCOUNTS WITH BANK OF AMERICA.
I ca n't access my money from my app because the bank does n't update my transactions

I have a credit card with Bank of America and have used promotional offers for balance transfers from credit cards. This is what they offer : " A balance transfer has several benefits, including : Saving you money on interest and monthly charges Consolidating debt, which may help you pay it off faster One statement with one payment due each month '' So, I thought that if I paid my statement in full I will pay my purchases and the balance transfer, because they said " one payment due each month ''. So I made a full payment of my balance on time, before the due date and I was charged interest, also, they said I still owe {$260.00} from my balance transfers. They do n't show the remaining balance related to balance transfers on their statements nor their website in their online bank, so there is no way for me to check what they are seeing or to check how much I have paid and how much I still owe. This is really a problem, because I do n't know if there is a mistake or not, if they are overcharging me or if what they say I owe is true or not. I do n't like to be late in my payments and I really do n't feel that the bank is being honest with me. 
It seems they apply my payments in the amount I owe from the statement, plus from the current purchases, but it is not clear how much they are applying to the remaining balance from my transfers I can show you my last statement if you need to see it. In my previous statement the total balance was XXXX and that 's what I paid and now they say I still owe {$260.00} due to the balance transfer. In the page where they post the Interest Charge Calculation, the balances there go up or down every month, even if I do n't do any new balance transfers and that is very confusing.

A. Problem history synopsis : Medical ER visit in XX/XX/XXXX got behind in payments. Final payment in XXXX which lasted until XXXX XXXX, then account charged off and went to collections for 30 days, then collection attorney. Bank of America was told about medical hardship in XXXX before charge off several times as was the nonprofit and the attorney later. Bank of America was asked to provide forbearance arrangements but none were offered or responded to. B. Dunning Letter issued in XXXX around 40 days after charge off. Call was attempted to dispute amount. C. XXXX XXXX filed a lawsuit filing in my County civil ( lower court ). Bank of America, NA V. MY NAME D. I attempted to have account placed on Debt Management Plan DMP with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I had an account with before. XXXX XXXX took my money, told me in writing that I could show the DMP to the judge to waive and dismiss the suit, and then sent the money with a proposal to Bank. The Bank kept the money and said " no '' to the proposal since it was " in legal. '' E. I have a phone call documented and recorded with Bank of America in which customer service representative who may have told me it was an attempt to collect a debt nevertheless told me they did not " own it '' anymore, implying that they sold it to XXXX XXXX and or XXXX XXXX XXXX. It turns out that the Bank still owns it and the collection attorney only represents them. F. Call # 1 to collection attorney phone call documented and recorded : XXXX XXXX XXXX representative coercing payment and arrangement plans against a default judgement that did not exist. Extended payment plan offered where the " judgement '' would stay and not be removed. " No other options '' existed etc. The color of law used against me to extract payment and collect a debt. My due process rights were usurped and obfuscated. The color of the law of a default judgement was used against me in order to collect a debt. Because XXXX XXXX XXXX obfuscated and clouded my rights as a consumer with a false statement about a judgement which did not exist I did not have any moment to present an attorney for them to speak to. This was especially apparent with second phone call. G. Second Call # 2 to collection attorney I asked again about an extended payment plan so I asked for a copy of that to review. They told me I had 30 days to get it back to them, however upon receiving the balance was incorrect and wrong. The paperwork had to be back in 10-14 days. The time passed due to the time that the proposal took to be mailed to me. So that passed due to fact I had a car accident. This customer service representative told me " to shred and or tear up any lawsuit notification service papers that I might receive. '' This constitutes advice by XXXX XXXX XXXX such that they told me not to respond to a lawsuit they filed against me which would mean losing the lawsuit by default. Furthermore, because the first call ( point F above ) purported a default judgement against me, I was NOT able to seek advice of an attorney, thereby once again losing not only my consumer rights but my constitutional rights as an American citizen. H. Many faxes sent to XXXX XXXX attorney : ( 1 ) general dispute, ( 2 ) dispute of balance on " agreed judgement '' as well as deceptive timelines for due dates given by Call # 2 & paperwork, ( 3 ) dispute # 3 asking for information regarding all credit cards ' lines which were consolidated into the present & original origination details including state of origination and copy of original application, ( 4 ) simple letter asking for a new agreed judgement with correct balance to review for consideration. No disputes were responded or handled correctly. I received one call from XXXX XXXX of Bank America in North Carolina. It was not clear what his phone call was about. I have disputed both the original debt accuracy via fax directly to Bank of America and XXXX XXXX XXXX. They did not respond. I disputed the accuracy of both their original stated balance due as well as the balance listed on the agreed judgement papers since I have had made several payments since XX/XX/XXXX to Bank of America. I. Improper ( potentially illegal ) servicing techniques and Talking to a 3rd party about my debt : Visit # 1 -  XXXX dropped off a person to my wife 's brother in law. They told him they had papers from Bank. Brother-in-law asked to see them. Courier showed them to him the paperwork showing Bank of America, NA vs MY NAME Visit # 2 - lady drove to my parents house. Video exists of visitor showing paperwork to my mother who can confirm that the Bank 's name and my name were on the papers such that Bank of America, NA vs. MY NAME. These visits to 3rd parties were made to look like they were trying to find me, but they were really pressuring and embarrassing me in order to retrieve signature to the agreed judgement as described above G. Please note : My mother had night terrors for 3 days after this visit. She is XXXX years old. J. No agreed judgement was signed nor agreed to because the balance was incorrect. Also, the first XXXX XXXX XXXX employee who called me, XXXX XXXX, was documented on phone as saying there was a default judgement which would not be removed unless I paid in one payment, two payment or a four payment arrangement. This turned out to be false. The balance was never verified or corrected and I find this to be completely deceptive to me the consumer. K. Other Violations of Texas debt collection practices : 1. Texas Fair Debt Collection Practices Act part 392.202 violations occurred include parts ( A ) & ( B ) upon points 1, 2 & 3. 2. Requirement to provide address to send payment during phone calls attempting to collect on a debt in Texas : On no phone call by XXXX XXXX XXXX or phones calls going back to XXXX with Bank of America and or XXXX XXXX was an address provided for sending payment. This presented a highly ambiguous, deceptive, and confusing path of becoming compliant especially before and right after the charge-off period. L. Suit by XXXX XXXX XXXX did not provide any customary 2 week notice and was done without properly notifying me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I made a check deposit of XXXX at the Bank of America ATM machine. This is something I have done for many years. After making the deposit I received access of only {$300.00} which as expected. After sending out several bills knowing my payroll would also hit my account on XX/XX/XXXX and expecting several automatic payments to go through I proceeded to spend my money on items needed in preparation for my son wedding. I believe on XX/XX/XXXX I was looking at my email and found a email from Bank of America that my account was -XXXX. I called customer service and was told the deposit I made on the XX/XX/XXXX was placed on a hold because of something that was written on the check, indicating the check could be insufficient. I asked the lady how was I supposed to know that this would happen, she stated you would not have known. and why did I have to find it in my email. When I asked if I could come get the check and go cash it at the bank it was written on she told me there was no way they could do this. I explained to her that I needed this money and there was several transactions coming in and all the BOA was doing was holding my check and charging me for {$35.00} for everything that comes in knowing they have a check with sufficient funds. The check was printed by Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts. The warrant number:XXXX, which guarantee the funds and I was informed by the Texas Comptroller these funds are guaranteed. This has cause much anguish, and has basically been a nightmare for me. I have no money, I cant use any of my credit cards because they have declined all payments, and I just do n't know what to do. This is wrong, I have had this account with BOA for over 17 years and have never received such a disservice. I am no longer to move forward with my sons wedding because this has caused a 7 day delay, and I 'm just numb. I need someone to help this wrong be a right. I just cry everyday because the whole reason of me to get these extra funds was to get all of my bills paid and get ready for this which should have been a happy occasion. 

After speaking to the lady with BOA she said I 'm going to refund you one of the {$35.00} fee, but that was all she could do.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX for the satisfaction of a mortgage at XXXX and a satisfaction of a Heloc loan and for an unspecified transaction, XXXX checks were shown by XXXX from XXXX XXXX ( Bank of America ) to have satisfied XXXX transactions. The Heloc loan,XXXX, was taken out by XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and could only have been satisfied from an account attached to their names.Bank of America account number XXXX XXXX XXXX was not found to be attached to either of their social security numbers. United States Trust, BOA, refused to speak with me in their NY address to locate the account. All three checks were issued on the account number. I do not know how the checks were funded. No brokerage account has been identified for the funding.Merrill Lynch has not found an account and has referred me back to BOA. I include the XXXX information about the Heloc being satisfied. If these checks are genuine, I will need the full account information about what account and whose account provided the funding. XXXX XXXX did identify a XXXX XXXX XXXX in their profile. For the year indicated, I was the designated trustee of the XXXX XXXX XXXXI provided the Ein number but there was not an account attached to it.

XXXX XXXX, 2017, This is an addendum to a complaint filed to The CFPB, file number XXXX, on XXXX XXXX, 2017, regarding multiple examples of gross violations of banking norms, malfeasance, inability to follow normal banking procedures, arrogance, shielding consumers from reaching a higher level of management to help solve problems beyond a receptionists skill set and/or training and clearly having a corporate culture and a mantra of " that 's just they way it is ''. That is not an acceptable answer especially when BOA is holding a corporate check ( XXXX XXXX ) for nearly 30 days. NO BOA, NEWS FLASH -- -- -THAT IS NOT JUST THE WAY IT IS ( Or T.HE WAY IT SHOULD BE ). I was told that BOA held the check ( for 30 days?, in order to protect me? From whom? XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX that issued the check? Since I have explained in detail my previous complaint, please allow me to list the chronological dates in order to show the absurdity in BOA 's business practices. Bank of America must feel that because it is a " bank to big to faiil '', it is also a bank that is too big to perform properly. And this is what our tax dollars paid for? No wonder BOA does not care. XXXX XXXX, 2017, A check was issued to me ( XXXX XXXX ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX, the mortgage holder of my home and the lien older by XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$7900.00} Although beyond BOA 's banking accumen, XXXX XXXX XXXX was added as a co-signer in order to protect their investment in my home. Additionally, I had paid the contractor in full, {$8900.00}, upon the completion of the kitchen restoration as a result of flood damage. Knowing that I would soon have the money to cover the contractor ( less than one week ). The contractor, XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), did and exceptional job in restoring my kitchen in record time, using additional employees to finish the job early. Similar to many small businesses, XXXX XXXX lives week to week in order to pay his employees on a weekly basis. I thought it unfair to use the BOA business model of withholding peoples money indefinitely. Unlike BOA, who can tie up one 's funds indefinitely in order to increase their profit by making inter-loan bank loans to other banks using OUR money. XXXX XXXX, 2017 XXXX XXXX XXXX issued a check to to both XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX and it was mailed to XXXX XXXX. I was given explicit instructions by both XXXX  XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX not to endorse the check, nor was I to make any marks on he check. I was to XXXX the check to XXXX XXXX XXXX for them to endorse the check and to place a " hold harmless '' statement on the check. XXXX XXXX XXXX then XXXX XXXX the check to me for my deposit. XXXX XXXX, 2017, I deposited the dual endorsed check into my Bank of America Account and on my receipt, it said nothing more than a 10 day hold was in force. After the 10 day hold had passed, my funds were still not available to me. After hours on the phone, I was told that XXXX XXXX XXXX had not endorsed it, which I made a copy before depositing the check, and that statement was a blatant lie. The check had been endorsed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. Upon another hour of review, I was told that XXXX XXXX XXXX was not listed on my account, ( as a spouse would be, and therefore the check could not be deposited ). Another Blatant lie. How many people have their mortgage company listed on their check as a co-depositor/co-signor ''? Really ''. This is the Best that BOA can come up with? That was pure nonsense. Nonetheless, I was told the funds would be available on XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX or not later than after the weekend on XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX, 2017 I asked to speak to a supervisor or someone in management. I do n't know what people in management do all day, but they certainly to not concern themselves with customer care/customer relations. No matter how many times I called, I could not break through the gatekeeper of the first line of defense. the customer service rep. Clearly, they were afraid to escalate calls for people who had legitimate problems to those executives in offices with windows and a view of the beautiful BOA campus. To a " T '', and by rote, the answer I received from everyone was " that 's just the way it is '' / And, curiously, nobody from BOA could produce the back side of the check that was endorsed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. I am attaching two different correspondence to me where I requested a copy of the front and back of the check. Both times they could only produce a copy of the front of the check. Now, I am certainly not a banker, but I am a XXXX XXXX who keeps copies of every document, front and back. But this would elude BOA 's technical abilities? XXXX XXXX, 2017 I again called BOA and they invoked the " legal '' clause, saying that legally, they had until XXXX XXXX to deliver the funds. Today is XXXX XXXX. No Funds. No communication ( ever, ever, ever, from BOA. It makes one wonder what they are hiding.

Consumer complaint narrative: This Bank of America credit card account was opened by my ex wife nearly 2 years BEFORE we were married. In our divorce decree, she agreed to take responsibility for the account because it was solely hers. I never had access to the account, nor did I ever use it. Shortly after our divorce, she quit making payments and B of A attempted to collect from me. She later filed bankruptcy and this B of A account was covered in that bankruptcy. Regardless, B of A has continued to attempt to collect from me. I have made several attempts to contact them to have this removed from my credit, once with a financial advisor who works for XXXX XXXX XXXX, but B of A refuses to give any information or help in any way without providing money or a payment. I have asked them to provide any type of document where I have used the account or signed an agreement of financial responsibility, but they have not done so. I have spend hours trying to receive these documents but have only been run around in circles on hold. The address they have on file for this acct, I have NEVER lived at. My credit is nearly perfect, this is my only blemish on there. I pay my bills on time every time.

There was unauthorized purchase on XXXX XXXX $ for XXXX XXXX XXXX sim card. Bank of America did n't start investigation after my dispute 2 months. After I called and ask for actual check they started investigation and completed in 1 day and declined it without investigation. When I called them they even could n't provide me a reason. I called to Bank of America 4 times after that and they just ignoring.

On XX/XX/XXXX representing BANK OF AMERICA, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, sued me in state court for an alleged credit card account that I have never seen before. The debt was disputed from the beginning. Neither Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX could not validate and verified the debt. In court they filed an affidavit that was prepared and signed on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. The affidavit calls me a " defendant '' 1 year and 3 months before I was sued. This type of affidavit ( bogus ) was penalized by the OCC. Bank of America and FIA Card Services paid XXXX XXXX after a Consent Order XXXX and XXXX dated XX/XX/XXXX. According to this Consent Order, BoA has violated few months later by doing exactly the same thing they promised not to repeat. The plaintiff has not filed any contract or terms and conditions with the case.

I filed a homeowner insurance claim with XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) Insurance Company due to a flooded and thereby destroyed kitchen. XXXX issued to me a check on XXXX XXXX, 2017 for {$7900.00} payable to me and to XXXX XXXX XXXX, the holder of my mortgage and therefore, the singular lien holder on my home. XXXX endorsed the check and forwarded the check to me. I endorsed the check and deposited the check into my checking account at Bank of America ( BOA ) on XXXX XXXX, 2017. BOA placed a 10 day hold on the check, for unexplained reasons. On day 1XXXX XXXX of the 10 day hold, the funds were still not made available to me. I called BOA, and after being placed on and off of hold for two hours, I was told that the check was rejected because XXXX had not endorsed the check. When I requested that they again look at the back of the check, they discovered that the check had indeed been endorsed by XXXX. After being placed on hold for another 45 minutes, I was told that the check had been rejected because XXXX was not listed on my checking account, much like a spouse would be listed as an authorized person on my checking account. In addition to the absolute absurdity of the explanations offered by BOA in trying to cover-up their arbitrary and capricious reasoning for rejecting the insurance check, I explained to BOA that I was nevertheless responsible, beginning on XXXX XXXX, 2017, for making payments for my mortgage, my automobile loans as well as " auto payment withdrawals '' for my car insurance, my life insurance policies for my grandchildren and certain other credit cards. Knowing that since my insurance check was rejected, that I would be unable to pay my mortgage and my automobile payment. I was also aware that once the " auto payments '' were withdrawn for my automobile insurance, life insurance payments for my grandchildren and certain other credit card payments, that there would be insufficient funds to pay these creditors. I asked BOA how they would handle the punitive charges of {$35.00} assessed by BOA for each payment made using non sufficient funds ( NSF ). I also asked about the consequences of the fees charged by my creditors due to NSF 's. I was told, " I hear you, but there is nothing we can do to help you ''. On my call to BOA on XXXX XXXX, I was told that my rejected check would arrive to my home possibly on XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX, but no later than XXXX XXXX. With the arrival of no check, I called BOA daily, requesting the escalation of each call to a higher level of management withing BOA. Today, XXXX XXXX, BOA told me that the check was rejected in order to protect me, in case the payer, XXXX XXXX XXXX Insurance Company, did not have sufficient funds. Really? The largest insurer in the State of NJ not having sufficient funds to cover a payment to me for {$7900.00}? Meanwhile, in BOA 's efforts to protect me from financial predators, I am unable to pay my bills.
<P/>
Today, XXXX XXXX, I was told by BOA that by law they did not have to deliver the rejected check to me until XXXX XXXX. How refreshing that BOA is more concerned about their rights under the law than helping their customer to avoid delinquencies in payments to creditors. This, in addition, to causing permanent damage to my credit ratings and credit report.
<P/>
Shame on you Bank of America. You bully your customers in order to protect your profits. If you choose to continue with this arrogant attitude, there will be no need for you to concern yourself with profits. Without customers, there will not be any profits. And, sadly, as you alienate more and more customers, there will come a time where you can no longer cost shift by continuing to add more and more punitive policies. This is not rocket science. With virtual currencies becoming more mainstream, who will need the non-services of Bank of America.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir, I am writing to confirm that I sent letters on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and several others regarding the verification of debt and thus lack of your company providing the required information. Additionally, I enclosed the Affidavit of Notice of Default that I sent on XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX that is associated with your failure of verifying the alleged debt. I am providing notice that I am disputing the debt due to a variety of legal issues. <P/>As of yet, neither you nor your firm have fully complied with my detailed requests. There are ( 11 ) items noted below that your firm are required to provide in order to verify the allege debt. <P/>Upon extensive professional analysis of the alleged debt by a leading forensic specialist, I have obtained vital evidence ( Expert Witness Affidavit ) of extensive fraud, statutory and regulatory violations ( FDCPA, RESPA, TILA, SEC, IRS and UDAP ) associated with the allege debt that has caused me personal injury. The Expert Witness Affidavit is available for inspection upon request and will be used as an instrument to enforce legal rights. <P/>I am committed to litigate against all parties that have engaged in this fraudulent conduct and seek punitive damages unless a solution is provided. <P/><P/><P/>Under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act, it mandates in FDCPA section 809 ( b ), 15 USC 1692g, if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period described in subsection ( a ) that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, or that the consumer requests the name and address of the original creditor, the debt collector shall CEASE AND DESIST collection of the debt, or any disputed portion thereof, UNTIL the debt collector obtains VALIDATION OF THE DEBT. <P/>In XXXX vs. XXXX, the collector can not get a judgment until the debt is validated. <P/>This letter is being sent to you in response to a Notice of Acceleration and Foreclosure dated XX/XX/XXXX. Please be advised that, pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g sec. 809 ( b ) that your claim IS DISPUTED and VALIDATION is requested. <P/><P/><P/>This letter requests VALIDATION of the alleged debt accompanied by an Affidavit from the Alleged Lender. <P/>Please provide the following : 1. Copy of the original alleged note accompanied by an AFFIDAVIT from the alleged Lender 2. Identify to what the alleged debt pertains.
3. Provide details how the alleged debt was calculated. ( XXXX v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX Court,XX/XX/XXXX 4. Provide Regulation Z, and Notice of Right to Cancel ( Truth in Lending Act ) 5. Provide copies of any papers that show that I agreed to pay the alleged debt. 6. Identify the original creditor. 7. Provide the agreement between the creditor and your firm which authorizes you to collect funds ( without a contract, your firm has no right to foreclose ). 8. Provide evidence that the Statute of Limitations has not expired on this account.
9. Provide evidence that you are licensed to collect in my state.
10. Provide the legal address of the alleged owner of the note 11. Please provide positive and affirmative proof of claim that the alleged loan promissory note and the deed of trust were transferred into to the REMIC at closing and acquired by real estate investment trust pursuant to Title 26 U.S.C. 856 ( e ) ( 1 ) to whom you alleged is the foreclosing entity.
<P/><P/><P/>
Upon receiving the requested information, I will require at least thirty ( 30 ) days to investigate this information. During such time, all collection activity must CEASE and DESIST. <P/>If your offices have reported unvalidated information to any of the three ( 3 ) major Credit Bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. If negative reporting is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will bring legal action against you, pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act. <P/>Also during this VALIDATION period, if ANY action is taken which could be considered detrimental, including negative reporting to credit bureaus which could be inaccurate or invalid, I will pursue legal action. <P/>If your offices fail to respond to this VALIDATION REQUEST within 30 days from the date of XX/XX/XXXX, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. <P/>I also request that your office make no telephone calls to my home or place of employment. If your offices attempt telephone communication with me, including but not limited to computer generated calls and calls or correspondence sent to or with any third parties, it will be considered harassment and I will have to pursue legal action. All future communications must be done in writing and sent to the address noted in this letter by USPS or certified mail. <P/>This is an attempt to validate the alleged debt and to correct records, and information obtained will be used for that purpose. <P/>If foreclosure proceedings, collection activities and sale date advertisements and are not stopped before XX/XX/XXXX, I will send letters directly to Federal Trade Commission, the U.S. Attorney General Consumer Protection Office, Department of Housing and Urban Development ( file under RESPA regulations ), FDIC, Department of Banking and Finance and the Georgia Bar Association ( for disregarding and failing to comply with Federal Code ). <P/>The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, Section 15 809, gives everyone who may have a loan certain consumer rights, whether or not the loan servicing has transferred. The FDCPA is intended for any DEBT COLLECTOR including MORTGAGES. If a borrower sends a VALIDATION OF DEBT letter to the present loan servicer, other alleged lender, or entity or company attempting to collect, all requested documentation must be provided to the borrower within 30 days of receipt of the request. During this 30 day period, the Lender or Servicer or Collector must suspend any and all collection activity ( including FORECLOSURE OF THE PROPERTY ) until the debt has been legally validated and VALIDATION has been received. <P/>If any debt collector fails to comply with the validation of debt notice the borrower is entitled to an award of actual damages, statutory damages up to {$1000.00} ( per count ), cost and attorneys fees. 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1692k ( a ). Class action relief is also available. 15 U.S.C. Sec 1692k ( a ) ( B ). <P/>Any debt collector who violates any provision of the FDCPA has a potential liability for the actual damages. A single violation is more than sufficient to support judgment for the borrower/consumer. See :  XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ; XXXX v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX). There can be actual damages which includes emotional stress, embarrassment, and humiliation caused by improper activities and conduct during their debt collection activities. The FDCPA allows recovery of Statutory damages limited to 1 % of the debt collector 's net worth or {$500000.00}, whichever is less. <P/>
In summary, please respond to this request for VALIDATION of the Alleged Debt with an AFFIDAVIT and please provide answers to the ( 10 ) items addressed above. <P/>Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX

I have had a credit card account with Bank of America since XX/XX/XXXX. Over the last 14 years, I have been allowed to add and delete authorized users on my account, and have always understood by doing so that I was taking full responsibility of allowing them to use my card, and that I was fully responsible for any and all charges associated with use of my credit card. On XX/XX/XXXX, I went to get gas as usual using my Bank of America credit card, and it was declined. Thinking the machine was broken, I left and went to a different gas station. After my card being declined again, I called in and found out that my account had been reviewed and closed without any prior notice or explanation. While that was not expected, and I understand it is within their rights to do so, I have another issue. I had earned XXXX points as of XX/XX/XXXX. I have tried to cash them out at the .01/pt rate they normally offer, and am unable to do so online as I have always done. I called in and spoke with 2 different people at Bank of America, and neither could give me a reason as to why the points could n't be redeemed, only stated that they were lost due to the account being closed. These points were earned. Had I cashed them out on XX/XX/XXXX, they would have sent a check. This is unfair, and I wish to be compensated for {$1000.00}, which I earned using this card.

The first represantitives answer was basically, 'if you do n't like it close the account. ' VERY helpful. The second rep I spoke with was the woman who I opened the account with. She now informs me there 's a 1 week hold on all my funds. She tells me this is normal procedure. That 's not what she told me the day before. Now I have no money, have no paycheck, and am left with the burden of traveling to work for a week with no money, food or gas. Their underhanded tactics and lies are going to cost me my job.

I would like to reopen a disputed transaction that Bank of America considered as resolved. It is about my recent dispute transaction with XXXX ( Claim ID:XXXX ). XXXX took out {$100.00} from my account without my authorization because their ticket buyer claimed that I sold invalid tickets. XXXX emailed me about this and asked me to obtain every proof that I can get from the venue itself, as well as my proof of purchase. I replied to their email right away and gave them everything they asked for ; however, the venue was not able to give me ticket scans. I sent XXXX all my chat conversations, and they have decided to take out the money from my account without giving me proof that their buyer was telling the truth. I am furious that Bank of America allowed XXXX to take out money from my account without my authorization. During the dispute process, XXXX sent them data and information about the transaction, and sent them user agreements from their website. As quote on quote stated on their user agreement : " If you fail to respond to this email and or to take any other actions required by XXXX to investigate the invalid ticket claim, you may be charged an amount equal to 55 % of the cost of the original tickets. In addition to the invalid ticket charge described in the paragraph above. A respnse constitutes an acknowledgment of our request and bonafide the effort to investigate the clain and obtain documentation. HOWEVER, FAILING TO RESPOND, AND NOT BEING ABLE TO PROVIDE DOCUMENTATION ARE NOT THE SAME. WE UNDERSTAND THAT EVERY TEAM AND VENUE IS DIFFERENT, AND THERE MAY BE CASES WHERE YOU CAN NOT OBTAIN DOCUMENTATION TO ASSIST IN THE INVESTIGATION. IN THESE CASES, WE 'LL WORK WITH YU AND USE YOUR HISTORY WITH US, SPECIFICALLY YOUR INVALID TICKET CLAIM RATE TO DETERMINE THE RESOLUTION. '' XXXX in no way worked with me on this when I emailed them and asked them for proof that the buyer was not lying and was not able to use my tickets. They did not reply back after they have already taken out the money from my account. I used their chat option to be able to talk to a representative, and I told the chat agent that I have a clean selling history with them and asked them to reconsider their decision, but they refused to give me that and they blocked me from using their website. Bank of America overlooked this on the documentation that XXXX sent them, and I still do not understand why Bank of America considered this as resolved when nothing has been resolved. XXXX refused to work with me even though their user agreement states that they will work with sellers when it comes to special cases like mines.

I recently traveled to XXXX XXXX, and brought a Bank of America credit card with me. No issues using it until the last day. Stopped to get gas for the rental car prior to returning it, and was given a slip to sign ( 1 ) and then given back a receipt ( 2 ) for the correct amount. After getting home, a charge for much more than the receipt ( 2 ) amount posted to my credit card. I disputed the charge as an " incorrect transaction amount '' with Bank of America, assuming it was a simple mistake and they could work it out with the gas station. The station sent back a receipt ( 3 ) that I did not sign - it was forged, and Bank of America said there was nothing they could do, because the card was present at the transaction, and I did not have the " correct '' receipt. I did n't realize the final receipt given to me ( 2 ) was from a different customer 's credit card, even though the dollar amount matches the dollar amount that I had originally signed for on receipt ( 1 ). I was never given a copy of my signed receipt when I left, just like in a restaurant.
<P/>
After all that, I disputed again, this time as a " fraud '' dispute - citing my forged signature and providing evidence of my signature. I just received word that this claim has also been denied.
<P/>
Thank you for your help in this matter. Please see below for a timeline and the attached supporting documentation. <P/>Important Dates : XX/XX/XXXX - Bank of America credit card used at gas station in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Receipt given to me at time of sale showed purchase amount of XXXX XXXX ( about $ 26-27 XXXX dollars ). XX/XX/XXXX - Transaction for {$140.00} shows as pending, and then posts on either XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX.
XX/XX/XXXX - Original dispute filed, for transaction amount charged. I disputed {$110.00} ( meaning I was comfortable paying at most {$30.00} for the gas purchase ). {$110.00} was immediately credited to my account.
XX/XX/XXXX - Notified that the claim was denied. BoA sent a letter via mail and my online banking. Online banking also included a copy of the merchant provided receipt for XXXX XXXX ( lines up with {$140.00} charge, this is referred to receipt ( 3 ) above ). I never signed receipt 3, it is not my signature. I called BoA the next day, and they asked me to send in some information I had, including the receipt I was given ( 2 ). XX/XX/XXXX - Went to a BoA branch and faxed in the attached " XXXX Full Package. '' This includes receipts ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) as well as a letter detailing the issue. XX/XX/XXXX - Received a letter from BoA ( mail and online banking ) explaining that the claim still could not be honored. See attached " XXXX Claim Letter. '' I called again and explained that the signature was forged, BoA again said they needed more information. XX/XX/XXXX - Stopped by BoA branch and faxed the attached " XXXX Full Package. '' Included is my current license ( to prove signature ), as well as the receipts ( 2 ) and ( 3 ), and BoA 's letters. I again called BoA and explained the situation. They said there was nothing they could do, because the card was present at the the transaction and there was a signature. XX/XX/XXXX - At the suggestion of a BoA employee I spoke with on the phone, I filed a fraud dispute for the charge online. This transaction is not something I authorized, so I think it should be labelled as fraud. Somebody took my card, swiped it for a purchase I did n't authorize, and the forged my signature. XX/XX/XXXX - Received the attached " XXXX Claim Letter '', once again denying my claim. XX/XX/XXXX - Filed this CFBP complaint. <P/><P/>Attached Documents XXXX Claim Letter XXXX Full Package XXXX Claim Letter XXXX Full Package XXXX Claim Letter

Consumer complaint narrative: The Complaint that I have is with Bank of America over the last 5 months I have requested validation on multiple occasions for debt that is listed on my credit report. I have asked for evidence that bears my signature that shows that I have a contractual obligation with Bank Of America I have not received anything that I requested and it still listed on my credit report from all three of the Credit Reporting Agencies. They also to not show on my report the I dispute this account and this is all in volition of Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. They keep sending me a letter asking me to provide them more information. I do not have more information. I am asking them what they are reporting and why. they can not tell me.

Late last year I opened a credit account with Bank of America, due to the terms and rewards advertising I decided to apply and was approved. Then about 4 or 5 months later they closed the account without explanation and told me they would not reopen it. I then asked if that would affect my rate to which they responded that it would not so I kept making my minimum payments since I figured at zero percent I was better to do it that way. Suddenly my minimum payment goes up about 3 or 4 months ago. I told them what the problem was and they told me I qualified for no such thing ( zero interest ) and in fact I had been always paying interest, and now my promotion was over and my interest was to be 28.99 % to which so far they have changed several times, I think the last one they gave me was 20 or 21 %. First they gave me a rate that was low or so I though and then they close the account without me being able to accumulate more rewards or take advantage of the rate for the full terms. These people should not get away with this, without someone doing something about it. Thank you!

So the day of XXXX XXXX,2017 I went to withdraw a somewhat big amount but was denied and the lady behind the counter told me was blocked and probably said it could be because you made a small purchase at. Such place then a big might still be processing and they 'd think that 's sketchy and I thought that was all bad so she gave me a number where tocall and I did got told that it will be closed did n't say a reason and told me I could withdraw my balance yet o went back to the branch and was told no I could not and they too called for it and I was like well I spoke to one she said I could withdraw he said no until it 's reviewed then it 'll be assign to someone and you can then call and see what is going on.

I had disputed with Bank of America for over a year the fact an account that had been closed, charged off and issued a XXXX for ( and filed and paid income tax on ) no longer had a balance owed but was still reporting as having a current balance due. In XX/XX/XXXX BofA finally confirmed in the attached letter that there was no remaining balance owed. The reporting was corrected on the three credit bureaus and I thought the issue was over. In XX/XX/XXXX I was declined credit and it referenced this account showing the old balance again showing due. I disputed again ( through the CFPB ) and received another letter ( attached as well ) indicating that the reporting was correct and referenced that the prior XX/XX/XXXX letter stated that as well ( IT ACTUALLY STATES THE OPPOSITE ). I have called and left phone messages and emailed the representative on the letter and received no response. Ironically I did receive the attached survey request from BofA regarding a return call I never received. My attorney has since written a letter ( see attached ) and has received no response as well. While he decides what to do next on his end, I am sending this additionally as an addition means to correct this issue.

I maintained a savings account for my son's college money at Bank of America from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. I opened it as a Balance Rewards Money Market account with no monthly charge, which was why I selected that type of account. Over the years I used it to pay my son's college tuition and other expenses. On XX/XX/XXXX there was XXXX in the account and no monthly charge. The following month Bank of America changed the account to a Money Market Savings account without notifying me, and began to charge a XXXX fee every month after that. I continued to use the account, assuming there was no service fee until XX/XX/XXXX, when I discovered the fee and closed the account. During these two years I used the account sporadically to transfer money online to my son, never seeing any notice of a service fee. (At this point I can't remember if I received statements in the mail, by email, or not at all. After I discovered the service fee in XX/XX/XXXX, I asked for a paper copy of each statement from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, which I now have.)When I complained to the Bank about changing the account to a different one without informing me, they refunded 6 months of service fees (XXXX), but refused to refund the remaining XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have been receiving excessive mail for two different people at the address I 've lived at for several years now, from Bank of America. I 've sent them back unopened, " Return to Sender and eventually " Cease and Desist '', which temporarily resolved the issue but now I have begun receiving credit card offers for these people again today. I finally opened one of them and spent 21 minutes on the phone today trying to resolve it and eventually hung up. I am beyond frustrated in exhausting my efforts and throwing away mail for them as well. They 've ignored my Cease and Desist requests and are now harassing me again and they make it impossible to reach anyone on the phone. I have no business with them and do not receive offers for myself. XXXX XXXX XXXX nor XXXX XXXX do not live at my address and I want the mail to cease immediately.

I had a Bank of America cash rewards business credit card. The card had accrued around {$160.00} in cash rewards. The bank decided to close my credit card XXXX 2016 and has refused to pay me the {$160.00} in rewards earned. I have spoke with Bank of America customer service and wriiten to the BBB.

I previously notified Bank of America that I am a victim of identity theft, and requested them to do the following : Close the unauthorized account Remove any charges on the unauthorized accounts, and Take steps to remove information about these account from my credit files. I still have not received written confirmation of these actions. As I stated before : I am a victim of identity theft. I recently learned that my personal information was used to open an account at your company without my authorization. I did not open or authorize this account and charges, and I request that it be closed immediately and all unauthorized charges be removed. Please send me written confirmation that I am not responsible for charges on this account, and take appropriate steps to remove information about this account from my credit files. I have enclosed a copy of my Police Identity Theft Report. Because the information you are reporting is the result of identity theft, and inaccurate, I request that you stop reporting this information to the CRAs, as directed by section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ). I ask that you take these steps as soon as possible. Please stop reporting this fraudulent information, investigate this matter, and delete any disputed items as soon as possible. Please send me a letter explaining your findings and actions. Sincerely, Enclosures : Identity Theft Police Report

On XX/XX/XXXX I deposited a check from one of our clients into our BoA business checking account. The following day I noticed that the check was placed on an extended hold and so then processed to reach out to the bank to see what was the cause oh the hold. The bank claimed that they could not verify the check, rather, that could not confirm that the check was written out to us even though the client clearly made the payment out to us. After speaking to multiple bank representatives and being placed on ridiculously long hold I then came to learn that BoA was closing our business account with them and would not render any explanation as to why they were doing so. BoA then decided to hold the check that I deposited along with the funds in our account, they disabled our ability to view the online banking portal thus making it impossible to transfer funds onto new account in order to continue conducting business. I made several attempts to regain access to our account, BoA representatives were not interested in helping us resolve this issue, they would constantly transfer me to a new person would then give me the same information that the previous person gave, and would they continue to not provide us with any explanation as to WHY this was happening. I also asked to speak to a department manager and was always denied. It has now been over three weeks and the issue is yet to be  resolved, BoA claims that the account is still in the process of closure, and I have not received the check that I attempted to deposit. As a result this has caused a serious strain on our business andcaused us to miss payments due to vendors and such, and has disabled our ability to conduct  business.

I have been monitoring my credit score for the last 2-3 years.
I signed up for XXXX in XXXX of 2015 and have been monitoring my credit report and score. XXXX has FICO scores, and they currently give me a score of XXXX.
I also signed up for XXXX earlier this year because they seem to use a different model called XXXXXXXX XXXX. My score on XXXX is XXXX.
Bank of America seems to use FICO scores from XXXX. However, neither their FICO score, nor XXXX score matches my credit score on either of the individual credit bureaus. BofA gives me a XXXX. Not sure how they come to this score and they wo n't give an explanation.
When I visited a BofA branch, I asked the representative about this and they did not have an answer for me. They just said we pull the score from XXXX, to which I told them that my score on XXXX is much different that what they show me. BofA credit score makes it difficult for me to ask for a credit line increase, they have turned me down once already.
My job requires me to travel quite a bit and use my credit card for flight and hotel bookings, and I have to keep paying it off 3 to 4 times a month every time I travel.
It would be great if BofA could explain how they give me the credit score they show on online banking and correct it to what XXXX actually shows as my credit score.

My husband and I ( XXXX and XXXX XXXX ) have a joint account at Bank of America. The recent balance in the account was approx {$24000.00}. On X/XX/2017 we were contacted by Bank of America to inform us that earlier that morning someone was able to represent himself as XXXX XXXX, successfully opened an additional joint checking account with Bank of America in XXXX XXXX 's name with a joint account holder. Neither my husband nor I know who the joint account holder is. {$140000.00} was successfully transferred to the fraudulent account. Essentially it was explained to us that my husband was a victim of identity theft. On XX/XX/XXXX I was initially assured that the money would be restored to our account and once restored I could go to the branch and close out my account that had been breached and created a new account to transfer the funds in to. Unfortunetly the funds we never transferred back to my account. I am now told that this will not happen until the fraud investigation is complete and that this could take up to 30 days! I find this unacceptable. I do n't understand why my funds have to be tied up for 30 days. We have presented proper ID at the bank and still we are told 30 days. I have been a customer of Bank of America for at least 15 years. This is not a small amount of money and I find this to be inappropriate and unethical. An investigation can continue without them holding my funds. I want my money transferred back to my account ASAP.

XXXX XXXX 2017- I Fill out on online credit application for new B of A credit card, with 0 % transfer fee & ask for small amount ( approx ) {$1000.00} transfer at the time. Slightly less than the balance on my old ( XXXX ) credit card. <P/>Approx 3 weeks later ( days before a major national holiday -around XXXX ) I receive my new card in the mail & right after a major holiday, receive on XXXX XXXX an email stating B of A is transferring almost 5K to my old card! ( {$4700.00} ) XXXX, a huge error, an amount almost 3 x my old card limit- which I never authorized. <P/>I call the support number immediately on XXXX XXXX. it says the location is closed. I try again again on the XXXX in the XXXX -asking this payment to be stopped. I was informed by several managers of Bank of America located on the The XXXX in XXXX XXXX that she would be reimbursed for her funds IF we were willing to press charges against the victims, which we are currently in the process of doing. Once informed, I immediately contacted the XXXX county Sheriff dept and the victims are currently being investigated. I provided Bank of America Check Fraud Dept AND the Electronic fraud dept with the police report number and the name and contact number of the detective that 's currently investigating on her behalf. I received correspondence from the check fraud dept ( X/XX/17 ) stating that Bank of America would only be willing to reimburse XXXX {$1500.00} for the check fraud claim ( claim # XXXX ) and rec'vd a letter dated ( X/XX/17 ) stating that the they would be reimbursing {$1300.00} for the electronic fraud claim ( claim # XXXX ). Due to amount of fraudulent transactions/withdrawals on this account, I had to compile a spreadsheet. To date, I have contacted Bank of America on the following dates : X/X/17 spoke with covering manager XXXX who stated that Bank of America would reimburse XXXX as long as we 're willing to press charges, X/XX/17 spoke with XXXX XXXX ( manager ) who stated that Bank of America will reimburse as long as we 're willing to press charges, X/XX/17 called fraud dept, spoke to XXXX who stated that claim had not yet been assigned, X/XX/17 mailed letter with attached spreadsheet to Bank of America Corporate office @ XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX ( which was given to me by XXXX in the fraud dept ) ; X/X/17 spoke with XXXX XXXX, X/X/17- called Fraud dept and spoke with XXXX to file an electronic investigation claim because I was not informed on X/X/17 that I would have to file two separate claims. X/XX/17 Called claims dept and spoke to XXXX who stated that Bank of America is only willing to reimburse {$1500.00} for the check fraud investigation because they were not notified within 60 days but could not provide me anything in writing re : company policy where that was stated. X/XX/17- spoke with XXXX re : electronic claim who stated they 're in need of an affidavit, X/XX/17- spoke with XXXX from escalated dept at XXXX who advised me to send a letter with spreadsheet to the corporate office XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX, letter was sent and no one ever responded to my letter. X/XX/17- spoke with XXXX ( assisting manager ) regarding the fraud claim, X/X/17- rec'vd a phone call from XXXX ( fraud dept ) stating that he 's in need of affidavit. X/XX/17- Called fraud dept- asked for supervisor, spoke with XXXX and he stated that he would send the check fraud claim to be investigated again due to me stating that I was going to contact the media regarding this issue. To date, nothing has been done! Please note, XXXX have been banking with Bank of America for years, therefore, Bank of America is well aware of her frugal style of banking. Additionally, ( 4 ) different people were writing checks and forging XXXX 's name. Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for the XXXX XXXX XXXX card and feel as though I received an unfair and misleading bait-and-switch offer. Apparently there are two credit card options -- which have very different terms and benefits -- the XXXX Signature has all of the benefits that are emphasized in the advertising, and the Platinum Plus XXXX, which has many many fewer benefits, including 1/6 of the bonus miles, no free checked baggage, and a significantly reduced companion ticket benefit. While it mentions this possibility on the application website, it was not clear to me during the application process that I had actually received the lower-tiered version. ( Unfortunately, I do n't have a screenshot of this process, however, I do not recall there being any verbiage indicating that I had not been approved for the XXXX Signature -- it must have just said I was approved for the Platinum Plus, which at the time I did n't realize was  different. ) It was also not clear that there were such different benefits between the two options. Furthermore, I was not given the option to state whether I was in fact interested in this lower-option ( which I was n't ) : once I applied and was approved for the lower version, I did not have the option to decline. So, essentially, I applied thinking I was going to get one card, was apparently not approved for it, and was automatically given a different card which I would never have applied for in the first place. It is also unclear to me why I was n't approved for the better option. I have a pretty good credit score ( XXXX ), and have other lines of credit that are in good standing. I tried calling Bank of America, and they were not able to provide me with answers. They only told me that I could reapply, but that I would n't get the additional bonus miles. I declined, and closed my account. I 'm sure Bank of America has covered its behind by putting all of this in the legalese of fine print, but honestly I consider myself a fairly savvy customer and I was still duped. I do n't think that, even if it says so in the fine print, you should be able to apply for one credit card and end up with another, with very different terms and benefits. ( Especially given that even applying for a credit card can negatively impact one 's credit score. Now I 've been hurt for getting a credit card I never wanted in the first place. )

I had a business checking account closed. I am guessing that they contractually had the right to do so. However, upon closing, the balance is supposed to be mailed. After getting suspicious, I went to my banking center and made several calls. They confirmed that a check for approximately {$7800.00} was mailed on XX/XX/XXXX. After inquiring on XX/XX/XXXX I was told they were within the 7-10 day processing period, to which I disagreed. After inquiring again on XX/XX/XXXX I was told that they would not stop the check and I would have to wait 90 days to verify if the check was not cashed and they would issue another. I was not provided the contact information for the legal department and was told I would have to find that information for myself. I then filed an OCC complaint and was called by a Bank of America representative who handles OCC complaints. She verified she had received the complaint and would get back to me that day after some research. Not hearing from her I had to initiate contact myself once again. I talked to a woman in the account closure department and XXXX XXXX XXXX whom I believe is in some type of resolution role. I was then contacted by XXXX XXXX ext XXXX who originally called me about the OCC complaint. After much discussion, I was told a check for MY FUNDS could not be stopped and that I would have to wait 90 days to see if the check had been cashed. I find this all very disturbing and unacceptable that a financial institution can not distribute my money from my account. The closure did n't involve any investigation that would tie this up. It was simply a business decision on the part of Bank of America.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX, 2012, I opened a secured credit card with Bank of America, and made a deposit of US XXXX XXXX dollar. I was told that once I used the card for one year and repay it as though it was an unsecured card I would be issued with a credit card from the bank. Upon using the card I later notice that I was being charge interest on the money I deposited. I was not pleased about it so I requested for the card to be closed after using the money that I had deposited. I later discovered that Bank of America reported the account to the credit bureau. I am puzzled as to why, because the money I used was put on the card by me. I have made several attempts to have them remove this item from credit report which they have ignored.

On XXXX XXXX, 2017 my VA Benefits were direct deposited into my Bank of America account. When I went to get the money out to pay my bills around XXXX, my debit card would not work at the ATM. Attempted to login to our online banking and was not able to do so. I waited in the Bank of America local branch parking lot until they opened at XXXX. When I was finally assisted I was informed that our account had been frozen due to fraudulent checks. When they showed me the checks they were from people all over the United States that I had never even met. The signature " my signature '' on the back of them looked nothing like my handwriting. I was then informed that they would have to close my account on the spot, knowing I have XXXX and VA payments direct deposited, and that until they were done with their investigation I was only allowed to have approximately {$600.00} of my $ 1900+ paycheck. I asked what I was suppose to do about my benefits that are direct deposited and was told to basically take my business elsewhere and open a new account. I did so, and updated Social Security and the VA of the changes. My social security was still sent to the closed account anyway and I was issued a cashiers check that i received a few days later in the mail. On XXXX XXXX, 2017 Bank of America actually closed the account. It had only been two weeks even though the Treasury 's Green Book states that the institute must keep the account open for 30 days. The account can be closed sooner if it is an issue of fraud, which it was, however the same regulation states that if this is done the bank must still accept the direct deposit and make it available to the consumer. On XXXX XXXX, 2017 my VA check should have been direct deposited into the new account. It was n't and instead was sent to the closed Bank of America account. Attempted to go to the bank to get my funds and I was told it was sent back to the Treasury and now we must wait up to 30 days for Bank of America to return the check to the treasury then for the treasury to either put it into our new account or mail a check which could take even longer.

Consumer complaint narrative: Time after time, BOA will hold checks and payments and wait until the moment my direct deposit has gone in. I am over it, there is no reason I should 've had a fee, when there WAS enough funds to cover the check. They also have a fake story of " rolling fee reversal '', but can not give me dates, or times. They also are are supoosed to have a 24 hour time frame to fix an account with a negative balance ( per their handbook ), though do not follow their own guidelines.

I have sent them a fraud package and they have ignored it. They continue to threaten me that if I do n't pay the balance on the account that they allowed to be opened in my name fraudulently that they would ruin my credit and send the account to a collector. I was the victim of identity theft and accounts were opened in my name using my correct personal information that was obtained as a result of the identity theft. When I have told this to the representatives at Bank of America they have told me that they did not care and that I was still required the fraudulent account. They are violating my rights, defaming my character and harassing me relentlessly. I did not open this or any other account with Bank of America, but they continue to verbally abuse me and threaten me.

I held a spousal ( second ) card a Bank of America credit card last year with an account ending in XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX my wife and together visited a Bank of America financial center branch in XXXX, MN. Our goal was to change my status from mere second cardholder to a fully-authorized co-holder so I could use Bank of Americas web portal to download rewards airline points earned ; I had been denied access when attempting that task a month prior. XXXX XXXX XXXX served us behind a counter as relationship banker that day, her business card below. Upon learning the details of our request she said that such a credit card status change was not possible and insisted we close XXXX and open a new one. I found it odd at the time, it seemed a simple technical matter to me. I inquired if the large amount of points we had accrued that year would seamlessly transition to a new account. She checked with her supervisor who was on site that morning and he said, yes indeed. So my wife and I went down that path that day, which was rather lengthy ; later we were sent new account cards ending in XXXX with co-equal status as requested. What did not ever happen was the transfer of airline rewards points from one account to the other. I made phone inquiries about his matter on XX/XX/XXXX ( with XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), XX/XX/XXXX, ( XXXX ), and today, XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ), to resolve the matter of my XXXX lost points. Case numbers were assigned by the seven Bank of American customer services agents named above ( XXXX, XXXX ) with promises for resolution based on further research. Whenever I phoned I asked if the agent could review case notes but adequate notes were never entered they said ; ultimately the answer was always " no. '' I view the whole matter now, a year in hindsight, to be a scam of the sort appearing in the press last year pertaining to similar serial transgressions by XXXX XXXX. We were effectively coerced into opening a new account that then wiped out {$33000.00} of charges accrued into points. We were given busy work of a new card application with only liabilities accruing. XXXX XXXX, her XX/XX/XXXX supervisor, and Bank of America as a corporation all should be ashamed of themselves. I suggest they be investigated and, if appropriate, be fined, fired, or both.

Consumer complaint narrative: I applied online for the Bank of America XXXX XXXX Signature Visa and all of the benefits that come with that specific card. I was instead automatically approved for an XXXX XXXX Visa Platinum plus card with a different annual fee and none of the benefits. Thinking this was a mistake, I applied again for the XXXX Visa Signature Card and the application went pending. I called BofA to see what was going on and they said they could approve me for the Visa Plat if i chose to. I chose not to but asked to have someone else look at my application for the Visa Signature card. He they asked if I consented to have my application reconsidered and i said yes. He then approved me for the other card, a Visa Platinum and claimed that I had never applied for the Visa Signature. I was escalated to a supervisor and she claimed my XXXX credit score and XXXX income did not qualify me for the Visa Signature and they decided to automatically approve me for a card that was not marketed at all on their application page. BAIT AND SWITCH. This is very deceptive. Definitely a UDAAP issue. I did some research online and there are HUNDREDS of other people who have complained about this same deceptive marketing practice. If you look at the link below, you will see advertising for ONLY the Visa Signature card and not the inferior yet still expensive Visa Platinum. There is no mention of the Platinum benefits or fees because they are inferior and nobody would apply knowing that they could be approved for the inferior card. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I never wanted the XXXX XXXX Visa Platinum with a {$50.00} annual fee and sub-par benefits . Nor did I apply for it. Yet somehow I was approved for TWO of them. I closed them but do not want them reported on my Credit Report.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX {$15000.00} was fraudulently withdrawn from our savings account with a use of a debit account. Our bank is Bank of American who we contacted immediately. We reported it to Bank of America, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Florida XXXX. Phone number is XXXX XXXX. Their internal fraud report apparently says that some one in the XXXX region open a debit card in my name. Our address is XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX. My wife has a debit card but I do not. Apparently the fraudulent card was opened in XXXX ( XXXX ), Florida which is on the west side of Florida and we live n the XXXX side. The person apparently attempted to withdraw money through an ATM machine connected to Delaware from a Bank of American office but was declined. He went to a Bank of America teller and withdrew {$7000.00} and than went to another location and withdrew {$8000.00}. I have been assured that if the money was fraudulently taken I will get it back. My issue is it is a lot of money for my wife and I and we have asked Bank of America twice to at least confirm in writing that the fraud happened and they are investigating and need a certain period of time to complete their investigation. We call the fraud line but get a different state and obviously a different person each time we call and they give no information except that it will take 30 to 60 days. I am concerned that at the end of this period they may not even acknowledge they are working on it. Even though Bank of America has promised to send an acknowledgement letter to us by email and by mail we have not received anything. This may be standard procedure and they may have to be very careful on what they say. This is my first experience in dealing with something like this. I am also surprised they do not make it clearer that we our covered by various financial regulations to help us alleviate our financial fear. The Bank of America local office has been very nice but all they can do is call they same fraud line that we call and get the same answer. I guess I am really concerned that if I am patient that in 60 days they will still not tell us anything.

Consumer complaint narrative: I use my debit card so I do not have to reconcile checks. I transferred money to another account after seeing that there was plenty of money in the bank and the account still went negative. After I made the transfer there was over a thousand dollars on the bank. But it still went negative. I explained this to the supervisor and they still refused to refund the fee!

On Tuesday XXXX XXXX, 2016 I lost my debit card shortly after leaving the bank. It took a couple days for me to realize my debit card was missing and when I called the bank the following Thursday or Friday to report my card missing I was informed that over {$1800.00} had been fraudulently charged to my account. At first the funds were credited to my account but then about 2 weeks later I recieve notification that the charges were not made in error and that I was responsible. Then the bank reversed the funds out of my account and left my account balance in the negative. I filed an appeal to their decision and did everything they instructed me to do and they still refused to cover my fraud claim even though their policy is 100 % Fraud Protection. When I refused to pay the negative balance now owed to my account as a result of this injustice, the bank went ahead and filed a negative report on my credit with XXXX XXXX. I found this out today when I was applying for a business account at another bank and was DENIED due to this erronious reporting. First they promise total fraud protection, then they break promise and take my money, and now they attempt to ruin my otherwise perfect credit. I 've accepted my fate and ignored the fact they STOLE over {$1800.00} from me but now reporting negatively on my good credit is where I draw the line.

Bank of America has been notified on more than 1 occasion that the debt they claim I owe was from Identity theft. Their story has continually changed over the course of a year and yet they refused to do anything about this. Well I have been looking at US codes and I have found a code Bank of America should be prosecuted under, Title 18 Part 1 Chapter 42 EXTORTIONATE CREDIT TRANSACTIONS. Under this code, it states that forcing someone to pay a debt by threatening their physical well being or personal reputation is a violation of criminal law. The CFPB should already have copies of my evidence that numbers in the 300 separate documents range, that Bank of America is in violation of this criminal law by using extortion and ruining my credit to try and force me to pay a debt that is not mine, forcing me to pay higher interest rates on lines of credit I have been able to receive. I demand the CFPB force Bank of America to answer for this crime or I will contact my elected officials, what is the point of having a CFPB if they only advocate for companies. I also want to add that any information Bank of America has provided has had information purposefully left out and the bank has refused to release any audio recordings of my phone conversations with them.

I called BOA on XX/XX/XXXX ; the day I received the letter and spoke to XXXX. XXXX instructed me to ignore the letter as the claim was resolved in my favor. I questioned him several times regarding this as it made no sense that they would send a letter on a closed claim. He assured me the claim was in fact closed and I needed to do nothing further. He also informed me that the merchant had 45 days to respond, BOA had 30 days and because they were doing research that only gave me a week to respond. Not only can a merchant send in any response regardless of merit but the bank can sit on it and do nothing to wind out the clock. They can then give you no time to respond and blame you for missing a deadline that has passed.
