Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing about an issue that I faced with bank of America account. Thsi happened on XXXX XXXX, 2017. I was being scamed for XXXX dollars. I met someone on facebook who was interested in renting my apartment. So for an initial advance for {$200.00} dollars i gave them my account number. Next, i heard that she transferred me XXXX instead of XXXX and wanted her money back. I transferred her the money back as i thought that is the most ethical thing to do ( I agree that this was my fault ). Next she told me that the money I transferred bounced back and when i checked my BoFa account and yes the money was returned to me as a credit adjustement. Therefore she asked me to transfer again and i did. Next day on XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my account and there are no sign of themoney that she initially transferred. She obviously pulled it back and i knew i lost XXXX dollars. My problem started when I asked the BoFa customer personnel about the credit adjustment that I was seeing in my account which in the first place made me transfer an extra XXXX dollars to that first. Bofa customer person told me that it is from a claim that i initiated for a ATM deposit. I told them I never initiatedany such claim. So we tried to tarck who initially filed that claim. We came to know that someone impersonated me and called BoFa and filed that claim. This is a clear case of identity theft and fraud. But bank of america is not considering this as a fruad and not takinh any action to get me atleast the {$2000.00} that i only paid because i saw that credit in my account. After some more digging, I came to know that some one ( a male ) called bank of america ( though I am a female and solely hold the account ). Consumer complaint narrative: I wanted to set up automatic payment from my bank to pay the full bill every month on my Bank of America XXXX XXXX obtained through XXXX XXXX XXXX. I filled out the form from XXXX XXXX and wrote in that I wanted to pay the full amount every month. When the approval came through I noticed the credit card company was only taking the minimum monthly bill in the future. A cozy way for them to let the balance ride and charge me interest. I called XXXX XXXX, complained and had that automatic payment canceled. The person on the phone sent me another paper application and told me I could also make the arrangement to pay the full amount on line. Well I tried on line but there was no option to pay the full amount every month. On the second paper application there was again no blank to direct paying the full amount every month. Previously I had written in the instruction to pay the full amount every month. Knowing this would not work, I did not resubmit the paper form, nor try the online form, which also did not offer the option I sought. So far I only used the credit card on my first in-store purchase at XXXX XXXX XXXX and have, which I paid by check, but have not used the card since. XXXX has an option for paying the full amount monthly on an automatic basis, which I take advantage of for two Visa cards. I think the failure of XXXX XXXX to offer this option is a sneaky way to keep running balances so they can charge interest.

On Sunday, XX/XX/XXXX, I attempted to use my Bank of America debit card at a local restaurant. The merchant informed me that my card was declined. In disbelief, because I knew what my account balance was, I called the banks customer service. After being on hold for over 30 mins, no satisfactory solution was provided. I was told that my card is marked as " expired '' in their system, despite my card being valid in accordance with the expiration date on the physical card. The representative acknowledged in the recorded phone call that they do n't know what the problem is. All they could tell me at this point was to wait for a replacement card in the mail, which could take over a week. I was very disappointed and upset and there was no manager available to fix my issue. I requested for a manager to call me as soon as possible. Apparently Bank of America does n't value their customers enough to even call them back when they are suffering from a circumstance that is a fault of the bank and not the consumer. No recompense has been provided so far. I made a fool of myself with the local restaurant. I would like for Bank of America to provide recompense for my troubles and embarrassment.

My problem combines two policies from Bank of America-their overdraft policy and their " monthly maintenance fee '' policy.
<P/>
I have a checking account with Bank of America and have had this same account open with them for about 8 years now, since I was a XXXX in high school. The amount of money this bank has taken from me has been grossly unethical yet still legal due to their self-serving and shady policies. I woke up today with a text alert notifying me that my account had been assessed an overdraft fee for {$35.00} because I did not bring my account to positive quickly enough. I have it set up so that I receive daily text notifications sent to my phone in order for me to keep updated with my balance and hopefully avoid overdraft items.
<P/>
Yesterday ( XXXX ) apparently my account had gone negative due to a recurring payment I have taken out with XXXX. However I was not aware the entire day because XXXX XXXX XXXX EST-I received a text message alert from Bank of America with my balance, reflecting a low balance yet still a positive amount. I went my entire day unaware that later on sometime that day, my account had gone into negative standing.
<P/>
It was an error on my part to not remember exactly what date I have these recurring automatic payments set up, however even so, I believe that it is irresponsible and dishonest on Bank of America 's part for : 1 ) creating their overdraft policy so that if/when a customer 's account balance does go negative, that customer only has the time from which they realized their account balance was negative until XXXX XXXX  that same day. They are adamant and rigid with dates when it comes to certain aspects to these policies but less consistent when it comes to other aspects ( i.e., the dates Bank of America assesses/applies their account fees vary and it is apparently justified by their mentioning of pay period cycles ).
<P/>
2 ) Handling customers ' bank accounts in such a way that processsing of fees are re-ordered and delayed, thus reflecting an inaccurate account balance to their customers ( this has happened to me countless times ) leading them to spend more than they actually have. This is called " high to low processing '' and it is a highly unethical yet perfectly legal trend practiced by banks.
<P/>
Now in regards to how their policy on their " monthly maintenance fee '' has affected me for some time now. This monthly fee is {$12.00} and was not applicable to me until recently because of my age. Their policy on their " monthly maintenance fee '' contains loopholes, that as a result unfairly made me start paying these fees once I hit a certain age and/or was no longer a XXXX. I was told that I was of a certain age and that is why the monthly maintenance fees started, however I was still a XXXX.
<P/>
I looked back a few months into my account history and noticed that Bank of America routinely has withdrawn this monthly maintenance fee on the XXXX of each month. Yet, this latest fee was deducted from my account on XXXX and not the XXXX like months prior. I brought this up to Bank of America to see if this could maybe waive my overdraft fee, but instead I received a justification as to WHY this last monthly maintenance was withdrawn all a different date and that is because " the pay period cycle varies each month due to months having different numbers of days. '' This is just another way they can use wording and irrelevant distractions to continue to justify their unethical practices. When it comes to withdrawing monthly maintenance fees, Bank of America does not consistently withdraw it on the same date yet their policy regarding overdraft fees allows no room for variation in dates and mandates that a customers ' account must be brought to positive standing before midnight that same day or else they will be charged the {$35.00} fee.
<P/>
These are clearly dishonest and manipulated practices led by Bank of America that have resulted in me paying this institution money that I should not have paid.

Consumer complaint narrative: I opened a safe deposit box at Bank of America in XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX. The safe deposit box was subsequently closed and the keys were surrendered in XX/XX/XXXX. At the time of the closure, they were unable to find the documentation to close the safe deposit box ( I believe it was my original signature card ). In XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notice in the mail saying that I owed a balance for the safe deposit box, and was told by a customer service representative when I called the XXXX number that I needed to contact the branch directly. I spoke with a teammate at the branch and was told that they would research the issue and follow up with me. I called back a week later and was told the same thing. On my third attempt to resolve the issue, I was told that my records were found, and the issue would be corrected. Also I was told that I would be sent a confirmation of closure via mail. In retrospect I never received the confirmation via mail, but as I was told the matter had been resolved I did n't think to follow up again. Today I received another Payment Notice for the safe deposit box with an outstanding balance of {$350.00}. I have n't accessed this box in over a decade now and the last time it was accessed was to validate that it was emptied and surrender the keys. I remember there being an access log, and it should show that I have n't accessed the box since XX/XX/XXXX or earlier. Massachusetts echeatment rules for safe boxes state that after one year of delinquency the bank should send me a 60 day escheatment notice, and escheat the contents to the state. Why am I still being billed for a safe deposit box that has been dormant for over 10 years AND that I closed 10 years ago? I do n't know what records are actually available for the account but certainly there should be record that this account has been dormant for over a decade and that I 'm still being billed for it. This is unfair : the bank is intentionally not closing the box to continue accruing rent. It seems very deceptive. The box should have been closed out years ago and regardless the bank should not have charged me for rent year after year for a delinquent box.

A month later the fraud department suddenly changed the ruling of those claims being fraud and pulled all of the money from our savings and checking accounts making them negative {$550.00} with additional over draft and low account fees. This is now going on two weeks with our checking account in the negative and our savings completely wiped out from charges we did not make. Bank of America policy requires adverse reporting to credit bureaus for seven years for accounts which have been PAID IN FULL following placement into profit and loss status. BOA is taking advantage of protection provided by a FCRA that does n't exist. FCRA Section 1681c relating to Accounts placed for collection or charged to profit and loss does not directly or specifically include accounts charged to profit and loss which have a CURRENT PAID IN FULL status. The law clearly states Accounts placed for collection or charged to profit and loss WITHOUT specifying reporting of accounts which have a PAID IN FULL status following a charge to profit and loss. I do not believe the INTENT of this FCRA law is to penalize a debtor who has PAID HIS DEBT IN FULL AT ANY TIME. Continued adverse reporting to credit bureaus penalizes the consumer AFTER he has paid his account IN FULL. Additionally, as a result of the lack of inclusion of accounts which are paid in full status under FCRA, XXXX has no right to maintain and adversely report information which the government has deemed nonexistent and not covered under this law.

When I received more money into my account, they took it. This is serious, my money was taken from me, they was not able claim it, they are wrong! I want my money back!

Consumer complaint narrative: Overdraft fees are outrageous. For the most part my account is positive. I wish that it would reflect that on XXXX XXXX. I should n't be charged for using the ATM.

I went into a branch with my kids to make a deposit into their minor savings accounts. They both had a check from grandma and loose change ( @ {$6.00} for one and @ {$26.00} for the other ). I was told I had to provide my ID in order for the cash to be accepted. There is no regulatory requirement for this requirement and it is more than intrusive. I hardly think my kids are head of a money laundering ring with deposits less than {$30.00} in cash. Furthermore, no ID would be required if an ATM had been used. I believe that this is an XXXX issue as many individuals with limited means may not have the requested ID and be blocked from saving and access to financial services. I understand that large dollar amounts enable the tracking of funds that could be connected to illegal acts. I do not see how tracking {$6.00} into a minor savings account will save any lives.

Without hearing anything back, on XX/XX/XXXX, I went to the branch again to ask the rep to help and called the customer services of B of A and was told by services rep at customer department that it will take up to 3 weeks to do investigation and know the result. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received the letter that indicated that they denied my claim. I called the next day to ask for evidences, such as signature on the withdraws slip as it 's withdrew from the counter, also the surveillance video footage. I did n't hear anything back before I made another call on XX/XX/XXXX, I told them I never left California and never did any withdraw in XXXX Florida and wants them to showed me the evidence : signature on the withdraw slips and the video footage from that branch. They told me they 'll do more investigation and they need police department to authorize such request. When I went to police station and was told that they do n't this type request.

Consumer complaint narrative: There are unauthorized charges to my debit card in excess of {$300.00} posted on XXXX/XXXX/2017. I went through all the proper channels to resolve this dispute as it is Bank of America 's statement that a customer is never responsible for unauthorized charges made to their bank card. My claim was denied THREE times. They sped through a myriad of reasons on why they denied my claim that are all based on speculative " evidence. '' I felt like I was being treated like a criminal when I 'm the victim of fraud. One reason for denial was that the signature was similar to the one signed on the fraudulent purchase. The only problem is that on the back of all their cards, it clearly states that the card is not valid or authorized until signed. As a result, ANYBODY can glance at the back and forge a signature so that evidence just throws itself out the window. Another reason for denial was that I did n't report it in a speedy manner. This one makes me cringe. As per Bank of America 's directions, they advise to wait till the bogus transaction posts, contact the company FIRST AND THEN contact the bank if there is no resolution ; I did just that in a timely fashion. So again, this denial reason is ludicrous. This joke of an investigation is criminal and so are the practices of this bank. They have denied my claims before and are rarely, if ever, on my side. But this time, I 've had enough being stepped on and bullied. The so-called investigators have Bank of America 's interest in mind and are n't concerned to whether or not there is actual PROOF, their job is to deny claims and save and generate money for the bank in a bureaucratic fashion. This is a conflict of interest. The letter that this bank has send me with their " proof '' is all speculative. And speculation never trumps real evidence. I BEGGED for video or photo evidence and was told they do n't do that. We are talking about a stadium that holds over 55,000 people and there is n't one camera around? So anybody can abuse my card, forge my signature and I have to pay for it? If I ca n't trust my bank to back me up, then who will? This is truly disturbing. I need help to rectify this situation please. No one can or wants to help me!

Hello, i had a bank of America checking account, and had deposited my payroll check, and my girlfriend 's payroll check into ATM. Bank of America did not like this for whatever reason, and seized the money for 30 days+.Bank of America then closed my account. Sent me the money. And reported to a company called XXXX XXXX that reports risk analysis to banks and determines I am too high of a risk to have an account at any bank. I 've called the company and they said call bank of America. I am no longer a bank of America customer therefore they are of no help. So I 'm stuck with no bank account for the past 5 years.

Consumer complaint narrative: On Bank of America I put two " Stop Payments '' on my checking account ending in XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. One was for " XXXX XXXX '' and the second was for " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ( these are really the same company, they changed names ). I also put a " hold '' on this account so money could be deposited but none could be withdrawn and I transferred all funds except {$1.00} to my other checking account ending in XXXX. <P/>The check # XXXX was changed to a " Check Conversion Voucher '' and honored on XX/XX/XXXX. The bank used my overdraft protection and took the funds from my savings account in the amount of {$490.00}. <P/>I received two Stop Payment Request Letters from Bank of America dated XX/XX/XXXX. I am sending the one copy, however, I accidentally shredded the one for XXXX XXXX XXXX and the bank said they could not send a copy because this is an automatic letter when stop payment is requested.

I 've been attempting to close my account and have plenty of issues with closing the account by phone. I am not able to visit a branch location to close the account because I am out of the country currently. They continue to charge me a monthly maintenance fee and this is a result of not being able to close the account on time. Bank Of America will not waive those fee 's even though they ca n't close my account.

I respectfully requested that your office provided me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you ( Bank of America ) regarding account # XXXX. This was NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, statements of the alleged account, or summary of when the alleged account was open, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. Now, I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character.

Sometime in XXXX XXXX my Bank of America debit card was compromised and used to make a fraudulent transaction. I contacted BofA right away and they closed and blocked the debit card and issued a new card no problem there. Problem had have several accounts tired to that debit card that are billed each month automatically. One of those accounts being with the company XXXX XXXX. I no longer wanted that account so when I was notifying companies and up dating my new debit card information I intentionally DID NOT update the debit card information with XXXX XXXX so they could not charge my account. XXXX XXXX tried to  charge my monthly fee to the old BofA debit they had on file on XX/XX/XXXX and again on XX/XX/XXXX with no luck. Then on XX/XX/XXXXthey were able to make the charge to my new debit card some how. I contacted BofA and they stopped the transaction and reversed the charge. On XX/XX/XXXX I talked with a representative of BofA and explained to them what happened and asked how could that happen. I was informed that after making several attempts to charge my account with no luck all XXXX XXXX has to do is contact BofA and proof to them that they had been charging old debit card account in the past and were unable to now that BofA would give XXXX XXXX the new debit card information. What I want to know is is this legal and right for BofA to give out this information. I know you ca n't give legal advise but can you at least give me an answer to this. If I had wanted XXXX XXXX to have that information I would have given it to them myself.

I received a letter from Bank of America on XXXX XXXX, 2017 dated XXXX XXXX, 2017 that my checking account was going to be closed and that my Debit card would be inactive in 21 days, and closed in 30 days and that this was a business decision, no further information or explanation would be provided and the decision would not be reconsidered. I immediately went into the bank and presented the letter and the agent looked up my account and indicated that it was not schedule for closured and the letter should be disregarded. I used my debit card on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and the morning of XX/XX/XXXX without issue. Over the past week I have had several deposits made into this account and now I can not even transfer the money into my savings account so that I may access it. I attempted to use my debit card the afternoon of XX/XX/XXXX and my card was declined. I attempted to call the bank and it indicated that I no longer had a debit card or a checking account with Bank of America. I have had this account for over 12 years, and I have never had any irregular activity or overdrafts. I do not owe Bank of America any money and I have received no other communication about why the status of my account has changed. I called the number provided on the letter for questions, and the agent repeated about 12 times- this was a bank of america decision and the reason is that your agreement says we can close the account at any time and we do not have a reason to provide. I now have no access to my funds, and I can not pay my bills because I can not transfer it and all of my direct deposits go into this account and my automatic withdrawals come out of this account as well. I have been halted from doing business and pending transfers into this account are in limbo- this is beyond an inconvenience and has caused me to experience loss of business and public embarrassment.

Consumer complaint narrative: My bank told me On XX/XX/2017 a withdrawal of {$360.00} was made, then on XX/XX/2017 a check of {$700.00} was deposited in a different city also in the same city another withdrawal was made of {$340.00}. I filed a claim stating my debit card was lost and that none of those transactions were made by me. A credit was issued to my account but couple weeks later the credit was reversed. I called the my bank to ask what happen and i was told that it wasnt posible that someone else other than me made those transactions. I just hope that CFPB finds the proper resolution before i have to take legal actions.

We had fraudulent activity on our account. I contacted Bank of America and they would not credit the charge back or do any investigation. The did provide the sales receipt & the charge was made at XXXX in XXXX TN. The receipt had the phone # of the store & I spoke with the manager. She agreed that it appeared to be fraud by an employee and the amount was credited back. I then contacted Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX @ XXXX we spoke with XXXX and closed the account. We got a notice on XX/XX/XXXX on regarding changing the terms of our credit, the 4 page notification did not contain a phone # you could and why would you receive a notice on an account that should not exist. Luckily I kept the records and was able to go back and retrieve my account # and a phone #. When I called I was on hold for 16 minutes and they asked for the 4 digit security # on the back of my card. I explained, when you close an account you cut the card up. They then said they had to speak with the primary card holder, Iadvised my husband was out of the country ; they said they could not do anything unless they spoke with him. I told them he spoke with them before on XX/XX/XXXXand they did not honor our request. He will call  AGAIN when he gets back to USA. In the meantime I have lost about {$200.00} in wages by tracking the  dispute and trying to get the account closed.

My issue is with Bank of America with whom I have had my checking/savings accounts over the past 10 years. What has prompted my complaint is that I recently started using a bank of america preferred cash rewards credit card ( for supposed premium customers ) along with other cards such as  XXXX  or   XXXX   XXXX  . In addition to these credit cards I have several others with other major bank credit cards. In every major institution with the exception of BOA, the ability to set up recurring payments for the full balance amount is extremely easy to do online. With the BOA credit card accounts they have deliberately set up their online payment system to allow recurring payments but only through a fixed amount as opposed to allowing multiple options of : a ) a fixed amount. b  ) minimum payment. c )  statement balance. d ) total balance. All other bank credit cards I have afford all those options.  <P/> In order to get around this, consumers have to submit a written form for payments or call a third party firm to do what every other major bank allows online. For Bank of America to set up a payment structure in this manner is clearly intended to take advantage of consumers. By hindering consumer ability to pay off their credit cards they are clearly trying to exploit customers to pay insufficient minimum payment fees or interest fees because NO  ONE  has a fixed credit card fee every month. As such WHY would they have a reoccurring payment option with the only option of a fixed fee unless it 's to exploit their customers? I refuse to believe this is just because of stupidity.

The bank subsequently debited my brother-in-laws account for the funds paid out because they claimed the check appeared to be forged.     When contacted about the debit placed on my husband and my account, the bank stated that they did so due to my husband being an additional signatory on his brother 's account.     My husband 's only dealing with his brother 's account was to deposit funds to the account after cashing his brother 's  XXXX  check and paying his brother 's bills. My husband told the bank representative that opened his brother 's account, that his association was to be limited to only adding funds to the account. Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX We refinanced our home with a loan from Countrywide, made payments until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX when the market crashed. See Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Countrywide sent a Notice of Default and Acceleration letter and said specifically, " If the default is not cured on or before XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the mortgage payments will be accelerated with the full amount remaining accelerated and becoming due and payable in full, and foreclosure proceedings will be initiated at that time. '' Clearly stated, this is not a foreclosure, but foreclosure may happen in the future. See Exhibit XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX came and went with no additional notices or legal actions as stated in the previous notice. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I file for BK See Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I waived my right to a discharge for all debt, letter mailed to creditors XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Statue of Limitations begins to run again 30 days after the mailed letter, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX See Exhibit XXXX. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Bank of America sends another NOD stating " Bank of America , N.A . intends to initiate foreclosure action on the mortgaged property. '' This another threat of a lawsuit that never came, but never the less another " Notice '' and reference a future action that that bank intends to take. See Exhibit XXXX Bank of XXXX to XXXX, and later to XXXX. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX sends Notice of Default and Acceleration letter, just like in XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and other notices over the previous 7+ years. This is another Notice ; a foreclosure has still not commenced and no other legal action has taken place. See Exhibit 6 According to WA State law, the 6-year statute of limitation for lender to collect on the debt was up on : XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. 

XXXX : Statute of Limitations requires a lender to take an actionto enforce within 6 years of the acceleration for written contracts. Law dictionary define an action as : n. a lawsuit in which one party ( or parties ) sues another. I still have not been a party to a lawsuit that would toll the statute. Exhibit 7 XXXX/XXXX/XXXX comes and goes and no lawsuit is filed. The lender has had over 7 years to take action, still no lawsuit filed, and over 6 years of the Statute of Limitations running. Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Trustee records Notice of Trustee Sale, with sale date XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Again, a NOTICE as in the title of the document. Lender specifically is choosing not to take legal action and file a lawsuit, rather to follow a non judicial process AFTER the debt is barred from collection. Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX comes and goes, several continuances of sale are issued. Trustee is aware of SOL issues. Phone calls and letters explain to trustee the situation and they do n't have the sale. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ( 120 days past sale date ) comes and goes with no sale occurring. WA foreclosure law requires lender to start the foreclosure process again. Still, no tolling has occurred yet. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Trustee records Discontinuance acknowledging that they have to start over but the last day to have the sale was XXXX XXXX Exhibit XXXX Trustee also records new NOTS with new sale date of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. They are starting over with the foreclosure process on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. See Exhibit XXXX. 

Now, the lender is wrongfully trying to collect a debt that is barred from collection AGAIN! 

Either way, the 6-year SOL has passed on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, over 302 days past the 6 year tolling date, and over 8 years past the first late payment. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX agrees to continue the sale until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX to look into this further. See Exhibit XXXX. 

As of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I have still not been sued by the lender, Bank, " holder '' " servicer '' or any other party claiming to have standing to do so, nor has anyone commence a Judicial Foreclosure. 

PLEASE HELP!!!

Consumer complaint narrative: Bank of America is holding me liable for a credit card debt from XXXX or XXXX. I have contacted this company and provided several documents to show that I never received a card to my residence which I have been residing almost 20 years nor did I apply, had no knowledge. I had never seen the application until filing a complaint. I have proven that a card was n't sent to my address. I have provided my signature as it does not match the one on their application. I stated about having a fraud alert on my credit report and indicated they did not contact me before granting credit. They claim they did @ at a number that I have never had. Then they claim something in reference to a XXXX account. I have attached the letter from XXXX financial indicating that the account did not belong to me. I sent this information to XXXX XXXX XXXX via email and called but did not receive a response. I should not have to turn to legal representation but I refuse to be liable for a debt in which I am not responsible for. I called and gave this company, Bank of America my address in which they never had. Bank America also submitted this debt to IRS as a charge off and they are charging me for a debt in which I never had any affiliation with. They also indicated about payments, I never paid this company nor authorizrd any payments.I have no reason to continuously go through this back and forth if I were n't being honest. I will suggest to Bank of America 's corporate office, they should obtain the party that is applying identification so they will have this on file as a more positive id of who is applying. This situation is stressful and ridiculous.

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX We refinanced our home with a loan from Countrywide, made payments until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX when the market crashed. See Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Countrywide sent a Notice of Default and Acceleration letter and said specifically, " If the default is not cured on or before XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the mortgage payments will be accelerated with the full amount remaining accelerated and becoming due and payable in full, and foreclosure proceedings will be initiated at that time. '' Clearly stated, this is not a foreclosure, but foreclosure may happen in the future. See Exhibit XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX came and went with no additional notices or legal actions as stated in the previous notice. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I file for BK See Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I waived my right to a discharge for all debt, letter mailed to creditors XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Statue of Limitations begins to run again 30 days after the mailed letter, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX See Exhibit 4. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Bank of America sends another NOD stating " Bank of America , N.A . intends to initiate foreclosure action on the mortgaged property. '' This another threat of a lawsuit that never came, but never the less another " Notice '' and reference a future action that that bank intends to take. See Exhibit 5 Bank of America transfers servicing to Residential Credit Soluions, and later to XXXX. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX sends Notice of Default and Acceleration letter, just like in XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and other notices over the previous 7+ years. This is another Notice ; a foreclosure has still not commenced and no other legal action has taken place. See Exhibit 6 According to WA State law, the 6-year statute of limitation for lender to collect on the debt was up on : XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. 

XXXX : Statute of Limitations requires a lender to take an actionto enforce within 6 years of the acceleration for written contracts. Law dictionary define an action as : n. a lawsuit in which one party ( or parties ) sues another. I still have not been a party to a lawsuit that would toll the statute. Exhibit 7 XXXX/XXXX/XXXX comes and goes and no lawsuit is filed. The lender has had over 7 years to take action, still no lawsuit filed, and over 6 years of the Statute of Limitations running. Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Trustee records Notice of Trustee Sale, with sale date XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Again, a NOTICE as in the title of the document. Lender specifically is choosing not to take legal action and file a lawsuit, rather to follow a non judicial process AFTER the debt is barred from collection. Exhibit XXXX XXXX/XXXX/XXXX comes and goes, several continuances of sale are issued. Trustee is aware of SOL issues. Phone calls and letters explain to trustee the situation and they do n't have the sale. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ( 120 days past sale date ) comes and goes with no sale occurring. WA foreclosure law requires lender to start the foreclosure process again. Still, no tolling has occurred yet. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Trustee records Discontinuance acknowledging that they have to start over but the last day to have the sale was XXXX See Exhibit 10 Trustee also records new NOTS with new sale date of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. They are starting over with the foreclosure process on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. See Exhibit 11. 

Now, the lender is wrongfully trying to collect a debt that is barred from collection AGAIN! 

Either way, the 6-year SOL has passed on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, over 302 days past the 6 year tolling date, and over 8 years past the first late payment. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX agrees to continue the sale until XXXX/XXXX/XXXX to look into this further. See Exhibit 12. 

As of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I have still not been sued by the lender, Bank, " holder '' " servicer '' or any other party claiming to have standing to do so, nor has anyone commence a Judicial Foreclosure. 

PLEASE HELP!!!

On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I was only approved for only {$1000.00} limit BofA Credit Card BECAUSE BofA said in writing I still had a {$50000.00} open line of credit with the firm! 

the bank stated the personal commercial line of credit for {$50000.00} was still open at prime plus XXXX pts and i was welcome to use it. When I tried to use it, I was told it was too old to use anymore and that I had to request it be closed and to ask for a new one that meets current BofA loan guidelines. So I did. but, no one has updated my credit reports to show it was closed, never late and paid as agreed. 

I have spent the past five months haggling with BofA mortgage dept to close the commercial line of credit and update my credit report it was paid in full & never late to no avail. That is a FCRA requirement! it has been open since XXXX and never closed by BofA due to negligence! 

I also asked them to terminate my personal Guarantee as well. I received a letter XXXX XXXX, XXXX that the loan was finally closed and my guarantee was terminated and that the credit report would be updated as paid as agreed, never late and closed. THAT NEVER HAPPENED! 

BofA archives Dept, Credit Card Dept, Commercial Mortgage Dept and Executive Resolution Dept each apologized for the FIVE month mixup until today. 

In a letter XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Pa A Mortgage some Resolution Specialist threatened to sue me if I contacted the bank again. I consider this an FDCPA violation and an FCRA violation and I want CFPB to order BofA to update the XXXX major Credit Reporting agencies I paid my bill off as agreed, never late and it is now closed! 

ALL I WANT IS MY CREDIT REPORT UPDATED THAT THE LOAN WAS PAID OFF AS AGREED, NEVER LATE AND CLOSED XXXX XXXX AND THAT I AM NO LONGER LIABLE!

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX - We got a $ XXXX loan with Countrywide for our primary residence valued, then, at $ XXXX. Made our payments to XXXX for the next few years w/o issue. Then in XXXX, Real Estate bubble burst. 
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX We missed our first Mortgage payment. 
XXXX - We were " served '' an official letter from Countrywide demanding payment in full of the {>= $1,000,000} loan. I called and spoke to, " XXXX XXXX '' who was absolutely horrible and said if we did n't pay the loan off, they could have us " out of our home by XXXX '' We had a new baby girl and XXXX XXXX XXXX boy/girl twins ( XXXX/XXXX/XXXX was their XXXX Birthday party. I will never forget how painful that was ) Attorney gave me the run down and timeframes so I could plan accordingly. We moved out of the home and lived with family to avoid a " Sheriff style eviction '' Foreclosure never happened, we were in limbo, not sure what to do. We moved back in temporarily. 
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX Eventually, at the advice of an attorney, XXXX filed Bankruptcy. He got a job in Florida so we moved to Florida to rebuild. 
XXXX - The mortgage finally drops off our credit report because of the federal Statute of Limitations. For 6 years we could n't get a car loan, rent a house, or finance anything without lots of help. Even with a co signor, a {>= $1,000,000} mortgage that is unpaid for 6 years is a big deal. We thought this was the end, and things would finally start to get better. We got a $ XXXX/month car loan and start to rebuild. 
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX - Surprise ... A Notice of Trustee Sale is recorded for the sale of our home after over 7 years of demanding payment in full, and no follow through. XXXX called the attorney representing the trustee told him I did n't think they had the right to foreclose because it had been XXXX years since they called the note due and Washington State has a 6 year statute of limitations. He was an arrogant jerk and said he could rely on whatever the bank was giving him and if I did n't like it, we had to retain an attorney and sue the bank to stop them. We had also done some research and told him that this was Agriculture property and they could legally not Non Judicially foreclose, they had to go through the courts system and the burden would XXXX to them to prove they had the right to foreclose. He did n't like this at all and got really mad and said he did n't even have to talk to me and I needed to get an attorney to talk to him from there on. For the next year we get notices saying that the sale is continued. We hire an attorney to write a few demand letters but they ignore them and take the position, if we do n't like it, we have to sue them. We demand that they prove they have legal standing and have complied with all the state and federal lending and foreclosure laws. This is a constant harassment from this agency and I crave your indulgence in this matter. I need justice! Thank you.

( 1 ) Lawyers can be " debt collectors '' under the FDCPA even if they are engaged in litigation activity. XXXX ( XXXX ) ; XXXX ( XXXX ) ( addressing what it means to be " regularly '' engaged in collection of debts ). 
( 2 ) Even if your law firm is a limited liability company, the owner of the firm may be directly liable under the FDCPA. XXXX ( XXXX ). 
( 3 ) Debt buyer directly liable under FDCPA if it engages in collection activity. See XXXX ( XXXX ). 
( 4 ) Debt buyer may be vicariously liable if principal-agent relationship exists. XXXX ( XXXX ). 
( 5 ) Debt buyer almost always vicariously liable for their attorney 's conduct. XXXX ( XXXX ) ( " Congress intended the actions of an attorney to be imputed to the client on whose behalf they were taken. " ) ; see also XXXX ( XXXX ) ( debt collection company can be vicariously liable for actions of collection attorney ). 
( 6 ) XXXX ( XXXX ) - letter case. " ... a debt collector may be held vicariously liable for the actions of a second debt collector working as an agent of the first, regardless of whether that second debt collector is an attorney. ''
